Authors: Zhang H., Wang X.
Title: TriBHMM: An energy-efficient and latency-aware hybrid main memory
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 IEEE Intl Conf on Parallel and Distributed Processing with Applications, Big Data and  Cloud Computing, Sustainable Computing and Communications, Social Computing and Networking, ISPA/BDCloud/SustainCom/SocialCom 2019
Affiliations: Research Center for Innovation in Government Economic, Development and Social Management Henan, University of Economics and Law Zhengzhou, Henan, 450046, China; School of Computer and Information Engineering, Henan University of Economics and Law Zhengzhou, Henan, 450046, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, H., Research Center for Innovation in Government Economic, Development and Social Management Henan, University of Economics and Law Zhengzhou, Henan, 450046, China; Wang, X., School of Computer and Information Engineering, Henan University of Economics and Law Zhengzhou, Henan, 450046, China
Abstract: Hybrid main memory has the advantages both of DRAM and PCM while overcome the disadvantages both of them. However, the existing hybrid main memory systems are not good at the advantages of DRAM and PCM. So we propose triple-based hybrid main memory (TriBHMM), a novel hybrid main memory system which consists of L1 DRAM and L2 DRAM and L2 PCM. How places data and migrates pages to DRAM or PCM with the page properties will significantly affect the main memory system performance. In this paper, we propose a new algorithm TriBHMM-LRU algorithm for sloving the page replacement problem in TriBHMM. TriBHM-LRU uses the locality of programm and the status of different memory types to place data to reduce PCM writes for improving the lifetime while reducing the latency of the TriBHMM. When pages migration happening, the recently updated pages are migrated from L1 DRAM to L2 DRAM. If some of these pages will be used again at soon, then the pages are replaced from L2 DRAM to L2 PCM. We evaluate the performance of TriBHM to others main memory system, and show the performance of TriBHM is more significant than others. The experiment shows that our TriBHMM is able to efficiently improve the whole performance and reduce PCM writes for improving the lifetime while reducing the latency. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Dram; Hybrid main memory; Page migration algorithm; Phase change memory
Index Keywords: Big data; Cloud computing; Data reduction; Energy efficiency; Pulse code modulation; Social networking (online); Energy efficient; Hybrid main memory; Latency-aware; LRU algorithms; Main memory; Page replacement; Dynamic random access storage

Authors: Gu C., Chen Y., Li W., Liu C.
Title: To shift tasks or to shift energy by esds? an economical scheduling for cloud data center
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 IEEE Intl Conf on Parallel and Distributed Processing with Applications, Big Data and  Cloud Computing, Sustainable Computing and Communications, Social Computing and Networking, ISPA/BDCloud/SustainCom/SocialCom 2019
Affiliations: Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen, China; University of Science and Technology of China, China; Shenzhen Research Institute of Big Data, China; Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, China
Authors with affiliations: Gu, C., Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen, China, University of Science and Technology of China, China, Shenzhen Research Institute of Big Data, China; Chen, Y., Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen, China, Shenzhen Research Institute of Big Data, China; Li, W., Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen, China, Shenzhen Research Institute of Big Data, China; Liu, C., Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, China
Abstract: In this paper, we propose a novel scheduling scheme to minimize the electricity cost for cloud data center by making the best of time-varying electricity prices of the power grid. In our model, the tasks may have different arrival time, execution time and deadlines, so that the energy cost can be reduced through task shifting within their deadlines. In addition, the energy cost can also be reduced through energy shifting when its price is low using energy storage devices (ESDs). However, it is challenging to decide whether to shift tasks or to shift energy using ESDs considering the fluctuating prices of the electricity. Note that, there are energy losses during charging, discharging and self-discharging of the ESDs, which can not be ignored. We solve the problem in two steps: 1) schedule the tasks based on the electricity prices within a certain time; 2) model the scheduling of energy into a constraint optimization problem and solve it using CPLEX. Experiment results show that our scheduling can significantly reduce electricity cost for a cloud data center. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Cloud data center; Cost; Deadlines; Energy; Esds; Scheduling; Storage devices; Task
Index Keywords: Big data; Cloud computing; Constrained optimization; Cost reduction; Digital storage; Electric energy storage; Energy dissipation; Scheduling; Social networking (online); Arrival time; Cloud data centers; Constraint optimization problems; Electricity costs; Electricity prices; Energy shifting; Scheduling schemes; Time-varying electricity prices; Electric power transmission networks

Authors: Yang B., Bai X.
Title: A Review of UAV Ferry Algorithms in Delay Tolerant Network
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 12th International Symposium on Computational Intelligence and Design, ISCID 2019
Affiliations: College of Computer Science of Inner Mongolia University, Inner Mongolia Key Laboratory of Wireless Networking and Mobile Computing, Hohhot, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, B., College of Computer Science of Inner Mongolia University, Inner Mongolia Key Laboratory of Wireless Networking and Mobile Computing, Hohhot, China; Bai, X., College of Computer Science of Inner Mongolia University, Inner Mongolia Key Laboratory of Wireless Networking and Mobile Computing, Hohhot, China
Abstract: The Delay Tolerant Network (DTN) is suitable for post-disaster environments where infrastructure is scarce. Search and rescue operations require network deployment in areas not covered by infrastructure. In the post-disaster DTN environment, UAVs are introduced as ferry nodes for message-passing and it is a popular practice recently. This paper introduces the application of Delay Tolerant Network in post-disaster environments and introduces message-passing through ferry nodes in DTN. Next, this paper analyzes the UAV's ferry algorithms from the perspectives of UAV network architecture, node routing algorithm, node deployment, node trajectory optimization, node energy optimization and node storage allocation optimization in DTN. The application of UAV ferry algorithm in post-disaster DTN environment is analyzed, and the performance evaluation as well as the comparison of different algorithms are given. Finally, this paper looks forward to the future research direction of UAV ferry algorithm in DTN environment. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: algorithm; Delay Tolerant Network; ferry node; UAV
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Disasters; Message passing; Network architecture; Petroleum reservoir evaluation; Unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV); Wireless networks; Allocation optimization; Future research directions; Network deployment; Node deployment; Post disasters; Search and rescue operations; Trajectory optimization; Uav networks; Delay tolerant networks

Authors: Cheng Y., Huang M.
Title: Based on the Internet of things environment data aggregation security requirements and key technology research
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 International Conference on Information Technology and Computer Application, ITCA 2019
Affiliations: Guangzhou Nanyang Polytechnic College, Guangzhou, 510925, China
Authors with affiliations: Cheng, Y., Guangzhou Nanyang Polytechnic College, Guangzhou, 510925, China; Huang, M., Guangzhou Nanyang Polytechnic College, Guangzhou, 510925, China
Abstract: With the increase of the scale of sensor nodes in the Internet of things, a large amount of data is generated in the network. Processing and transferring this data consumes a lot of communication, energy, computing and storage resources. Due to the limited resources (energy, computing power and storage capacity) of sensor nodes, how to effectively deal with the large amount of data generated in the Internet of things has become an urgent problem to be solved. Aiming at the energy consumption, environment and security of wireless sensor networks, data aggregation technology is proposed. In this context, data aggregation came into being. Due to the aggregation of multiple data into one data in the process of data transmission, data aggregation reduces data redundancy, saves energy consumption, bandwidth and other resources, thus reducing data transmission delay and thereby improving the reliability, security and stability of the network. This increases the network life cycle. The security of data aggregation in the Internet of things is effectively solved. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: data aggregation; Internet of things; security needs; technical research
Index Keywords: Data transfer; Digital storage; Energy utilization; Internet of things; Life cycle; Redundancy; Sensor nodes; Data transmission delay; Environment data; Key technologies; Network life cycle; Security and stability; Security of wireless sensor networks; Security requirements; Storage resources; Network security

Authors: Hassan A.A., Abdilhakiim M.M., El-Hennawey S.
Title: A Smart autonomous tour guide for museums
Source title: 2019 International Conference on Smart Applications, Communications and Networking, SmartNets 2019
Affiliations: MSA University, Electronics and Communication Engineering Department, Giza, Egypt; MIU University, Department of Electronics and Communication, Cairo, Egypt
Authors with affiliations: Hassan, A.A., MSA University, Electronics and Communication Engineering Department, Giza, Egypt; Abdilhakiim, M.M., MSA University, Electronics and Communication Engineering Department, Giza, Egypt; El-Hennawey, S., MIU University, Department of Electronics and Communication, Cairo, Egypt
Abstract: For decades, worldwide museums posted text information about the displayed antiquities. This is done at most with only two languages. Also, they lack the interactivity factor which plays a key role in making the tourist interested to know more. In the past decade, efforts were spent to mitigate this issue by using a smart moving unit, usually a smart phone, where audio information can be listened to by the tourist. All information pieces are stored in the moving device. The problem becomes significant, when the antiquities to display are of a huge number and of extensive information. This, together with multiple languages becomes an impeding factor for moving unit of low or moderate storage capabilities. This paper proposes new design and implementation for a special purpose handheld device, with limited storage, capable of displaying different types of high-quality multimedia on an interactive screen of high resolution. This is resolved in this paper through employing a server, in which all antiquities database is stored. Firstly, the moving unit determines its location, sends its coordinates to the database server. Then, the latter determines the nearest antiquity to the moving unit and finally sends the antiquity's multimedia data to the moving unit to display. For moderate needed accuracy, long lifetime, ease of operation and cost effectiveness, Bluetooth Low-Energy beacons are used. Experimentation is conducted for verification. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: indoor positioning; museum information display; real-Time multimedia; smart devices
Index Keywords: Cost effectiveness; Smartphones; Audio information; Bluetooth low energies (BTLE); Data-base servers; Design and implementations; Hand held device; Impeding factors; Multiple languages; Storage capability; Digital storage

Authors: Sun L., Xiao F.
Title: Optimization of Just-In-Time Part Supply Scheduling in Assembly Job Shop
Source title: 2019 16th International Computer Conference on Wavelet Active Media Technology and Information Processing, ICCWAMTIP 2019
Affiliations: Southeast University, School of Mechanical Engineering, Nanjing, 211100, China
Authors with affiliations: Sun, L., Southeast University, School of Mechanical Engineering, Nanjing, 211100, China; Xiao, F., Southeast University, School of Mechanical Engineering, Nanjing, 211100, China
Abstract: Taking the actual assembly job shop as an example, this paper comprehensively considers the resource constraints of the assembly job shop, the capacity of distribution vehicle and the capacity constraints of the station temporary storage area. A mathematical model was constructed with the optimization goal of minimizing the inventory of the temporary storage area and the total transportation energy consumption without allowing the shortage of parts. Based on the idea of chaotic mapping and reverse learning, the food source coding and initialization were redesigned, and a modified discrete artificial bee colony algorithm was constructed to make joint decision on part supply time and delivery quantity. Finally, simulation analysis was performed to verify the feasibility and effectiveness of the algorithm and model. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Artificial bee colony algorithm; Assembly job shop; Energy consumption; Part supply
Index Keywords: Energy utilization; Optimization; Artificial bee colony algorithms; Capacity constraints; Distribution vehicles; Optimization goals; Resource Constraint; Simulation analysis; Temporary storage; Transportation energy consumption; Job shop scheduling

Authors: Kadar P.
Title: Autonomous Micro-Market Operation on the Low Voltage Network
Source title: 2019 20th International Conference on Intelligent System Application to Power Systems, ISAP 2019
Affiliations: Óbuda University, Alternative Energy Sources Knowledge Centre, Dept. of Power Systems, Bécsi u. 94, Budapest, H-1034, Hungary
Authors with affiliations: Kadar, P., Óbuda University, Alternative Energy Sources Knowledge Centre, Dept. of Power Systems, Bécsi u. 94, Budapest, H-1034, Hungary
Abstract: In this paper a novel autonomous micro-market operation method is shown on the Low Voltage network. The centralized national and global level can't provide adaptive, dynamic and flexible local control on the lowest level household generation-consumption in narrow circle. Although many storage devices are offered energy remains expensive and unsustainable. In this operation the small energy producers are allowed prosumer-prosumer direct trade of the surplus energy beside the traditional utility supply. The system requires a local household energy control box with internet link. The box transmits autonomous bids for the pool for the next period and makes short term bilateral contract with a prosumer that can reschedule its load by the offers. Through this operation huge amount of reschedulable consumption capacities can be involved in the demand side management. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Autonomous Market Operation; Demand Side Management; Prosumers
Index Keywords: Electric utilities; Intelligent systems; Virtual storage; Bilateral contracts; Household energy; Internet links; Local control; Low voltage network; Micro-markets; Surplus energy; Utility supply; Commerce

Authors: Cao T., Shen Z., Zhang G.
Title: LSTM-aided reinforcement learning for energy management in microgrid with energy storage and EV charging
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 15th International Conference on Mobile Ad-Hoc and Sensor Networks, MSN 2019
Affiliations: College of Information Science and Technology, Donghua University, Engineering Research Center of Digitized Textile and Apparel Technology, Ministry of Education, Shanghai, 201620, China
Authors with affiliations: Cao, T., College of Information Science and Technology, Donghua University, Engineering Research Center of Digitized Textile and Apparel Technology, Ministry of Education, Shanghai, 201620, China; Shen, Z., College of Information Science and Technology, Donghua University, Engineering Research Center of Digitized Textile and Apparel Technology, Ministry of Education, Shanghai, 201620, China; Zhang, G., College of Information Science and Technology, Donghua University, Engineering Research Center of Digitized Textile and Apparel Technology, Ministry of Education, Shanghai, 201620, China
Abstract: This work studies an electric vehicles (EVs) loaded microgrid with renewable energy resources, energy storage system (ESS) and external power grid. The microgrid's energy management problem is formulated to maximize its daily average operation revenue and balance the supply and demand based on the system statistical information, i.e., electricity market price, renewable energy arrivals and EVs' charging characteristics. For online optimization, we develop a reinforcement learning (RL) based approach to smartly control the microgrid's ESS in real-time by considering future reward of an charging/discharging action. Moreover, to speed up the RL training stage, a prediction model using long short term memory (LSTM) networks is adopted to explore the system input traces for more accurate future reward counting in current learning process. The simulation results validate the superior performance of the proposed algorithm with comparison to the conventional online optimization version. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Electric vehicle; Energy management network; Microgrid; Renewable energy resources
Index Keywords: Charging (batteries); Electric charge; Electric energy storage; Electric power transmission networks; Energy management; Information management; Learning systems; Microgrids; Mobile ad hoc networks; Reinforcement learning; Renewable energy resources; Sensor networks; Charging characteristics; Charging/discharging; Electric Vehicles (EVs); Energy storage systems; Management problems; Online optimization; Renewable energies; Statistical information; Long short-term memory

Authors: Li J., Xing Z., Wei S., Qian Y., Zhang W.
Title: Dynamic Vehicle Data Gathering via Deep Reinforcement Learning Approach
Source title: 2019 IEEE 5th International Conference on Computer and Communications, ICCC 2019
Affiliations: Nanjing University of Science and Technology, School of Electronic and Optical Engineering, Nanjing, 210094, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, J., Nanjing University of Science and Technology, School of Electronic and Optical Engineering, Nanjing, 210094, China; Xing, Z., Nanjing University of Science and Technology, School of Electronic and Optical Engineering, Nanjing, 210094, China; Wei, S., Nanjing University of Science and Technology, School of Electronic and Optical Engineering, Nanjing, 210094, China; Qian, Y., Nanjing University of Science and Technology, School of Electronic and Optical Engineering, Nanjing, 210094, China; Zhang, W., Nanjing University of Science and Technology, School of Electronic and Optical Engineering, Nanjing, 210094, China
Abstract: With the rapid development of vehicular ad hoc networks (VANETs), there have been numerous efforts to big data and analysis of vehicle information for roadside intelligence. However, continuous data gathering is energy consuming and eventually causes data backlog due to the capacity-limited backhaul links, while sparse gathering frequency may miss the timely detection of critical traffic information. Therefore, this paper focus on the dynamic data gathering problem in vehicular networks. In the scenario with environment changes dynamically, we first model the problem as a Markov decision process (MDP), and then propose different deep reinforcement learning(DRL) based maximization frequency matching algorithms, to determine the optimal gathering frequency at each time. The simulation results compare the performance differences of the algorithms, and show the trend of frequency matching in different storage spaces. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: data gathering; DRL; MDP; VANETs
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Markov processes; Reinforcement learning; Vehicular ad hoc networks; Critical traffic; Environment change; Frequency matching; Limited backhauls; Markov Decision Processes; Reinforcement learning approach; Vehicular Adhoc Networks (VANETs); Vehicular networks; Deep learning

Authors: Wei T., Sun Y., Zhang Y., Wang Z., Wu W., Gao J.
Title: Energy Efficient User Access and Computation Offloading Strategy for Fog Radio Access Network with Uplink/Downlink Decoupling
Source title: 2019 IEEE 5th International Conference on Computer and Communications, ICCC 2019
Affiliations: Beijing University of Technology, Faculty of Information Technology, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Wei, T., Beijing University of Technology, Faculty of Information Technology, Beijing, China; Sun, Y., Beijing University of Technology, Faculty of Information Technology, Beijing, China; Zhang, Y., Beijing University of Technology, Faculty of Information Technology, Beijing, China; Wang, Z., Beijing University of Technology, Faculty of Information Technology, Beijing, China; Wu, W., Beijing University of Technology, Faculty of Information Technology, Beijing, China; Gao, J., Beijing University of Technology, Faculty of Information Technology, Beijing, China
Abstract: Fog radio access networks (F-RANs) are regarded as a promising solution for the future wireless networks by incorporating the concept of fog computing into the architecture of wireless access networks. F-RANs make full use of the computing and storage capabilities of edge network devices, and can effectively alleviate the overhead of backhaul links and reduce the processing delay of the tasks. However, existing researches were mostly focused on the coupled uplink and downlink scenario which will lead to insufficient utilization of resources and high energy consumption. In order to solve above problems, we introduce the decoupled the uplink and downlink (DUDA) access mode to F-RANs and jointly optimize the user access and computation offloading decisions with the aim of energy consumption minimization. To reduce the computational complexity, we further utilize the reinforcement learning algorithm to solve this complex combinatorial optimization problem. The simulation results show that compared with other schemes, the proposed algorithm can significantly improve the energy consumption performance while meeting user demands. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: computation offloading; decoupled uplink/downlink access; Fog radio access networks; reinforcement learning
Index Keywords: Combinatorial optimization; Complex networks; Energy efficiency; Energy utilization; Fog; Radio access networks; Reinforcement learning; Wireless networks; Combinatorial optimization problems; Computation offloading; Energy Consumption Minimization; Future wireless networks; High energy consumption; Storage capability; Utilization of resources; Wireless access networks; Fog computing

Authors: Mohammed U., Aminu M.A., Adeshina S.A., Oshiga O., Koyunlu G., Thomas S.
Title: Design and Implementation of Regulated DC Variable Power Supply Using Solar PV with Storage (0-15V, 5A)
Source title: 2019 15th International Conference on Electronics, Computer and Computation, ICECCO 2019
Affiliations: Nile University of Nigeria, Dept. of Elect/Elect Engineering, Abuja, Nigeria; Nile University of Nigeria, Dept. of Computer Engineering, Abuja, Nigeria
Authors with affiliations: Mohammed, U., Nile University of Nigeria, Dept. of Elect/Elect Engineering, Abuja, Nigeria; Aminu, M.A., Nile University of Nigeria, Dept. of Elect/Elect Engineering, Abuja, Nigeria; Adeshina, S.A., Nile University of Nigeria, Dept. of Computer Engineering, Abuja, Nigeria; Oshiga, O., Nile University of Nigeria, Dept. of Elect/Elect Engineering, Abuja, Nigeria; Koyunlu, G., Nile University of Nigeria, Dept. of Computer Engineering, Abuja, Nigeria; Thomas, S., Nile University of Nigeria, Dept. of Computer Engineering, Abuja, Nigeria
Abstract: In Nigeria, due to the epileptic nature of power supply, most institutions, individuals, and industries resort to self-generation of power via petrol and diesel generators, which does not only cause environmental and sound pollution but very expensive. As a result, the prices of domestic goods are on the rise. The threat of noise pollution and greenhouse gas emission associated with these generators cannot be over-emphasized. A renewable energy resource will provide a better alternative. This paper therefore designs and implements a regulated DC variable power supply of rating (0-15)V, 5A using solar PV with storage. The gap found from the literature review was; lack of digitally displayed output of the system. The paper designed and implemented DC variable power supply using a voltage regulator (LM33S), resistors, LED, capacitors, a solar PV of200 W, a 12V/24V20 A charge controller and two 12 V, l8Ah batteries. During the design stage, the voltage regulator capacity, solar PV, charge controller, battery ratings were designed. Tests were carried out with the aid of a digital multimeter to determine the response of the system. Results obtained showed that the system is capable of powering DC loads not greater than 75 W. It was also established that implemented system output voltage ranges from 1.21 V to 15.2 V. It was evident that basic experiments and other needs of DC power that are within the design range can be met. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Dc; Power supply; Regulated; Solar PV; Variable
Index Keywords: Greenhouse gases; Noise generators; Noise pollution; Renewable energy resources; Voltage regulators; Charge controllers; Design and implementations; Diesel generators; Digital multimeters; Literature reviews; Self-generation; Sound pollution; Variable power; Secondary batteries

Authors: Bammami S.M., Okafor E.N.C., Hussein S.U., Bammami M.I., Thomas S., Oshiga O.
Title: Improvement of gravity light generation modeling using bond graph method
Source title: 2019 15th International Conference on Electronics, Computer and Computation, ICECCO 2019
Affiliations: Nile University of Nigeria, Abuja, Nigeria
Authors with affiliations: Bammami, S.M., Nile University of Nigeria, Abuja, Nigeria; Okafor, E.N.C., Nile University of Nigeria, Abuja, Nigeria; Hussein, S.U., Nile University of Nigeria, Abuja, Nigeria; Bammami, M.I., Nile University of Nigeria, Abuja, Nigeria; Thomas, S., Nile University of Nigeria, Abuja, Nigeria; Oshiga, O., Nile University of Nigeria, Abuja, Nigeria
Abstract: this research is aimed at modeling and performing structural analysis on Gravity light system using bond graph method in order to improve its performance. To achieve the bond graph model of the gravity light system, the various subsystems, storage elements, junction structures, transformer elements with appropriate causality assignments and energy exchange that make up the gravity light system were identified and modeled. In the developed model, the effect of friction was considered. 20-Sim software was used to validate the developed bond graph model. The structural design and analysis of the system carried out shows that, it is not just another renewable energy generating source but one that improves greatly, the exiting gravity light system by extended operational time of 40 minutes and higher efficiency of over 80%. Hence, it meets all requirements for the application of renewable energy sources, and technically viable for construction and further developments. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Qian L., Yu J., Zhu G., Mei F., Lu W., Ge B., Wang L., Mei Z., Pang H., Xu M., Chen H.
Title: A duplication reduction approach for unstructured data using machine learning method
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 International Conference on Intelligent Computing, Automation and Systems, ICICAS 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Company Information and Telecommunication Branch, Hangzhou, China; State Grid Information and Telecommunication Co.,Ltd., Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Qian, L., State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Yu, J., State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Zhu, G., State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Mei, F., State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Company Information and Telecommunication Branch, Hangzhou, China; Lu, W., State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Company Information and Telecommunication Branch, Hangzhou, China; Ge, B., State Grid Information and Telecommunication Co.,Ltd., Beijing, China; Wang, L., State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Mei, Z., State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Pang, H., State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Xu, M., State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Chen, H., State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China
Abstract: With the development of the Internet technology, the data becomes more and more large, and occupy more and more storage space. Although the price of storage is becoming much cheaper than before, the physical space and the electric power consuming is still large, making much load when operating. In this paper, we propose a new method for duplicated unstructured data reduction. Firstly, we compute the features for all of our unstructured data, and then compare the them with other files in the filesystem. We remove the files with the high similarity and only leave one file. In this way, we can reduce many of duplicate files. We conduct experiments on real-world data. The results suggest the effectiveness of our method. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Zamzam M., Elshabrawy T., Ashour M.
Title: Resource Management using Machine Learning in Mobile Edge Computing: A Survey
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 IEEE 9th International Conference on Intelligent Computing and Information Systems, ICICIS 2019
Affiliations: Faculty of Information Engineering Technology, German University in Cairo, Cairo, Egypt
Authors with affiliations: Zamzam, M., Faculty of Information Engineering Technology, German University in Cairo, Cairo, Egypt; Elshabrawy, T., Faculty of Information Engineering Technology, German University in Cairo, Cairo, Egypt; Ashour, M., Faculty of Information Engineering Technology, German University in Cairo, Cairo, Egypt
Abstract: Mobile Edge Computing (MEC) aims to overcome the limited terminal battery and processing capabilities associated with running applications in the mobile terminal and the high latency introduced by offloading these applications to the cloud. It extends the computing resources of the cloud at the edge of the cellular network closer to the mobile user. Resource management in mobile edge computing is one of the main issues that are studied recently by many researchers. It consists of resource allocation and computation offloading. Allocation of resources involves managing and scheduling the resources to accomplish the requests of the users. It depends on the availability and the capacity of the resources. According to the deadline of each requested task, the service provider will assign each user the sufficient resources. Computation offloading is the transfer of the tasks to be executed at an external platform (edge or cloud server). It depends on the processing capability and the storage capacity of the device. It is difficult to provide an optimal solution for resource management in a dynamic system due to the random variations of tasks required by the users and the mobility of these users, thus machine learning techniques are proposed to solve this optimization problem. In this paper we provide the state-of-the-art for using machine learning to optimize resource management in mobile edge computing. We divide the research into four categories: 1) minimizing the cost, 2) minimizing the energy consumption, 3) minimizing the latency and 4) minimizing both latency and energy consumption. We then classify the system model, the constraints and the types of machine learning techniques that are used in each optimization problem. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: allocation; cost; energy; latency; machine learning; Mobile edge computing; offloading
Index Keywords: Edge computing; Energy utilization; Information systems; Information use; Intelligent computing; Learning algorithms; Machine learning; Mobile telecommunication systems; Natural resources management; Optimization; Resource allocation; Computation offloading; Computing resource; Machine learning techniques; Optimal solutions; Optimization problems; Processing capability; Resource management; Running applications; Mobile cloud computing

Authors: Sharma R., Seema, Singh B., Chandra A., Al-Haddad K.
Title: FZA-APNCA Control Strategy for WG/HG/PV Based Microgrid at Unbalanced Nonlinear Loads
Source title: 2019 National Power Electronics Conference, NPEC 2019
Authors with affiliations: Sharma, R.; Seema; Singh, B.; Chandra, A.; Al-Haddad, K.
Abstract: To achieve harmonics compensation in a distributed generation (DG) unit, a flexible zero attracting affine projection normalized correlation algorithm (FZA-APNCA) is used in this paper. The proposed control provides improved convergence without affecting the harmonics compensation when connected to unbalanced and nonlinear loads. In proposed islanded microgrid, by using the proposed FZA-APNCA both system stability and load power sharing capability are achieved. In addition, the robustness of the implemented control structure is investigated by comparing it with conventional controls. The proposed system is a combination of wind turbine driven permanent magnet brushless DC generator (PMBLDCG), battery energy storage (BES), solar PV array and synchronous reluctance generator (SyRG) used for hydro generation. Where, BES (Battery Energy Storage) is attached at the DC link, which maintains the power balance under perturbation in generation and loads. Test results from the laboratory prototype are validated and are meeting the requirement of the IEEE 1547.4 standard. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Microgrid; Pico-Hydro Generation; PMBLDC Generator; Power Quality; solar PV (Photovoltaic)
Index Keywords: Electric batteries; Microgrids; Permanent magnets; Photovoltaic cells; Power electronics; Synchronous generators; System stability; Battery energy storage; Battery energy storages (BES); Brushless DC generators; Distributed generation units; Harmonics compensation; Improved convergence; Normalized correlation; Synchronous reluctance generator; Battery storage

Authors: Pei L., Zhengdong Y., Li J.
Title: Marine Meteorological Observation Technology and Application Based on Large Floating Platform
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Meteorology Observations, ICMO 2019
Affiliations: CETC Ocean Information Technology Research Institute Co. Ltd, Department of General, Beijing, China; CMA Chengdu University of Information Technology, Key Laboratory of Atmospheric Sounding, Chengdu, China
Authors with affiliations: Pei, L., CETC Ocean Information Technology Research Institute Co. Ltd, Department of General, Beijing, China; Zhengdong, Y., CMA Chengdu University of Information Technology, Key Laboratory of Atmospheric Sounding, Chengdu, China; Li, J., CMA Chengdu University of Information Technology, Key Laboratory of Atmospheric Sounding, Chengdu, China
Abstract: This paper proposes a marine observation technology based on a new type of maritime information base platform. After practical application, it is found that this technology can steadily improve marine meteorological observation capabilities and promote the development of international meteorological observation engineering technology. In order to improve the ability of real-time monitoring of marine (especially the distant sea) meteorology and the level of protection against catastrophic weather, China Electronics Technology Group led the development of largescale, flexible deployment (18 meters hight) floating platform. The floating platform includes systems such as platform, detection, energy, communication, and information management. It can be equipped with a variety of marine meteorological environment monitoring equipment to achieve wind speed, wind direction, temperature, pressure, atmospheric waveguide, solar radiation, sea fog, precipitation, Visibility, and all-weather real-time observations of marine meteorological environmental factors such as seawater salinity, seawater temperature, velocity, and direction, to obtain marine meteorological data from the sea surface to the upper air. At the same time, various weather data collected by the platform and video data of meteorological activities such as giant waves and typhoons can be transmitted to the data center in real time through its own communication system to obtain the first-time data. This technology can provide information support for marine meteorological services and lay an important foundation for the interdisciplinary development of marine science and technology. Through the continuous development and application of the world's first large-scale floating platform for marine meteorological observation technology, it leads a crossconvergence of multiple theories, methods, and technologies to drive the overall change and breakthroughs in the field of marine meteorological observation. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: anchorage information floating platform; hydrometeorology; integrated meteorological observation; marine meteorological observation

Authors: Azougagh D., Rebbani A., Bouattane O.
Title: An Enhanced Bit-line Keeper for Computational Memory Architecture
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 4th International Conference on Systems of Collaboration, Big Data, Internet of Things and Security, SysCoBIoTS 2019
Affiliations: SSDIA Laboratory, ENSET Mohammedia, Hassan II University of Casablanca, BP 159 Bd Hassan II, Mohammedia, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: Azougagh, D., SSDIA Laboratory, ENSET Mohammedia, Hassan II University of Casablanca, BP 159 Bd Hassan II, Mohammedia, Morocco; Rebbani, A., SSDIA Laboratory, ENSET Mohammedia, Hassan II University of Casablanca, BP 159 Bd Hassan II, Mohammedia, Morocco; Bouattane, O., SSDIA Laboratory, ENSET Mohammedia, Hassan II University of Casablanca, BP 159 Bd Hassan II, Mohammedia, Morocco
Abstract: Today, Processing In Memory (PIM) is in demand more than ever to cope with the growth of Big Data, memory wall and power wall. Most existing PIM works are concentrated on near-memory processing (NMP) and/or in-memory processing (IMP). A computational Memory Architecture (CMA) supporting in bit-line processing brings parallel computation as close as possible to the location of the stored data/bits without using any dedicated computational logic unit(s). It first selects and sets up an operation, reads bit information from external inputs and/or local memory cells in parallel and simultaneously, stabilizes the bit-lines throughout the controlled bit-line keeper (KEEPER), and finally writes the data to external outputs and/or local memory cells in one compute cycle with eight phases. PIM eliminates the overhead of data movement between processing unit and memory, resulting in high bandwidth, massive parallelism, with a high energy efficiency. Since, computational logic unit are not used, CMA further eliminates the overhead of data movement between the computing logic and memory units. In this work, we introduce an enhanced bit-line keeper (E-KEEPER) that does not require any dedicated commands from the compute-line controller. The E-KEEPER helps in reducing the number of phases in one compute cycle to three phases only. Therefore, the compute cycle, the number of bit-flip of command lines and the write critical zone are reduced by 62.5%, 15.38% and 66.6%, respectively. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Murillo-Yarce D., Marulanda-Durango J.J., Mejía A.E., Alzatc-Gómez A.
Title: Optimal Indirect Power Predictive Controller in the Alpha-Beta Reference Frame for Grid-Connected Converters
Source title: 2019 FISE-IEEE/CIGRE Conference - Living the Energy Transition, FISE/CIGRE 2019
Affiliations: Engineering Systems, Faculty of Engineering, Universidad de Talca, Curicó, Chile; Electrical Engineering Graduate and Undergraduate Program, Universidad Tecnológica de Pereira, Pereira, Colombia
Authors with affiliations: Murillo-Yarce, D., Engineering Systems, Faculty of Engineering, Universidad de Talca, Curicó, Chile; Marulanda-Durango, J.J., Electrical Engineering Graduate and Undergraduate Program, Universidad Tecnológica de Pereira, Pereira, Colombia; Mejía, A.E., Electrical Engineering Graduate and Undergraduate Program, Universidad Tecnológica de Pereira, Pereira, Colombia; Alzatc-Gómez, A., Electrical Engineering Graduate and Undergraduate Program, Universidad Tecnológica de Pereira, Pereira, Colombia
Abstract: This article presents an indirect power predictive optimal controller applicable to grid-connected converters. The VSI converter is used as an interface between distributed generators, energy storage systems and the ac-grid. The objective of the research project is to develop a controller with high static and dynamic features, that performs with low computational burden and low switching stress. The first step to develop the controller is to select the appropiate reference frame. The αβ frame is used for its simple structure and easy implementation. Then, the proposed methodology consider the controller performance to define the sampling period, the prediction horizon and the switching pattern. Results show that an increment in the sampling period results in a major harmonic content, and if the prediction horizon increases, the number of calculations is higher without improving the controller performance. The main features of the proposed controller are: low sampling times and a two-steps prediction horizon. With these features the VSI efficiency rises, while the systems's losses and harmonic distortion are reduced. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Indirect control; instantaneous power; power control; predictive control; voltage source inverter

Abstract: This document contains an analysis of the challenges and opportunities in the integration of smart grids in the Colombian power system. Starting from the review of the integration of technological trends in AMI, distributed generation, demand response, energy storage, electric vehicles and digital network, from the point of view of policy guidelines, regulatory instruments, current status and case studies. Finally, some challenges and opportunities to massify the use of smart grids in the country are identified, maximizing the benefits for different actors. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Lemic F., Marquez-Barja J., Famaey J.
Title: Modeling and reducing idling energy consumption in energy harvesting terahertz nanonetworks
Source title: 2019 IEEE Global Communications Conference, GLOBECOM 2019 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Internet Technology and Data Science Lab (IDLab), University of Antwerpen - Imec, Belgium
Authors with affiliations: Lemic, F., Internet Technology and Data Science Lab (IDLab), University of Antwerpen - Imec, Belgium; Marquez-Barja, J., Internet Technology and Data Science Lab (IDLab), University of Antwerpen - Imec, Belgium; Famaey, J., Internet Technology and Data Science Lab (IDLab), University of Antwerpen - Imec, Belgium
Abstract: A variety of nanoscale applications require downlink and broadcast-based transmission of control packets from a powered transmitter to energy-harvesting nanonodes with constrained storage capacity. The nanonode's communication system is anticipated to be a bottleneck for such nanonetworks, hence an accurate modeling of its energy consumption is needed. Currently, TS-OOK is a prevailing scheme for nanocommunication in the terahertz (THz) frequencies, with short pulses representing logical "1"s and silences logical "0"s. In the energy modeling of this scheme, certain energy consumptions are attributed to the transmission and reception of the pulses. However, traditional communication systems teach us that the idling energy consumption should not be neglected. Hence, we provide an energy consumption model for TS-OOK-based nanocommunication systems that accounts for the energy consumed in idling, in addition to the transmission and reception-originated consumptions. We demonstrate that, for a meaningful performance of the considered nanonetwork, the nanonode's idling energy consumption has to be at least nine orders of magnitude lower than the corresponding energy consumption in reception. To increase the tolerable idling energy, we propose a new energy lifecycle for the receiving nanonodes. Assuming frequent packet repetitions on the transmit side, the proposed lifecycle utilizes periodic short wake-ups of the receiving nanonodes. We show that, when the proposed lifecycle is utilized, up to three orders of magnitude higher idling energy consumption can be tolerated compared to the baseline. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Amplitude shift keying; Energy harvesting; Life cycle; Nanotechnology; Accurate modeling; Energy consumption model; Nanoscale applications; Orders of magnitude; Packet repetition; Storage capacity; Terahertz frequencies; Three orders of magnitude; Energy utilization

Authors: Awad H., Abdalfatah S., Hegazy H., Elkholy E.E.
Title: Hybrid PV/FC System Design and Simulation
Source title: 2019 21st International Middle East Power Systems Conference, MEPCON 2019 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Helwan University, Faculty of Industrial Education, Egypt; Menoufia University, Engineering Department, Egypt
Authors with affiliations: Awad, H., Helwan University, Faculty of Industrial Education, Egypt; Abdalfatah, S., Helwan University, Faculty of Industrial Education, Egypt; Hegazy, H., Helwan University, Faculty of Industrial Education, Egypt; Elkholy, E.E., Menoufia University, Engineering Department, Egypt
Abstract: as the power generated by a Photovoltaic (PV) system is affected by the weather conditions, there must be storage units to store and deliver energy as per customer needs. One of the potential solutions to this issue is the integration of the PV generator with electrolytic hydrogen and fuel cell (FC). This paper proposes a hybrid-power system that combines a PV generator, Proton-Exchange-Membrane FC, Electrolyzes (ELZ) and hydrogen tanks to serve as energy storage. Depending on the amount of solar radiation, two approaches of connecting the PV generator and FCs are implemented. In the first approach, the FC acts like a backup for the PV system while with the second approach, a hybrid PV-FC generation system is employed. A model of the (ELZ) is implemented in order to simulate the production and storing of hydrogen. The operation of the fuel cell is simulated and analyzed using Matlab/Simulink where many of the encountered problems were solved. The simulation results of the proposed system prove that it can efficiently solve the intermittent nature of the PV energy systems while preserving the environment. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Communication Technologies Requirement for Energy Hubs: A survey
Source title: 2019 21st International Middle East Power Systems Conference, MEPCON 2019 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, El-Mansoura, Egypt; Nile Higher Institute for Engineering and Technology, Dept. of Electronics and Communication Engineering, El-Mansoura, Egypt

Abstract: Over the last 100 years, no change has been in the power grid infrastructure. Through experiments, it became clear that the top-down central power grids are not suited to the needs of the twenty-first century. The new energy revolution by considering multi-energy carriers, not just electricity, represents an opportunity to improve the system and will have a revolutionary impact on the future power grids. To meet current power grid challenges, a new concept of the energy hub has emerged. The energy hub can be considered as a modern electric power grid infrastructure that contains different types of energy sources and generation with multi-Type energy storage devices to feed electrical, heating and gas demands. The new energy hub needs a more complex and different one, because its size is much larger, while traditional energy systems rely on a strong infrastructure of information and communication. This paper focuses on critical issues related to technologies of energy hub in the first place with regard to information and communication technology (ICT). This paper main objective is presenting a contemporary view of the current state of the art in the field of energy hub communications as well as to discuss research issues that remain open in this area. This paper is expected to provide a better understanding of the energy hub technologies, benefits and research challenges and raise the interest of the community of research to explore this promising research area. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: Superconducting magnetic energy storage (SMES) system is one of the commonly used technique by the end users to mitigate the voltage sag at their premises from the distribution system. The SMES is a superconductor coil wound on a nonmagnetic core. Contribution of refrigeration and AC loss in total SMES coil loss at different output power rating is investigated. Different Low Temperature Superconductivity (LTS) coil materials at operating temperature of 4-circ\mathrm {K} are considered to select the best material with minimum coil loss. The results concluded that Nb-Ti material achieved minimum coil loss when compared with \mathrm {M}\mathrm {g}\mathrm {B}-{2} and YBCO. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: The technique 'All-Electric Ships' gives the opportunity to reduce greenhouse emissions and shifting toward a wide increase of utilizing renewable and sustainable energy in Naval ships.This paper introduces a standalone hybrid power system, as an island micro-grid system with both ACDC bus-bars powered from different energy sourced fuel cells, diesel generator and energy storage system connecting together through AC/DC and DC/AC inverters.This micro-grid with different types of loads pulsing load, weapons, combat systems and ship propulsion system need to be integrated and controlled not only in communication system but also in power system so the need to model and simulated the system using MATLAB/SIMULINK is a priority to obtain the results that uncertainty before manufacturing and can be handled to ensure the continuous and stability of the power system. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Abulanwar S., Ghanem A., Rizk M.E.M., Ismael I.
Title: Mitigation of DC Wind Farm Power Fluctuations Based Battery Energy Storage System
Source title: 2019 21st International Middle East Power Systems Conference, MEPCON 2019 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Mansoura University, Electrical Engineering Dept, Mansoura, Egypt
Authors with affiliations: Abulanwar, S., Mansoura University, Electrical Engineering Dept, Mansoura, Egypt; Ghanem, A., Mansoura University, Electrical Engineering Dept, Mansoura, Egypt; Rizk, M.E.M., Mansoura University, Electrical Engineering Dept, Mansoura, Egypt; Ismael, I., Mansoura University, Electrical Engineering Dept, Mansoura, Egypt
Abstract: Typically, wind farms (WFs) are intermittent re-sources that rely on stochastic wind speed profiles. Hence, fulfilling transmission system operators (TSOs) requirements such as frequency support, flicker mitigation and reactive power compensation is challenging due to higher active power fluctuations. In this paper, a proposed operational and control scheme is proposed for a DC wind farm (DCWF) attached to a high voltage direct current based voltage source converters (VSC-HVDC) system via a small-scale battery energy storage (BES) system. The main objective is to mitigate wind farm power fluctuations at the point of common coupling (PCC) in order to assist in ancillary services demanded by TSOs. Accordingly, the WF is made predictable, reliable and easily controllable power source as conventional generators. An average model for an offshore DCWF connected to a VSC-HVDC system integrated with BES is modeled in Matlab Simulink and different case studies are investigated Which validate the proposed scheme. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Day-Ahead Optimal Scheduling for Grid-Connected Microgrid with Energy Storage Systems
Source title: 2019 21st International Middle East Power Systems Conference, MEPCON 2019 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Ain Shams University, Electrical Power and Machines Department, Cairo, Egypt; 15th of May Higher Institute of Engineering, Mathematical Physical and Engineering Sciences, Cairo, Egypt; Kafrelsheikh University, Electrical Power and Machines Department, Kafr El-sheikh, Egypt; Future University in Egypt, Faculty of Engineering and Technology, Cairo, Egypt

Abstract: Nowadays, the operation of a microgrid (MG) with minimized operating cost and high employment of renewable energy sources, has become a head corner of the MG operation system. This paper proposes an optimized approach for energy scheduling of grid-connected MG that includes a battery energy storage system (BESS) and different distributed generators as micro-Turbines, fuel cells, wind turbines, and photovoltaic units, where the optimal hourly generation scheduling is needed to get the minimum MG's operating cost. The general algebraic modeling system (GAMS) is used in modelling of the studied system and solving the constrained optimization problem. The optimal hourly generation scheduling of the MG is investigated in three different scenarios. In the first scenario, no BESS is connected to the system, while in the second scenario, the BESS is connected to the system, and in the third scenario, the optimal generation scheduling of the MG is investigated with BESS considered while considering increased limits of the power imported from or exported to the main grid. The results obtained validate the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm compared to the results obtained by other algorithms presented in the literature. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Saad A.I., Saad N.H., Ezzat M.
Title: Combined Power and Attitude Control System for Low Earth Orbit Satellites
Source title: 2019 21st International Middle East Power Systems Conference, MEPCON 2019 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Military Technical College, Communication and Electronic Department, Cairo, Egypt; Ain Shams University, Electrical Power and Machines Department, Cairo, Egypt
Authors with affiliations: Saad, A.I., Military Technical College, Communication and Electronic Department, Cairo, Egypt; Saad, N.H., Ain Shams University, Electrical Power and Machines Department, Cairo, Egypt; Ezzat, M., Ain Shams University, Electrical Power and Machines Department, Cairo, Egypt
Abstract: Flywheel power systems are now seen as a technology that can be used in various applications, including low-earth space satellite orbits, pulse transmission for hybrid electric vehicles and many other applications. In consideration of the energy storage feature, a flywheel device has great advantages over chemical batteries for Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellites: lifespan, density of power, short charge time, wide operational temperature band, and deep depth of discharge. Flywheel systems have significant advantages over chemical batteries also it can be used to control the spacecraft attitude. The combination of power and attitude control is a practical solution for small satellites to enhance space missions. Double counter-rotating flywheels mounted on an air table are introduced in this paper to execute the control system of combined power and single-Axis attitude control. The system control technique of integrated power and attitude control could be implemented based either on a speed control mode or on a torque control mode. The control algorithm's method is known as field orientation control. This method offers the flywheel motor / generator with precise and high bandwidth torque control by controlling rotor reference frame currents that are dc in steady-state. The Permanent magnet synchronous motor/generator is regulated by the direction of the field. The current rotational frame of the d-Axis is ordered to zero and the current order of the q-Axis rotational frame of reference differs to maintain dc bus regulation and control of attitude. MATLAB Simulink is used to model the combined power and single-Axis attitude control system using two similar flywheels. Furthermore, different cases and different modes of operation are presented which showed that flywheels behavior changed according to different operations. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: In Electric Vehicles (EVs)and Hybrid Electric Vehicles (HEVs), energy efficiency is essential where energy storage is limited. Adding to its high stability and low cost, the induction motor efficiency improves with loss minimization. Also, it can consume more power than you actually need to perform its working when it operating in less than full load condition. In this paper, a proposed topology and its control strategies based on the Fuzzy Logic Control (FLC) are used. FLC makes control of start current amplitude and saves more power. Through the MATLAB/SIMULINK software package, the performance of this control was verified through simulation. Compare with the conventional Proportional Integral Derivative (PID) controller, the simulation schemes show good, high-performance results in time-domain response and rapid rejection of system-Affected disturbance. Therefore, the core losses of the induction motor are greatly reduced, and in this way improved the efficiency of the driving system. Finally, the suggested control system is validated by the experimental results obtained in our laboratory, which are in good agreement with the simulation results. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Optimal Assessment of Hybrid Wind Energy with Fuel Cell for Supplying Distribution Network in Egypt
Source title: 2019 21st International Middle East Power Systems Conference, MEPCON 2019 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Menoufia University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Shebin El-Kom, Egypt

Abstract: Wind energy has a great application in Egypt. However, due to the nature of intermittent wind energy, power storage systems are used as basic systems that can be used to meet the challenges of power generation and load balancing. This paper aims to optimize and assess different wind generating modes for supplying a part of Egyptian electrical distribution network. The wind turbines are optimized according to their technical and economical points. Then, the output of the optimal wind turbine is determined. The load demand is determined and compared with the power output from the wind farm to find the surplus power generated which is used to generate an amount of hydrogen (H2) through water electrolysis operation. This hydrogen is used to generate electric energy from fuel cell plant. This energy will be used to supply the system in the deficit times. Also, the economical design of the fuel cell is computed in this paper. The proposed optimization design is applied to real network as a part of Egyptian network which the results show the efficiency and capability of the proposed optimization modes. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Suetterlein J., Friese R.D., Tallent N.R., Schram M.
Title: TAZeR: Hiding the Cost of Remote I/O in Distributed Scientific Workflows
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 IEEE International Conference on Big Data, Big Data 2019
Affiliations: Pacific Northwest National Laboratory
Authors with affiliations: Suetterlein, J., Pacific Northwest National Laboratory; Friese, R.D., Pacific Northwest National Laboratory; Tallent, N.R., Pacific Northwest National Laboratory; Schram, M., Pacific Northwest National Laboratory
Abstract: Many scientific workflows access data derived from specialized instruments. When the data is analyzed, it is accessed over wide area networks, creating bottlenecks from long access latencies. We ask the question: assuming that data must be accessed remotely, can latencies be hidden without application change? We present TAZeR, a remote I/O framework that reduces effective data access latency. TAZeR transparently converts POSIX I/O into operations that interleave application work with data transfer, i.e., read prefetching and write stage-out. TAZeR ensures read data moves directly to application memory without synchronous intervention (soft zero-copy). TAZeR uses distributed bandwidth-aware staging to exploit data reuse across application tasks and to manage the capacity constraints of fast hierarchical storage. We evaluate TAZeR on a High Energy Physics workflow where two 1 Gb/s WAN links request remote data at 48 Gb/s using non-streaming access patterns. TAZeR is 12 times and 22 times faster than XRootD (state-of-the-art) and file copies (current approach), respectively; and within 7% of optimal. We explore conditions under which TAZeR can hide I/O accesses by showing performance as effective staging sizes change. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: distributed staging; I/O pipelining; remote I/O; scientific workflows; soft zero-copy

Authors: Ziad C., Rajamani H.-S., Manikas I.
Title: Game-theoretic Approach to Fleet Management for Vehicle to Grid Services
Source title: 2019 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Signal Processing and Information Technology, ISSPIT 2019
Affiliations: University of Wollongong in Dubai, Faculty of Engineering and Information Sciences, Dubai, United Arab Emirates; University of Wollongong in Dubai, Faculty of Business, Dubai, United Arab Emirates

Abstract: There is a growing interest in the efficient use of energy in smart cities of the future, especially through the effective use of electrical vehicles that accommodate the needs of advanced city wide infrastructure. Vehicle to Grid service provision has been proposed previously as a way of providing storage for the smart grid to mitigate stresses, particularly at peak times. Organizations having a fleet of electrical vehicles can benefit through acting as a single aggregator. We propose an advanced architecture that acts to control scheduling for such fleets. The focus is on how a large facility in a smart city, with many electrical vehicles that are under different departments could optimize their rewards based on a game-theoretic approach that aims at supporting the grid. Genetic algorithms are used to schedule the vehicles for optimum operation. The major contribution of our work is the design of a dynamic cooperative game between the departments of a facility to support the grid. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: Energy storage is one of the most important parts of the smart grid, and the pump storage power stations (PSPS) which are applied most widely are the largest scale energy storage facilities in China. PSPS can provide positive effects on peak and frequency regulation, improve the electricity quality. Reliability guarantee is made for applying new energy to the power system by PSPS. This paper takes the control system of a large pump storage power station as an example to analyze the intelligent control function of pump storage power station which is put into operation in China southern power grid. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Research and Application of Grid-connected Control Device for Distributed Photovoltaic Power Supply
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 4th Advanced Information Technology, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IAEAC 2019
Affiliations: Electric Power Research Institute of State Grid Jiangxi Electric Power Ltd, Nanchang, Jiangxi, China
Authors with affiliations: Xu, Z.-D., Electric Power Research Institute of State Grid Jiangxi Electric Power Ltd, Nanchang, Jiangxi, China; Zhou, Q.-K., Electric Power Research Institute of State Grid Jiangxi Electric Power Ltd, Nanchang, Jiangxi, China; Liu, Y., Electric Power Research Institute of State Grid Jiangxi Electric Power Ltd, Nanchang, Jiangxi, China
Abstract: Distributed photovoltaic grid connection has impaired the power quality of the distribution network. Aiming at this salient problem, a regulation method for the voltage at the point of interconnection in the distribution network is proposed. Besides, the basic principles of voltage regulation device are introduced, and the computing method for the capacity energy storage battery configuration, matched with the power generation capacity, is given. The simulation model based on the full-control device is built in the PSCAD environment, which verified the accuracy of the control strategy and the favorable dynamic adjusting performance. Finally, by the prototype developed, the effectiveness of the new regulation method for the voltage at the point of interconnection in the distribution network is proved. © 2019 IEEE.
