Authors: Zhao R., Yang Y., Zhang C., Wei Z., Deng M.
Title: Multi-Energy Storage Control Based on SOC for DC-Microgrid
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 4th Advanced Information Technology, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IAEAC 2019
Affiliations: Xihua University, School of Electrical Engineering and Electronic Information, Chengdu, China; Chengdu Integrid Electric Co. LTD of Sichuan Province, Chengdu, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, R., Xihua University, School of Electrical Engineering and Electronic Information, Chengdu, China; Yang, Y., Xihua University, School of Electrical Engineering and Electronic Information, Chengdu, China, Chengdu Integrid Electric Co. LTD of Sichuan Province, Chengdu, China; Zhang, C., Xihua University, School of Electrical Engineering and Electronic Information, Chengdu, China; Wei, Z., Xihua University, School of Electrical Engineering and Electronic Information, Chengdu, China, Chengdu Integrid Electric Co. LTD of Sichuan Province, Chengdu, China; Deng, M., Xihua University, School of Electrical Engineering and Electronic Information, Chengdu, China
Abstract: In order to control and use the highly random distributed renewable energy and the load with high demand fluctuation better, the energy storage system must be equipped in the microgrid. In DC microgrids, due to differences between battery energy storage system units, the same charge and discharge rate is likely to cause overcharge or overdischarge of the energy storage battery. In order to extend the life of the energy storage battery, the improved droop control strategy should be used to balance the output of each energy storage unit according to the respective state of charge of the distributed energy storage. Regarding the issue above, this paper introduces a new droop control reference voltage and coordinates the energy storage unit output by adjusting the droop control reference voltage. According to the respective state of charge and output power of distributed energy storage, over-charging of energy storage units can be avoided with low SOC(State-of-Charge) energy storage unit over discharge or high SOC energy storage unit over charge. Finally, the effectiveness of the proposed strategy is verified by Matlab/simulink simulation. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: DC microgrid; Droop control; Energy storage system; Reference voltage; State of charge(SOC)
Index Keywords: Battery management systems; Battery storage; Charging (batteries); Electric power supplies to apparatus; MATLAB; Microgrids; Dc micro-grid; Droop control; Energy storage systems; Reference voltages; State of charge; Secondary batteries

Authors: Gong Y.
Title: Network-Structure-Based Energy Aware Routing in Wireless Sensor Networks
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 4th Advanced Information Technology, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IAEAC 2019
Affiliations: Zhaoqing University, School of Computer Science and Software, School of Big Data, Zhaoqing City, China
Authors with affiliations: Gong, Y., Zhaoqing University, School of Computer Science and Software, School of Big Data, Zhaoqing City, China
Abstract: In Wireless Sensor Network (WSN), Routing protocol is a research hotspot due to its rapidly increasing application in monitoring various kinds of environment by sensing physical phenomenon. Since the sensor nodes have a limited transmission range, processing power, storage capabilities and energy resources, routing protocols must be able to prolong the lifetime of a network. In this paper, we first outline the design challenges for routing protocols in WSNs. Then, we classify the current network-structure-based routing protocols into different kinds, and we also describe and compare these kinds of routing protocols that can be used to improve the network lifetime. Besides, we also point out several further research direction of routing in WSNs. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Classification of Protocols; Energy-aware; Routing Protocol; Wireless Sensor Network
Index Keywords: Energy resources; Internet protocols; Network routing; Routing protocols; Sensor nodes; Wireless sensor networks; Classification of protocols; Design challenges; Energy aware; Network structures; Physical phenomena; Processing power; Storage capability; Transmission ranges; Power management (telecommunication)

Authors: Ma S., Gao S.
Title: The Impact of Adopting Computational Storage in Heterogeneous Computing Systems
Source title: 2019 International Conference on Reconfigurable Computing and FPGAs, ReConFig 2019
Affiliations: Micron Technology Inc.
Authors with affiliations: Ma, S., Micron Technology Inc.; Gao, S., Micron Technology Inc.
Abstract: Heterogeneous computing systems have been the focus of major efforts in pursuit of Exascale computing over the past few years. These heterogeneous computing systems, often contain various accelerators, can significantly improve the computation performance thanks to their parallel compute cores. Much research has exploited accelerators to reduce the computation time; however, I/O access time or end-to-end total execution time is often overlooked. Typically, when I/O access time with the storage is considered, the performance gain from accelerators can be substantially degraded. In this work, we designed a computational storage in a heterogeneous computing system. Our evaluation employs a real-world compute-bound machine learning application on three computing systems: A conventional CPU system, a modern FPGA system, and the computational storage system. Compared to CPU system, we found that the modern FPGA system can achieve a 100x speedup for computation and 62x better energy efficiency, but only 26 × speedup and 16 × energy efficiency improvement when data movement time is taken into account; whereas the computational storage system can achieve 63 × computation speedup and 51 × better energy efficiency including data movement time. The experiment demonstrates that a compute-bound problem on conventional CPU system may become an I/O-bound problem on heterogeneous system. By adopting computational storage in heterogeneous system, we find that both the computation performance and the I/O performance is improved. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Computer aided instruction; Energy efficiency; Field programmable gate arrays (FPGA); Reconfigurable architectures; Reconfigurable hardware; Computation performance; Computing system; Energy efficiency improvements; Exascale computing; Heterogeneous computing system; Heterogeneous systems; Machine learning applications; Performance Gain; Digital storage

Authors: Lv Y., Song Z., Liu Y.
Title: Simultaneous Cooperative Spectrum Sensing and Wireless Power Transfer in Single-antenna Cognitive Radio
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 4th Advanced Information Technology, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IAEAC 2019
Affiliations: 54th Research Institute of CECT, Shijiazhuang, China
Authors with affiliations: Lv, Y., 54th Research Institute of CECT, Shijiazhuang, China; Song, Z., 54th Research Institute of CECT, Shijiazhuang, China; Liu, Y., 54th Research Institute of CECT, Shijiazhuang, China
Abstract: In single-antenna cognitive radio, the sensing performance of the primary user (PU) in the fading channel can be improved by antenna cooperative spectrum detection. However, due to simultaneous cooperative spectrum sensing, CR may consume more storage energy, thereby reducing its transmission performance. In this paper, in order to ensure its transmission performance, a scheme of synchronous simultaneous cooperative spectrum sensing and wireless power transmission is proposed, which can harvest radio frequency energy of PU signals to provide energy consumed by spectrum detection. A time-splitting model is proposed to achieve collaborative spectrum detection, energy harvesting and data transmission synchronization. Optimization problems applicable to the scheme were developed to maximize the spectral efficiency of cognitive radio in the synchronous simultaneous cooperative spectrum sensing and wireless power transmission models, limited by the probability of detection and the energy collected. Finally, the optimal distribution factor is calculated to achieve the maximum spectral efficiency, and the conclusion is drawn through simulation. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: cooperative spectrum sensing; energy harvesting; Single-antenna cognitive radio; spectrum efficiency; wireless power transfer
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Energy harvesting; Energy transfer; Fading (radio); Fading channels; Inductive power transmission; Rectennas; Wireless power transfer; Co-operative spectrum sensing; Optimal distributions; Optimization problems; Probability of detection; Radio-frequency energy; Single antenna; Spectrum efficiency; Transmission performance; Cognitive radio

Authors: Zhang K., Li J., Zhang Z.
Title: Optimal Bidding Strategy of PV-Storage System in the Electricity Market
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 4th Advanced Information Technology, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IAEAC 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Sichuan Economic Research Institute, China; State Grid Shaanxi Electric Power Company, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, K., State Grid Sichuan Economic Research Institute, China; Li, J., State Grid Shaanxi Electric Power Company, China; Zhang, Z., State Grid Sichuan Economic Research Institute, China
Abstract: In power system, the penetration of renewable energy resources, mainly PV and wind power has grown rapidly. To deal with their inherent uncertainty, energy storage (ES) is seen as the most promising technology. It is urgent and meaningful to exploit the operation strategy of PV-ES system in the electricity market environment. So this paper proposed an optimal biding strategy in day-ahead market and a real-time operation strategy for PV-ES system considering the twofold uncertainty from electricity price and PV output. The optimal model has considered the benefit in day-ahead market, benefit and penalty in real-time operation, and the operation cost of ES. We also constructed the operation model under uncertainty for ES. Case study certificates the necessity of incorporating PV real-time power fluctuation in the day-ahead market. The model can effectively balance the day-ahead and real-time benefi. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: day-ahead bidding strategy; PV-energy storage system; real-time operation strategy; uncertainty
Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; Electric industry; Real time systems; Wind power; Bidding strategy; Electricity prices; Operation strategy; Optimal bidding strategy; Power fluctuations; PV energy; Real-time operation; uncertainty; Power markets

Authors: Arif S., Rabbi A.E., Aziz T.
Title: Post-Fault Operation Scenerio in a Wind Integrated Microgrid: Voltage Recovery Issue and Solution
Source title: Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference, APPEEC
Affiliations: Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology, Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Dhaka, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Arif, S., Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology, Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Dhaka, Bangladesh; Rabbi, A.E., Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology, Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Dhaka, Bangladesh; Aziz, T., Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology, Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Dhaka, Bangladesh
Abstract: In recent years, more and more wind power is getting integrated into power system to reduce the share of fossil fuel in power generation. The dynamics of present wind generations are different than that of conventional power generations and hence create adverse effect on system stability. In this paper, IEEE 43 bus test system is integrated with wind generation to find its impact on post-fault operation scenario. It has been noticed through simulations that increased share of wind in generation deteriorates the post-fault voltage recovery performance of the system. Placement of battery energy storage system (BESS) at wind generation terminal can be a solution to such problems. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery energy storage system; post-fault recovery; wind energy
Index Keywords: Fossil fuels; System stability; Wind power; Adverse effect; Battery energy storage systems; Bus test systems; Conventional power; Fault operation; Fault recovery; Voltage recovery; Wind generation; Battery storage

Authors: [No author name available]
Title: A Three-Phase Smart Inverter for Frequency and Voltage Regulation in an Unbalanced Distribution System
Source title: Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference, APPEEC
Abstract: In recent years, the use of renewable energy (RE) in distributed power generation has been increasing. However, a key drawback of RE is unstable power output that causes systemic effects. Moreover, with the increasing penetration of RE in three-phase distribution systems, the problem of unbalanced three-phase systems becomes increasingly challenging. This paper proposes a novel control strategy for a grid-connected three-phase four-wire smart inverter. By using the proposed power control strategy and the positive- and negative-sequence decoupling controls, the smart inverter can provide not only frequency but also voltage regulation to maintain a balanced and stable system. To verify the feasibility of the proposed method, a 2 kW grid-connected three-phase four-wire prototype inverter was implemented, which was connected to a three-phase AC source for analysis. The experimental results indicate that the proposed control strategy is a feasible scheme. System frequency regulation and phase voltage compensation can be achieved to support the system under an unbalanced or unstable condition. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery energy storage system (BESS); Distributed energy; frequency regulation; unbalanced three-phase system; voltage regulation
Index Keywords: Electric inverters; Voltage control; Voltage regulators; Battery energy storage systems; Distributed energies; Frequency and voltage regulations; Frequency regulations; Three-phase distribution systems; Unbalanced distribution systems; Unbalanced three-phase system; Use of renewable energies; Power control

Authors: Xiang W., Sun W., Pei L., Xi P.
Title: Generalized Energy Storage Configuration Strategy Considering Uncertainty of Load Aggregator Response
Source title: Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference, APPEEC
Affiliations: University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, School of Mechanical Engineering, Shanghai, China; Shanghai Electrical Apparatus Research Institute Co. Ltd., Shanghai Key Laboratory of Smart Grid Demand Response, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Xiang, W., University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, School of Mechanical Engineering, Shanghai, China; Sun, W., University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, School of Mechanical Engineering, Shanghai, China; Pei, L., University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, School of Mechanical Engineering, Shanghai, China; Xi, P., Shanghai Electrical Apparatus Research Institute Co. Ltd., Shanghai Key Laboratory of Smart Grid Demand Response, Shanghai, China
Abstract: The future power system will present the typical characteristics of 'energy interconnection' and 'integration of high-penetration renewable energy'. User-side resources will gradually become important interactive resources to relieve the stress of real-time balance between supply and demand in the system. To fully tap the economic potential of user-side resources, the new energy storage system that consists of loads with a certain adjustment capability on user side is regarded as virtual energy storage (VES). Combining VES with traditional narrow sense energy storage (NSES), the concept of generalized energy storage (GES) is proposed and its characteristics are described based on the response characteristics of NSES and VES. Secondly, considering the uncertainty of VES response, GES response model under the NSES supplementary response strategy is established. On this basis, GES is scheduled by (load aggregator (LA) to participate in the auxiliary service market. The configuration optimization model of NSES with the objective of maximizing the net revenue of LA is established. Finally, under the guidance of the existing electricity auxiliary market policy, the optimization model is simulated. The results show that the NSES configuration strategy increases the revenue of LA while improving the response quality of LA. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: ancillary service market; generalized energy storage; high-penetration renewable energy; load aggregator; virtual energy storage
Index Keywords: Commerce; Optimization; Renewable energy resources; Ancillary service markets; Configuration optimization; Economic potentials; Interactive resources; Optimization modeling; Renewable energies; Response characteristic; Response strategies; Electric energy storage

Authors: Aqib M., Ukil A.
Title: Optimal Method of Electric Vehicle Charging and Discharging with Voltage Sensitivity Analysis in Distribution Grid
Source title: Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference, APPEEC
Affiliations: University of Auckland, Department of Electrical Computer, and Software Engineering, New Zealand
Authors with affiliations: Aqib, M., University of Auckland, Department of Electrical Computer, and Software Engineering, New Zealand; Ukil, A., University of Auckland, Department of Electrical Computer, and Software Engineering, New Zealand
Abstract: Large scale grid integration of electric vehicles (EVs) is greatly dependent on electricity price, renewable energy and energy storage system (ESS). In this paper, EVs are charged and discharged according to the requirement of the user with an effective method of charge flow analysis from energy management system. It comprises of controlled operational method that works with the state of charge (SOC) of the EV. The operation is mainly focused on two modes, with each mode performing the task by the early detection of EV SOC. This would trigger the users to decide to charge using the automatically controlled technique, or the user control tab. Both methods ensure the proper load flow in a microgrid, when charging and discharging of EV occuring any time of the day. The proposed system is implemented and designed in OpenDSS to test the results in different scenarios. © 2019 IEEE.

Source title: Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference, APPEEC

Abstract: Flexible DC grid is regarded as a promoter for the future power system. In other words, it provides a feasible approach to realizing large-scale access of renewable energy sources in energy integration, interconnection and storage technology. However, fault current limiting technology is an urgent barrier for the advancement of flexible DC grid. This paper classified faults in flexible DC grid mainly into two categories, and summarized various available fault current limiting technologies. What±s more, a comprehensive outlook for advanced flexible DC grid is set to promote developments in this field. Finally, some challenges and recommendations were also summarized. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Luo L., Chen W., Tian Y., Tan Z., Hu Y.
Title: Compensation Strategy for Multiple Series Centralized Voltage Sag in Medium Voltage Distribution Network
Source title: Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference, APPEEC
Affiliations: Hunan University, College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China
Authors with affiliations: Luo, L., Hunan University, College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Chen, W., Hunan University, College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Tian, Y., Hunan University, College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Tan, Z., Hunan University, College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Hu, Y., Hunan University, College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China
Abstract: In order to solve the major production accidents caused by voltage sag in power supply park, such as equipment shutdown and production line shutdown, this paper proposes a new DVR topology to compensate voltage sag. In this strategy, the storage battery is centralized for energy management, and the stored energy is output through the combination of multiple converters and multi-winding transformers. Based on this topological mathematical model, this paper presents a hybrid control method of grid voltage feedforward and load voltage feedback, which can compensate the large capacity, long, deep and asymmetric voltage sags in the medium voltage distribution network. In addition, in order to solve the problem of DC bias caused by the circulating current between multiple windings on the secondary side of transformer, a circulating current suppression algorithm is proposed. The effectiveness of the proposed strategy is verified by matlab/simulink simulation analysis and experiments. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Sun W., Zhang W., Zhang T., Du Y.
Title: Optimal Day-Ahead Scheduling in AC/DC Hybrid Distribution Networks based on SOCP
Source title: Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference, APPEEC
Affiliations: Shandong University, Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent Dispatch and Control, Ministry of Education School of Electrical Engineering, Jinan, China
Authors with affiliations: Sun, W., Shandong University, Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent Dispatch and Control, Ministry of Education School of Electrical Engineering, Jinan, China; Zhang, W., Shandong University, Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent Dispatch and Control, Ministry of Education School of Electrical Engineering, Jinan, China; Zhang, T., Shandong University, Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent Dispatch and Control, Ministry of Education School of Electrical Engineering, Jinan, China; Du, Y., Shandong University, Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent Dispatch and Control, Ministry of Education School of Electrical Engineering, Jinan, China
Abstract: DC distribution systems, which can improve the accommodation of renewable energy sources and DC loads, have developed rapidly, leading to the appearance of hybrid AC/DC distribution systems. This paper proposes an optimal day-ahead scheduling model to increase the economy of the system operation considering the high penetration and uncertainty of the distributed generations. The proposed model aims to minimize the active power loss and electricity purchasing cost by coordinating active or reactive power outputs of voltage source converter (VSC), energy storage system (ESS) and static var compensation (SVC), as well as the voltage regulation capability of OLTC. Besides, the load model has been carefully analysed to implement conservation voltage reduction (CVR). In addition, VSC is detailed modelled to capture the coupling between active power and reactive power. Moreover, the second-order cone programming (SOCP) is used in this paper to transform the mixed integer nonlinear programming problem to a convex optimization one, which shortens the solving time. The IEEE 33-bus test system is employed to demonstrate the effectiveness and efficiency of the proposed method. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Active-reactive power combined optimal dispatch; conservation voltage reduction; hybrid AC/DC distribution networks; second-order cone programming.
Index Keywords: Convex optimization; Electric energy storage; Nonlinear programming; Reactive power; Renewable energy resources; Scheduling; Voltage regulators; Conservation voltage reductions; Effectiveness and efficiencies; Mixed integer non-linear programming problems; Optimal dispatch; Renewable energy source; Second-order cone programming; Static VAR compensation; Voltage source converters; Integer programming

Authors: Wang S., Yang F., Bai X., Liu S., Yue C.
Title: Optimal Power Dispatch Strategy for Multiple Battery Containers in a Grid-scale BESS Station
Source title: Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference, APPEEC
Affiliations: Beijing Electric Power Economic Research Institute, 15 Guang'anmen Station West Street, Beijing, 100055, China; Universal Plaza, ABB (China) Power Grids, Chaoyang District, Beijing, 100015, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, S., Beijing Electric Power Economic Research Institute, 15 Guang'anmen Station West Street, Beijing, 100055, China; Yang, F., Beijing Electric Power Economic Research Institute, 15 Guang'anmen Station West Street, Beijing, 100055, China; Bai, X., Beijing Electric Power Economic Research Institute, 15 Guang'anmen Station West Street, Beijing, 100055, China; Liu, S., Universal Plaza, ABB (China) Power Grids, Chaoyang District, Beijing, 100015, China; Yue, C., Universal Plaza, ABB (China) Power Grids, Chaoyang District, Beijing, 100015, China
Abstract: A grid-scale BESS station usually contains multiple battery containers and corresponding electric paths. Each path and container could become a dispatchable unit when receiving network operators' orders. Battery containers will perform differently after long-term use, especially considering a mixed utilization of new and recycled battery. Currently the storage import/export power is distributed equally among containers. The dispatch and control strategy for containers mainly focus on their capacity constraint, rather than their performance, temperature, and ageing conditions. This paper proposed a novel optimal power dispatch strategy for multiple battery containers in a BESS station. This method established the mathematical relationship between battery ageing with SOC, DOD, operating temperature and charging state transition times. The minimum total battery ageing is used as the optimization objective to achieve the optimal power dispatch among containers. The simulation results showed this strategy helps to balance the ageing, temperature and SOC between containers, leading to a more reliable and secure operation of BESS station. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: ageing; battery energy storage system; container; optimization; power dispatch; time-sequential simulation
Index Keywords: Charging (batteries); Containers; Electric power transmission networks; Optimization; Secondary batteries; ageing; Battery energy storage systems; Capacity constraints; Mathematical relationship; Operating temperature; Optimal power dispatch; Power dispatch; Time-sequential; Electric load dispatching

Authors: Gao Q., Yuan Y., Zhu J., Wu H., Luo X.
Title: Optimal Dispatching of Virtual Power Plant Considering Hydrogen Storage System
Source title: Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference, APPEEC
Affiliations: Hohai University, College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Gao, Q., Hohai University, College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Yuan, Y., Hohai University, College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Zhu, J., Hohai University, College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Wu, H., Hohai University, College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Luo, X., Hohai University, College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China
Abstract: Virtual power plant (VPP) integrating into distribution network is of great significance to improve the security of power system and promote the absorption of renewable energy. Combining with hydrogen storage system (HSS), VPP can mitigate the risks caused by the uncertainty of renewable energy and increase the benefits. This paper proposes a novel HSS model, in which not only the bi-directional regulation of charging and discharging but also the service of hydrogen selling is considered. A mixed integer second-order cone programming (MISOCP) model is established with the objective of maximum VPP profits. Results show that the participation of HSS can bring great benefits to VPP, and the reactive power generated by grid-connected inverter can also provide auxiliary services for distribution network. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Wang J., Wu H., Li S., Yang S.
Title: Reliability Evaluation of Distribution Network Containing PV-assisted Charging Station for EVs
Source title: Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference, APPEEC
Affiliations: Hefei University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei, 230009, China; State Grid Jiangsu Electric Power Company, Nanjing, 210024, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, J., Hefei University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei, 230009, China; Wu, H., Hefei University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei, 230009, China; Li, S., Hefei University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei, 230009, China; Yang, S., State Grid Jiangsu Electric Power Company, Nanjing, 210024, China
Abstract: In this paper, the optimal operation of PV-assisted charging station and the fault probability of distribution network are considered, and Sequential Monte Carlo algorithm is used to evaluate system's reliability. After considering the charging cost, discharge times of energy storage system and other objective conditions, PV-assisted charging station's optimal operation model is proposed. Then, on the basis of PV-assisted charging station's optimal operation model, reliability assessment of distribution network containing vehicle-photovoltaic charging station is realized using Monte Carlo, and fault response of electric vehicle charging station, optimization strategies and the situation of charging station as a power source to supply power to the island of fault area are also considered. The influence of PV-assisted charging station on distribution network's reliability is also analyzed. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: charging station; Monte Carlo; optimal operation; Photovoltaic; Reliability evaluation

Title: A Distributionally Robust Chance Constrained Planning Method for Integrated Energy Systems
Source title: Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference, APPEEC
Affiliations: State Grid Fujian Electric Power Co. Ltd., Xiamen Power Supply Company, Xiamen, Fujian Province, China; College of Electrical Engineering Sichuan University, SCU, Chengdu, Sichuan Province, China

Ltd., Xiamen Power Supply Company, Xiamen, Fujian Province, China; He, S., College of Electrical Engineering Sichuan University, SCU, Chengdu, Sichuan Province, China; Gao, H., College of Electrical Engineering Sichuan University, SCU, Chengdu, Sichuan Province, China; Liu, J., College of Electrical Engineering Sichuan University, SCU, Chengdu, Sichuan Province, China
Abstract: It is of great significance for the development of urban energy Internet to realize the coordinated planning of integrated energy system. Based on this, a distributionally robust chance constrained (DRCC) planning method for the integrated heat and electricity system is proposed. Firstly, the model considers the investment of energy storage devices, taking the minimum investment and operation cost of electro-thermal coupling system as the optimization objective. The planning model takes into account the investment constraints of energy storage systems and the operation constraints of energy conversion devices. Secondly, the power balance constraint is expressed as a chance constrained to ensure the safe and reliable operation of the system. The moment uncertainty based distributionally robust method is used to deal with the uncertainty of wind power. Then, the DRCC model is established. In addition, The DRCC model is transformed into a second order cone programming model by the CVaR approximation method and duality theorem. Finally, the model is solved by CPLEX in MATLAB. The effectiveness of the DRCC method for the integrated heat and electricity system proposed in this paper is verified by an example. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Hierarchical optimal operation strategy for multi micro energy systems within distribution system
Source title: Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference, APPEEC

Ltd, Nanjing, China; Wang, Q., Southeast University, Nanjing, China
Abstract: Recently diverse and heterogeneous energy sources like electricity, heat and gas are widely interconnected and integrated to achieve full cross-border exchange of energy flows, information flows and value flows, which makes the research of integrated energy system (IES) a topic of interest. However, the dynamic characteristics of the energy devices and optimal operation strategy of IES still need to be further studied, especially with the integration of storage system. Besides, the influence of mass IESs on distribution grid is also worth taking note of. This paper aims to establish the model of specific devices in micro IES and propose a hierarchical optimal operation strategy for multi micro IESs within distribution system. The proposed hierarchical framework is presented from the micro IES side and distribution system side with different operating objectives. The case study is conducted on the modified IEEE 14-bus system to verify the rationality and effectiveness of the proposed method in terms of the unit commitment, power balance and economic analysis in the micro IES, together with the quantified distribution grid operational indicators. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Pei L., Sun W., Xiang W., Li H.
Title: Mulitiple Value Evaluation for Energy Storage System
Source title: Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference, APPEEC
Affiliations: University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, School of Mechanical Engineering, Shanghai, China; Shanghai University of Electric Power, Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Pei, L., University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, School of Mechanical Engineering, Shanghai, China; Sun, W., University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, School of Mechanical Engineering, Shanghai, China; Xiang, W., University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, School of Mechanical Engineering, Shanghai, China; Li, H., Shanghai University of Electric Power, Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai, China
Abstract: High-penetration renewable energy is an important feature of future power system. However, the power outputs of renewable energy are uncertain, which makes the rigid balance between power sources and power loads much harder to satisfy. Thus, due to the ability of transferring electricity power in time and space dimension, energy storage system technology has been the key supporting technology of future power systems with high penetration renewable energy. Firstly, this paper analyzes the multiple value composition of energy storage system comprehensively, which includes direct value, indirect value and additional vale and analyzes the multiple value characteristics of energy storage system. The multiple value model of energy storage system applied in electric energy time-shift, wind capacity firming, improving electric service reliability and environmental benefit is established. Finally, Garver 6-bus test system is taken as an example to calculate the multiple value the energy storage system under different capacity configuration. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy storage system; high penetration renewable energy; multiple value; value evaluation
Index Keywords: Renewable energy resources; Electric energies; Energy storage systems; Environmental benefits; Important features; multiple value; Renewable energies; Supporting technology; Value evaluations; Electric energy storage

Authors: Bai B., Wang K., Bu L., Liu S., Cheng M., Yue C.
Title: Feasibility Evaluation for a Multi-Energy Microgrid Case Study in China
Source title: Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference, APPEEC
Affiliations: State Grid Energy Conservation Service Co. Ltd, Ducheng Building, 8 Nanheng Road, Xicheng District, Beijing, 100052, China; ABB (China) Power Grids, B21 Universal Plaza, Chaoyang District, Beijing, 100015, China
Authors with affiliations: Bai, B., State Grid Energy Conservation Service Co. Ltd, Ducheng Building, 8 Nanheng Road, Xicheng District, Beijing, 100052, China; Wang, K., State Grid Energy Conservation Service Co. Ltd, Ducheng Building, 8 Nanheng Road, Xicheng District, Beijing, 100052, China; Bu, L., State Grid Energy Conservation Service Co. Ltd, Ducheng Building, 8 Nanheng Road, Xicheng District, Beijing, 100052, China; Liu, S., ABB (China) Power Grids, B21 Universal Plaza, Chaoyang District, Beijing, 100015, China; Cheng, M., ABB (China) Power Grids, B21 Universal Plaza, Chaoyang District, Beijing, 100015, China; Yue, C., ABB (China) Power Grids, B21 Universal Plaza, Chaoyang District, Beijing, 100015, China
Abstract: A microgrid integrates multi-energy distributed generation, cooling-heating-power demand and energy storage to provide an effective solution for power supplies to remote and islanded areas. The microgrid planning should consider both technical and economic aspects based on local demand and resources condition, as well as the network structure and operating strategy of the microgrid. This paper introduces an industrial solution on integrated resource planning for microgrids, which applies the software 'Capacity Expansion' and 'Portfolio Optimization' to optimize the composition and capacity of renewable generations and battery storage, as well as to produce the operational and economic results in a long-term horizon. A case study is performed using the proposed solution based on an actual microgrid project in China. The results provide recommendations on microgrid's generation capacity expansion, optimal sizing for battery storage, operating constraints on energy exchange with upper main grid, and electricity bill contract design. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery storage sizing; capacity expansion; economic analysis; feasibility study; integrated resource planning; microgrid planning
Index Keywords: Economic analysis; Electric batteries; Expansion; Financial data processing; Microgrids; Resource allocation; Capacity expansion; Feasibility studies; Industrial solutions; Integrated resource planning; Micro-grid planning; Operating constraints; Portfolio optimization; Renewable generation; Battery storage

Authors: Solis J., Oka T., Ericsson J., Nilsson M.
Title: Forecasting of Electric Energy Consumption for Housing Cooperative with a Grid Connected PV System
Source title: 7th International Conference on Smart Grid, icSmartGrid 2019
Affiliations: Karlstad University, Department of Engineering and Physics, Karlstad, Sweden; Glava Energy Center, Operations Department, Arvika, Sweden
Authors with affiliations: Solis, J., Karlstad University, Department of Engineering and Physics, Karlstad, Sweden; Oka, T., Karlstad University, Department of Engineering and Physics, Karlstad, Sweden; Ericsson, J., Karlstad University, Department of Engineering and Physics, Karlstad, Sweden; Nilsson, M., Glava Energy Center, Operations Department, Arvika, Sweden
Abstract: Our research aims to develop an adaptive control system for photovoltaic systems with energy storage that adapts after changing different kinds of conditions. In particular, for efficient controlling of battery storage, the precise prediction of electricity consumption is required. Due to the complexity of the proposed research, in this paper, we proposed the simplification of the complexity of the long short-term memory model for the forecasting of the electric energy consumption from a house cooperative in Karlstad, Sweden. Based on the experimental results, there is a 1.233 kWh of mean absolute error and 1.859 kWh of root-mean square error for the predicted energy consumption (validated from testing data collected 7 days after the collected training data for the selected deep learning model). © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: artificial intelligence; energy consumption; housing cooperative; Photovoltaic system
Index Keywords: Adaptive control systems; Artificial intelligence; Deep learning; Digital storage; Electric energy storage; Electric power transmission networks; Forecasting; Housing; Mean square error; Photovoltaic cells; Smart power grids; Electric energy consumption; Electricity-consumption; Grid connected PV system; Learning models; Mean absolute error; Photovoltaic systems; Root mean square errors; Short term memory; Energy utilization

Authors: Davidson I.E., Reddy R.
Title: Performance Evaluation of Solar Roof-Top PV on Eskom's LV Electric Power Distribution Networks
Source title: 7th International Conference on Smart Grid, icSmartGrid 2019
Affiliations: Durban University of Technology, Department of Electrical Power Engineering, Durban, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Davidson, I.E., Durban University of Technology, Department of Electrical Power Engineering, Durban, South Africa; Reddy, R., Durban University of Technology, Department of Electrical Power Engineering, Durban, South Africa
Abstract: The South African government policy to electrify all customers has placed immense demands on the electricity infrastructure. Several new connected customers in line with these government targets and plans are in networks that are already constrained, with the consequence of violating statutory performance requirements and electrical parameters, such as thermal loading, voltage limits and technical losses. Utilities' solutions to remedy these problems sometimes requires huge investments to upgrade infrastructure and this may take years for implementation. In many instances, short-term solutions are available and feasible. This study investigates Solar Roof-Top PV (RTPV) as a renewable energy resource for reticulation (11/22KV) networks. Currently RTPV is not well documented and guided when considering available Grid codes, Guidelines and Standards. This paper demonstrates that RTPV penetration is more worthwhile to consider than capital strengthening/refurbishment projects. The study demonstrates the supportive role of RTPV to meet electrification demands. With increased penetration of RTPV's on distribution networks, there is a benefit to the feeder tail-end voltages with reduced thermal loading and technical losses in distribution networks. This provides Utilities with the opportunity to electrify more customers and defer capital expenditure, while reducing the carbon footprint. The balance of the paper presents an accurate view of RTPV analysis, attributed to the accuracy of data, by using a practical network topology coupled with its related statistical loading. It further takes into account the associated customer connected at the LV transformers. With the imminent influx of RTPV, the results of this study will assist in equipping the South African Electricity Supply Industry (ESI) for the readiness of RTPV and the influence of RTPV on reticulation networks by quantifying the impacts and expectations for the Electric Power Utility and the customer. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS); Roof-Top Photovoltaics (RTPV)
Index Keywords: Carbon footprint; Digital storage; Electric energy storage; Electric power distribution; Electric power transmission networks; Energy policy; Investments; Renewable energy resources; Roofs; Sales; Smart power grids; Thermal load; Battery energy storage systems; Electric power utilities; Electrical parameter; Electricity infrastructure; Photovoltaics; Short-term solutions; South African government; Statutory performance; Electric network parameters

Authors: Saidi A., Harrouz A., Colak I., Kayisli K., Bayindir R.
Title: Performance Enhancement of Hybrid Solar PV-Wind System Based on Fuzzy Power Management Strategy: A Case Study
Source title: 7th International Conference on Smart Grid, icSmartGrid 2019
Affiliations: SGRE Laboratory, Tahri Mohamed University, Electrical Engineering Department, Béchar, 08000, Algeria; LDDI Laboratory, University Ahmed Draia, Department of Hydrocarbon and Renewable Energy, Adrar, 01000, Algeria; Faculty of Engineering and Architecture, Nisantasi University, Department of Electrical-Electronics Eng., Istanbul, Turkey; Gazi University, Faculty of Technology, Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Ankara, Turkey
Authors with affiliations: Saidi, A., SGRE Laboratory, Tahri Mohamed University, Electrical Engineering Department, Béchar, 08000, Algeria; Harrouz, A., LDDI Laboratory, University Ahmed Draia, Department of Hydrocarbon and Renewable Energy, Adrar, 01000, Algeria; Colak, I., Faculty of Engineering and Architecture, Nisantasi University, Department of Electrical-Electronics Eng., Istanbul, Turkey; Kayisli, K., Faculty of Engineering and Architecture, Nisantasi University, Department of Electrical-Electronics Eng., Istanbul, Turkey; Bayindir, R., Gazi University, Faculty of Technology, Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Ankara, Turkey
Abstract: A Standalone hybrid power generated system based on renewable energy systems such as photovoltaic solar (PV) system and PMSG wind turbines (WT) generators are coupled via DC-DC converters to satisfied electric and hydraulic network branch. The electric system branch devises in load as consumers side and the battery bank storage as the second side, the hydraulic system side made of one 5HP motor-pumps installed to meet the freshwater and satisfy consumer demand of a small isolated community. This part of the study describes the importance of binomial Power/Water to manage power flows optimization. For this and other reasons, a new strategy energy Management based on Fuzzy Logic is proposed and developed in this paper. A reliable simulator model of the proposed PV-Wind hybrid system has been introduced and tested via the SIMULINK-MATLAB environment. To extract a real scenario predicted, a group of tests is carried out with real data using meteorological data detected in Adrar region and compared with the practical load demand profile estimated. The simulation shows that the 'coupled strategy' clearly outperforms the classical management strategies. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Batteries; fuzzy logic; motor-pumps; Power management; PV; Wind

Authors: Cosemans S., Verhoef B., Doevenspeck J., Papistas I.A., Catthoor F., Debacker P., Mallik A., Verkest D.
Title: Towards 10000TOPS/W DNN Inference with Analog in-Memory Computing - A Circuit Blueprint, Device Options and Requirements
Source title: Technical Digest - International Electron Devices Meeting, IEDM
Affiliations: Imec, Leuven, Belgium; KU Leuven, Leuven, Belgium
Authors with affiliations: Cosemans, S., Imec, Leuven, Belgium; Verhoef, B., Imec, Leuven, Belgium; Doevenspeck, J., Imec, Leuven, Belgium, KU Leuven, Leuven, Belgium; Papistas, I.A., Imec, Leuven, Belgium; Catthoor, F., Imec, Leuven, Belgium, KU Leuven, Leuven, Belgium; Debacker, P., Imec, Leuven, Belgium; Mallik, A., Imec, Leuven, Belgium; Verkest, D., Imec, Leuven, Belgium
Abstract: This paper presents a blueprint for a 10000TOPS/W matrix-vector multiplier for neural network inference based on Analog in-Memory Computing (AiMC), an energy efficiency at least 10x beyond ultimate digital implementations. The presented analysis connects circuit design with technology options and requirements. A compute array using pulse-width encoded activations and precharge-discharge summation line is used as circuit blueprint, key device requirements for this compute array are derived and 3 suited device options are discussed: SOT-MRAM, IGZO-based 2T1C DRAM gain cell, and projection PCM with separate write path. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Deep neural networks; Dynamic random access storage; Electron devices; Energy efficiency; Green computing; MRAM devices; Semiconducting indium compounds; Timing circuits; Circuit designs; Device options; Digital implementation; Matrix-vector multipliers; Network inference; Pre-charge; Pulsewidths; Technology options; Integrated circuit manufacture

Authors: Liao Z., Wei Q., Song R.
Title: Parallel Adaptive Critic Designs of Optimal Control for Ice-Storage Air Conditioning Systems
Source title: 2019 IEEE Symposium Series on Computational Intelligence, SSCI 2019
Affiliations: Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences, State Key Laboratory of Management and Control for Complex Systems, Beijing, China; University of Science and Technology Beijing, School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Liao, Z., Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences, State Key Laboratory of Management and Control for Complex Systems, Beijing, China; Wei, Q., Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences, State Key Laboratory of Management and Control for Complex Systems, Beijing, China; Song, R., University of Science and Technology Beijing, School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China
Abstract: As a kind of distributed energy storage system, ice-storage air conditioning (IAC) system is an effective way for transferring cooling load. A parallel adaptive critic design method is constructed for solving the optimal control problem of IAC systems. Adaptive critic design is also called adaptive dynamic programming (ADP). The initial value function of the parallel ADP method is obtained by using particle swarm optimization (PSO) method to pre-train the weights of the neural networks. Another PSO algorithm is utilized in each iteration to achieve the target control, which avoids solving a nonlinear equation in traditional ADP algorithms. Finally, the efficiency of the parallel ADP algorithm will be illustrated through the experiment results. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: adaptive dynamic programming; ice-storage air conditioning; Parallel adaptive critic design; particle swarm optimization

Authors: Wang L., Liu C., Dong X., Zhang X., Wang Y., Wang Y.
Title: Design and Implementation of Fault Injector for Hybrid Heterogeneous Storage System
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Computational Intelligence and Knowledge Economy, ICCIKE 2019
Affiliations: Xi'An Jiaotong University, School of Electronics and Information Engineering, Xian, China; Shenzhen Institute of Information Technology, College of Software, Shenzhen, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, L., Xi'An Jiaotong University, School of Electronics and Information Engineering, Xian, China; Liu, C., Xi'An Jiaotong University, School of Electronics and Information Engineering, Xian, China; Dong, X., Xi'An Jiaotong University, School of Electronics and Information Engineering, Xian, China; Zhang, X., Xi'An Jiaotong University, School of Electronics and Information Engineering, Xian, China; Wang, Y., Xi'An Jiaotong University, School of Electronics and Information Engineering, Xian, China; Wang, Y., Shenzhen Institute of Information Technology, College of Software, Shenzhen, China
Abstract: Compared with traditional HDD(Hard Disk Drive), SSD (Solid-state drive) has the advantages of fast read and write performance, light weight and low energy consumption. However, the cost of per GB data by SSD is much more than that by HDD. Therefore, the hybrid heterogeneous storage system based on SSD and HDD has become the main stream of development of storage systems. In the hybrid storage system, the internal structure, working principle and failure mechanism of different storage devices are very different, which brings great challenges to the reliability of the storage system. Therefore, how to evaluate the reliability of hybrid heterogeneous storage system has become an important research area. The former evaluation method lacks the consideration of the heterogeneity of storage system and the failure rate of storage medium. To solve these problems, we design and implement a fault injector for hybrid heterogeneous storage systems by using the Systemtap and shell script to inject fault. The fault types are classified into four types: storage media failures, memory failures, CPU failures and network adapter failures. In addition, for the storage media failures, we establish corresponding function model of fault rate according to the related research on HDD and SSD failure rate and use those models to inject faults. By this way, in a short time we can evaluate the reliability of hybrid heterogeneous storage system for long-term operation. The experimental results show that the fault injector can effectively simulate the hardware failures in the hybrid heterogeneous storage system. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: failure rate function model; fault injection; hybrid heterogeneous storage system; systemtap
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Energy utilization; Failure (mechanical); Failure analysis; Function evaluation; Software testing; Virtual storage; Design and implementations; Design and implements; Failure rate functions; Fault injection; Hybrid storage systems; Low energy consumption; Storage systems; systemtap; Hard disk storage

Authors: Garniwa I., Kuncoro M., Darussalam R.
Title: Comparative Study for PV Power Stabilization Technology using Matlab Simulink
Source title: Proceedings of the 2019 International Conference on Mechatronics, Robotics and Systems Engineering, MoRSE 2019
Affiliations: University of Indonesia, Department of Electrical Engineering, Depok, Indonesia; Research Center for Electrical Power and Mechatronics, Indonesian Institute of Sciences, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Garniwa, I., University of Indonesia, Department of Electrical Engineering, Depok, Indonesia; Kuncoro, M., University of Indonesia, Department of Electrical Engineering, Depok, Indonesia; Darussalam, R., Research Center for Electrical Power and Mechatronics, Indonesian Institute of Sciences, Indonesia
Abstract: Nowadays the global utilization of solar energy for electricity generation has greatly increased. But the amount is still very small compared to the other existing potentials. The classic issue in the utilization of solar energy is intermittent solar energy and power fluctuations. The power of the PV is not fixed, unpredictable and dependent on natural factors, namely irradiation, temperature and the influence of shadows. Several methods have been proposed to overcome intermittent energy and fluctuations in PV power including the Hybrid PV Generators, Power Curtailment, Geographical Dispersed, and Electrical Storage methods. Each method has characteristics in its application. Hybrid PV generators are relatively easy to apply but they are expensive and cause greenhouse gases. Power Curtailment is easy to apply but it is inefficient because a lot of energy is wasted. Geographical Dispersed requires large land. Electrical storage requires a large energy storage capacity. To overcome this, a new method is proposed, namely Dynamic Power Injection which is a combination of MPPT, Power Curtailment, and Electrical Storage. A comparative study with simulation using Simulink Matlab against 3 methods of PV power stabilization was conducted. The simulation results show that the DPI method is the most effective and efficient way to increase the stability of PV power. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: DPI; Matlab Simulink; PV power stabilization
Index Keywords: Agricultural robots; Electric energy storage; Greenhouse gases; MATLAB; Robotics; Solar energy; Stabilization; Systems engineering; Comparative studies; Electricity generation; Energy storage capacity; ITS applications; MATLAB/ SIMULINK; Natural factors; Power fluctuations; Power stabilization; Solar power generation

Authors: Zhang H., Zhao G., Qin X.
Title: Analysis of Grain Condition in Improved Granary Based on Grey Prediction Algorithm
Source title: 2019 IEEE Symposium Series on Computational Intelligence, SSCI 2019
Affiliations: Xi'an University of Post Telecommunications, School of Automation, Xi'an, 710121, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, H., Xi'an University of Post Telecommunications, School of Automation, Xi'an, 710121, China; Zhao, G., Xi'an University of Post Telecommunications, School of Automation, Xi'an, 710121, China; Qin, X., Xi'an University of Post Telecommunications, School of Automation, Xi'an, 710121, China
Abstract: Scientific grain storage plays an important role in ensuring food security and promoting high-efficiency energy-saving operations. The paper provides more accurate reference datas for grain storage work. It can easily monitor the grain situation during the reserve period, and can scientifically predict the future grain development trend more accurately. It takes countermeasure in advance to prevent food disaster and further reduce. The workload of the warehouse clerk and related staff, while ensuring the safe and stable operation of the grain storage. Compared with the traditional Gery Model, the residual correction method is proposed to improve the data prediction accuracy. Combined with the Grey Verhulst model, a new residual-corrected Verhulst model is proposed. The simulation prove that the improved model is more traditional than the traditional one. The model is more conducive to the prediction of volatility data and the prediction accuracy is greatly improved. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: gery model; grain situation prediction; grey verhulst model; residual correction
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Digital storage; Disaster prevention; Energy conservation; Food storage; Food supply; Energy-saving operation; Grain development; Grey Verhulst model; Grey-prediction algorithms; Prediction accuracy; Residual correction; Situation prediction; Stable operation; Forecasting

Authors: Khan A., Javaid N.
Title: Optimum sizing of PV-WT-FC-DG hybrid energy system using teaching learning-based optimization
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 International Conference on Frontiers of Information Technology, FIT 2019
Affiliations: COMSATS University Islamabad, Islamabad, 44000, Pakistan
Authors with affiliations: Khan, A., COMSATS University Islamabad, Islamabad, 44000, Pakistan; Javaid, N., COMSATS University Islamabad, Islamabad, 44000, Pakistan
Abstract: In a hybrid energy system, fulfilling the user's electricity demand cost-effectively is an imperative task. In a stand-alone environment, diesel generator (DG) and renewable energy sources (RESs) like wind turbines (WTs), photovoltaics (PVs), and fuel cells (FCs) provide an effective and reliable solution to fulfill a household load. To achieve the economic and environmental aspects of hybrid RESs (HRESs), optimal sizing of components is indispensable. In this paper, the PVWT-FC-DG hybrid system is considered, optimally sized, and modeled in terms of environmental emissions and total annual cost (TAC) values for Hawksbay, Pakistan. For optimal sizing, the teaching learning-based optimization (TLBO) algorithm is proposed that does not require any algorithm-specific parameter for its execution. The results reveal that TLBO fulfills the household load at minimum TAC. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy storage system; Fuel cells; Optimization; Renewable energy sources; Standalone system; Unit sizing
Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; Electromagnetic wave emission; Fuel cells; Fuel storage; Hybrid systems; Natural resources; Optimization; Energy storage systems; Environmental aspects; Environmental emissions; Hybrid energy system; Renewable energy source; Standalone systems; Teaching-learning-based optimizations; Unit sizing; Renewable energy resources

Authors: Hussain S.S., Khattak K.S., Khan A., Khan Z.H.
Title: Cyber physical system for solar energy monitoring
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 International Conference on Frontiers of Information Technology, FIT 2019
Affiliations: Department of Computer Systems Engineering, University of Engineering and Technology, Peshawar, Pakistan
Authors with affiliations: Hussain, S.S., Department of Computer Systems Engineering, University of Engineering and Technology, Peshawar, Pakistan; Khattak, K.S., Department of Computer Systems Engineering, University of Engineering and Technology, Peshawar, Pakistan; Khan, A., Department of Computer Systems Engineering, University of Engineering and Technology, Peshawar, Pakistan; Khan, Z.H., Department of Computer Systems Engineering, University of Engineering and Technology, Peshawar, Pakistan
Abstract: Renewable energy sources (RES) are potential sources of carbon neutral, sustainable and unlimited energy to satiate growing world energy needs. Among these, solar energy has evolved as the most cost-effective and mature technology for energy generation. Solar energy being intermittent in nature with numerous parameters affecting its operations such as sunlight intensity, soiling on solar panels and panel defects can result in unexpected and undesirable power output oscillation. Thus a low cost, real time solar panel monitoring system is needed for performance evaluation and preventive measures. This work presents a low-cost real time cyber-physical system for remote monitoring of solar energy plants. The proposed system uses arduino nano integrated with current, voltage, light intensity, dust, humidity and temperature sensors for performance evaluation and effect of different sensed parameters on power generation. Using GSM module, the sensed parameters are transmitted to free and open source cloud platform for processing, storage, analysis and preventive measures to enhance power generation capability. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Matheri A.N., Ngila J.C., Njenga C.K., Belaid M., Van Rensburg N.J.
Title: Smart City Energy Trend Transformation in the Fourth Industrial Revolution Digital Disruption
Source title: IEEE International Conference on Industrial Engineering and Engineering Management
Affiliations: Process Energy Environmental Technology Station (PEETS), University of Johannesburg, South Africa; University of Johannesburg, Department of Chemical Sciences, Johannesburg, South Africa; United Nation Environment Programme (UNEP), Pretoria, South Africa; University of Johannesburg, Department of Chemical Engineering, Johannesburg, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Matheri, A.N., Process Energy Environmental Technology Station (PEETS), University of Johannesburg, South Africa; Ngila, J.C., University of Johannesburg, Department of Chemical Sciences, Johannesburg, South Africa; Njenga, C.K., United Nation Environment Programme (UNEP), Pretoria, South Africa; Belaid, M., University of Johannesburg, Department of Chemical Engineering, Johannesburg, South Africa; Van Rensburg, N.J., Process Energy Environmental Technology Station (PEETS), University of Johannesburg, South Africa
Abstract: The future of digital transformation of industrial platform and electricity lies on the electrification, decentralization and digitalization. Technologies are becoming commercially available to systems and services that can enable efficient and sustainable management of energy production and use. In short, smart cities can be defined as a city that uses IC'I's solutions such as smart sensors, cognitive learning, and context awareness to make life more comfortable, more efficient and more sustainable. A smart city is a sustainable and efficient urban center providing its inhabitants with a high quality of life through optimal management resources. This study examines how intelligent technologies and services can integrate local energy production and use to provide a more sustainable and efficient system. Due to rapid urbanization, energy management in smart cities is an essential challenge to tackle. Due to the complexity of the energy systems and their vital role, energy management is one of the most demanding issues within urban centers. Therefore, this problem needs to be devoted to considerable attention and effort. Optimized operations using predictive analytics, data mining and modeling are the main tools commonly used to evaluate the technological and policy impacts of smart solutions, as well as to plan the best ways to move from current to smarter cities. The reviews show energy-related work on smart city planning and operating models by classifying their scope into main areas of intervention: energy generation, infrastructure, energy storage, mobile internet, cloud technology, internet of things (IoT), autonomous and near autonomous vehicles, facilities, and intelligent transport system. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: 4IR; Digital Transformation; Energy; Sustainable Management; Technology Disruption
Index Keywords: Data mining; Digital storage; Electric energy storage; Energy management; Intelligent systems; Internet of things; Predictive analytics; Smart city; Sustainable development; Digital transformation; Energy; Industrial revolutions; Intelligent technology; Intelligent transport systems; Internet of Things (IOT); Optimized operations; Sustainable management; Energy management systems

Authors: Gencer A., Surucu G.
Title: DFT study for the mechanical and electronic properties of Mg3BHx (x=l,4,7) compounds for hydrogen storage applications
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: Karamanoglu Mehmetbey University, Dept. of Physics, Karaman, 70100, Turkey; Middle East Technical University, Dept. of Physics, Ankara, 06800, Turkey; Ahi Evran University, Department of Electric and Energy, Kirsehir, 40100, Turkey
Authors with affiliations: Gencer, A., Karamanoglu Mehmetbey University, Dept. of Physics, Karaman, 70100, Turkey; Surucu, G., Middle East Technical University, Dept. of Physics, Ankara, 06800, Turkey, Ahi Evran University, Department of Electric and Energy, Kirsehir, 40100, Turkey
Abstract: The electronic devices such as cell phones, laptops etc. are a necessary part of our daily life that requires portable power sources. Hydrogen being the most abundant element on the Earth, is an excellent energy carrier with high energy capacity that enable to use hydrogen storage methods in portable power sources. In addition, hydrogen storage could be essential to store the energy obtained from the renewable energy sources. The solid state hydrogen storage is an encouraging method for hydrogen storage applications. In this study, Mg3BHx (x=1,4,7) compounds have been studied using Density Functional Theory (DFT) with the Vienna Ab-initio Simulation Package (VASP). The elastic constants have been obtained for the optimized structures. In addition, the band structures have been determined with the corresponding density of states. The gravimetric storage capacities have been determined for these compounds. Mg3BHx compounds with mechanical stability could be promising compounds for hydrogen storage applications. © 2019 Author(s).

Title: International Conference "Information Technologies in Business and Industry" - 2 - Mathematical Simulation and Computer Data Analysis

Authors: Yun D., Zonglin L., Shouxue C.
Title: The Methods of Range Query and Access Control on Multidimensional Data of Two-layer Wireless Sensor Network Facing Privacy Protection
Source title: PervasiveHealth: Pervasive Computing Technologies for Healthcare
Affiliations: College of Information Science and Engineering, Guilin University of Technology, Guilin Guangxi, China
Authors with affiliations: Yun, D., College of Information Science and Engineering, Guilin University of Technology, Guilin Guangxi, China; Zonglin, L., College of Information Science and Engineering, Guilin University of Technology, Guilin Guangxi, China; Shouxue, C., College of Information Science and Engineering, Guilin University of Technology, Guilin Guangxi, China
Abstract: As the low-power sensor nodes are limited in computing competency and storage space and wireless sensor network features in lower bandwidth and higher channel error ratio, energy-efficient range-querying methods to privately protect multidimensional data are proposed with two-layer wireless sensor network taken as the research object. Based on the pre-shared key mechanism and Diffie-Hellman key exchange protocol, the key management mechanism of symmetric encryption algorithm is designed, and the confidentiality of data transmission and storage is realized on the basis of lightweight data encryption algorithms, such as AES and RC6; The multidimensional data's time-property of two-dimensional characteristic defined by formalization divides the storage structure of the privacy data included in sensor network into many two-dimensional subspaces according to the attribute and the collection time period of data, so as to achieve the storage of multidimensional collected data; Based on the approach of order-preserving function as well as Cramer's Rule working out polynomial, the range query of the multidimensional data for two-layer sensor network, without revealing privacy information, is accurately finished with the improvement the of energy consumption efficiency; The methods, the encryption chain formed by the neighbor data items and the code set encoded by reconstructed order-preserving, are adopted to respond to the attack by part returning query results, in order to verify integrity of search results. Fine-grained access control and anonymous access of the query are realized with taking the k-Threshold strategy in the Sahai scheme as reference, and employing the attribute base encryption algorithm, attribute certificate, digital signature as well as threshold mechanism. Both theoretical analysis and experimental results show that this method privately protects perception data, query results and target ranges, and boasts higher energy efficiency than the existing methods. © 2019 ACM.
Author Keywords: Access control; Multidimensional data; Privacy protection; Range query; Two-layer wireless sensor network
Index Keywords: Access control; Data privacy; Digital storage; Energy efficiency; Energy utilization; Information management; Low power electronics; Network layers; Sensor nodes; Attribute certificate; Data encryption algorithm; Diffie-Hellman key exchange protocol; Encryption algorithms; Energy consumption efficiency; Key management mechanism; Order-preserving functions; Two-dimensional subspaces; Cryptography

Title: Simulation Research on Battery Charge and Discharge Control
Source title: PervasiveHealth: Pervasive Computing Technologies for Healthcare

Authors with affiliations: Wang, Y., College of Mechanical and Control Engineering, Guilin University of Technology, Guilin, China; Zhang, Y., College of Mechanical and Control Engineering, Guilin University of Technology, Guangxi Key Laboratory of Building, New Energy and Energy Saving, Guilin, China; Lu, Q., Guangxi Key Laboratory of Building, New Energy and Energy Saving, Guilin, China
Abstract: DC microgrid system consisting of photovoltaic power generation and storage battery can achieve energy balance andimprove power quality. In this paper, considering the battery voltage change and the temperature change, the double-closed-loop control bidirectional DC conversion ensures the normal energy exchange between the battery and the photovoltaic cell. Finally, the simulation model is established in MATLAB/Simulink, and the simulation of PV DC microgrid in different operating conditions is carried out. The simulation results verify the effectiveness and feasibility of the proposed control strategy. © 2019 ACM.

Authors: Huang H., Zhang M., Li G., Wang Z.
Title: A 2Mbps sub-100μw crystal-less rf transmitter with energy harvesting for multi-channel neural signal acquisition
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 IEEE Asian Solid-State Circuits Conference, A-SSCC 2019
Affiliations: Department of Electronic Engineering; Institute of Microelectronics, Tsinghua University, China
Authors with affiliations: Huang, H., Department of Electronic Engineering; Zhang, M., Department of Electronic Engineering; Li, G., Department of Electronic Engineering; Wang, Z., Institute of Microelectronics, Tsinghua University, China
Abstract: This paper presents a 427MHz OOK modulated transmitter with energy harvesting for multi-channel neural acquisition. A power efficient OOK modulator is proposed integrated a 3-input AND gate array to drive the power transistors. The requirement on the driving capability of the VCO output is greatly reduced. A 9-stage ring oscillator based VCO is designed with PLL and edge-combining technology. A crystal based 6.78MHz oscillator is combined with the wireless power transmitter coil to power up the entire transmitter design, as well as to generate a reference frequency to the transmitter, resulting a crystal-less transmitter design. The proposed design was fabricated in 180nm technology, occupying a silicon area of only 0.26mm2. Experimental results show a power consumption of 96μW with a -19dBm output. A 48pJ/bit efficiency is achieved under a data rate of 2Mbps. © IEEE 2019
Author Keywords: Edge-combining; Energy havering; Neural signal acquisition; Phase locked loop; Ring oscillator; Transmitter; Ultra-low-power; Wireless power transmission
