Authors: Kadar P.
Title: Role of the battery storage in the operation of the power system
Source title: CANDO-EPE 2019 - Proceedings: IEEE 2nd International Conference and Workshop in Obuda on Electrical and Power Engineering
Affiliations: Dept. of Power Systems, Kandó Kálmán Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Alternative Energy Resources Knowledge Center, Óbuda University Budapest, Hungary
Authors with affiliations: Kadar, P., Dept. of Power Systems, Kandó Kálmán Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Alternative Energy Resources Knowledge Center, Óbuda University Budapest, Hungary
Abstract: The application of the batteries only for power system scale stationary energy storage is not the best investment. The power electronics combined smartly controllable storage units has more benefits in the power system operation. In the last years spread over the small household kW scale batteries, the Plug-in Hybrid Electric Vehicles (PHEV) and the medium size MW scale battery storage facilities. The operation of these tools affect differently the power systems. The main role of household devices is to store the daytime generated PV energy and push back it in the early night hours. It is a rough change in the customers daily demand profile and affects the global load curve too. The PHEV-s have mainly security storage role. In case of smaller system disturbance the thousands of Electric Vehicles (EV) can feed back to the (low voltage) power system some energy that can ease the power system level power lack. The medium size battery banks can serve as primary source for the load-frequency control (FCR), but also can form reserve for the secondary control (FRR) in the large power systems but in the smaller microgrids as well. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery storage; EV storage; Power system
Index Keywords: Electric frequency control; Electric power system control; Investments; Microgrids; Plug-in hybrid vehicles; Secondary batteries; Large power systems; Load-frequency control; Plug in hybrid electric vehicles; Power system operations; Secondary control; Stationary energy storages; Storage facilities; System disturbances; Battery storage

Authors: Kotb K.M., Elmorshedy M.F., Dan A.
Title: Permanence improvement of a local energy production system including unbalanced loading
Source title: CANDO-EPE 2019 - Proceedings: IEEE 2nd International Conference and Workshop in Obuda on Electrical and Power Engineering
Affiliations: Tanta University, Department of Electrical Power and Machines Engineering, Tanta, Egypt; Budapest University of Technology and Economics, Budapest, Hungary; Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China; Budapest University of Technology and Economics, Department of Electrical Power Engineering, Budapest, Hungary
Authors with affiliations: Kotb, K.M., Tanta University, Department of Electrical Power and Machines Engineering, Tanta, Egypt, Budapest University of Technology and Economics, Budapest, Hungary; Elmorshedy, M.F., Tanta University, Department of Electrical Power and Machines Engineering, Tanta, Egypt, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China; Dan, A., Budapest University of Technology and Economics, Department of Electrical Power Engineering, Budapest, Hungary
Abstract: To establish a more sustainable future, we need to utilize local renewable energy sources and use up this energy in a smarter way. However, there are a lot of challenges and threats that evolve from elevated penetration levels in both photovoltaic and wind energy systems and due to sudden unbalance in the load. This paper introduces an adequate solution to enhance the stability functioning of a local energy production system (LEPS) with the aid of a robust control technique. This LEPS comprises of PV unit, wind turbine integrated with a battery bank due to the intermittency nature of both PV and wind power generating systems. In addition, both PV and wind power generation systems are separately moderated to wrest their maximum accessible powers. The usefulness of the control techniques is inspected in the presence of both constant and variable wind speed and partially shadow on the PV unit. Moreover, the unremitting load supplying at constant voltage and frequency for balanced and sudden unbalanced loading conditions is investigated via a variable modulation index control of the voltage source inverter. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery Storage System; DC-bus; Local Energy Production System; MPPT Techniques; Variable Modulation Index Control
Index Keywords: Electric inverters; Electric power generation; Robust control; Wind; Control techniques; Penetration level; Robust control techniques; Unbalanced loading; Voltage source inverter; Wind energy systems; Wind power generation systems; Wind-power generating systems; Wind power

Authors: Poursafar N., Taghizadeh S., Hossain M.J.
Title: An optimized power management system for an islanded DC microgrid
Source title: 2019 29th Australasian Universities Power Engineering Conference, AUPEC 2019
Authors with affiliations: Poursafar, N.; Taghizadeh, S.; Hossain, M.J.
Abstract: This paper presents an optimized power management scheme for an islanded dc microgrid (DCMG), which includes a photovoltaic system (PV) as a distributed generator (DG), a backup energy storage system (BESS), electric vehicles (EV), an ac load and dc loads. Conventionally, the DCMGs were required to either be shut down during critical situations of their dc-bus overvoltage, or experienced load curtailment during undervoltage caused by a high mismatch between load demand and generation. To solve this issue, weather forecasting and/or employing more DGs were required which had the drawbacks of complexity, availability of more sources and higher cost. The proposed system in this paper uses an enhanced control strategy for the converter's operation of the integrated PV system. As a result, unlike the conventional power management systems, the stability of the dc-bus voltage can be ensured, particularly during the critical situation of dc-bus overvoltage without a need for shutting down the system, adding complexity and increasing total cost. The proposed power management system is analyzed by different scenarios in MATLAB Simulink. From results, it is found that the proposed optimized energy management provides a robust and stable operation for the dc bus when a BESS/EV assistance is not available. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: DC microgrid; Distributed generator (DG); Islanding mode; Power management system; Voltage stability
Index Keywords: Electrolysis; Microgrids; Photovoltaic cells; Weather forecasting; Control strategies; Conventional power; Distributed generators; Energy storage systems; Optimized energy managements; Photovoltaic systems; Power management scheme; Power management systems; Power management

Authors: Chang J., Du Y., Chen X., Lim E.G., Yan K.
Title: Forecasting based virtual inertia control of PV systems for islanded micro-grid
Source title: 2019 29th Australasian Universities Power Engineering Conference, AUPEC 2019
Authors with affiliations: Chang, J.; Du, Y.; Chen, X.; Lim, E.G.; Yan, K.
Abstract: Grid frequency stability is maintained by the power system inertia. However, as the converter interfaced photovoltaic (PV) generation increases, the system inertia reduces. This may result in system failures, especially for islanded micro-grid. Virtual inertial control (VIC) technology, which enables PVs to mimic the characteristics of synchronous generators (SG), has drawn increasing attention. Nevertheless, the implementation of a traditional VSG strategy typically requires a constant PV power reserve, causing unnecessary production loss during system steady states. Although VIC can also be effectively implemented by utilizing an energy storage system (ESS). The high cost is still hindering its large-scale integration. In this paper, a forecasting based virtual inertia control (FB-VIC) strategy is proposed, which enables the PV system to serve as an alternative inertia supplier without using any ESS. PV generation is pre-reserved based on the load forecasting results. The reserved PV power and SG are coordinated to perform frequency regulation. A simulation model is built to simulate the proposed FB-VIC method during a system contingency. The simulation results reveal that the proposed method can reduce the instantaneous SG power capacity over 40%. In addition, the proposed control method limits the frequency oscillation in a smaller range, which improves the system dynamic stability. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Load forecasting; Micro-grid; Virtual inertial control; Virtual synchronous generator
Index Keywords: Forecasting; Photovoltaic cells; Systems engineering; Energy storage systems; Frequency oscillations; Frequency regulations; Inertial controls; Islanded micro grids; Photovoltaic generation; Simulation model; System contingencies; System stability

Authors: Liikanen H., Aref M.M., Mattila J.
Title: M-Estimator Application in Real-Time Sensor Fusion for Smooth Position Feedback of Heavy-Duty Field Robots
Source title: Proceedings of the IEEE 2019 9th International Conference on Cybernetics and Intelligent Systems and Robotics, Automation and Mechatronics, CIS and RAM 2019
Affiliations: Tampere University, Unit of Automation Technology and Mechanical Engineering, Tampere, Finland
Authors with affiliations: Liikanen, H., Tampere University, Unit of Automation Technology and Mechanical Engineering, Tampere, Finland; Aref, M.M., Tampere University, Unit of Automation Technology and Mechanical Engineering, Tampere, Finland; Mattila, J., Tampere University, Unit of Automation Technology and Mechanical Engineering, Tampere, Finland
Abstract: In this paper, we study the performance of a complementary filter with adaptive weights in a sensor fusion application for real-time localization of an omnidirectional field robot. The test-case robot is a large, four-wheel drive and steer (4WDS) construction vehicle with nonlinear internal dynamics and hydraulic driving and steering actuators. Our objective is to provide the vehicle's real-time controller with robust, smooth feedback that prevents unnecessary oscillations in steering, which can waste significant amounts of energy. We do so by assigning weights for measurements based on their consistency with the robot's motions. The calculations are based on two main data sources: (1) measured velocity vectors from wheel driving (odometer) and steering of the 4WDS test-case robot; and (2) data obtained from a differential global navigation satellite system on the absolute pose of the robot. We show that the sensor fusion is robust to the noise and single point failures of the sensors, while the maximum heading oscillations are reduced by 70%-95%, preserving the accuracy of the global positioning system. Moreover, we demonstrate the feasibility and efficacy of the real-time implementation of this filtering method in path-following control of the robot. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: GNSS; GPS; heavy-dutyfield robot; motion estimation; path following; sensor fusion; wheel odometry
Index Keywords: Agricultural robots; All wheel drive vehicles; Automobile steering equipment; Digital storage; Feedback; Four wheel steering; Global positioning system; Hydraulic actuators; Intelligent systems; Real time control; Robotics; Solid wastes; Wheels; Complementary filters; Differential global navigation satellite systems; Path following control; Real time controllers; Real-time implementations; Real-time localization; Sensor-fusion applications; Single point failure; Robots

Authors: Chen L., Su Z.
Title: Realization of Modern Tram Data Acquisition System Based on Labview and Modbus TCP
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 2nd International Conference on Safety Produce Informatization, IICSPI 2019
Affiliations: CCCC Tunnel Engineering Company Limited, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, L., CCCC Tunnel Engineering Company Limited, Beijing, China; Su, Z., CCCC Tunnel Engineering Company Limited, Beijing, China
Abstract: In order to develop modern tram energy-saving management system, a real-time data acquisition system based on Labview and Modbus TCP communication protocol is designed. Compared with the traditional human-machine interface (HMI) development, which requires the establishment of Modbus I/O server, the development steps of the system are simpler. Compared with the disadvantages of poor self-adaptability and low communication efficiency of serial communication, Ethernet has a wide range of networking, good compatibility and strong anti-jamming ability, which meets the practical application requirements of large data communication volume and efficient transmission of the system. The system is installed on an industrial computer and can be debugged and operated independently. It establishes communication connection with depot energy management system through TCP/IP protocol, and then obtains corresponding energy consumption data through question-and-answer transmission protocol Modbus. Experiments show that the developed modern tram data acquisition system can realize real-time data collection, display and storage, which provides powerful support for modern tram energy management. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: communication protocol; Labview; Modbus TCP; Modern tram energy-saving management
Index Keywords: Data acquisition; Digital storage; Energy conservation; Energy management; Energy management systems; Energy utilization; Information management; Program debugging; Railroad rolling stock; Transmission control protocol; Application requirements; Communication connection; Communication efficiency; Data acquisition system; Energy consumption datum; Energy saving managements; Real time data collections; Real-time data acquisition systems; Data communication systems

Authors: Mao M., Cheng D., Chang L.
Title: Investigation on the Pattern of Transient Energy Flow under DC Fault of MMC-HVDC Grid
Source title: 2019 4th IEEE Workshop on the Electronic Grid, eGRID 2019
Affiliations: Research Center for Photovoltaic System Engineering, MOE, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China
Authors with affiliations: Mao, M., Research Center for Photovoltaic System Engineering, MOE, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China; Cheng, D., Research Center for Photovoltaic System Engineering, MOE, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China; Chang, L., Research Center for Photovoltaic System Engineering, MOE, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China
Abstract: This paper presents an analysis method of electromagnetic transient energy flow for modular multilevel converter based high voltage direct current grid. This method can extract the features of transient energy flow of the key components such as AC side, DC side, three-phase upper and lower bridge arm inductors, energy storage elements and DC side inductor under the condition of DC side faults. The characteristics of each part of electromagnetic transient energy are analyzed, along with the key factors affecting the evolution of them, in order to provide a basis for the optimal design of DC short-circuit fault detection and protection strategy. The four-terminal MMC-HVDC grid simulation model is built in PSCAD. The transient energy flow of the system under different scenarios for DC side fault is analyzed in details. The simulation results show that the transient energy flow and its evolution characteristics can provide a new way for the fast location of DC short-circuit fault and the optimization of protection strategy. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: DC fault protection; Fault detection; MMC-HVDC grid; Transient energy flow
Index Keywords: Fault detection; Transients; Electro-magnetic transient; Evolution characteristics; High voltage direct current; Modular multilevel converters; Protection strategy; Short-circuit fault; Storage elements; Transient energy flow; HVDC power transmission

Authors: Zhang Y., Liu X., Wu Y., Wang S.-E., Wang Y., Tang Z., Zheng H., Hao J.
Title: Analysis of Inertia Mechanism of Grid-tied Photovoltaic Power Generation System with Virtual Inertia Control
Source title: 2019 4th IEEE Workshop on the Electronic Grid, eGRID 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Research Institute, Taiyuan, China; School of Electrical and Control Engineering, Shaanxi University of Science Technology, Xi'an, China; School of Automation, Nanjing Institute of Technology, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, Y., State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Research Institute, Taiyuan, China; Liu, X., State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Research Institute, Taiyuan, China; Wu, Y., School of Electrical and Control Engineering, Shaanxi University of Science Technology, Xi'an, China; Wang, S.-E., School of Electrical and Control Engineering, Shaanxi University of Science Technology, Xi'an, China; Wang, Y., School of Automation, Nanjing Institute of Technology, Nanjing, China; Tang, Z., State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Research Institute, Taiyuan, China; Zheng, H., State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Research Institute, Taiyuan, China; Hao, J., State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Research Institute, Taiyuan, China
Abstract: In the absence of energy storage, photovoltaics (PV) also need to provide inertia support to the power electronic power system. Based on the DC bus voltage droop control to provide the inertia of the converter, two improved virtual inertia control strategies are proposed. From the perspective of DC bus voltage Udc and system virtual inertia coefficient Hv under load disturbance, the advantages and disadvantages of three virtual inertia control strategies and the influence of control parameters on system inertia are analyzed. The conventional droop control is a full-band response load disturbance, and the inertia coefficient Hdpincreases with the droop coefficient Kdp increases, but the DC bus voltage cannot be restored to the initial set value. The improved low-pass filter control (ILPFC) only responds to the load disturbance in the low frequency band. In fact, a delay link is introduced on the basis of the conventional droop control to slow down the frequency response speed, and increasing the K1 or ω1 can also increase the system inertia effect. The improved high-pass filter control (IHPFC) only responds to load disturbances in the high frequency band, overcomes the problem that the conventional droop control cannot restore the DC bus voltage to the initial set value. Meanwhile, increasing Kh or decreasing ωh can also improve the system inertia support. Finally, the effectiveness of the control strategy and the correctness of the analysis conclusion are verified by simulation. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Conventional droop control; Improved high-pass filter control; Improved low-pass filter control; Photovoltaic system; Virtual inertia control
Index Keywords: Frequency response; High pass filters; HVDC power transmission; Low pass filters; Photovoltaic cells; Restoration; Solar energy; Control parameters; Control strategies; Electronic power systems; High frequency bands; Inertia coefficient; Load disturbances; Low frequency band; Photovoltaic power generation systems; Electric power system control

Authors: Golosova J., Romanovs A., Kunicina N.
Title: Review of the Blockchain Technology in the Energy Sector
Source title: Advances in Information, Electronic and Electrical Engineering, AIEEE 2019 - Proceedings of the 7th IEEE Workshop
Affiliations: Riga Technical University, Dept. of Modelling and Simulation, Riga, Latvia; Institute of Industrial Electronics and Electrical Engineering, Latvia
Authors with affiliations: Golosova, J., Riga Technical University, Dept. of Modelling and Simulation, Riga, Latvia; Romanovs, A., Riga Technical University, Dept. of Modelling and Simulation, Riga, Latvia; Kunicina, N., Institute of Industrial Electronics and Electrical Engineering, Latvia
Abstract: With the appearance of Blockchain technology, besides cryptocurrency, interest in the use of this technology in various fields has increased, including in the energy sector. Since Blockchain technology has repeatedly proven its importance in various fields, now the advantages of technology have become obvious in large energy companies. Many developed countries are massively starting to introduce Blockchain technology into the energy industry. While it is mainly pilot projects or just technology testing but already now Blockchain can qualify for creating new energy markets. The energy sector is currently at the stage of transition from a centralized system to a decentralized one in which complete autonomy will be achieved through the production and storage of energy. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Brenes E.M., Meza C.
Title: An Application-specific Instruction Set Processor for Microgrid Simulation
Source title: 2019 IEEE 39th Central America and Panama Convention, CONCAPAN 2019
Affiliations: Aruba Networks Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Heredia, Costa Rica; Electronic Engineering School, Instituto Tecnologico de Costa Rica, Cartago, Costa Rica
Authors with affiliations: Brenes, E.M., Aruba Networks Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Heredia, Costa Rica; Meza, C., Electronic Engineering School, Instituto Tecnologico de Costa Rica, Cartago, Costa Rica
Abstract: Microgrid represents a new paradigm in the power sector that offers more reliability and flexibility for electricity delivery. A microgrid consists of different types of power generation units, loads and energy storage systems that are controlled and coordinated. Smart power processing units play an important role in a microgrid. The present paper presents an application-specific instruction set processor for the study of power converters operating in isolated microgrids. The proposed processor has been developed in order to solve differential algebraic equations that describe the dynamical behavior of microgrid power processor. Due to the inherently parallelism of the proposed processor the simulation time is reduced considerably with respect to a general purpose processor. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors with affiliations: Fernandez, E.O., Technological University of the Philippines, Electronics Engineering Department, Manila, Philippines; Autriz, R.M.D., Technological University of the Philippines, Electronics Engineering Department, Manila, Philippines; Madrigal, G.A.M., Technological University of the Philippines, Electronics Engineering Department, Manila, Philippines; Limdy, D.I., Technological University of the Philippines, Electronics Engineering Department, Manila, Philippines; Padilla, M.V.C., Technological University of the Philippines, Electronics Engineering Department, Manila, Philippines; Merin, C.A.L., Technological University of the Philippines, Electronics Engineering Department, Manila, Philippines; Tolentino, L.K.S., Technological University of the Philippines, Electronics Engineering Department, Manila, Philippines; Sabete, R.M.T., Technological University of the Philippines, Electronics Engineering Department, Manila, Philippines; Uddin, A.T., Technological University of the Philippines, Electronics Engineering Department, Manila, Philippines
Abstract: The advent of large-scale renewable energy generation is driving a growing need for new electrochemical energy storage systems. Metal-air batteries, having a promising technology that could address this need, faces challenges due to the costly and locally unavailable production of air-cathode. Thus, the proponents came up with the idea of designing portable metal-air battery with configured air-cathode layering technology using activated carbon derived from waste coffee grounds and saltwater as electrolyte. The design process involves genetic algorithm to optimize both performance and dimensions. In this study it has been proven that activated carbon derived from waste coffee grounds possess characteristics that is significant for the production of air-cathode and batteries such as microporosity and absorption property. The fabricated air-cathode improved conductivity, affordability, and promotes the passage of ambient air required for electrochemical reaction to occur. Result shows that genetic algorithm successfully optimized the dimension of the device making it portable yet with comparable performance. The device is capable of storing 285 mL of saltwater enough to power a radio for 4 hours, LED lightings for 11 hours and can fully charge mobile phones. The device has a rated output of DC 5-30V/ 2A / 10-60W, capacity of 60 Wh and optimized dimension of 130 mm x 80 mm x 172.25 mm. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: activated carbon; air-cathode; coffee grounds; electrochemical energy; genetic algorithm

Authors: Villagracia A.R., Bayasen D.S., Pedrosa G.R., Rillera A., Ong H.L., Culaba A., David M., Arboleda N.
Title: First Principles Investigation on the Elastic Properties of Mg, Ca, K-decorated Planar Aluminene
Source title: 2019 IEEE 11th International Conference on Humanoid, Nanotechnology, Information Technology, Communication and Control, Environment, and Management, HNICEM 2019
Affiliations: De la Salle University, Physics Department, Philippines; De la Salle University, Mechanical Engineering Department, Philippines
Authors with affiliations: Villagracia, A.R., De la Salle University, Physics Department, Philippines; Bayasen, D.S., De la Salle University, Physics Department, Philippines; Pedrosa, G.R., De la Salle University, Physics Department, Philippines; Rillera, A., De la Salle University, Physics Department, Philippines; Ong, H.L., De la Salle University, Physics Department, Philippines; Culaba, A., De la Salle University, Mechanical Engineering Department, Philippines; David, M., De la Salle University, Physics Department, Philippines; Arboleda, N., De la Salle University, Physics Department, Philippines
Abstract: With 2D materials rising as candidates for hydrogen storage media, it is important to understand their mechanical properties. Using density functional theory, this study investigated Mg, Ca, and K as dopants to aluminene to determine their effects on its physical properties. Calculations were carried out using Vienna ab initio simulation package (VASP) with Perdew-Burke-Erzernhof (PBE) as generalized gradient approximation (GGA) exchange correlation functional. The brillouin zone sampling was set to 8 by 8 by 1 mesh size, and the energy cut-off of 450 eV. Density functional theory were employed to determine the best possible site (either at the hollow, bridge, or top) for adsorption, and to obtain stress-strain graphs. Among the three sites it was found that the Mg, Ca, and K decorations all prefer the hollow site for adsorption. With its shortest distances also located at that site. As for the stress-strain graph it was found to have a low strain as seen by its linear behavior. Lastly obtaining the slope gave the elastic modulus and stiffness, and with the introduction of the decorations at the hollow site increases its property values. Results showed better stiffness and modulus compared to pristine aluminene. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Aluminene; density functional theory; elastic modulus

Abstract: The battery management system (BMS) is indispensable for photovoltaic installations with storage because they optimize the use of batteries, protect them against damage and prolong their life. This paper presents a hardware platform for the experimentation of battery storage station. This platform contains a BMS for lead-acid batteries built around an Arduino Mega. The software of BMS allows, in addition to the functions of battery management and load control, to store the data in an excel sheet for later use. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Andam M., Alami J.E., Louartassi Y.
Title: Optimization of the Energy Lack and Surplus in a Stand-Alone Photovoltaic System
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 7th International Renewable and Sustainable Energy Conference, IRSEC 2019
Affiliations: Laboratory for System Analysis Information Processing and Integrated Management, High School of Technology-Salé, Mohammed v University, Rabat, Morocco

Abstract: Renewable energies represent a big interest for different researchers at international level. However, the intermittent character of these energies and the storage difficulties of such systems still hinder the emergence of this sector. Consequently, our research aims first to define and analyze different parameters that can contribute in the design of an optimal storage system appropriated to a stand-alone installation. The modeling of whole energy autonomous system and obviously the battery was studied. Two important characteristics particularly the energy Lack and Surplus were analyzed for a specified system in Morocco. Therefore, our study focused on a virtual stand-alone system located in rural area in Errachidia. This system was then designed, the battery was sized, and the lack and surplus were calculated for one year. The goal of this article is consequently to study the optimization of the Lack and Surplus without over or under sizing. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Optimization and Control based Energy Management for a Smart Building Integrated Microgrid
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 7th International Renewable and Sustainable Energy Conference, IRSEC 2019

Abstract: This paper presents an effective approach for the modelling and optimization of a smart building integrated microgrid (BIM). More specifically, we consider a BIM consisting of a roof-top solar PV, wind turbine, battery energy storage system (BESS), plug-in electric vehicle (PEV), micro-CHP, metering infrastructure and loads. The BIM loads are associated to satisfying the electric needs of occupants as well exploiting the operational flexibilities of thermal load defined as the required hot water and desired buildings temperature. The emphasis will be dedicated to the optimal operation of the BIM, where the aim is to control the power flows inside the microgrid in order to satisfy the local loads of the microgrids (electric and thermal). The main contribution of this paper is the development of an energy management strategy to optimally control the microgrid. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Sheikh B., Kadi K.E., Janajreh I.
Title: Sensible and Evaporative Cooling of Greenhouse via Wind-tower Integration
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 7th International Renewable and Sustainable Energy Conference, IRSEC 2019
Affiliations: Khalifa University of Science and Technology, Department of Mechanical Engineering, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
Authors with affiliations: Sheikh, B., Khalifa University of Science and Technology, Department of Mechanical Engineering, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates; Kadi, K.E., Khalifa University of Science and Technology, Department of Mechanical Engineering, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates; Janajreh, I., Khalifa University of Science and Technology, Department of Mechanical Engineering, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
Abstract: Wind tower has been used as traditional Arabic architectural element to create passive ventilation in buildings for human comfort in hot and arid regions. Greenhouse agriculture has been a profitable technology despite the large energy and water need. Integrating these technologies will result in substantial energy and water saving. Sensible cooling is attempted first in the greenhouse. The time evolution of the temperature variation of the flowing air and temperature of conduit walls along the height of the tower and at the greenhouse exit are studied. Parameters like tower height, made-off materials, entry temperature, and wind velocity are considered in the quest to reach to lowest temperature at the greenhouse exit. A high-fidelity model is developed governed by the non-isothermal Navier-Stokes flow in conjugated heat with the conduit material in unsteady and turbulent flow regime. The continuity, momentum, energy, and turbulent scalars are solved simultaneously and results are compared/validated against the first principle of convective-sensible heat for conduit temperature. Results reveal that additional height enable more cooling energy storage, however this cooling energy is non-sustainable and depletes in a relatively short time over several minutes. This suggests utilization of very high specific heat materials or integration of trans-evaporative cooling. The latter is simulated and results are favorable and shows to bring the needed cooling to the greenhouse. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: CFD; cooling tower; evaporative cooling; greenhouse cooling

Title: Architecture and Methodology for a Grid Connected PV-Battery Hybrid System
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 7th International Renewable and Sustainable Energy Conference, IRSEC 2019
Affiliations: Foundation for Research, Development and Innovation in Engineering Sciences (FRDISI), Casablanca, Morocco; EAS Research Team, Laboratory of Research and Engineering-ENSEM, Casablanca, Morocco; Pluridisciplinary Laboratory of Research &innovation (LPRI), EMSI, Casablanca, Morocco

Abstract: Countries all around the world, especially those with significant renewable potential, are beginning to adopt strict policies to increase the share of renewable energy use in order to strengthen their own energy mix. This leads researchers to think of appropriate solutions for an ease integration of renewable energies into electricity sector and to overcome its major obstacle, which is none other than intermittency. In this context, we defend our proposed architecture based on a grid-connected PV-battery hybrid system. Our proposal was tested under real meteorological solar conditions for a typical year using TRNSYS. Its performance evaluation was carried out using statistical analysis via Minitab and shows that the system could be in deficit with a frequency less than 10%• That means that the proposed hybrid system able to meet the demand for its 90% energy states. Such a statistical analysis of the hybrid system energy states let us deduce influence of stochastic parameters on the system size, architecture and energy management. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Primary Frequency Control for Wind/Battery Stand-Alone Microgrid

Abstract: A Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) is one of the solutions being proposed to improve the performance and reliability of various power system applications. Indeed, BESS is a reliable resource to provide energy, and to increase the reliability and flexibility of the renewable energy dispatch. Wind energy has the largest contribution among renewable energy resources and its control has become a research focus in the power systems area. This paper introduces a novel BESS control, which depends on a Fuzzy-Logic based Frequency Regulation (FL-FR) for wind farms composed of 5 Wind Turbine Generators (WTGs) augmented with BESS. Moreover, rotor speed of the deloaded WTG is optimized to extract more rotational kinetic energy. WTG can ensure sufficient generation reserve using deloaded operation, which can be used during depressed frequency conditions. The performance of the studied system is proved through simulation in the MATLAB/Simulink environment. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: The present study aimed to establish a novel control strategy of an hybrid production system, Wind/Grid/Diesel, including an energy storage system (HPSWGDB), and operating in standalone mode or connected to the grid. This paper highlights mainly imperative problems, disputes in the ensuring the complete energy autonomy.In this context, this article concerns the implementation of the novel control strategy (NCSCDER) based on Arduino that was realized in the Renewable Energy Development Center (CDER) used to control the HPSWGDB. The experimental results using Arduino control board under different operating conditions have been presented and two scenarios have been considered: observation of the production system behavior with and without load The obtained results depict the effectiveness of the strategy to help proper installation and maintenance of a small wind energy system by ensuring optimal energy dispatch while promoting the energy produced by the wind generator. The proposed system might be applicable for other region of the world where the climate conditions are similar. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Khelif M.
Title: Detailed Design of a 6 KWp Grid Connected PV Plant with Storage Batteries: Part-I-Central Inverter Benchmark Study Simulation
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 7th International Renewable and Sustainable Energy Conference, IRSEC 2019
Affiliations: Centre de Développement des Energies Renouvelables, CDER, Algiers, 16340, Algeria
Authors with affiliations: Khelif, M., Centre de Développement des Energies Renouvelables, CDER, Algiers, 16340, Algeria
Abstract: The distributed and intermittent characters of electrical energy production from renewable resources constitute the main challenges in the way of optimising the power transfer for grid connected systems in terms of efficiency, quality and reliability. Concerning the photovoltaic solar energy conversion, such performances being mainly related to the DC-AC stage, the grid connected inverter control strategy design became a major research subject to bring answers for the ever challenging grid technical regulations (grid codes). As a prerequisite option for active power bi-directional operation, the storage batteries pack is assumed here as an energy buffer directly connected between the DC-DC and DC-AC stages. As a consequence, the strong decoupling effect induced by imposing a constant DC link voltage, allows conducting the analysis and design of both parts separately. In this context and as part-I of the overall undertaken design project, a grid connected inverter using a hysteresis current control (HCC) strategy is pre-designed and optimised to serve as an open loop, bidirectional DC-AC power converter benchmark. Foreseeing the main practical realization constraints, an original sizing process of the associated line inductor is applied to limit the maximum switching frequency. Then, making use of the rich electrical engineering library of the SimPowerSystems toolbox under Matlab/Simulink environment, the designed grid connected installation is analysed through detailed simulations. Furthermore, particular control circuits are elaborated to generate properly the corresponding AC current reference and allow bi-directional active and reactive power flow decoupled control. Finally, reproducing tightly the detailed and realistic architecture of the planned realization, the resulting DC-AC stage structure is submitted to numerous validating tests as a power converter which may be further included in simple but robust active and reactive power control closed loops. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: This DFT study aims at investigating hydrogen storage by the bowl-shaped sumanene molecule. Different models have been constructed, by substituting the rim positions of sumanene by nitrogen atoms. Subsequently, based on a comparison to pristine sumanene, effects of this nitrogen doping have been explored. Interaction energies between hydrogen molecule and the di-aza-substituted sumanene have been reported. The substitution position seems to govern the parameters studied, mainly, the interaction energy. © 2019 IEEE.

Using Matlab/Simulink, Simulation results allow us to visualize the capabilities and performance of each of them. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Magouh N., Belkourchia Y., Bakhti H., Lahcen A.
Title: Coupled Identification Procedure of Piezoelectric Constants using PSO and Exact Solution by Stroh-like Formalism
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 7th International Renewable and Sustainable Energy Conference, IRSEC 2019
Affiliations: Research Center STIS, M2CS, ENSET, Mohammed v University, Dept. of App. Math. and Info., Rabat, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: Magouh, N., Research Center STIS, M2CS, ENSET, Mohammed v University, Dept. of App. Math. and Info., Rabat, Morocco; Belkourchia, Y., Research Center STIS, M2CS, ENSET, Mohammed v University, Dept. of App. Math. and Info., Rabat, Morocco; Bakhti, H., Research Center STIS, M2CS, ENSET, Mohammed v University, Dept. of App. Math. and Info., Rabat, Morocco; Lahcen, A., Research Center STIS, M2CS, ENSET, Mohammed v University, Dept. of App. Math. and Info., Rabat, Morocco
Abstract: The paper presents an optimization technique for the identification of dielectric and elastic properties of simply supported rectangular functionally graded piezoelectric plates (FGPM) using the exact three dimensional solution for the static deformations under mechanical load of FGPM rectangular plates. The procedure uses the Stroh-like formalism to obtain the exact solution for FGPM plates which can be expressed in more concise and easier handling forms comparing to other more complicated semi-analytical or numerical approaches used in the literature. Particle Swarm Optimizer (PSO) is then used to solve the optimization problem in order to identify the piezoelectric material properties in the z-direction. In order to validate the given exact solution, a numerical example for a single-layer FGPM plate is presented and compared to the previous findings in the literature. Several numerical examples are presented using PSO algorithm to solve the identification problem of piezoelectric material constants and good results are obtaind. The obtained results confirm the efficiency of the proposed coupled procedure and demonstrate that the PSO algorithm is an effective technique for solving optimal design problems to improve the performance of the piezoelectric materials for more energy storage. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Elbanoby Y., Aborizka M., Maghraby F.
Title: Real-Time Data Management for IoT in Cloud Environment
Source title: 2019 IEEE Global Conference on Internet of Things, GCIoT 2019
Affiliations: College of Computing and Information Technology (CCIT), Arab Academy for Science Technology and Maritime Transport (AASTMT), Information Systems Department, Cairo, Egypt
Authors with affiliations: Elbanoby, Y., College of Computing and Information Technology (CCIT), Arab Academy for Science Technology and Maritime Transport (AASTMT), Information Systems Department, Cairo, Egypt; Aborizka, M., College of Computing and Information Technology (CCIT), Arab Academy for Science Technology and Maritime Transport (AASTMT), Information Systems Department, Cairo, Egypt; Maghraby, F., College of Computing and Information Technology (CCIT), Arab Academy for Science Technology and Maritime Transport (AASTMT), Information Systems Department, Cairo, Egypt
Abstract: Internet of Things (IoT) is changing the physical world. Billions of smart objects across the world generate sensed data about the environmental changes and report them. These sensed data create a lot of traffic in the network, a lot of redundancy, and duplicated records, and increase the storage size in BigData in cloud computing. Some of the sensed data are required to perform a real-time action. In this paper, we propose a framework to provide the decision makers in today's organizations with real-time data that could help them make better decisions. In addition, it could filter and fuse the data with Adaptive Sampling rate using Feedback control mechanism (FCM) in the network layer. The proposed framework will reduce the number of IoT records. Moreover, it avoids a lot of traffic in the network, increases the network life, and minimizes the energy consumption. The proposed approach can help most of Businessmen in their decisions, increases the performance and reduces the cost. It can also be applied to any Business-like ERP, CRM, and SCM. We have implemented and tested it by SQL and CQL. The results of the experiments show that the reduction has been achieved by 82.34 percent compared to the base one. This reduction has improved the energy consumption in the traffic in the network layer, generating an efficient BigData in terms of non-noise, storage capacity and cost. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: BigData; Cloud Computing; Data Filtration; Data Fusion; Data Redundancy; Data Stream; Feedback Control Mechanism (FCM); Internet of Things (IoT); Real-Time; Wireless Sensor Network (WSN)
Index Keywords: Adaptive control systems; Cost reduction; Decision making; Digital storage; Energy utilization; Feedback; Information management; Network layers; Adaptive sampling; Cloud environments; Control mechanism; Decision makers; Environmental change; Internet of Things (IOT); Real time data management; Storage capacity; Internet of things

Title: Coordinated Optimization Scheduling for Photovoltaic Storage Home Energy Management System Considering User Satisfaction
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China
Authors with affiliations: Gong, L., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Wang, J., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Wang, L., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Ren, S., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Zhang, Z., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Yin, X., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China
Abstract: This paper constructs the photo-voltaic storage home energy management system (PV Storage HEMS) including PV power generation, battery energy storage, and electrical load. Based on the analysis of load working state model, the paper founds an integrated objective function considering electricity charge and user satisfaction, a coefficient is used to adjust the proportion of user satisfaction in the function. Furthermore, a coordinated optimization scheduling strategy for the system is proposed under operation constraints. Finally, the case study is carried out to analyze electricity usage and satisfaction for different scheduling modes, as well as verifying the application value of the strategy. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Liu J., Shen W., Yang H., Su K., Zhou H.

Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019

Abstract: Integration of renewable energy generation has a significant influence on distribution systems security due to the variability and uncertainty of renewable energy generation. Natural complementary characteristics of wind and solar power generation are considered and the frank-copula function is selected to establish the probability distribution of windsolar combined power generation in this paper. Based on the regulation and water storage characteristics of cascade hydropower stations pumped storage hydropower stations and other types of hydropower, the combined operation strategy of multi-type hydropower stations participating in the utilization of wind power and solar energy is Proposed. Simulation results on a practical example which is about a certain area of Qinghai province show that the proposed strategy is feasible and effective. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Qian C., Jing Z., Peng Q., Yi L., Xiaoming H., Chao D., Xiaojun N.
Title: Smooth Control Strategy for Fuel Cell-Battery Power System
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: Electric Power Research Institute of State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Corporation, Hangzhou, China; Hangzhou Power Supply Company of State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Company, Hangzhou, China

Abstract: As the energy crisis and environmental problems are increasingly serious, fuel cell is adopted in many applications as green energy. In order to improve the dynamic performance of fuel cell, auxiliary power storage elements should be added. In our paper, the main power supply-fuel cell and auxiliary power supply-battery are in parallel to generate, which improve the performance of bus voltage. Firstly, the simulation models of the main and auxiliary power supply are set up. Then, a simple and feasible system control strategy is proposed for fuel cell discharging regulator and bus voltage regulator. Finally, a simulation platform is built up to verify that the control strategy proposed in this paper can realize smooth switching among different working modes and reasonable energy flow between the main and auxiliary power supply. Bus voltage has excellent steady-state and dynamic characteristics under all working conditions, which is suitable for the high-precision dc load. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Wang J., Chen X., Xiao J.
Title: Robust Optimization for Power Consumption Strategy of Commercial building Considering Uncertainty of Environmental Factors
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: Hohai University, College of Energy Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, J., Hohai University, College of Energy Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Chen, X., Hohai University, College of Energy Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Xiao, J., Hohai University, College of Energy Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China
Abstract: With the rapid development of renewable energy and techniques of smart grid, a robust optimization model for electricity consumption of commercial buildings is established considering distributed photovoltaic units. In the modeling process, the models of distributed photovoltaic units, the energy storage system, the air conditioning energy consumption and the lighting system energy consumption are analyzed first. Then, considering the uncertain factors such as outdoor temperature, illumination intensity and the operating cost of an energy storage system, the minimum energy consumption cost of commercial buildings is taken as the objective function. The robustness index method is utilized to deal with the uncertainty factors, and then the robust optimization model is formulated for commercial buildings with distributed photovoltaic units. Finally, the effectiveness of the proposed robust optimization model is verified by numerical simulation using CPLEX. The result shows that users of commercial building set different weight coefficients or comprehensive robustness indexes, leading to different electricity consumption optimization schemes. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: commercial building; distributed photovoltaic system; electricity system; environmental factor uncertainty; intelligent electricity use; robust optimization

Authors: Jiang L., Zhou R., Zhu J., Xu J., Xu Y.
Title: Electricity Charge Saved for Industrial and Commercial Utilizing Cloud Energy Storage Services
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: Changsha University of Science and Technology, Hunan Province Collaborative Innovation Center of Clean Energy and Smart Grid, Changsha, China
Authors with affiliations: Jiang, L., Changsha University of Science and Technology, Hunan Province Collaborative Innovation Center of Clean Energy and Smart Grid, Changsha, China; Zhou, R., Changsha University of Science and Technology, Hunan Province Collaborative Innovation Center of Clean Energy and Smart Grid, Changsha, China; Zhu, J., Changsha University of Science and Technology, Hunan Province Collaborative Innovation Center of Clean Energy and Smart Grid, Changsha, China; Xu, J., Changsha University of Science and Technology, Hunan Province Collaborative Innovation Center of Clean Energy and Smart Grid, Changsha, China; Xu, Y., Changsha University of Science and Technology, Hunan Province Collaborative Innovation Center of Clean Energy and Smart Grid, Changsha, China
Abstract: By utilizing the potential of existing policies, the government and industrial park can meet the urgent needs of reducing electricity bills. Based on the analysis of Chinese current peak-valley electricity prices policy, the distributed energy storage and centralized energy storage are comprehensively utilized to provide cloud storage and leasing services for industrial park users flexibly and economically. Considering the scales of economies that cloud storage has, this paper has developed three cloud energy storage leasing schemes that consider peak and valley electricity prices. Taking the lowest total cost of electricity for industrial park users as the objective function, the power balance and interaction restrictions with the main network and the limitation of cloud energy storage equipment are used to optimize the capacity and power of the leased cloud energy storage, and also can further analyze and discuss its economy. The results show that the introduction of cloud energy storage services by industry and commerce can effectively reduce the total cost of electricity consumption. Moreover, mixed energy storage and power storage have more significant economic value. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Zhang J., Li Y., Yu H.
Title: Review on Technologies of Compressed Air Energy Storage in Aquifers
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Hunan Electric Power Company Limited Research Institute, Power Technology Center, Changsha, China; Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Hydraulic Engineering, Changsha, China

Abstract: To solve the fluctuation and instability of renewable energy, a large-scale energy storage technology is considered to be an effective way. Due to the merits of large energy storage scale and long storage period, compressed air energy storage has attracted extensive attention and research. The working principle and advantages as well as research status of compressed air energy storage in aquifers are discussed. The key problems of economic cost, reservoir property, wellbore structure design, caprock safety and injection-production scheme design of compressed air energy storage in aquifers are also analyzed. Furthermore, the shortcomings in the current research of compressed air energy storage in aquifers at the present stage are summarized. Finally, proposed more indoor experiments and pilot tests of actual sites are needed in future research. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Li L., Zhou L., Yu C., Xu Y., Li F., Hui W.
Title: Research on Stabilizing the Output Power of Wind Farms by Electric Vehicles Based on Robust Optimization Model
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Hubei Huadian Xisaishan Power Generation Co. LTD, Hubei, Hubei, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, L., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Zhou, L., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Yu, C., Hubei Huadian Xisaishan Power Generation Co. LTD, Hubei, Hubei, China; Xu, Y., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Li, F., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Hui, W., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China
Abstract: Due to the randomness and intermittent of wind power, the output power of the wind farms is with large fluctuations. A robust optimization model is proposed to stabilize the wind power output fluctuation by electric vehicles. Based on the requirements of "active power change" in wind power in national standards, the change of wind power output rate is expressed. After that, the robust optimization method is used to deal with the uncertainty of wind power output, and a double-layer optimization model for the coordinated control of wind farm and electric vehicles is established. The upper layer model decision maker is the wind farm, with the objective of maximizing the income of selling electricity of wind farm as the objective function. The lower layer model decision makers are electric vehicle owners, with the objective of minimizing the cost of electric vehicle electricity expenses. In addition, the robust optimization model is transformed into a mixed integer linear programming problem by linear programming dual theorem and KKT optimality condition. Ultimately, the simulation results verify that the electric vehicle is used as a movable energy storage device to stabilize the fluctuation of wind power output, which can effectively reduce the amount of waste wind power and mitigate the impact of wind power output uncertainty on the safe operation of the grid. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: double-layer optimization; electric vehicle; power fluctuation; robust optimization

Authors: Li Q., Peng G., Mao C.
Title: The Comparative Study of Instantaneous Power Theory in Three-Phase Three-Wire Systems
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: CSG EHV Power Transmission Company, Maintenance Test Center, Guangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, Q., CSG EHV Power Transmission Company, Maintenance Test Center, Guangzhou, China; Peng, G., CSG EHV Power Transmission Company, Maintenance Test Center, Guangzhou, China; Mao, C., CSG EHV Power Transmission Company, Maintenance Test Center, Guangzhou, China
Abstract: The main objective of this paper is to investigate the compensation features of switching compensator in three-phase three-wire systems as instantaneous real oscillating power, which is defined in p-q theory as the compensation goal. This compensation goal should be paid special attention when involving torque oscillation or frequency variation in week systems. The relationship between compensator current and the original supply current is highlighted by employing Current's Physical Components (CPC) power theory as the analytic tool. This paper demonstrates that in three-phase three-wire systems, there are numerous kinds of compensator currents to reach this compensation goal, including the compensator current derived from p-q theory or CPC theory. The former uses the minimum size of energy storage elements than any other kinds of current. While the latter improves the quality of the load by reducing its unbalanced current and harmonics. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: CPC theory; instantaneous power; p-q theory; switching compensator
Index Keywords: Energy management; Energy resources; Comparative studies; Compensator current; Current's physical components; Frequency variation; Instantaneous power theory; Switching compensators; Three phase three wire systems; Unbalanced currents; Wire

State Grid, Beijing, China; Peng, F., Economic and Technological Research Institute Co, Ltd. State Grid, Beijing, China
Abstract: Offshore multi-platform integrated energy system (IES) is multi-energy coupling oriented to meet the various load needs of users for power, gas, cold and heat. Firstly, the basic structure of offshore multi-platform IES is analyzed and divided into five links: energy coupling, transmission, conversion, consumption and storage. Focusing on the five evaluation criteria of economy, efficiency, safety, flexibility and adaptability, more micro-indicators are proposed for IES evaluation, and the definition and evaluation standard of each index are elaborated in detail. Furthermore, the index value is standardized and the index weight is determined by the improved analytic hierarchy processentropy weight method, by which IES can be evaluated. The feasibility and effectiveness of the proposed evaluation indices and assessment methods are verified in practical cases. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Fu Y., Zhu Y., Huang S., Zhang Y., Zhang Y., Wang Z.
Title: Multi-objective Security Constrained Dynamic Optimal Dispatch with Regenerative Clean Energy
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, Economic Technology Research Institute, Jinan, China; Yangjiang Power Supply Bureau of Guangdong Power Grid Co., LTD, Yangjiang, China; Yingda Media Investment Group Company, LTD, Beijing, China; State Grid Shengli Power Supply Company, Dongying, China
Authors with affiliations: Fu, Y., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, Economic Technology Research Institute, Jinan, China; Zhu, Y., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, Economic Technology Research Institute, Jinan, China; Huang, S., Yangjiang Power Supply Bureau of Guangdong Power Grid Co., LTD, Yangjiang, China; Zhang, Y., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, Economic Technology Research Institute, Jinan, China; Zhang, Y., Yingda Media Investment Group Company, LTD, Beijing, China; Wang, Z., State Grid Shengli Power Supply Company, Dongying, China
Abstract: A dynamically optimal dispatch model for power systems with regenerative clean energy (wind farms and PS stations) is proposed, and fuel consumption, emission of atmospheric pollutants and power purchase cost are taken as objectives. The network security constraints under basic status and N-1 outage and operation dispatch of pumped storage (PS) stations are considered. Moreover, the idea of checking-adding loop is used to handle network security constraints and improve the computational efficiency was enhanced. The normal boundary intersection (NBI) algorithm and interior point method are adopted to solve this model and a series of evenly distributed Pareto optimal sets are obtained. Because of the role of PS stations in peak load shifting load and coping with randomness of wind farm output, this complex model converges smoothly. Test results on a real provincial power system show that the proposed method can comprehensively consider the optimal compromise among security, economy and environmental protection of generation schedule, and can develop the functions of PS stations in shifting load and coping with randomness of wind farm output. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: dynamic optimal dispatch; Multi-objective optimization; N-1 outage; Normal boundary intersection algorithm; PS station; Wind power penetration

Abstract: The renewable energy is growing in significant way especially photovoltaic (PV) system in order to keep up with huge needs of electricity. However, the PV output power is suffering from both; intermittency and environmental condition which have great influence on its performance. So, using batteries as complementary source becomes imperative with PV system. Therefore, the batteries must be sizing precisely. In this paper, the different aspects which affect the battery sizing will be explained. These factors will figure out the system behavior and performance. The main aim of this paper is to acquire high system efficiency and reliability with optimal cost. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Said M., Yassin A.
Title: Operation Study of a Combined System of Diesel Engine Generators and Wind Turbine with Battery Storage System
Source title: ACCS/PEIT 2019 - 2019 6th International Conference on Advanced Control Circuits and Systems and 2019 5th International Conference on New Paradigms in Electronics and Information Technology
Affiliations: Faculty of Engineering, Fayoum University, Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Fayoum, Egypt; Electronics Research Institute, Dept. of Power Electronics and Energy Conversion, Giza, Egypt
Authors with affiliations: Said, M., Faculty of Engineering, Fayoum University, Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Fayoum, Egypt; Yassin, A., Electronics Research Institute, Dept. of Power Electronics and Energy Conversion, Giza, Egypt
Abstract: In this research work, the operation plan of diesel engine generator (DEG) and wind turbine (WT) with battery storage system (BSS) is optimized as a nonlinear system considering load profile. Furthermore, three types operation cases. Case 1: load profile is feed by DEG, Case 2: load profile is feed by WT with BSS, and Case 3: load profile is feed by combined system of DEG, and WT with BSS. These sources are suggested to deliver energy to a micro grid of nine household in RED SEA governorate, Egypt. A comparison study between the three operating cases is satisfied. This research work reports that the total performance of the combined system of case 3 is higher than independent operation of each system according to the system cost and emission of gases. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Wang J., Dong R., Zhang X., Xu Z., Liu H., Qiu J., Tian L., Xue C., Zhang X.
Title: Microgrid Optimal Dispatch Model Considering Energy Storage System
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning and Finance Department, Taiyuan, China; University of Technology Sydney, Taiyuan, China; State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Design Center, Taiyuan, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, J., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning and Finance Department, Taiyuan, China; Dong, R., University of Technology Sydney, Taiyuan, China; Zhang, X., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning and Finance Department, Taiyuan, China; Xu, Z., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning and Finance Department, Taiyuan, China; Liu, H., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning and Finance Department, Taiyuan, China; Qiu, J., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning and Finance Department, Taiyuan, China; Tian, L., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning and Finance Department, Taiyuan, China; Xue, C., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning and Finance Department, Taiyuan, China; Zhang, X., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Design Center, Taiyuan, China
Abstract: In order to alleviate the impact of grid-connected new energy micro-grid including wind power and photovoltaic on the safe operation of the system, a micro-network optimization scheduling strategy considering energy storage system under time-sharing electricity price is proposed. The investment cost, pollution penalty cost and main network purchase cost are considered respectively, and the micro-network main network joint operation optimization model is established. The simulation results are used to analyze the optimization results under different scenarios. The results of the example show that the proposed strategy and model can effectively realize the micro-network optimization scheduling, effectively reduce the annual operating cost of the micro-grid including electric vehicles and storage batteries, and ensure the joint safe operation of the micro-network and the main network. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Ma Z., Wang D., Zhang H., Wang Y., Dong H.
Title: Two-stage optimal dispatching based on wind-photovoltaic - Pumped storage-thermal power combined power generation system
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Gansu Electric Power Research Institute, Lanzhou, China; Lanzhoujiaotong University, School of Automation Electrical Engineering, Lanzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Ma, Z., State Grid Gansu Electric Power Research Institute, Lanzhou, China; Wang, D., State Grid Gansu Electric Power Research Institute, Lanzhou, China; Zhang, H., State Grid Gansu Electric Power Research Institute, Lanzhou, China; Wang, Y., State Grid Gansu Electric Power Research Institute, Lanzhou, China; Dong, H., Lanzhoujiaotong University, School of Automation Electrical Engineering, Lanzhou, China
Abstract: Power output of wind farm and photovoltaic power station possess randomness, interval and volatility, causes influence for power generation planning and scheduling when they are connected to the power grid at a large scale. So, a two-stage optimal dispatching strategy is given for wind- photovoltaic -pumped storage-thermal power combined power generation system. By pumping characteristics of pumped-storage, transfer the power output of the wind farm and photovoltaic power station to the pumped storage plant to hold water during the peak load period, the joint power output of wind- photovoltaic -pumped storage can be converted into a stable schedulable power supply with peaking shaving, which makes it participates in the optimal scheduling with thermal power units. The paper establishes the two-stage optimal scheduling model, one is wind-solar- pumped storage combined schedule and cutting peak model of aiming at the fluctuation minimum of generalized load and the power output maximum of wind-photovoltaic-pumped storage, the other is the economic dispatch model of aiming at the operating costs at the minimum of thermal power units, then, separately using mixed integer programming method and unit commitment optimization to solve it. Taking the 10-machine test system as an example, by analyzing the simulation outcomes the follow conclusion can be obtained: The dispatching strategy can improve the utilization rate of wind energy and solar energy, And relieve the peak pressure of thermal power units, significantly reducing the anti-peaking characteristics of wind power. Thereby, the strategy can also ensure the power system to be safe, stable and economical operation. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: equal unit commitment; mixed-integer programming; peak shaving; two-stage optimal dispatching

Authors: Zhao J., Zhang R., Hu R., Tian Z., He Y., Qu Z.
Title: Joint Optimal Operation of Generalized Demand Response and Multi-Energy Storage for Energy Internet
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: Dongguan Power Supply Bureau of Guangdong Power Grid Corporation, Power Dispatching Control Center, Dongguan, China; Technology Center Dongfang Electronics Co., Ltd., Shandong, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, J., Dongguan Power Supply Bureau of Guangdong Power Grid Corporation, Power Dispatching Control Center, Dongguan, China; Zhang, R., Dongguan Power Supply Bureau of Guangdong Power Grid Corporation, Power Dispatching Control Center, Dongguan, China; Hu, R., Dongguan Power Supply Bureau of Guangdong Power Grid Corporation, Power Dispatching Control Center, Dongguan, China; Tian, Z., Technology Center Dongfang Electronics Co., Ltd., Shandong, China; He, Y., Technology Center Dongfang Electronics Co., Ltd., Shandong, China; Qu, Z., Dongguan Power Supply Bureau of Guangdong Power Grid Corporation, Power Dispatching Control Center, Dongguan, China
Abstract: In the energy internet, the technologies of multi-energy storage (MES) and generalized demand response (GDR) have been widely applied, which make a great contribution to meet development needs of modern power systems. In order to analyze the effect of adequate cooperation style between GDR and MES, a joint optimal operation strategy of GDR-MES is proposed in integrated electricity-gas system (IEGS) in this paper. According to the actual operation characteristics of MES equipment and GDR implementation in the IEGS, GDR models based on energy prices and MES models including battery stations and gas storage tanks are respectively established to maximize operation benefits of IEGS operators. The validity of the presented model is verified by an example of regional IEGS operators, and the results show that the joint optimal operation strategy of GDR-MES can increase the benefits of IEGS operators and create a better energy-consumption fashion for the whole system. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy internet; generalized demand response; integrated electricity-gas system; joint optimal operation; multi-energy storage
Index Keywords: Energy utilization; Actual operation; Demand response; Development needs; Energy internet; Energy prices; Gas storage tank; Optimal operation; Optimal operation strategy; Electric energy storage

Authors: Chen J., Cai Y., Gan D., Li J.
Title: Economic Analysis of Ice-storage in Multiple Energy Systems: An Real-world Case Study
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: Zhuhai Power Supply Bureau Guangdong Power Grid Co., Ltd, Guangdong, China; Tsinghua University, State Key Lab of Power Systems Department of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, J., Zhuhai Power Supply Bureau Guangdong Power Grid Co., Ltd, Guangdong, China; Cai, Y., Tsinghua University, State Key Lab of Power Systems Department of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Gan, D., Zhuhai Power Supply Bureau Guangdong Power Grid Co., Ltd, Guangdong, China; Li, J., Zhuhai Power Supply Bureau Guangdong Power Grid Co., Ltd, Guangdong, China
Abstract: Integrating multiple energy systems (MES) such as gas, power, heat, and cooling systems is an effective way to improve the overall efficiency of the whole energy systems. MES is viewed as an important component of the construction of Energy Internet. There have been various demonstration projects for MES all around China since the government called for the construction of Energy Internet. This paper conducts real-world case studies on an MES in one Energy Internet demonstration project in Zhuhai, China, especially for the economic analysis of the role of ice-storage in the MES. Four scenarios with/without ice-storage are compared. Results show that the introduction of ice-storage can reduce the overall cost and lower the capacity requirement of other energy conversions in the MES. © 2019 IEEE.
