Authors: Han Z., Luo G., Song X., Yang C., Zhang L., Jia Y., Zhao Z., Jin Y.
Title: Research on the dispatch proportion of battery capacity in photovoltaic primary frequency control
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Zhejiang Power Co., Ltd., Hangzhou, China; State Grid Shaoxing Power Supply Company, Shaoxing, China; Taiyuan University of Technology, Shanxi Key Lab. of Power System Operation and Control, Taiyuan, China; Shaoxing Jianyuan Power Group Co., Ltd., Shaoxing, China
Authors with affiliations: Han, Z., State Grid Zhejiang Power Co., Ltd., Hangzhou, China; Luo, G., State Grid Shaoxing Power Supply Company, Shaoxing, China; Song, X., Taiyuan University of Technology, Shanxi Key Lab. of Power System Operation and Control, Taiyuan, China; Yang, C., State Grid Shaoxing Power Supply Company, Shaoxing, China; Zhang, L., State Grid Shaoxing Power Supply Company, Shaoxing, China; Jia, Y., Taiyuan University of Technology, Shanxi Key Lab. of Power System Operation and Control, Taiyuan, China; Zhao, Z., Shaoxing Jianyuan Power Group Co., Ltd., Shaoxing, China; Jin, Y., State Grid Shaoxing Power Supply Company, Shaoxing, China
Abstract: It is an inevitable problem of frequency control with the increasing capacity of PV connected into large-scale grid. In order to resolve the problem of the contradiction between the increasing demand and dressing supply capacity of frequency control, the requirement of relevant technical for PV to take part in primary frequency control is put forward. The battery-assisted frequency control system is introduced, and the primary frequency control effect can be improved by using its fast response characteristic. In this paper, the ratio of battery output to all power output is used to analyze the primary frequency control gain of the battery participating in the frequency control of the PV plant. The simulation results show that the larger proportion of energy storage system output can bring better frequency control capacity, reduce frequency fluctuations and improve system stability. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: capacity ratio; frequency control quality; primary frequency control; stability
Index Keywords: System stability; Battery capacity; Fast response; Frequency fluctuation; Increasing capacities; Large scale grids; Primary frequency control; Proportion of energy; Supply capacity; Electric batteries

Authors: Shen Z., Wang Z., Zhao H., Shen Z., Hu E., Xing Y., Song X., Zhang Z., Qiu J.
Title: Multi-objective Stochastic Scheduling Optimization Model for Virtual Power Plants with Carbon Emission Constraints
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning Review Center, Taiyuan, China; State Grid Changzhi Power Supply Company, Development Planning Department, Changzhi, China
Authors with affiliations: Shen, Z., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning Review Center, Taiyuan, China; Wang, Z., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning Review Center, Taiyuan, China; Zhao, H., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning Review Center, Taiyuan, China; Shen, Z., State Grid Changzhi Power Supply Company, Development Planning Department, Changzhi, China; Hu, E., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning Review Center, Taiyuan, China; Xing, Y., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning Review Center, Taiyuan, China; Song, X., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning Review Center, Taiyuan, China; Zhang, Z., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning Review Center, Taiyuan, China; Qiu, J., State Grid Shanxi Economic Research Institute, Planning Review Center, Taiyuan, China
Abstract: In this paper, wind power plant, photovoltaic generation, biomass power generation, energy storage, convention gas turbine and flexible load are defined as virtual power plant (VPP). In order to further reduce the risk of wind/solar uncertainty, the objective function of minimizing operational risk is constructed by conditional risk at value (CVaR), and the constraints of uncertain variables are transformed by robust stochastic optimization theory. The multi-objective risk aversion optimization model of VPP is constructed by choosing the maximum operating income and minimizing total carbon emissions. Finally, an improved IEEE30-bus system is selected to carry out an example analysis. The results show that: (1) The risk aversion model can take into account the multiple demands of benefits, risks and carbon emissions; in particular, when the robustness coefficient is less than 0.85, smaller uncertainties will bring greater risks, indicating that decision makers'risk attitudes will affect the VPP scheduling scheme; (2) When the prediction error E is high, the same growth rate will bring the higher growth rate of CVaR, which indicates that the lower prediction accuracy will magnify the uncertainty risk. Decision makers need to improve the prediction accuracy to reduce the operational risk of VPP; (3) Maximum total emission allocation (MTEA) can highlight the environmental friendliness of clean energy and realize the optimal balanced operation of VPP as a whole. In conclusion, the model can provide decision support for decision-making to formulate optimal VPP scheduling strategy. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: conditional risk at value; demand response; uncertainty; virtual power plant
Index Keywords: Carbon; Decision making; Decision support systems; Forecasting; Multiobjective optimization; Power plants; Scheduling; Site selection; Stochastic models; Wind power; Biomass power generations; Environmental friendliness; Optimization modeling; Photovoltaic generation; Scheduling strategies; Stochastic optimization theories; Stochastic scheduling; Virtual power plants (VPP); Growth rate

Authors: Tian S., Han N., Qi B., Zheng M., Kong X., Yang S.
Title: Collaborative Optimization of Resident Load Based on Cloud-edge-terminal
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019

Abstract: This paper proposes a collaborative optimization method based on cloud edge terminal, and establishes a residential edge load coordination optimization technology architecture based on cloud edge terminal, and designs a load collaborative optimization algorithm based on cloud edge terminal. The architecture includes a power and demand interaction platform (cloud), a home smart energy gateway (edge) and a range of smart home appliances and energy storage devices (terminals). The results show that the proposed method has a good optimization effect on energy economy and stability. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Xu W., Tang Q., Li T., Lei Y., Liu F., Jia Z., Xiang Y., Liu J., Jawad S.
Title: Optimal Investment of Mobile Energy Storage Based on Life Cycle Cost-benefit Analysis
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Sichuan Economic Research Institute, Chengdu, China; Sichuan University, College of Electrical Engineering, Chengdu, China

Abstract: Recently with the broadening of the electricity sales market and the growing development of energy storage technology, the issues of mobile energy storage investment planning have become imperative. The function and operation mode of multi-investors mobile energy storage will no longer be single. Based on life cycle cost-benefit analysis, this paper proposes different operating modes for various investment entities of mobile energy storage. Also, the feasibility of the business model is evaluated by case study, and the impact of the investment recovery period and transaction price of mobile energy storage under different application scenarios is obtained. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Chen X., Wu Q., Zhang J.
Title: Optimal Control for a Wind-Hydrogen-Fuel Cell Multi-Vector Energy System
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: Guizhou University, Electrical Engineering School, Guiyang, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, X., Guizhou University, Electrical Engineering School, Guiyang, China; Wu, Q., Guizhou University, Electrical Engineering School, Guiyang, China; Zhang, J., Guizhou University, Electrical Engineering School, Guiyang, China
Abstract: Efficient applications of renewable energy (e.g. wind, solar, bio-energy etc.) is high on the Chinese governmental agenda. Multi-vector energy system is one of the solutions to cope with this issue. Moreover, a safe and resilient operational method is required for such complicated energy systems. This paper proposes a multi-vector energy system including wind, hydrogen and fuel cells as a supplement part to the main grid. Electricity is firstly converted by wind energy while certain percent of electricity is used for water electrolysis where hydrogen as energy storage is generated. Fuel cells consume hydrogen when electrical energy demand peaks. To evaluate the performance of the energy system, an analytical model is developed to coordinate the operation of the system involving energy conversion between hydrogen, electrical and mechanical forms. Genetic Algorithm (GA) as optimal strategy is used to determine the operational scheme for the system. In the study, different load scenarios are used on the basis of real-world measurement data. The results have confirmed the effectiveness of the proposed methodology where wind energy is consumed in maximum locally. As a consequence, this study provides a demonstration of an integrated renewable energy system w can be widely that can be used in wind-rich rural areas. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: CO2 emissions; fuel cells; hydrogen; multi-vector energy system; wind energy
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Electric energy storage; Energy conversion; Genetic algorithms; Hydrogen storage; Vector control (Electric machinery); Wind power; Electrical energy demand; Integrated renewable energy systems; Operational methods; Operational schemes; Optimal controls; Optimal strategies; Renewable energies; Water electrolysis; Fuel cells

Authors: Bai H., Yang M., Song D., He Y., Su T., Jiang X.
Title: A Review of the Application of Locational Marginal Price Theory in the New Situation
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Electric Power of HeNan, Economic and Technological Research Institute, Zhengzhou, China; State Grid Electric Power of HeNan, Electricity Trading Center, Zhengzhou, China; School of Electrical Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Bai, H., State Grid Electric Power of HeNan, Economic and Technological Research Institute, Zhengzhou, China; Yang, M., State Grid Electric Power of HeNan, Economic and Technological Research Institute, Zhengzhou, China; Song, D., State Grid Electric Power of HeNan, Economic and Technological Research Institute, Zhengzhou, China; He, Y., State Grid Electric Power of HeNan, Electricity Trading Center, Zhengzhou, China; Su, T., School of Electrical Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China; Jiang, X., School of Electrical Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China
Abstract: Locational marginal price (LMP) is a method to measure the price of electricity. It reflects the space-time economy of electricity, and in the meantime, it is one of the means to deal with congestion management in the power market. This paper describes LMP from three aspects. Firstly, the basic model and solution method of LMP are sorted out; secondly, the main factors affecting LMP are analyzed; thirdly, the settlement model of LMP is summarized in three electricity markets from the time scale: day-ahead, real-time and afterwards. With the development and application of a high proportion of renewable energy, energy storage system (ESS) and energy Internet, the LMP model and algorithm are facing new challenges. On the basis of sorting out the latest research and application results, the current key problems faced by LMP research field are summarized in this paper. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: electricity market; energy Internet; energy storage system (ESS); locational marginal price (LMP)
Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; Congestion management; Development and applications; Energy storage systems; Locational marginal prices; Model and algorithms; Renewable energies; Research and application; Settlement models; Power markets

Authors: Ma D., Sun B., Jia B., Li Y.
Title: New energy short-term prediction system based on measured weather and network weather error correction
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: School of Control Science and Engineering Shandong University, Jinan, China
Authors with affiliations: Ma, D., School of Control Science and Engineering Shandong University, Jinan, China; Sun, B., School of Control Science and Engineering Shandong University, Jinan, China; Jia, B., School of Control Science and Engineering Shandong University, Jinan, China; Li, Y., School of Control Science and Engineering Shandong University, Jinan, China
Abstract: The new energy forecast will guide the adjustment of the future capacity plan in the new energy system. The stability of the macro-control of the power grid is highly dependent on the accuracy of energy generation power forecasting. Meanwhile, the trend of the source-source power of the system is highly dependent on a variety of weather conditions. The accuracy of the forecasting of the weather greatly affects the prediction accuracy of the system. The forecasting system uses the labview development platform visual programming method and the powerful storage capacity of the MYSQL database. To set up weather information in the region, it collects and stores multiple weather data in the weather information of the region and the system with adapting fuzzy processing method to analyze and extract data. The paper also uses numerical weight adjustment method to combine historical data, real-time data, and future data to obtain correction error for achieving corrections to future weather data. Therefore, the corrected weather data can be used as input data in combination with the final model for prediction. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: data analysis; Energy forecasting; numerical weight adjustment method; prediction model
Index Keywords: Computer programming; Digital storage; Electric power system control; Electric power transmission networks; Error correction; Meteorology; Numerical methods; Correction errors; Development platform; Energy generations; Forecasting system; Prediction accuracy; Short term prediction; Visual programming; Weather information; Weather forecasting

Authors: Hu Y., Liu S., Wang P., Sun N., Wang D., Wei T., Yang Z., Qing H., Wu Y.
Title: Model for Controlling Risk Optimization Using Energy Storage and Distributed Renewable Energy
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Economic and Electrical Research, Taiyuan, China; Company Taiyuan Power Supply Bureau, State Grid Shanxi Electric Power, Taiyuan, China; State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Company Lvliang Power Supply Company, Lvliang, China; Qinghai Power Company, Xining, China; Shanxi Coal Group Coal Industry Management Co., Ltd., Taiyuan, China; State Grid Shanxi Province Power Supply Company Linyi County Power Supply Company, Yuncheng, China

Abstract: With the gradual establishment of the monthly bidding market, the spot market and the auxiliary service market, China's power retail industry has shown a rapid development trend, but there are big differences in the risk factors of different types of power sales companies. The risk management of power sales companies is a research point with important practical significance. This paper builds a power-selling company to bundle the electricity demand of power users, and considers the power-supply system purchase model of energy storage system and distributed renewable energy optimization to reduce the overall deviation of power and assessment costs, and increase total profit. The economic loss is affected by the control deviation assessment policy and the load forecast deviation risk. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: distributed renewable energy; electricity retail; energy storage system; power purchase model; risk management
Index Keywords: Commerce; Electric energy storage; Electric power systems; Losses; Risk management; Sales; Service industry; Assessment policy; Auxiliary services; Development trends; Electricity demands; Energy storage systems; Renewable energies; Retail industry; Risk optimization; Risk assessment

Authors: Qi M., Yang H., Wang D., Luo Y., Zhang S., Liao S.
Title: Prosumers Peer-to-Peer Transaction Decision Considering Network Constraints
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Economics Management, Changsha, China; State Grid Fujian Electric Power Company Economic and Technological Research Institute, Fujian, China
Authors with affiliations: Qi, M., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Yang, H., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Wang, D., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Luo, Y., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Economics Management, Changsha, China; Zhang, S., State Grid Fujian Electric Power Company Economic and Technological Research Institute, Fujian, China; Liao, S., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China
Abstract: With a large number of distributed renewable energies, distributed energy storage and controllable devices connected to end users, the traditional electricity consumers have been transformed into prosumers with dual characteristics of electricity production and consumption, which can carry out flexible peer-to-peer transactions anytime and anywhere. Firstly, this paper puts forward the framework of prosumers peer-to-peer transaction. Secondly, a peer-to-peer transaction model is constructed, which takes the constraints of energy conservation, energy storage charge and discharge, and interactive power into account. And the aim is maximizing the interests of prosumers. Then, considering the influence of distribution network physical constraints on the transaction results, the transmission power of the transmission line is calculated by the power transfer distribution factor (PTDF) to adjust the transaction. Finally, taking the distribution network with IEEE15 nodes to study the case, and analyzing the influence of distribution network physical constraints to the prosumers peer-to-peer transaction. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: network physical constraints; peer-to-peer transaction; power transfer distribution factor (PTDF); prosumers
Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; Energy transfer; Distributed energy storages; Electricity consumers; Electricity production; Network constraints; Physical constraints; Power transfer distribution factors; Renewable energies; Transmission power; Peer to peer networks

Authors: Qian X., Zhang S., Liu J., Zheng Y., Liu W.
Title: Hierarchical Optimal Planning of Battery Energy Storage Systems in Radial Distribution Networks
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Company, Hangzhou, 310007, China; Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Shenzhen, 518172, China
Authors with affiliations: Qian, X., State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Company, Hangzhou, 310007, China; Zhang, S., State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Company, Hangzhou, 310007, China; Liu, J., Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Shenzhen, 518172, China; Zheng, Y., State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Company, Hangzhou, 310007, China; Liu, W., Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Shenzhen, 518172, China
Abstract: In this paper, an optimal planning model of battery energy storage systems (BESS) in radial distribution networks is proposed to regulate bus voltage and reduce energy cost. The optimal number, locations and capacity for BESS is obtained by a hierarchical optimal planning model. The model firstly determines the BESS number. Then the most effective locations can be selected based on voltage sensitivity analysis. Given the number and location, the BESS capacity can be determined by a constrained mixed-integer nonlinear programming problem solved by natural aggregation algorithm (NAA). The final configuration of BESS is determined by voltage regulation constrained minimizing the total life cycle cost, which includes the system operation cost, investment cost, residual value of BESS, and, etc. A case study conducted on a modified IEEE 15-bus distribution system shows the performance and outcome of the optimal planning model. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery Energy Storage System; Distribution Systems; Hierarchical Optimal Planning; Voltage Regulation
Index Keywords: Battery storage; Costs; Data storage equipment; Electric batteries; Hierarchical systems; Integer programming; Life cycle; Location; Nonlinear programming; Planning; Sensitivity analysis; Voltage regulators; Aggregation algorithms; Battery energy storage systems; Distribution systems; Effective location; Mixed integer non-linear programming problems; Optimal planning models; Radial distribution networks; Total life cycle costs; Investments

Authors: Yan Y., Zhu W., Ouyang F., Li H., Xu H., Yu B.
Title: Battery Energy Storage Power Station Based Suppression Method for Power System Broadband Oscillation
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: Company Limited Research Institute, State Grid Hunan Electric Power, Changsha, China
Authors with affiliations: Yan, Y., Company Limited Research Institute, State Grid Hunan Electric Power, Changsha, China; Zhu, W., Company Limited Research Institute, State Grid Hunan Electric Power, Changsha, China; Ouyang, F., Company Limited Research Institute, State Grid Hunan Electric Power, Changsha, China; Li, H., Company Limited Research Institute, State Grid Hunan Electric Power, Changsha, China; Xu, H., Company Limited Research Institute, State Grid Hunan Electric Power, Changsha, China; Yu, B., Company Limited Research Institute, State Grid Hunan Electric Power, Changsha, China
Abstract: With the integration of large-scale wind power/photovoltaic generations, the applying of high-voltage direct current transmission in the power grid and the growth of power electronic interfaced load, the characteristics of power systems tend to become more power-electronized, and the characteristics of power electronic equipment make the system oscillations cover a wider frequency band. To suppress the broadband oscillation becomes a new challenge for the safe and stable operation of the power system. The battery energy storage power station has flexible regulation characteristics, and by optimizing its dynamic characteristics, it can improve the safe and stable operation capability of power systems. In this paper, an adaptive control branch which is based on the phase-locking principle is added to the current control loop of the energy converter to optimize the dynamic characteristics of energy storage power station. By optimizing the dynamic characteristics of the energy storage converter, the broadband oscillation in power system can be effective suppressed. Timedomain simulation results of a case system implemented in MATLAB/Simulink validate the correctness of analysis and the effectiveness of the proposed control strategy. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery energy storage power station; broadband oscillation; current control; energy storage converter; power- electronized power system
Index Keywords: Electric batteries; Electric power transmission networks; Electronic equipment; HVDC power transmission; MATLAB; Power electronics; Power plants; Wind power; Battery energy storage; Broadband oscillations; Current control loop; Dynamic characteristics; High voltage direct current transmission; Large-scale wind power; System oscillation; Time-domain simulations; Battery storage

Authors: Yang R., Zhang W.
Title: Research on Modeling and Simulation of New Energy Ship power system
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: Wuhan University of Technology, Reliability Engineering Institute, Wuhan, Hubei, 430063, China; China Waterborne Transport Research Institute, Beijing, 100088, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, R., Wuhan University of Technology, Reliability Engineering Institute, Wuhan, Hubei, 430063, China; Zhang, W., China Waterborne Transport Research Institute, Beijing, 100088, China
Abstract: In order to improve the energy efficiency and reduce emissions of ship, both of the diesel generator and fuel cell are used to supply power to the hybrid ship, in which the engine provides the basic load, and the rest power is provided by the fuel cell when the ship power load demand is greater than the basic load. Ship power transmission model and optimized performance indicators which can be calculated are deduced. The model of the ship electric propulsion system with energy storage units is established based on Matlab/Simulink. The simulation results show that the running efficiency of diesel engine is improved, satisfying the power demand of ship by use of new energy controller and improving the stability of the system. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Liao S., Su K., Yu Q., Wang D., Zhang Q., Qi M.
Title: Optimal Capacity Allocation for Wind-Solar Station Considering Power Response of Pumped Storage
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Co., Ltd, Taizhou Power Supply Co., Ltd, Taizhou, China; Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Economics and Management, Changsha, China
Authors with affiliations: Liao, S., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Su, K., State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Co., Ltd, Taizhou Power Supply Co., Ltd, Taizhou, China; Yu, Q., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Economics and Management, Changsha, China; Wang, D., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Zhang, Q., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Qi, M., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha, China
Abstract: Large-scale renewable energy access with randomness and volatility poses severe challenges to power grid security dispatch. In order to reduce the adverse impact of wind power and solar power on the grid, the fluctuation of wind power and solar power should be considered in the construction of wind-photovoltaic power plants. Therefore, considering the regulation ability of pumped storage units to suppress wind and solar fluctuations quickly, the power response model of pumped storage units under the conditions of pumping and hydroelectric power generation is established in this paper. Aiming at the economy and the proportion of wind energy and solar energy absorption, an optimal allocation method of wind energy and solar power capacity considering the power response of pumped storage units is proposed. Under the condition of positive and negative peak regulation of wind power output, the simulation results show that the optimal installed capacity allocation scheme of wind power and solar power plants is obtained. The simulation results verify the feasibility and effectiveness of this method. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Fast power response; Joint operation system; Optimal allocation of capacity; Pumped storage; Wind and solar absorption
Index Keywords: Electric power system security; Hydroelectric power; Photovoltaic cells; Solar energy; Solar power generation; Solar power plants; Wind power; Installed capacity; Optimal allocation; Optimal capacity allocation; Photovoltaic power plant; Power grid securities; Pumped-storage units; Regulation ability; Renewable energies; Electric power transmission networks

Authors: Jiang C., Ai X.
Title: Study on Optimal Operation of Integrated Energy System Considering New Energy Incentive Mechanism
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: North China Electric Power University, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Jiang, C., North China Electric Power University, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Beijing, China; Ai, X., North China Electric Power University, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Beijing, China
Abstract: At present, China is in a critical period of energy structure transformation. The development of integrated energy systems opens a new path for in-depth reform of the energy sector. However, integrated energy systems are currently facing problems such as high operating costs, limited consumption levels of new energy and low energy efficiency per unit equipment. Therefore, firstly, we propose an integrated energy system optimal operation model considering new energy incentive mechanism. By utilizing the lowest integrated energy system daily operation cost as the target, mixed integer linear programming method is adopted for calculation and solution, whilst artificial intelligence algorithm is introduced to ensure the accuracy of relevant prediction data. Secondly, the study fully considers the economy, rationality, efficiency and other requirements of system operation, improves constraint model of each unit equipment in the system and implementing four typical scenarios of incentive mechanism. Finally, the influence of the four typical scenarios on the integrated energy system operation is analyzed through the cases. The results show that the optimal model and incentive mechanism in this paper can further reduce the system operating cost, improve new energy consumption level, and improving each unit equipment operation flexibility and stability in the system, especially the regulating role of energy storage equipment in system operation. Meanwhile, the research results also quantitatively show the integrated energy system operating cost change rate under the different incentive mechanisms. It has great significance to the decision-making of system deployment and operation, clarifies the influence of different incentive mechanisms on the system operation economic benefits, and promotes the benefits of integrated energy system developing. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: incentive mechanism; integrated energy system; mixed integer linear programming; new energy; optimal operation
Index Keywords: Behavioral research; Decision making; Digital storage; Economics; Energy efficiency; Energy utilization; Integer programming; Artificial intelligence algorithms; Consumption levels; Economic benefits; Incentive mechanism; Integrated energy systems; Mixed integer linear programming; Operation flexibility; Optimal operation; Operating costs

Authors: Liu B., Zeng X., Xiao X., Liu D., Li L., Chen X.
Title: Modeling and Simulation of Hydrogeneration System with Doubly Fed Generator
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: Shaoyang University, Hunan Provincial Key Laboratory of Grids Operation and Control on Multi-Power Sources Area, Shaoyang, China; Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Huaihua Design Institute of Water Conservancy and Electric Power, Huaihua, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, B., Shaoyang University, Hunan Provincial Key Laboratory of Grids Operation and Control on Multi-Power Sources Area, Shaoyang, China; Zeng, X., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Xiao, X., Huaihua Design Institute of Water Conservancy and Electric Power, Huaihua, China; Liu, D., Changsha University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical Information Engineering, Changsha, China; Li, L., Shaoyang University, Hunan Provincial Key Laboratory of Grids Operation and Control on Multi-Power Sources Area, Shaoyang, China; Chen, X., Shaoyang University, Hunan Provincial Key Laboratory of Grids Operation and Control on Multi-Power Sources Area, Shaoyang, China
Abstract: With growing concerns about renewable energy consumption, pumped storage power plant is becoming a popular concept and thus the modeling of the doubly fed generator based hydrogeneration system becomes an interesting research topic. In this paper the power control strategy on the doubly fed generator based on pumped storage power plant with the aim of active power and slip control was studied. Multi-index control was employed to achieve the independent control of active power and slip of the machine. The machine was modeled in state equations in a synchronous reference frame. The complete simulation model was developed for such hydrogeneration system under variable speed operation using MATLAB Simulink environment for obtaining the optimal parameters of multi-index control and the dynamic performance got further improved. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: alternating current excitation generator; doubly fed generator; excitation control; hydrogeneration system; pumped storage power plant

Authors: Zhang Y., Mao Z., Cheng S., Yu M., Wei W., Wu X.
Title: Model Construction of the Electric Methane Generation Based on Biocatalyst
Source title: 2019 3rd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration: Ubiquitous Energy Network Connecting Everything, EI2 2019
Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; State Key Laboratory of Clean Energy Utilization, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, Y., College of Electrical Engineering Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Mao, Z., State Key Laboratory of Clean Energy Utilization, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Cheng, S., State Key Laboratory of Clean Energy Utilization, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Yu, M., College of Electrical Engineering Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Wei, W., College of Electrical Engineering Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Wu, X., College of Electrical Engineering Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Abstract: There are rich renewable solar and wind sources in China, but large amounts of carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions are urgent at the same time. Electromethanogenesis (EMG) can convert electricity and CO2 into methane by using the biocatalyst of methanogen, which can provide an effective solution for electricity storage and reduction of CO2. The advantages are as follows. (i)It can achieve the long-term and large-capacity electricity consumption to avoid large power curtailment in the distributed generation system. (ii) CO2 is applied as the reactant, which can mitigate the greenhouse effect caused by CO2. (iii) The self-propagated biocatalysts are superior to the chemical catalysts in the cost and stable performance. (iv) EMG can be considered as the junction among electricity energy, chemical energy and heat energy, which can promote research on the Integrated Energy Internet. In this paper, a well-designed electrolytic cell structure and methane-generated principle in the EMG system are introduced firstly. The author try to analyze the influence and the growth of cathode methanogens in this new area based on Nyquist diagram of the electrochemical impedance. Finally, the EMG electrical model is constructed firstly by recording working current and methane production with the terminal voltage change. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: electrochemical model; electromethanogenesis; methanogenic biocatalyst; power system

Title: Analysis of grid inertial response with high penetration of PV systems and battery energy storage
Source title: 2019 IEEE International Autumn Meeting on Power, Electronics and Computing, ROPEC 2019
Affiliations: Universidad Autónoma de San Luis Potosí, Facultad de Ingeniería, San Luis Potosí, Mexico; Instituto Tecnológico de Sonora, Departamento de Eléctrica y Eléctrónica, Ciudad Obregón, Mexico; Universidad Michoacana de San Nicolás de Hidalgo, Facultad de Ingeniería Eléctrica, Morelia, Mexico; Instituto Tecnológico Superior de Coatzacoalcos, División de Ingeniería Eléctrica, Coatzacoalcos, Mexico

Abstract: The increasing incorporation of renewable energy sources with power electronics converters into electric power systems impacts in the grid inertial response. This impact is more severe when conventional generators are replaced for photovoltaic (PV) systems and when the penetration of this renewable source is high. In this paper, the impact of replacing synchronous generators for PV generation systems in a test network is analyzed. Due to PV generation systems cannot provide an inertial response, it is proposed to use a battery energy storage system (BESS) to enhance the grid inertial response under fault conditions. A comparative study is carried out through simulations in Simulink/MATLAB to show the grid inertial response of the test system, varying the number of synchronous generators, PV modules, and BESS. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery energy storage; Inertial response; Modeling and simulation; Photovoltaic generation; Renewable energy

Authors: Gil-Gonzalez W., Garces A., Montoya O.D.
Title: Mitigating fluctuations of wind power generation using superconducting magnetic energy storage: A passivity-based approach
Source title: 2019 IEEE International Autumn Meeting on Power, Electronics and Computing, ROPEC 2019
Affiliations: Universidad Tecnológica de Pereira, Programa de Ingeniería Eléctrica, Pereira, Colombia; Universidad Tecnológica de Bolivar, Programa de Ingeniería Eléctrica, Cartegana, Colombia
Authors with affiliations: Gil-Gonzalez, W., Universidad Tecnológica de Pereira, Programa de Ingeniería Eléctrica, Pereira, Colombia; Garces, A., Universidad Tecnológica de Pereira, Programa de Ingeniería Eléctrica, Pereira, Colombia; Montoya, O.D., Universidad Tecnológica de Bolivar, Programa de Ingeniería Eléctrica, Cartegana, Colombia
Abstract: This paper presents the control of the active and reactive power of a superconducting magnetic energy storage (SMES) system for compensating fluctuations of a power system with high penetration of wind energy during extreme scenarios of wind gusts. The wind energy conversion system (WECS) is a Type-A turbine with squirrel cage induction generator (SCIG) and a capacitor bank. A passivity-based proportional-integral control (PI-PBC) is used that controls the power transfer of the SMES system to the power grid. The proposed controller is designed with two main objectives: First, to deliver (or absorb) a suitable active power to (or from) the power system, and second, to regulate the voltage of the WECS. The proposed PI-PBC guarantees asymptotically stability in closed-loop and exploits the advantages of the proportional-integral (PI) actions. Also, it presents a superior performance when it is compared to a conventional PI controller and a proportional feedback linearization controller. Simulation results carried-out in MATLAB/SIMULINK demonstrate the advantages of the proposed methodology. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: Single-phase multilevel inverters have increased their use in the industry, particularly in medium and high power applications. Multilevel inverters are considered very convenient topologies in application in renewable energy source systems. Their high efficiency and quality in their output voltage make them an interesting choice for photovoltaic applications, wind energy and battery storage systems. In this paper, a comparative analysis of different inverter topologies with seven-level voltage outputs, with applications in transformerless photovoltaic systems, is performed. The comparison considers two fundamental aspects in multilevel converters, firstly the structure of the multilevel topology and, secondly performance parameters. The considered parameters are total harmonic distortion, efficiency and common mode currents. An SL-PWM modulation scheme is implemented for comparisons and numerical results are presented to assess the performance of analyzed power converters. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Filippa A., Hashemi S., Traholt C.
Title: Economic Evaluation of Frequency Reserve Provision using Battery Energy Storage
Source title: 2019 IEEE 2nd International Conference on Renewable Energy and Power Engineering, REPE 2019
Affiliations: Technical University of Denmark, Center for Electric Power and Energy (CEE), Copenhagen, Denmark
Authors with affiliations: Filippa, A., Technical University of Denmark, Center for Electric Power and Energy (CEE), Copenhagen, Denmark; Hashemi, S., Technical University of Denmark, Center for Electric Power and Energy (CEE), Copenhagen, Denmark; Traholt, C., Technical University of Denmark, Center for Electric Power and Energy (CEE), Copenhagen, Denmark
Abstract: The integration of battery energy storage systems (BESSs) into electric power grids is increasing, and frequency reserve provision is one of the most economic services suggested for these units. This paper investigates the economic benefit of providing Frequency-Controlled Normal operation Reserve (FCR-N) using a BESS under Eastern Denmark's (DK2) regulations. The main influencing factors, including the legal framework, energy tariffs and taxation, and battery degradation, are investigated, and the one-year operation of a 1MW/1MWh BESS providing FCR-N is simulated using second-based frequency data. Simulations show that provision of FCR-N using BESS is economic in certain future scenarios. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Hernandez J.V., Aguilar R.R., Lechuga G.P., Monroy B.D., Olmedo B.L.
Title: Energy Evaluation of a Thermoelectric Cooling System for the Transfer of Vaccines Powered by Solar Energy
Source title: 2019 IEEE 2nd International Conference on Renewable Energy and Power Engineering, REPE 2019
Affiliations: Universidad Autónoma Del Estado de Hidalgo, Cold Technology Engineering, Hidalgo, Mexico
Authors with affiliations: Hernandez, J.V., Universidad Autónoma Del Estado de Hidalgo, Cold Technology Engineering, Hidalgo, Mexico; Aguilar, R.R., Universidad Autónoma Del Estado de Hidalgo, Cold Technology Engineering, Hidalgo, Mexico; Lechuga, G.P., Universidad Autónoma Del Estado de Hidalgo, Cold Technology Engineering, Hidalgo, Mexico; Monroy, B.D., Universidad Autónoma Del Estado de Hidalgo, Cold Technology Engineering, Hidalgo, Mexico; Olmedo, B.L., Universidad Autónoma Del Estado de Hidalgo, Cold Technology Engineering, Hidalgo, Mexico
Abstract: Vaccination is one of the most important methods in disease prevention. To maintain the effectiveness of these biological products it is necessary to keep them at temperatures between 2° C and 8° C. Thermoelectric chillers are solid-state devices that convert electrical energy into thermal energy, although these systems are designed for small cooling capacities, from 2 to 250 Watts, they are optimal for cooling portable systems. This paper describes the design, analysis and energy evaluation of a portable system for the transfer of vaccines in rural areas, which will be powered by solar energy. The design integrates the choice of thermal insulation, geometry, capacity and interior arrangement of the container. The energy analysis is carried out based on the modeling and simulation using Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) of the system. The results show the temperature distribution within the refrigerated device, as well as the most appropriate arrangement for its implementation; the type of thermoelectric cell recommended to maintain vaccines at the optimum storage temperature and the capacity of the photovoltaic panel for the required energy. Based on the results, the energy evaluation that shows the viability of the system is carried out. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: CFD simulation; cooling system; Solar energy; Thermoelectric

Authors: Xiao-Qing T., Shuai Z., Yang Y., Shu-Ling Z., Xiao-Chuan W.
Title: Micro-scale RF Energy Harvesting and Power Management for Passive IoT Devices
Source title: 2019 IEEE 2nd International Conference on Renewable Energy and Power Engineering, REPE 2019
Affiliations: Wuhan Second Ship Design and Research Institute, Wuhan, China; Hubei University of Economics, School of Information and Communication Engineering, Wuhan, China; Huazhong University of Science and Technology, School of Optical and Electronic Information, Wuhan, China

Abstract: A micro-scale radio frequency (RF) energy harvesting and power management solution is proposed in this work to reduce the startup power of energy collection. Analysis of existing energy harvesting solutions determines that controllable connection between the energy storage and boosting modules can maximize energy harvesting. On this basis, a low-power voltage monitoring circuit with a latch function and a feedback control loop circuit with a startup maintenance function are designed. Taking RF energy harvesting as an example, a prototype is designed and fabricated in combination with low-power Wi-Fi scattering communication technology. Measured results show that the system startup voltage is less than 0.7 V, the startup current is less than 200 nA, and the startup power is less than 140 nW, which is more than 20 times lower than the existing energy harvesting solutions. Therefore, the solution can effectively improve energy collection sensitivity, significantly expand the scope of energy collection, and provide an improved and low-cost environmental energy collection solution for hundreds of millions of passive Internet of things devices. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy harvesting; passive Internet of things (IoT); power management

Authors: Hanggoro D., Sari R.F.
Title: A review of lightweight blockchain technology implementation to the internet of things
Source title: IEEE Region 10 Humanitarian Technology Conference, R10-HTC
Affiliations: Faculty of Engineering, Universitas Indonesia, Department of Electrical Engineering, Depok, 16424, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hanggoro, D., Faculty of Engineering, Universitas Indonesia, Department of Electrical Engineering, Depok, 16424, Indonesia; Sari, R.F., Faculty of Engineering, Universitas Indonesia, Department of Electrical Engineering, Depok, 16424, Indonesia
Abstract: Internet of Things devices provide data from existing sensors and usually have limited resources from computing performance to storage. That happens because IoT devices are required to be able to save much energy as possible, so the network lifetime of the IoT devices will be more optimal. The limitations of computing and storage reduce the level of security and trust in the IoT network environment itself. Blockchain can guarantee data security and reliability, as well as solve security problems in the IoT network. There is some research focused on modifying blockchain without eliminating security features and data reliability. This technology can be applied to the IoT network. This type of blockchain is usually called a lightweight blockchain. For example, a lightweight blockchain called LightChain, it modifies Proof-of-Work consensus algorithm. It is reported the use of this modified consensus algorithm can reduce computing power by 39.32%. This study will show some lightweight blockchain concepts that exist today and allow them to be applied in conjunction with IoT technology. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Blockchain; Internet of things; Lightweight blockchain
Index Keywords: Blockchain; Digital storage; Network security; Computing performance; Consensus algorithms; Network lifetime; Security and reliabilities; Security and trusts; Security features; Security problems; Technology implementation; Internet of things

Abstract: These days, the Internet of Things (IoT) is a very popular environment for many applications. An application such as Smart School, Smart Education, Farming, Monitoring, and others. Some of these applications need transfer data through Internet to some data storage. In IoT networks, there is a lot more vulnerabilities than in Internet. Thus, we need to know, how effectively secure data in IoT environment. In this paper, we examine security mechanism and algorithm for IoT networks. These algorithms need to be effective, energy effective and computing effective. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Derouiche R., Brahmi Z., Gammoudi M.M.
Title: Cooperative agents based data placement approach for data intensive workflows
Source title: Proceedings of IEEE/ACS International Conference on Computer Systems and Applications, AICCSA
Affiliations: Faculty of Sciences of Tunis, Tunis, Tunisia; RIADI-GDL Laboratory, Tunisia; Taibah University, KSA KSA, RIADI-GDL Laboratory, Tunisia; ISAMM, University of Mannouba, Manouba, Tunisia
Authors with affiliations: Derouiche, R., Faculty of Sciences of Tunis, Tunis, Tunisia, RIADI-GDL Laboratory, Tunisia; Brahmi, Z., Faculty of Sciences of Tunis, Tunis, Tunisia; Gammoudi, M.M., Taibah University, KSA KSA, RIADI-GDL Laboratory, Tunisia, ISAMM, University of Mannouba, Manouba, Tunisia
Abstract: Cloud Computing can offer a cost-effective way to deploy scientific applications that are abstracted as scientific workflows than traditional distributed computing environments such as Grid and Cluster. Due to the large size of consumed and produced datasets by these workflows, data placement is becoming more and more a challenging task. When Intensive Workflows tasks are executed, they may require a massive volume of data that are physically distributed across multiple Servers. Moving these datasets appears to be costly in terms of workflow execution time, communication cost and energy consumption. Thus, an efficient data placement strategy is needed and it must take into consideration the following challenges: reducing the workflow communication, the total data movement, and the energy consumption. Actually, ensuring an optimal mapping of data to Cloud Storage Service in a reasonable time turns out to constitute a challenging task as it is considered as an NP-Hard problem. In this paper, a decentralized and scalable agent based-approach that considers both the placement of original and intermediate datasets obtained during workflow run is proposed, with the main concern is reducing the execution time of the data placement algorithm. It involves two steps. The first step consists in distributing all the data placement process based on a set of cooperative agents and this is based on the idea that the formal context can be partitioned on a set of formal sub-context. The second step is the placement of the newly generated datasets during the execution of workflow tasks as 'intermediate data' using an Incremental algorithm for constructing Concepts Lattice (or Galois Lattice). Experimentation proved that our proposed strategy appears to be effective in reducing the total execution time and in finding optimal data mapping in polynomial time. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Agent; Cooperative; Distribution; Execution Time; Incremental; Intermediate Data; Placement
Index Keywords: Agents; Cluster computing; Cost effectiveness; Energy utilization; Large dataset; Mapping; NP-hard; Optimization; Polynomial approximation; Cooperative; Distribution; Execution Time; Incremental; Intermediate Data; Placement; Digital storage

Authors: Hu X., Lan W.
Title: Intelligent control semiconductor laser reliability test system
Source title: 2019 16th China International Forum on Solid State Lighting and 2019 International Forum on Wide Bandgap Semiconductors China, SSLChina: IFWS 2019
Affiliations: Beijing University of Technology, Faculty of Information Technology, China; Tianjin Zhengfang Science and Technology Development Co., Ltd, Pingleyuan 100# Chaoyang Distric, Beijing, 100124, China
Authors with affiliations: Hu, X., Beijing University of Technology, Faculty of Information Technology, China; Lan, W., Tianjin Zhengfang Science and Technology Development Co., Ltd, Pingleyuan 100# Chaoyang Distric, Beijing, 100124, China
Abstract: With the development of electronic technology, semiconductor lasers have been widely used in the field of optoelectronics due to their own distinctive features. In order to improve the performance of semiconductor lasers, reliability testing research has become a hot issue at present. In this paper, the intelligent control semiconductor laser reliability test system is described. Its aging and screening process must be controlled by a highly automated, intelligent control system. There are five parts that make up this system: the master control system, the slave control system, the RS-485 serial data interface standard used to communicate between the master unit and the slave unit, the hot stage used to control the test temperature and the power supply includes +5V, +12V, ±15V, +24V. The test system is mainly controlled by AT89C51 single-chip microcomputer, which can not only realize the continuous adjustment of the drive current (0~3A), but also realize the continuous adjustment of the aging temperature (room temperature~150°C). Moreover, the system's current control accuracy is up to milliamp, and temperature control accuracy is ±0.5°C. The system can also preset the aging current value and the aging temperature value, and display the current working current and working temperature in real time. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Control systems; Digital storage; Energy gap; Intelligent control; Lighting; Reliability; Wide band gap semiconductors; Aging temperatures; Electronic technologies; Laser reliability; Master control systems; Reliability testing; Single chip microcomputers; Test temperatures; Working temperatures; Semiconductor lasers

Title: Submodule Control Strategy and DC Fault Ride through Strategy for Battery Energy Storage System-Based Hybrid MMC
Source title: 2019 IEEE 4th International Future Energy Electronics Conference, IFEEC 2019
Affiliations: Southeast University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, B., Southeast University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Zhao, J., Southeast University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Li, D., Southeast University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Zhang, S., Southeast University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Jin, C., Southeast University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China
Abstract: The hybrid modular multilevel converter (HMMC) is a promising topology that can be used in flexible DC transmission system because of its capacity of blocking DC fault. However, renewable energy sources connected to the AC side of HMMC will lead to fluctuation of DC transmission power. To solve this issue, a battery energy storage system (BESS) is proposed to be embedded in submodule (SM) of HMMC, serving as the energy buffer unit. Based on this structure, SM control strategy and DC fault ride through (FRT) strategy are proposed in this paper. The former is aimed at eliminating low frequency component in battery current, accelerating battery current response and balancing SM voltage without additional voltage balance methods, and the latter ensures the continuous operation ability of system without blocking IGBTs in DC fault state. The validity of the proposed method is verified by the full-scale simulations extensively. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery energy storage system (BESS); DC fault ride through (FRT); flexible DC transmission system; hybrid modular multilevel converter (HMMC); submodule (SM)

Title: Research on a smart LED lighting based on improved flyback driver
Source title: 2019 16th China International Forum on Solid State Lighting and 2019 International Forum on Wide Bandgap Semiconductors China, SSLChina: IFWS 2019

Abstract: Aiming at various lighting energy supply circuits currently used, a improved Flyback circuit is proposed applied in the smart LED lighting in this paper, which can realize photovoltaic power generation and energy storage, and stored energy is inverter to the grid or AC load. The proposed driver can realize multi-form and multi-function utilization of energy. The circuit operating process is analyzed and the key parameters relation equations are set up in detail. The design circuit uses 18V photovoltaic panel as input, 24V 6AH lead-acid battery as storage part, three 1W 350mA LED lamps in series as LED lamp group, and 50 ohms AC load as DC-AC inverter load. The simulation software PSIM is carried out to verify the feasibility of the improved circuit design and analysis. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Khodadady M., Meskin N., Massoud A.
Title: Non-Overshooting Controller for High-Power Multi-Port DC-DC Converters
Source title: 2nd International Conference on Smart Grid and Renewable Energy, SGRE 2019 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Qatar University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Doha, Qatar
Authors with affiliations: Khodadady, M., Qatar University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Doha, Qatar; Meskin, N., Qatar University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Doha, Qatar; Massoud, A., Qatar University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Doha, Qatar
Abstract: The trend toward generating electricity from Renewable Energy Sources (RESs) has encouraged the researchers to investigate more reliable and efficient ways of combining various sources, storage systems, and loads with different voltage ratings. This has led to the development of the multiport DC-DC converter, which provides a localized energy processing model with a centralized controller. This paper studies the operation and characteristics of the multiport converter, specifically for medium-voltage and high-power RES applications. The steady-state and dynamical modeling of the multiport DC-DC converter are presented in this work. A mathematical representation of the average current model is derived, and it is employed to obtain the linearized model of the multiport DC-DC converter. Non-overshooting state feedback is designed and implemented for a five-port converter, and its performance is compared with the conventional optimal control scheme. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Zeddam B., Belkaid F., Bennekrouf M.
Title: Bi-objective optimization for the Production-Routing problem Cost vs Environment with energy consideration
Source title: 2019 International Conference on Advanced Electrical Engineering, ICAEE 2019
Affiliations: University of Tlemcen, Manufacturing Engineering Laboratory of Tlemcen, Tlemcen, Algeria; ESSA Tlemcen, Tlemcen, Algeria
Authors with affiliations: Zeddam, B., University of Tlemcen, Manufacturing Engineering Laboratory of Tlemcen, Tlemcen, Algeria; Belkaid, F., University of Tlemcen, Manufacturing Engineering Laboratory of Tlemcen, Tlemcen, Algeria; Bennekrouf, M., ESSA Tlemcen, Tlemcen, Algeria
Abstract: The integrated supply chain and its benefits are being studied increasingly, optimizing the different activities of different processes which have the same objective, especially cost minimization which became a center of interest because of its value for any commercial company. This paper has the purpose of developing a new approach to solve one of the integrated problems which concerns production, storage and distribution activities 'Production-Routing Problem', treating the economic, environmental and energetic aspects, three mathematical models are then proposed: one of them aims to minimize the total costs including production, inventory and distribution costs, the second one aims to minimize the total carbon emissions of the three activities, then a multi-objective model is proposed to join both objectives in only one using LP-metric, not only that but this problem is solved under an energy capacity constraints and with different processing speeds for the production system. Finally, experimental results are presented and discussed to show the tradeoff between the aspects. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors with affiliations: Onate, L., Universidad de las Fuerzas Armadas, ESPE, Departamento de Eléctrica, Electrónica y Telecomunicaciones, Sangolquí, Ecuador; Tito, X., Universidad de las Fuerzas Armadas, ESPE, Departamento de Eléctrica, Electrónica y Telecomunicaciones, Sangolquí, Ecuador; Arcos-Aviles, D., Universidad de las Fuerzas Armadas, ESPE, Departamento de Eléctrica, Electrónica y Telecomunicaciones, Sangolquí, Ecuador; Ibarra, A., Universidad de las Fuerzas Armadas, ESPE, Departamento de Eléctrica, Electrónica y Telecomunicaciones, Sangolquí, Ecuador; Ayala, P., Universidad de las Fuerzas Armadas, ESPE, Departamento de Eléctrica, Electrónica y Telecomunicaciones, Sangolquí, Ecuador
Abstract: This paper presents the design and implementation of a battery charger of a photovoltaic panel based on Model Predictive Control (MPC). The design of buck DC-DC converter using Dynamic Matrix Control (DMC) is presented. The proposed control is responsible for regulating the solar panel power flow (i.e., voltage and current coming from the solar panel) to perform the suitable and efficient charging process of the Energy Storage System (ESS) consisting of a lead-acid Absorbent Glass Mat (AGM) battery. A comparison between the proposed control and a traditional PID control is presented at simulation level, whereas the performance of the proposed control is experimentally validated through its implementation at the Electrical and Electronics Laboratory of Universidad de las Fuerzas Armadas ESPE, Sangolquí-Ecuador. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery charger; buck DC-DC converter; dynamic matrix control; model predictive control; photovoltaic panel

Authors: Jiang W., Yang K., Yang J., Xue N., Zhuo Z.
Title: Energy management strategy for maximization of renewable energy consumption in multi-microgrids
Source title: 2019 6th International Conference on Systems and Informatics, ICSAI 2019
Affiliations: Shanghai Dianji University, College of Electronics and Information Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Jiang, W., Shanghai Dianji University, College of Electronics and Information Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; Yang, K., Shanghai Dianji University, College of Electronics and Information Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; Yang, J., Shanghai Dianji University, College of Electronics and Information Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; Xue, N., Shanghai Dianji University, College of Electronics and Information Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; Zhuo, Z., Shanghai Dianji University, College of Electronics and Information Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China
Abstract: This paper presents a multiagent hierarchical energy management for interconnected multi-microgrids (MMG). In this procedure, firstly, each microgrid (MG) performs energy management based on the proposed optimization model to determine the surplus/shortage power and the charge and discharge power of battery energy storage system (BESS), in which the demand response programs (DRP) have been considered. The incorporation of DRP will increase the renewable energy consumption and reduce operational cost simultaneously. Then, the MMG energy management system (EMS) uses the received data to perform a global energy management based on the proposed optimization model, where the BESS of each MG and community BESS are considered to improve the utilization of renewable energy. In this paper, the optimization model based on mixed integer linear programming (MILP) is proposed for each step, which is easy to implement. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Demand response programs; Energy management system; Mixed integer linear programming; Multi-microgrids; Multiagent system
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Energy management; Energy utilization; Information management; Integer programming; Microgrids; Multi agent systems; Battery energy storage systems; Charge and discharge; Demand response programs; Energy management strategies; Mixed integer linear programming; Multi micro-grids; Optimization modeling; Renewable energy consumption; Energy management systems

Authors: Zhuo Z., Yang J., Hu F., Yang K., Xue N.
Title: Two-stage optimized dispatch strategy of AC/DC hybrid microgrid under uncertainty
Source title: 2019 6th International Conference on Systems and Informatics, ICSAI 2019
Affiliations: School of Electronic and Information Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; Shanghai Dianji University, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhuo, Z., School of Electronic and Information Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; Yang, J., School of Electronic and Information Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China, Shanghai Dianji University, Shanghai, China; Hu, F., School of Electronic and Information Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; Yang, K., School of Electronic and Information Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; Xue, N., School of Electronic and Information Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China
Abstract: Considering that the operation of microgrid is susceptible to various uncertain factors and the current trend of increasing DC load ratio, this paper proposed a two-stage optimized dispatch strategy for the AC/DC hybrid microgrid. Firstly, the time of use (TOU) power price are applied to coordinate the renewable energy, storage batteries, and transferable load output to formulate a daily dispatch plan. In addition, in order to reduce the influence of uncertainty factors, the interruptible load is introduced to correct the daily dispatch plan in real time. The improved non-dominated sorting genetic algorithm (NSGA-II) is used to realize the proposed strategy, and the effectiveness of the proposed strategy is verified in the example. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: AC/DC hybrid microgrid; Component; Demand side response; NSGA-II; Two-stage scheduling; Uncertainty
Index Keywords: Electric power supplies to apparatus; Genetic algorithms; Microgrids; Component; Demand side response; Micro grid; NSGA-II; Uncertainty; Electric load dispatching

Authors: Mutsvangwa A., Nleya B., Gomba M., Chidzonga R.
Title: User and Microgrid Energy Optimization in Cooperative MGs
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 International Multidisciplinary Information Technology and Engineering Conference, IMITEC 2019
Affiliations: North-West University, Faculty of Education, Mafikeng, South Africa; Durban University of Technology, Department of Electronic Engineering, Durban, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Mutsvangwa, A., North-West University, Faculty of Education, Mafikeng, South Africa; Nleya, B., Durban University of Technology, Department of Electronic Engineering, Durban, South Africa; Gomba, M., Durban University of Technology, Department of Electronic Engineering, Durban, South Africa; Chidzonga, R., Durban University of Technology, Department of Electronic Engineering, Durban, South Africa
Abstract: The envisaged future generation power or smart grid (SG) will incorporate ICT technologies as well as innovative ideas for advanced integrated and automated power systems. The bidirectional information and energy flows within the envisaged advanced SG together with other aiding devices and objects, promote a new vision to energy supply and demand response. Meanwhile, the gradual shift to the next generation fully fledged SGswill be preceded by individualisolated microgrids voluntarily collaborating in the managing of allthe available energy resources within theircontrol to optimally serve both demand and distribution. In so doing, innovative applications will emerge that will bring numerous benefits as well as challenges in the SG. This paper introduces a power-management approach that is gearedtowards optimizing power distribution, trading, as well as storage amongcooperative microgrids (MGs). The initial task is to formulate the problem as a convex optimization problem and ultimately decompose it into a formulation that jointly considers user utility as well as factors such as MG load variance and associated transmission costs. It is deduced from obtained analytical results that the-formulated generic optimization algorithmcharacterizingboth aggregated demand and response from the cooperative microgrids assist greatly in determining therequired resources hence enabling operational cost viability of the entire system. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy cooperative microgrids; energy storage system; smart grid
Index Keywords: Convex optimization; Economics; Electric power transmission networks; Energy resources; Microgrids; Convex optimization problems; Energy optimization; Energy storage systems; Future generations; Generic optimization; Power distributions; Smart grid; Transmission costs; Smart power grids

Authors: Xu P., Lu Y.
Title: Combination of microsources and optimization capacity configuration in microgrid
Source title: 2019 6th International Conference on Systems and Informatics, ICSAI 2019
Affiliations: Shanghai DianJi University, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Xu, P., Shanghai DianJi University, Shanghai, China; Lu, Y., Shanghai DianJi University, Shanghai, China
Abstract: In this paper, taking the economic and environmental protection as the goal, considering the randomness of load power, the uncertainty of power supply output, the capacity of energy storage system and other factors, the off-grid microgrid model is built for simulation. From the simulation results, the corresponding optimal configuration in the system under different conditions is found out. In the microgrid system, wind turbines, photovoltaic arrays, gasoline generators and batteries were added, and an output model of the power generation unit was established. The off-grid microgrid model configuration was developed in the Hybrid Optimization Model for Electric Renewables (HOMER) software to investigate the correlation between the entire system by minimizing the life cycle cost of the facility to optimize facility configuration. The simulation reveals the optimal facility configuration, minimizes long-term costs, and studies the sensitivity analysis of gasoline prices and wind speeds to find out the impact of various parameters on the microgrid system. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Magubane Z., Tarwireyi P., Adigun M.O.
Title: Evaluating the Energy Efficiency of IoT Routing Protocols
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 International Multidisciplinary Information Technology and Engineering Conference, IMITEC 2019
Affiliations: Computer Science, University of Zululand, KwaDlangezwa, 3886, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Magubane, Z., Computer Science, University of Zululand, KwaDlangezwa, 3886, South Africa; Tarwireyi, P., Computer Science, University of Zululand, KwaDlangezwa, 3886, South Africa; Adigun, M.O., Computer Science, University of Zululand, KwaDlangezwa, 3886, South Africa
Abstract: Internet of Things (IoT) is an emerging technological paradigm that revolutionizes the way we communicate, live, work and play. Recent growth in the novel and cheap, sensor and actuation devices show that the interest in IoT technologies is phenomenal. IoT devices present several challenges due to device constraints such as limited power, storage, bandwidth, and processing capacity. For a battery powered IoT device to operate for an extended amount of time, it is vitally important for it to be designed to conserve power to ensure realize prolonged network life. In IoT networks, energy is usually expended during the transmission and reception of packets. Ensuring successful transmissions while minimizing energy use is a challenge. Routing protocols play a vital role in facilitating the delivery of these packets from the source to the destination nodes. The use of energy-efficient routing protocols can help to reduce the power consumption of IoT devices. Several routing protocols have been developed for network communication. It is important to evaluate these protocols to find one that is suitable for use in power constrained IoT environments. This study conducts a comparative energy evaluation of RPL (Routing Protocol for Low Power and Lossy networks) and LOADng (Lightweight On-demand Ad hoc Distance-vector Routing Protocol-Next Generation). The study focuses on the power consumed during the transmission of data between the IoT devices in a network. The Routing protocols are implemented in the Contiki Operating System and evaluated in the Cooja Network Simulator. The results depict that RPL is energy efficient routing protocol. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Cooja; energy-efficiency; IoT; LOADng; RPL
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Energy efficiency; Internet protocols; Low power electronics; Network routing; Power management (telecommunication); Routing protocols; Contiki operating systems; Cooja; Distance vector routing protocols; Energy efficient routing protocol; Internet of Things (IOT); LOADng; Network communications; Processing capacities; Internet of things

Authors: Liu X., Wu J., Wang L.
Title: Design of a low power data collection node
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 2nd World Conference on Mechanical Engineering and Intelligent Manufacturing, WCMEIM 2019
Affiliations: Department of Modem Physics, University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei, 230026, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, X., Department of Modem Physics, University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei, 230026, China; Wu, J., Department of Modem Physics, University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei, 230026, China; Wang, L., Department of Modem Physics, University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei, 230026, China
Abstract: In the process of industrial production, it is often necessary to collect various kinds of data to assist production. Data is usually generated by various sensors, encapsulated by the collection node, and sent to the data center for storage and analyzing. The number of sensors in a manufacturing system is large, as well as the data collection nodes accordingly: These data collection nodes pose great challenges to energy saving. This article describes a design of a low-power data collection node that can be widely used for data collection and transmission. To fully reduce the power consumption of data transmission, which is the most significant part of the total power consumption, we designed the ultra-low power data Transceiver constructed by low voltage discrete devices working at the 1.8V voltage. The power consumption of other parts of the node is also optimized. As a result, the overall power consumption is less than 80mW when the data rate is 2Mbps. The low-power collection node can be connected to any sensor that generates a digital signal. Low power consumption and reliable features make it suitable for large-scale and complex production environments. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Data collection node; Data Transceiver; Low power consumption
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Electric power utilization; Energy conservation; Manufacture; Transceivers; Complex production; Data collection; Data transceivers; Digital signals; Discrete devices; Industrial production; Low-power consumption; Total power consumption; Data acquisition

Authors: Lin J., Chen L.
Title: Reliability design against catastrophic failure caused by rare event
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 2nd World Conference on Mechanical Engineering and Intelligent Manufacturing, WCMEIM 2019
Affiliations: Ocean & Civil Engineering Department, Dalian Ocean University, Dalian, China
Authors with affiliations: Lin, J., Ocean & Civil Engineering Department, Dalian Ocean University, Dalian, China; Chen, L., Ocean & Civil Engineering Department, Dalian Ocean University, Dalian, China
Abstract: When a system involves storage, control, usage and transformation of large amounts of energy, failures can have catastrophic consequences. However, ultimate failure is almost always preceded by a chain of events involving multiple factors, including system configuration, coupling behavior, interactions, unexpected feedback loops, weak links, operator errors, random events, common mode failures, and the like. In this paper, the position is taken that no matter how well a system has been designed, failure is inevitable. By thinking in terms of energy and process physics, a new tool to assist in this analysis, the Energy Expansion Tree, is employed to look for opportunities to short circuit the chain of events in such a way as to achieve relatively fail-safe behavior. ©2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Black swans; Fail safe; System safety; Useful life
