Authors: Zhang X., Chen X., Han Y.
Title: FeMAT: Exploring in-memory processing in multifunctional FeFET-based memory array
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 IEEE International Conference on Computer Design, ICCD 2019
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Computer Architecture, Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences, China; School of Computer Science and Technology, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, X., State Key Laboratory of Computer Architecture, Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences, China, School of Computer Science and Technology, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, China; Chen, X., State Key Laboratory of Computer Architecture, Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences, China; Han, Y., State Key Laboratory of Computer Architecture, Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences, China
Abstract: The performance gap between the processors and the main memory is continuously widening, known as the memory wall bottleneck. Emerging nonvolatile devices have the ability of in-memory processing, and thus, have the potential to partially alleviate the memory wall bottleneck. People have adopted nonvolatile devices to build various accelerators that are targeted at different problems and applications. In this work, we adopt one of the emerging nonvolatile devices, the ferroelectric field-effect transistor (FeFET), to build a multifunctional in-memory processing unit, which is named FeMAT. From a structural point of view, FeMAT is an FeFET-based memory array composed of 3T-based cells. From a functional point of view, FeMAT not only is a nonvolatile memory, but also can perform some logic operations (i.e., the processing-in-memory (PIM) mode), binary convolutions (i.e., the binary convolutional neural network (BCNN) acceleration mode) and content searching (i.e., the ternary content-addressable memory (TCAM) mode) in the memory. These functions are seamlessly fused into the FeFET-based memory array and can be configured online without changing the circuit structure. Superior energy efficiency is demonstrated by our experiments and comparisons with a resistive random-access memory (ReRAM) based equivalence, as well as a TCAM and a BCNN accelerator based on complementary metal-oxide-semiconductor (CMOS) devices. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Binary convolutional neural network; Ferroelectric-field effect transistor; In-memory processing; Ternary content-addressable memory

Title: ReRAM crossbar-based analog computing architecture for naive bayesian engine
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 IEEE International Conference on Computer Design, ICCD 2019

Tong, W., Wuhan National Laboratory for Optoelectronics, Key Laboratory of Information Storage System, Engineering Research Center of Data Storage Systems and Technology, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Ministry of Education of China, China; Liu, J., Wuhan National Laboratory for Optoelectronics, Key Laboratory of Information Storage System, Engineering Research Center of Data Storage Systems and Technology, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Ministry of Education of China, China; Wang, C., Wuhan National Laboratory for Optoelectronics, Key Laboratory of Information Storage System, Engineering Research Center of Data Storage Systems and Technology, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Ministry of Education of China, China; Zhao, W., Wuhan National Laboratory for Optoelectronics, Key Laboratory of Information Storage System, Engineering Research Center of Data Storage Systems and Technology, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Ministry of Education of China, China; Peng, M., Wuhan National Laboratory for Optoelectronics, Key Laboratory of Information Storage System, Engineering Research Center of Data Storage Systems and Technology, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Ministry of Education of China, China
Abstract: Recent advances in Resistive RAM (ReRAM) have explored the in-situ Matrix-Vector Multiplication (MVM) ability of crossbar arrays to achieve high energy-efficiency Process-In-Memory (PIM) architectures for Convolutional Neural Network (CNN), image processing, and so on. However, the existing ReRAM-based PIM architectures suffer from considerable additional auxiliary logic and device variations. In this work, we propose a novel analog computing architecture NB Engine for classification by implementing Naive Bayesian (NB) algorithm on ReRAM crossbar arrays. The two key steps of the NB algorithm, that is, probability calculation and electing the class that has the highest probability, are elaborately accomplished in our architecture. The ReRAM arrays are both used as storage and computation components. We store the pre-calculated prior probabilities and conditional probabilities of every class in crossbar arrays. Then the probability calculation step is completed in parallel through the MVM operation of the array. In general, the election step is a multiple-comparison procedure and is normally implemented by a comparison tree. Here, we reuse the max pooling module in a conventional CNN PIM architecture to realize a compatible comparison logic. However, neither of the two designs can avoid the overhead of costly high bit-precision Analog-to-Digital Converters (ADCs). So we introduce a novel analog parallel comparison design which does not need any ADCs or other computing logic with better energy-saving and area-efficiency. Our proposed NB Engine is tested by 11 various datasets. The influence of several non-ideal device properties is discussed and the NB Engine exhibits great tolerance to these variations. The experiment results show that our design offers a runtime speedup up to 2289.6x compared with the software-implemented NB classifier with negligible accuracy loss. In addition, the NB Engine saves 96.2% energy consumption and 45.2% array area compared with the CNN PIM compatible design. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Naive Bayes; Processing In Memory; ReRAM

Authors: Waloyo H.T., Nizam M., Tjahjana D.D.D.P.
Title: Energy Effectiveness of Advanced Vehicle for Urban Transportation
Source title: ICEVT 2019 - Proceeding: 6th International Conference on Electric Vehicular Technology 2019
Affiliations: Universitas Muhammadiyah Kalimantan Timur, Dept. of Mechanical Engineering, Samarinda, Indonesia; Dept. of Mechanical Engineering, Universitas Sebelas Maret, Surakarta, Indonesia; Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Universitas Sebelas Maret, Surakarta, Indonesia; National Centre of Sustainable, Transportation Technologi (NCSTT), Bandung, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Waloyo, H.T., Universitas Muhammadiyah Kalimantan Timur, Dept. of Mechanical Engineering, Samarinda, Indonesia, Dept. of Mechanical Engineering, Universitas Sebelas Maret, Surakarta, Indonesia; Nizam, M., Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Universitas Sebelas Maret, Surakarta, Indonesia, National Centre of Sustainable, Transportation Technologi (NCSTT), Bandung, Indonesia; Tjahjana, D.D.D.P., Dept. of Mechanical Engineering, Universitas Sebelas Maret, Surakarta, Indonesia, National Centre of Sustainable, Transportation Technologi (NCSTT), Bandung, Indonesia
Abstract: Advanced vehicles are an alternative solution to reduce environmental pollution due to the use of fossil fuels. It can be pure electric vehicles or hybrid vehicles. The Hybrid vehicles combine internal combustion engines and electric motors to move. The use of resources on hybrid vehicles can be either series or parallel. A series hybrid model uses an electric motor as a driving force and combustion engine as a generator drive when a parallel hybrid vehicles use both resources as drivers simultaneously. Electrical energy can be obtained from renewable energy or waste utilization. This paper discuss the effectiveness of the use of advanced vehicles to reduce the use of fossil fuels. In this study compared some types of advanced vehicles with travel routes in Surakarta as represent urban area in Indonesia. The test is done using vehicle modeling with MATLAB software simulation. The research was done by using drive cycle data from previous research. The shows hybrid vehicle series need more fuel than parallel type. The size of the combustion engine in the vehicle series is very influential on the performance of the vehicle. With the increasing use of advanced vehicles in urban areas, the use of non-renewable fuels can be suppressed and the impact on the environment can be reduced. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Islameka M., Haq I.N., Leksono E., Yuliarto B.
Title: Energy Consumption Simulation and Analysis of Rear-Driven Electric Bus with Regenerative Braking
Source title: ICEVT 2019 - Proceeding: 6th International Conference on Electric Vehicular Technology 2019
Affiliations: Institut Teknologi Bandung, Department of Engineering Physics, Bandung, Indonesia; National Center for Sustainable Transportation Technology, Bandung, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Islameka, M., Institut Teknologi Bandung, Department of Engineering Physics, Bandung, Indonesia; Haq, I.N., Institut Teknologi Bandung, Department of Engineering Physics, Bandung, Indonesia, National Center for Sustainable Transportation Technology, Bandung, Indonesia; Leksono, E., Institut Teknologi Bandung, Department of Engineering Physics, Bandung, Indonesia; Yuliarto, B., Institut Teknologi Bandung, Department of Engineering Physics, Bandung, Indonesia
Abstract: The Indonesian government plans to change the Transjakarta bus into an electric bus. Therefore, we analyze the energy consumption of rear-drive electric buses with regenerative braking to estimate the specifications of the electric motor and the batteries needed for one cycle of driving. BYD C6 and ITB electric buses will be compared using the driving cycle in the Transjakarta corridor 1 (Kota-Blok M). Transjakarta corridor 1 driving cycle data is collected several times to get varied driving cycles. The electric bus energy consumption model was created using Matlab/Simulink. The simulation is conducted by using the data bus specifications of BYD C6 and ITB. The results show that BYD C6 electric buses have more SOC battery remaining in one cycle of driving due to a larger amount of battery charge. However, ITB electric bus can recover more energy from the regenerative braking system due to the larger motor specifications. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: electric bus; energy consumption; energy recovery; mathematical modeling; regenerative braking

Authors: Guajardo J., Chavez H., Acevedo M.
Title: BESS for Energy Arbitrage and Ancillary Services: The Case of Chile
Source title: IEEE CHILEAN Conference on Electrical, Electronics Engineering, Information and Communication Technologies, CHILECON 2019

Abstract: The contribution of Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) to power system operation is currently widely accepted. Aspects such as fast response has an important impact on system adequacy. However, it is not clear if BESS are economically sustainable, given the high investment costs and the various regulatory frameworks in different countries. This work presents a detailed analysis on the particular case of Chile to understand BESS economic opportunities. In particular, energy arbitrage and ancillary services are considered. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Aliaga R., Munoz J., Rojas D., Villalon A., Troncoso J., Gaisse P.
Title: Predictive Control of a Buck Converter for Photovoltaic Energy: An Experimental Implementation
Source title: IEEE CHILEAN Conference on Electrical, Electronics Engineering, Information and Communication Technologies, CHILECON 2019
Affiliations: Universidad de Talca, Departamento de Ingenierí A Elá Ctrica, Curicó, 3344158, Chile
Authors with affiliations: Aliaga, R., Universidad de Talca, Departamento de Ingenierí A Elá Ctrica, Curicó, 3344158, Chile; Munoz, J., Universidad de Talca, Departamento de Ingenierí A Elá Ctrica, Curicó, 3344158, Chile; Rojas, D., Universidad de Talca, Departamento de Ingenierí A Elá Ctrica, Curicó, 3344158, Chile; Villalon, A., Universidad de Talca, Departamento de Ingenierí A Elá Ctrica, Curicó, 3344158, Chile; Troncoso, J., Universidad de Talca, Departamento de Ingenierí A Elá Ctrica, Curicó, 3344158, Chile; Gaisse, P., Universidad de Talca, Departamento de Ingenierí A Elá Ctrica, Curicó, 3344158, Chile
Abstract: Predictive control has emerged as a feasible alternative for the control of power converters for photovoltaic applications. In this work, a predictive control scheme is proposed to control a Buck converter that works attached to a photovoltaic system and to a energy storage system. The predictive control is used to control the current using the reference from the perturb and observe algorithm to assure the photovoltaic system is working on the maximum power point. To prove the proposed control scheme, simulation and experimental results are obtained. The results show clearly that the predictive control scheme applied to the buck converter is able to track the reference current coming from the pertub and observe algorithm in order to make the photovoltaic system work efficiently. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: This paper presents an interactive algorithm based on game theory for optimizing an energy management system (EMS) of a microgrid. As agents in game, load, storage and energy resources adopt an individual strategy and through a potential game, they are able to reach a Nash Equilibrium. Results show energy dispatch for four different agents conditions, including exclusion of one of the energy sources to emulate plug and play behavior. Availability and ease to change parameters for agents in proposed algorithm allows users tune it for several different conditions, achieving a useful tool for energy management in a microgrid. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy management; Game theory; Microgrid; Nash equilibrium
Index Keywords: Computation theory; Electric load dispatching; Energy management; Energy resources; Game theory; Microgrids; Energy source; Interactive algorithms; Management systems; Micro grid; Nash equilibria; Plug and play; Potential games; Energy management systems

Authors: Roje T., Navas A., Urrutia M., Mendoza-Araya P., Jimenez-Estevez G.
Title: Advanced lead-acid battery models for the state-of-charge estimation in an isolated microgrid
Source title: IEEE CHILEAN Conference on Electrical, Electronics Engineering, Information and Communication Technologies, CHILECON 2019
Affiliations: University of Chile, Department of Electrical Engineering, FCFM, Santiago, 8370451, Chile; University of Chile, Energy Center, FCFM, Santiago, 8370451, Chile
Authors with affiliations: Roje, T., University of Chile, Department of Electrical Engineering, FCFM, Santiago, 8370451, Chile; Navas, A., University of Chile, Department of Electrical Engineering, FCFM, Santiago, 8370451, Chile; Urrutia, M., University of Chile, Department of Electrical Engineering, FCFM, Santiago, 8370451, Chile; Mendoza-Araya, P., University of Chile, Department of Electrical Engineering, FCFM, Santiago, 8370451, Chile; Jimenez-Estevez, G., University of Chile, Energy Center, FCFM, Santiago, 8370451, Chile
Abstract: In order to compare and improve battery energy storage system (BESS) models, this work exhibits a comparative study of the Coppeti, the Coulomb counting, and the Thevenin based models of the State of Charge (SoC) for lead-acid batteries. Additionally, a multi-model estimator that merges and exploits the benefits of aforementioned models is proposed by using an extended Kalman filter (EKF). The performance of the different SoC models are evaluated by means of simulations in a economic dispatch problem of an isolated microgrid with an Energy Management System (EMS). The Comparative study of the SoC models is done using real operation data from the Huatacondo's microgrid with an EMS based on a rolling horizon strategy. As shown in the results, the operating costs of the microgrid are considerably reduced when the multi-model estimator is used, showing a direct impact in the economical costs of the system. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: BESS; EKF; EMS-RH; Multi-model; SoC
Index Keywords: Charging (batteries); Digital storage; Electric load dispatching; Energy management systems; Extended Kalman filters; Lead acid batteries; Microgrids; Operating costs; Scheduling; System-on-chip; Battery energy storage systems; BESS; Comparative studies; Economic dispatch problems; Economical Costs; Multi model; State of charge; State-of-charge estimation; Battery management systems

Title: Design of Device IoT Parameter Collector at Photovoltaic Panels

Abstract: This paper describes the design and functioning by stages that compose the environmental and electric parameter recollecting device for research Purposes, energetic efficiency, that take place in the production of electric energy using a photovoltaic panel. The device has a local storage through an uSD memory card and remote cloud storage. The device is classified as an IoT device. The information can be accessed through a mobile app. It has temperature, UV rays, light, current, voltage and power sensors. A prototype of the device has been constructed and the results of this prototype are shown in a display and the electric variables were compared using a calibrated multimeter. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Static Synchronous Compensator based on the Matrix Converter
Source title: IEEE CHILEAN Conference on Electrical, Electronics Engineering, Information and Communication Technologies, CHILECON 2019
Affiliations: Universidad de Guanajuato, Department of Electronic Engineering, Salamanca MX, Mexico

Abstract: In this paper, a Static Synchronous Compensator based on the direct Matrix Converter (MC-STATCOM) is proposed for reactive power compensation. The MC-STATCOM allows eliminating the energy storage device used in conventional STATCOM topologies, besides improving some of its operational characteristics. This device is controlled through a linear control strategy in order to ensure its stability and dynamic response. The MC-STATCOM performance is verified through several time domain simulations carried out in MATLAB /Simulink. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Lill H., Allik A., Annuk A.
Title: Case study for battery bank subsidization
Source title: 8th International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications, ICRERA 2019
Affiliations: Department of Energy Application Engineering, Institute of Technology, Estonian University of Life Sciences, Tartu, Estonia
Authors with affiliations: Lill, H., Department of Energy Application Engineering, Institute of Technology, Estonian University of Life Sciences, Tartu, Estonia; Allik, A., Department of Energy Application Engineering, Institute of Technology, Estonian University of Life Sciences, Tartu, Estonia; Annuk, A., Department of Energy Application Engineering, Institute of Technology, Estonian University of Life Sciences, Tartu, Estonia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to investigate how government subsidies for purchasing battery banks would affect the production of renewable energy. The Republic of Estonia, like many other countries supports investments into solar panels and the selling of renewable energy. At the same time, the cost of solar panels has been falling, and this in turn raises the question if it's reasonable to support solar panel installations? In the same time, it is extremely important that the energy supply is continuous and uniform from the grid operator's point of view. Selling electricity produced by solar panels or wind generators without an intermediate storage device is extremely chaotic and does not provide the consumer with the necessary uninterrupted energy flow. Due to the high cost of battery banks, small energy producers also find it economically difficult to install battery banks in order to ensure uninterrupted energy supply. The article focuses on finding the optimal subsidy system for support to installing a battery bank for a prosumer. The hypothesis is that an installation subsidy of 100 € per 1 kWh of energy storage capacity of a battery bank makes the investment feasible for renewable energy producers and, in this context, also increases energy security. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery storage; Energy storage system (ESS); Renewable energy; Solar energy; Subsidies

Authors: Zameel A., Najmuldeen M., Gormus S.
Title: Context-Aware Caching in Wireless IoT Networks
Source title: ELECO 2019 - 11th International Conference on Electrical and Electronics Engineering
Affiliations: Karadeniz Technical University, Computer Engineering, Trabzon, Turkey
Authors with affiliations: Zameel, A., Karadeniz Technical University, Computer Engineering, Trabzon, Turkey; Najmuldeen, M., Karadeniz Technical University, Computer Engineering, Trabzon, Turkey; Gormus, S., Karadeniz Technical University, Computer Engineering, Trabzon, Turkey
Abstract: Wireless communication has been increasingly utilized to connect a plethora of services over the Internet backbone. Caching is considered to be a way forward to efficiently deliver contents over the Internet. However, with the introduction of the Internet of Things (IoT) concept, new requirements emerge. In contrast to traditional Internet traffic, IoT data are ordinarily transient and occasionally refreshed by the producer. Furthermore, IoT devices can be resource-constrained with limitations in terms of energy, storage, and processing capabilities. In this paper, we propose a new context-aware caching approach for IoT networks which pro-actively learn the caching need in a particular instant and modify the cached data to improve the cache hit rate. This approach can enable application to achieve a better user experience since the user will not have to wait for the data to be retrieved from a central entity. © 2019 Chamber of Turkish Electrical Engineers.
Index Keywords: Digital storage; User experience; Cache hit rates; Central-entity; Context-Aware; Internet backbone; Internet of thing (IOT); Internet traffic; Processing capability; Wireless communications; Internet of things

Authors: Ion C., Marinescu C.
Title: Optimal charging scheduling of electrical vehicles in a residential microgrid based on RES
Source title: 8th International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications, ICRERA 2019
Affiliations: Transilvania University of Brasov, Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, Brasov, Romania
Authors with affiliations: Ion, C., Transilvania University of Brasov, Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, Brasov, Romania; Marinescu, C., Transilvania University of Brasov, Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, Brasov, Romania
Abstract: In the light of present-day climate evolution, the transition towards a clean urban transport is mandatory. Residential charging stations for electrical vehicles (EVs), when being supplied by renewable energy sources (RES) like wind and photovoltaic represent a strong alternative to classical ones. As both aforementioned renewable energy sources and domestic consumers exhibit significant power variations, determining the optimal charging interval for one or more EVs is of real interest in terms of costs and system reliability. For a proposed and studied Residential RES based microgrid (MG), simulations using HOMER Pro software are performed to yield the most appropriate period when the electric car battery should be charged. The simulations are enhanced by experimental determinations. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Makrygiorgou D.I., Alexandridis A.T.
Title: Integrating autonomous DC microgrids on the basis of a plant/controller modular formulation of individual DERs
Source title: 8th International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications, ICRERA 2019
Affiliations: University of Patras, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Rion, Patras, 26504, Greece
Authors with affiliations: Makrygiorgou, D.I., University of Patras, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Rion, Patras, 26504, Greece; Alexandridis, A.T., University of Patras, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Rion, Patras, 26504, Greece
Abstract: The increasing number of dc loads, dc-based distributed energy resources (DERs) and energy storage systems (ESS) have spotlighted the dc microgrids as a strong candidate in the future distribution systems. Several factors, such as the higher efficiency and the lack of frequency and reactive power regulation, enforced the dc against the ac distribution. This paper presents a complete study on model-based dynamic nonlinear representation, control design and stability analysis of dc microgrids in stand-alone operation. By this way the dc microgrids are easily integrated into the distribution network in order to achieve: a) a systematic analysis and control of autonomous dc microgrids with different DERs units operating in desired power level, and b) the sharing of the ESS charging/discharging and the dc voltage regulation. Suitable current-mode cascaded controllers are implemented on the power converter interfaces which include droop-based feedback. The whole deployment is presented in an open and expandable formulation, while the theoretical stability analysis is conducted under the view of advanced Lyapunov techniques. Hence, now the analysis is globally valid opposite to the conventional small signal linear methods which are valid only for specific system conditions. Furthermore, the stability analysis is given in a generic form, while the entire methodology is applicable to every structure of dc microgrids with variable topology, number of DERs, loads, ESS and parameter values. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Dc microgrids; Dc/dc converters; Distributed energy resources; Droop control; Stability analysis; Storage devices
Index Keywords: Data storage equipment; DC-DC converters; Energy policy; Energy resources; Stability; Virtual storage; Voltage regulators; Distributed Energy Resources; Droop control; Energy storage systems; Future distribution systems; Power-converter interfaces; Reactive power regulation; Stability analysis; Stand-alone operation; Microgrids

Authors: Kurt E., Soykan G.
Title: Performance analysis of DC grid connected PV system under irradiation and temperature variations
Source title: 8th International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications, ICRERA 2019
Affiliations: Energy Systems Engineering, Bahçeşehir University, Istanbul, Turkey
Authors with affiliations: Kurt, E., Energy Systems Engineering, Bahçeşehir University, Istanbul, Turkey; Soykan, G., Energy Systems Engineering, Bahçeşehir University, Istanbul, Turkey
Abstract: Because of some of the renewable energy types, some of the energy storage types and DC consumption, DC grid is an inevitable approach in the power system. This study is investigated the DC grid connected PV system's performance under irradiation and temperature variations. In order to improve the performance of the system, the DC-DC boost converter is designed according to the desired specifications. The maximum power point tracking (MPPT) method and PI controller are implemented to the boost converter in order to provide maximum power to the DC grid. Moreover, the DC grid is modeled as a bipolar low voltage (LV) DC grid form. Modeling and simulation of the DC grid connected PV system is performed in PSCAD. Two cases are simulated in the system. The results depending on the proposed model show that a direct proportion occurs between PV array power and the irradiation, and an inverse proportion happens between PV array power and the temperature. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Yang Y., Xiang L., Guo X., Zheng Y.
Title: Introducing LADRC to Load Frequency Control Model with Pumped Storage Power Station Considering Demand Response
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2019
Affiliations: Huaqiao University Xiamen, College of Information Science and Engineering, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, Y., Huaqiao University Xiamen, College of Information Science and Engineering, China; Xiang, L., Huaqiao University Xiamen, College of Information Science and Engineering, China; Guo, X., Huaqiao University Xiamen, College of Information Science and Engineering, China; Zheng, Y., Huaqiao University Xiamen, College of Information Science and Engineering, China
Abstract: The increasing penetration of renewable energy generation has raised new requirements for load frequency control (LFC) due to more frequency fluctuations caused by new energy generation in power systems. In this paper, a power system model with a pumped storage power station is established with demand response (DR) control loop to compensate frequency deviation of the power grid in time. Furthermore, linear active disturbance rejection control (LADRC) is adopted to adjust the frequency change in the power system. Simulation results indicate that the system with this control strategy has smaller frequency fluctuations and can achieve better control performance. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Liu L., Feng H., Zhang J., Zeng Q., Hu Q., Wu J.
Title: Design and Operation Control of 'Photovoltaic-Battery-SOFC' Hybrid Power Generation System
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2019
Affiliations: School of Information Engineering, Zhejiang AF University, Hangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, L., School of Information Engineering, Zhejiang AF University, Hangzhou, China; Feng, H., School of Information Engineering, Zhejiang AF University, Hangzhou, China; Zhang, J., School of Information Engineering, Zhejiang AF University, Hangzhou, China; Zeng, Q., School of Information Engineering, Zhejiang AF University, Hangzhou, China; Hu, Q., School of Information Engineering, Zhejiang AF University, Hangzhou, China; Wu, J., School of Information Engineering, Zhejiang AF University, Hangzhou, China
Abstract: Photovoltaic power generation has problems such as randomness, intermittentness, and insufficient power supply. A small PV-Battery-SOFC' hybrid power generation system was designed to solve these problems. The system consists of photovoltaic arrays (PV), high-temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell (SOFC), battery, DC load, power conversion circuit, PLC controller and other components. A new type of SOFC was used as a reliable supplementary power supply for the photovoltaic array. The control unit adopted Delta DVP series PLC as the controller and the voltage and current control method to collect and feedback the system operation data in real-time, which can automatically monitor the system current and voltage to make them work in a stable state. According to the working characteristics of each component unit, the control strategy of the corresponding interface conversion circuit was developed. In this way, the PLC controller completed the intelligent switching of multiple operating modes of the system, and also realized the energy balance management between photovoltaic array, high-temperature SOFC and battery. Through the analysis of the experimental data, it is shown that the multiple micro-power sources in PV-Battery-SOFC' hybrid power generation system can be operated and switched in a safe and stable state. Thus, the rapid and accurate management of various micro-power sources in the system can be realized and the stable operation and high-efficiency control of the power generation system also can be ensured. Finally, the results fully demonstrate that this research can help to control the operation of distributed power supply and energy storage unit, and contribute to constructing multi-energy complementary microgrid in rural and remote areas and off-grid power supply. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Zhu L., Yu Z., Liu N., Xu J.
Title: Whole Life Cycle Optimal Allocation of the Energy Storage Systems in a Distributed Network
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2019
Affiliations: Ningxia Electric Power Company, State Grid, Yinchuan, China; Ningxia Electric Power Company, State Grid, Shizuishan Power Supply Company, Shizuishan, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhu, L., Ningxia Electric Power Company, State Grid, Yinchuan, China; Yu, Z., Ningxia Electric Power Company, State Grid, Yinchuan, China; Liu, N., Ningxia Electric Power Company, State Grid, Shizuishan Power Supply Company, Shizuishan, China; Xu, J., Ningxia Electric Power Company, State Grid, Yinchuan, China
Abstract: The intermittent and uncertainties of distributed energy output such as photovoltaics will adversely affect the operation and control of distribution networks. The energy storage system has the functions of cutting peaks and filling valleys, promoting distributed energy consumption, improving power quality and improving power supply reliability. Reasonable allocation of energy storage is an effective means to deal with the above problems. This paper aims at investing in the operation and maintenance cost and the lowest cost of purchasing electricity in the life cycle of the energy storage system. Taking into account the whole life cycle operation and maintenance of energy storage system, considering the factors such as charge and discharge loss, capacity degradation, state of charge, energy storage time, peaking and valley filling efficiency of the energy storage system, the optimized allocation model of the energy storage system of the distribution network is constructed. The second-order cone programming (SOCP) is used to relax the power flow constraints, and then the optimization problem is solved. Finally, an example is given to verify the effectiveness of the proposed method. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: allocation optimization; capacity degradation; energy storage system; second-order cone programming; the whole life cycle cost
Index Keywords: Costs; Electric energy storage; Electric load flow; Energy utilization; Life cycle; Allocation optimization; Capacity degradation; Energy storage systems; Second-order cone programming; Whole life cycles; Data storage equipment

Authors: Li J., Qi W., Li C., Li X., Cheng X.
Title: Research on Cooperative Dispatching Method of Distribution Network Considering Flexible Load
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2019

Ltd., Shenyang, China; Cheng, X., Electric Power Research Institute of State, Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang, China
Abstract: Replacing coal with electricity, large capacity storage and electricity heating making the composition and characteristics of conventional load change fundamentally. There are the larger changes in the overall features of the power load and the larger randomness and elasticity of loads. As a result, mastering users' characteristics and behavior habits of electricity can be effectively applied in the system of safety evaluation and operation plan. Power system load under the condition of new energy power complied with high permeability is influenced by a variety of external factors. We must take effective measures to fully exert the load ability of adjusting and scheduling, realize the coordinated scheduling of the distribution network. Therefore, the main research contents of this paper are as follows: (1) analyze the charging behavior characteristics of EV and establish the probability model of EV charging load; (2) analyze the control characteristics and operation mode of the heat and power storage boiler, then establish the thermo-electric regulation and control load model of the heat and power storage boiler; (3) analyze the working mode and operating constraints of energy storage battery, and establish the power regulation load model of large-capacity energy storage battery. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Wang H., Wang Q., Li M., Shi T.
Title: An Edge Computing Based Gateway for WIA-PA Networks
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2019
Affiliations: University of Posts and Telecommunications, Key Laboratory of Industrial Internet of Things and Networked Control, Chongqing, 400065, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, H., University of Posts and Telecommunications, Key Laboratory of Industrial Internet of Things and Networked Control, Chongqing, 400065, China; Wang, Q., University of Posts and Telecommunications, Key Laboratory of Industrial Internet of Things and Networked Control, Chongqing, 400065, China; Li, M., University of Posts and Telecommunications, Key Laboratory of Industrial Internet of Things and Networked Control, Chongqing, 400065, China; Shi, T., University of Posts and Telecommunications, Key Laboratory of Industrial Internet of Things and Networked Control, Chongqing, 400065, China
Abstract: Edge computing is a distributed processing architecture that includes computing, storage and network resources near the edge of network where data is generated. The specification of Wireless Networks for Industrial Automation-Process Automation (WIA-PA) is an industrial wireless communication standard with the advantages of low energy consumption and well real-time performance. Introducing edge computing to WIAPA networks leads to more powerful local processing ability and convenient interaction with cloud. However, existing WIAPA gateways do not directly support edge computing, which becomes a bottleneck. To address this issue, we propose an edge computing based gateway for WIA-PA networks, including new edge gateway structure, edge/cloud data processing method, and microservice for configuration among heterogeneous industrial network devices. Experimental results verify the performance of the proposed edge gateway. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Wang B., Liu S., Wu X.
Title: Study on the Control Scheme of Energy Storage MMC
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings
Affiliations: Tsinghua University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Department of Electrical Engineering, Wuhan, China; China University of Mining and Technology, Department of Electrical Engineering, Xuzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, B., Tsinghua University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Liu, S., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Department of Electrical Engineering, Wuhan, China; Wu, X., China University of Mining and Technology, Department of Electrical Engineering, Xuzhou, China
Abstract: Energy storage MMC is a new energy storage converter based on modular multilevel converters. In this paper, in order to establish the grid-connected system composed of energy storage MMC and battery energy storage system, the system energy management mechanism is firstly set up. Then, DC/DC converters are installed in the battery energy storage system to connect the DC capacitors of MMC sub-module with the battery energy storage units, which enables distributed energy storage. Afterwards, an integrated grid-connected control strategy of energy storage MMC and battery energy storage system is provided to implement bidirectional transmission of energy, under the condition that the average power of the DC side of MMC is stable. At last, the simulation model of the whole system is built in Matlab/Simulink to verify the correctness and feasibility of the control strategies. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Xi Y., Zhang H., Gong X., Cheng X., Yu H.
Title: Strategy of Smoothing Wind Power Fluctuation Based on H-P filtering Method
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings
Affiliations: North China Electric Power University, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Beijing, China; Guangdong Power Grid Co. Ltd, Power System Planning Research Center, Guangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Xi, Y., North China Electric Power University, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Beijing, China; Zhang, H., North China Electric Power University, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Beijing, China; Gong, X., Guangdong Power Grid Co. Ltd, Power System Planning Research Center, Guangzhou, China; Cheng, X., Guangdong Power Grid Co. Ltd, Power System Planning Research Center, Guangzhou, China; Yu, H., Guangdong Power Grid Co. Ltd, Power System Planning Research Center, Guangzhou, China
Abstract: Advances in battery energy storage technology have provided new ideas for smoothing wind power fluctuations. However due to the high cost, battery energy storage cannot be configured on a large scale in power systems. By applying the H-P filtering method, the time-varying wind power fluctuation can be decomposed into long-term trend component parts and short-term fluctuation component parts. A coordinated control method is proposed in this paper that the long-term trend component parts of wind power fluctuations are stabilized by thermal power units while short-term fluctuation component parts are suppressed by battery energy storage systems (BESS). Thereby avoiding frequent regulation of the thermal power units and saving the capacity requirement of the BESS. Finally, the effectiveness of the proposed strategy is verified based on the PSCAD/EMTDC simulation model. The simulation results indicate the feasibility and advantage of the proposed coordinated control method. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery Energy Storage SystemThermal Power Units; Fluctuation Smoothing; H-P filtering
Index Keywords: Battery storage; Electric batteries; Fossil fuel power plants; Wind power; Battery energy storage; Battery energy storage systems; Capacity requirement; Co-ordinated control; Fluctuation smoothing; Power units; PSCAD/EMTDC simulations; Thermal power units; Electric power transmission networks

Authors: Liu C., Chen G., Huang Y., Guo T., Liu Y., Liu J.
Title: Determining deep peak-regulation reserve for power system with high-share of renewable energy based on virtual energy storage
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Sichuan Electric Power, Research Institute, Chengdu, China; State Grid Chengdu Power Supply Company, Chengdu, China; Sichuan University, College of Electrical Engineering, Chengdu, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, C., State Grid Sichuan Electric Power, Research Institute, Chengdu, China; Chen, G., State Grid Sichuan Electric Power, Research Institute, Chengdu, China; Huang, Y., State Grid Chengdu Power Supply Company, Chengdu, China; Guo, T., Sichuan University, College of Electrical Engineering, Chengdu, China; Liu, Y., Sichuan University, College of Electrical Engineering, Chengdu, China; Liu, J., Sichuan University, College of Electrical Engineering, Chengdu, China
Abstract: With the continuous rapid growth of the renewable energy power generation, the contradiction between renewable energy accommodation demand and reverse peak regulation characteristics has become a severe challenge for power grid operation, while the power marketization has also provided a new way for large-scale renewable energy accommodation. To address this issue, a deep peak-regulation reserve trading strategy for power system with high-share of renewable energy based on virtual energy storages (VES) is proposed in this paper. Firstly, a peak-regulation reserve model of renewable energy is established based on the uncertainty, and a peak-regulation reserve model of VES is designed considering the demand-side response and the "charge and discharge" characteristics of energy storage. Secondly, on the basis of the deep peak-regulation technology of thermal units, a deep peak-regulation reserve model for thermal power is proposed, in which different peak-regulation depths have different electricity price compensations. Finally, a peak-regulation reserve trading strategy with renewable energy accommodation as the core and minimum peak-regulation reserve cost as the objective is proposed, where VES and deep peak regulation of thermal power are both the market participants. Results of case study verify the effectiveness of the proposed reserve trading strategy to ensure the peak-regulation reserve capacity of the system. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: deep peak regulation; peak-regulation reserve; Renewable energy accommodation; trading strategy; virtual energy storage
Index Keywords: Commerce; Electric energy storage; Electric power transmission networks; Virtual addresses; Charge and discharge; Deep peak regulations; Demand side response; peak-regulation reserve; Power grid operations; Renewable energies; Renewable energy power; Trading strategies; Renewable energy resources

Authors: Liang Z., Hao Y., Zhang J.
Title: Economic Optimal Configuration of Mico-gas turbine and Storage Device in an Integrated Energy System Based on Genetic Algorithm
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings
Affiliations: Southeast University, School of Energy and Environment, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Liang, Z., Southeast University, School of Energy and Environment, Nanjing, China; Hao, Y., Southeast University, School of Energy and Environment, Nanjing, China; Zhang, J., Southeast University, School of Energy and Environment, Nanjing, China
Abstract: Integrated energy system always works under poor economy because of its own characteristics. In order to improve the economic benefits, this paper studies the optimization scheme in configuration stage. For an integrated system in residential community building that located in a hot in summer and cold in winter region, a mixed integer nonlinear programming model is established, with configuration and operation economic performances all being considered at the same time. The model is simplified reasonably and then solved by the genetic algorithm, which is proved suitable for this problem. Moreover, after adding initial seeds, the solver efficiency can be improved. The differences between other strategies and the economic optimal strategies are compared, and the improvement direction of this system economy is qualitatively analyzed. Result shows that the most important optimization factors are the energy storage equipment and the peak-valley electricity price. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: Demand response, as an important flexible interactive response model, provides an important way to improve wind power grid-connected power. This paper selects the RTP project in PBDR and the DLC and DSB projects in IBDR as the research direction. Combined with energy storage facilities, a wind power consumption model based on two types of DR projects, power generation plan and real-time scheduling. Exploring the feasibility of introducing DR and its impact on system operation and wind power consumption. The IEEE30-node 6-machine system is used as an analog system for case analysis. In this paper, the traditional unit combination model including large-scale wind power and the DR-based wind power consumption optimization scheduling model are compared to analyze the impact of DR on wind power consumption in order to simplify the analysis process. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Research on the Application of BESS for LFC Support through RR Control of a High IPS
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings

Abstract: This paper presents the Ramp Rate (RR) control of a wind power system and the Load Frequency Control (LFC) of a multi-machine power system taking the Virtual Inertia (VI) advantage of Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS). Power producers, who agreed to meet the standards set by the national grid operators, are obliged to look for the time to time generation variation especially from the Intermittent Power Sources (IPS). The determination and sizing of BESS for RR control is a one-time decision process that needs consideration of many cost components. Dynamic Exponential Smoothing (DES) techniques coupled with large scale data clustering and PSO based optimization algorithms are employed for sizing BESS for Zhangjiakou wind power plant in China. The LFC response improvement of the 3-machine power system by the VI capability of the BESS is studied. Results indicate that the RR characteristic of the wind farm is improved; the VI capability of the BESS improved the transient frequency response and steady state frequency response of the test power system. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: The Energy Internet, featuring in-depth integration of renewable energy and internet information technology, is the future orientation of the energy industry. This paper breaks through the former studies on energy efficiency which only concentrate on one form or one section of energy. Based on the second law of thermodynamics, it analyzes and proposes five kinds of energy efficiency evaluation indexes from the energy sections of production, transmission, consumption, storage and conversion. It provides guidance to top-level design, project acceptance and optimization of Energy Internet. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: You J., Jiang T.
Title: Parameter Design and Operating Power Regulation Strategy of Pumped Storage Power Station with Virtual Water Head
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings
Affiliations: North China Electric Power University, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: You, J., North China Electric Power University, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Beijing, China; Jiang, T., North China Electric Power University, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Beijing, China
Abstract: Pumped storage power station with virtual head can increase the available storage capacity of pumped storage power station. In the process of power regulation of power plant operation, it is necessary to control the constant head of high-pressure pool so as to improve the efficiency of pump-turbine unit and make the power plant run steadily. In this paper, a 1250 kW pumped storage power station is designed, and the power regulation strategy for stable operation of power generation and electric conditions is put forward. The mathematical model of each module of the power station is established. According to the power regulation instructions, the ideal values of the operation parameters of the power station are calculated, and the regulation instructions are given to the driving equipment of the hydraulic transformer. Thus, the running speed of the hydraulic piston is controlled, and the pressure of the high-pressure water tank is constant. The operation process of the hydraulic piston is also modeled and simulated, which verifies the feasibility of the strategy. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Ying Q., Zhen T., Wei D., Jie H., Xinyuan L., Xueting C., Wenping Q.
Title: A Novel Configuration of Virtual Synchronous Generator based on Energy Exchange for Inertia Reference on LI Storage
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Shanxi Electic Power Corporation, Electric Power Research Institute, Shanxi, China; Taiyuan University of Technology, College of Electrical Power Engineering, Taiyuan, China

Abstract: Due to the high penetration of renewable energy sources (RESs), there needs enough hot standby of synchronous generators to suppress the frequency deviation caused by the lack of system inertia. In order to improve the efficiency of microgrid, this paper proposed an enhanced virtual synchronous generator(EVSG) for microgrid. In the EVSG, a Buck-Boost converter with lithium-ion(LI) storage is implemented to get frequency reference on DC side for the three phase inverter. Taking into account the energy exchange during contingencies, this configuration enhanced robustness and stability of the microgrid. A coordinate control strategy has also been developed to accomplish primary and secondary control, which gives the central controller a signal of power adjusting over the PI controller. The proposed configuration and control strategy are vertified on Matlab. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Wang J., Sun Y., Xu Z., Xiong J.
Title: Optimization Dispatch of Integrated Natural Gas and Electricity Energy System under the Mode of Electricity-Orientated
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings
Affiliations: Hohai University, College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, 210098, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, J., Hohai University, College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, 210098, China; Sun, Y., Hohai University, College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, 210098, China; Xu, Z., Hohai University, College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, 210098, China; Xiong, J., Hohai University, College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, 210098, China
Abstract: The coupling and complementary utilization of multiple energy sources is the basis of energy structure optimization, and the accommodation of renewable energy is the key issue in power system industry. In this paper, through the cooperation of gas turbine (GT) and power-to-gas (P2G) equipment, an integrated natural gas and electric power system (IGES) with bidirectional energy transmission is constructed. The gas turbine is used as the peak shaving unit of power system, and the excessive wind power is accommodated by P2G, which is converted into natural gas stored in gas storage tanks (GST). The contract model is proposed to regulate the natural gas in GST injected to pipeline network generated by P2G. Finally, the 14-bus natural gas system (NGS) and the IEEE-14-bus electric power system (EPS) are used to construct the IGES system with the mode of Electricity-Orientated. Aiming at the optimization of economy, by comparing the wind power accommodation in two scenarios, it shows that P2G can effectively accommodate wind power, and that injecting natural gas generated by P2G into gas network by contract can reduce the uncertainty of gas network dispatching. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Ma X., Xu R.L., Wei C.Z., Kang W.F., Chen M.Y.
Title: Power mileage-based allocation and dispatch strategy of battery energy storage system
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings
Affiliations: Chongqing Electric Power Research Institute of State Grid, Chongqing Electrical Power Company, Chongqing, China; Chongqing University, State Key Laboratory of Power Transmission Equipment System Security and New Technology, Chongqing, 400044, China
Authors with affiliations: Ma, X., Chongqing Electric Power Research Institute of State Grid, Chongqing Electrical Power Company, Chongqing, China; Xu, R.L., Chongqing Electric Power Research Institute of State Grid, Chongqing Electrical Power Company, Chongqing, China; Wei, C.Z., Chongqing University, State Key Laboratory of Power Transmission Equipment System Security and New Technology, Chongqing, 400044, China; Kang, W.F., Chongqing University, State Key Laboratory of Power Transmission Equipment System Security and New Technology, Chongqing, 400044, China; Chen, M.Y., Chongqing University, State Key Laboratory of Power Transmission Equipment System Security and New Technology, Chongqing, 400044, China
Abstract: The unsteady nature of renewable energy leads to voltage and power profile fluctuations over short periods of time and according to seasonal variations. Battery energy storage systems (BESS) offer promise to mitigate such disadvantages. However, to apply BESSs to practical power grids, we require a means to allocate them, including their number, location, and capacity, and a control strategy to allocate power demand. In this paper, we first define a linear performance index, called power mileage, which denotes the voltage quality. We then build a new model using power mileage to optimize the allocation of BESSs and construct a simple control method to alleviate the voltage fluctuation. The use of a power dispatch matrix obtained from the optimization model yields a simple but effective method for controlling the batteries. Applying our model to a real-world power grid in Chongqing, China shows that the method works well at peak-shaving on a large scale and mitigates fluctuation over short time periods. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery energy storage system; control strategy; output fluctuation; peak shaving
Index Keywords: Battery storage; Electric batteries; Electric power system control; Electric power transmission networks; Battery energy storage systems; Control strategies; Linear performance index; Optimization modeling; Output fluctuations; Peak shaving; Simple control method; Voltage fluctuations; Electric load dispatching

Title: Integrated Distribution Network Planning Tool Supported by Geographical Information System
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings

Abstract: Historically the distribution system operator (DSO) planned the network considering single direction flow of energy. With the liberalization of the retail market and uptake of end-user investments, either in generation, flexible demand or storage, this process became more complex. To tackle these new challenges the DSOs should take advantage of newly available data sources and technologies to further enhance their network planning tools. This paper describes and elaborates on the concept and procedures to create an integrated software tool by using data from multiple sources and existing DSO applications. The final product is designed to help distribution system operator in easier planning of the distribution network layout. Challenges of creating the tool range from quality and source of the input data to the time needed for the optimization algorithms to find the optimal solution. Finally, the functionality of the tool is presented on a case study of a real distribution network in Zagreb, Croatia. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Quantitative Analysis of Complementary Benefits of Cooling, Heating and Electricity in Regional Integrated Energy System Based on Operation Simulation

Affiliations: Guangdong Power Grid Co. Ltd., Foshan Power Supply Bureau, Foshan, 528000, China; Tianjin University, Key Lab Smart Grid, Minist Educ, Tianjin, 300072, China

Ltd., Foshan Power Supply Bureau, Foshan, 528000, China; Huang, X., Guangdong Power Grid Co. Ltd., Foshan Power Supply Bureau, Foshan, 528000, China
Abstract: Energy Internet is a new energy utilization system characterized by the deep integration of new energy technology and information technology to solve the gradual depletion of fossil fuels and the environmental pollution caused by them. As an important part of the integrated energy system, it can realize the optimal utilization of all kinds of energy and effectively solve the problems of environmental pollution and energy waste. This paper focuses on the quantitative analysis of the complementary benefits of combined cooling, heating and power (CCHP) based regional integrated energy system. On the basis of analyzing the energy supply structure of typical combined cooling, heating, power supply and storage systems, this paper studies the relationship between the heat and cold and power energy flow and the mathematical model of the equipment, and establishes the economic dispatching model of the combined cooling, heating and power supply system based on time-sharing electricity price. Finally, the complementary benefits of cooling, heating and power of regional integrated energy system are quantitatively analyzed. Through an example of an eco-city in North China, the equipment output and load balance of cooling, heating and power in the comprehensive energy system of each region are analyzed, and the economic comparison is made with the situation that there is no coupling of cooling, heating and power in the region, so as to quantify the complementary benefits of cooling, heating and power. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Research of Demand Response Method for Diversified Users Based on The Real-Time Electricity Price

Affiliations: State Grid Zhenjiang Power Supply Company, Zhengjiang, China; Zhejiang University, College of Electrical Engineering, Hangzhou, China

Abstract: In this paper, the diversified users' demand response method based on the real-time electricity price is studied, considering the diversified demand side subject, including photovoltaic users and distributed energy storage users. For ordinary users, photovoltaic users and distributed energy storage users, etc., according to the operating characteristics, the users' loads or electrical equipment are classified and modeled. And through the seasonal ARIMA model, real-time electricity price and photovoltaic power of the future are forecasted, providing reference for the optimization of user demand response. At the same time, considering reducing electric charge as the objective function of the user. Thus, a demand response model adapted to multiple subjects and diversified users based on real-time electricity price is established. By solving the demand response model, and proposing a benchmark electricity consumption scheme for comparison, the validity of the demand response model in promoting the consumption of renewable energy and improving the user benefits is verified. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: A Robust Aggregate Model for Multi-Energy Virtual Power Plant in Grid Dispatch
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings

Abstract: This paper proposes a model for the aggregation problem of a multi-energy virtual power plant participating in day-ahead energy markets. The virtual power plant comprises various multi-energy conversion equipment, renewable units and energy storage. The proposed model considers the uncertainty associated with the dispatch signals from the system operator. The resulting model is heuristically modified by solving a series of robust optimization problem to guarantee any possible dispatch signals which satisfy the proposed model can be realized. Results from a case study illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Ren H., Lu H.
Title: Demand Response Analysis of Load Aggregator Considering Energy Storage and User Response Uncertainty
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings
Affiliations: North China Electric Power University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Baoding, China
Authors with affiliations: Ren, H., North China Electric Power University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Baoding, China; Lu, H., North China Electric Power University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Baoding, China
Abstract: Demand response can involve demand side resources instead of supply side resources into electricity market services. Firstly, this paper establishes a demand response structure based on load aggregator, which can aggregate the response resources of small and medium-sized users to participate in the demand response. Secondly, the response uncertainty of the main flexible load on the user side is analyzed, and the model of user's response difference is established. Then, this paper proposes an LA's response strategy that combines energy storage equipment to eliminate the risk of LA's insufficient response caused by user's response uncertainty, and the contact quantity of energy storage equipment and the optimal economic incentives can be determined through the LA's response profit maximization function. Finally, the effectiveness of the proposed model is verified by a simulation. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Ming W., Dechang Y., Miao M.
Title: Optimization Strategy of Hybrid AC-DC Power Supply for Regional Integrated Energy System
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings
Affiliations: China Agricultural University, College of Information and Electrical Engineering, China; Hunan University, College of Electrical and Information Engineering, China
Authors with affiliations: Ming, W., China Agricultural University, College of Information and Electrical Engineering, China; Dechang, Y., China Agricultural University, College of Information and Electrical Engineering, China; Miao, M., Hunan University, College of Electrical and Information Engineering, China
Abstract: The establishment of regional integrated energy system (RIES) can make various forms of energy complement each other, and improve the performance of the whole energy utilization system in new energy elimination, comprehensive energy utilization, environmental cost and overall operating efficiency. This paper proposes an optimization model of on-grid hybrid AC-DC power supply for multiple energy system, which realizes the AC-DC flexible conversion of electric energy and comprehensive utilization of multi-energy. The structural diagram of economic dispatch of a multi-energy system is first built, and the corresponding mathematical models for each module are established, analyzing comprehensively characteristics of the AC-DC power supply in regional integrated energy systems (RIES), combined with the heating characteristics, the charging & discharging characteristics of the energy storage device. Then, the economic model of on-grid hybrid AC-DC operation is established, considering the constraints such as energy balance, the operating of each device, and the environmental cost with the objective of minimizing total operating cost. Further, based on GAMS optimization software, the optimal output and total operating cost in the traditional AC grid-connection model and in the on-grid hybrid AC-DC model are obtained within the dispatching cycle. Finally, the comparative results demonstrate that the proposed model can reduce operating costs, harmful gas emissions and coal consumption effectively. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Tang Y., Wei D., Liu K., Yan H., Nie Y., Fu X.
Title: Research on Topology Design of User Side Energy Interconnection Network in Typical Environment
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings
Affiliations: China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China; Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, 25003, China
Authors with affiliations: Tang, Y., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China; Wei, D., Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, 25003, China; Liu, K., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China; Yan, H., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China; Nie, Y., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China; Fu, X., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China
Abstract: The construction of smart green city promotes the development of efficient energy use. The development and utilization of user-side demand response resources has become one of the key and difficult problems to be solved urgently in urban sustainable development. This paper first analyzes the multi-dimensional decision-making of multi-objects such as energy demand, distributed renewable power, energy storage device, etc., and then analyzes the "incentive guidance-output correction" between the demand response implementer and the responder. The continuous and interactive process, and then proposes a two-layer topology model that uses the upper layer to guide the lower layer and the lower layer to feedback the upper layer to characterize the user side demand response. Consider the overall goal of maximizing social welfare based on cost considerations, and establish a two-layer topology model designed by user-side demand response incentive mechanism. The validity of the two-layer topology model proposed in this paper is verified by a numerical example. The benefits of the demand response and the influencing factors of the incentive mechanism are discussed. Based on this model, the topology design of the energy interconnection network is proposed. Principles and two new types of energy Internet topologies - the star topology of primary energy plus auxiliary energy and the ring topology with multiple distributed energy systems. Finally, a typical application scenario is selected for analysis and description of the user-side energy interconnection network topology in a typical scenario, and a feasible optimal configuration scheme and network topology are provided. © 2019 IEEE.

Affiliations: North China Electric Power University, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, No. 2 Beinong Road, Changping District, Beijing, 102206, China; North China Electric Power University, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Beijing, 102206, China
Authors with affiliations: Zongyao, H., North China Electric Power University, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, No. 2 Beinong Road, Changping District, Beijing, 102206, China; Zhengxu, Q., North China Electric Power University, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Beijing, 102206, China; Tong, J., North China Electric Power University, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Beijing, 102206, China
Abstract: Isothermal compressed air energy storage has many advantages, such as large scale, low cost, no need of fuel, high efficiency of thermal power conversion, and it is one of the important development directions of compressed air energy storage. In this paper, I-CAES power plant is considered as an important dispatching resource to participate in optimal dispatching of distribution network operation cost. Firstly, based on the thermodynamic characteristics of I-CAES power station, the operation constraint model of energy storage power station is established. Then, an optimal dispatching model of distribution network operation cost including I-CAES plant is proposed. The minimum purchase cost in one day is taken as the objective function. Finally, an example is simulated by the modified IEEE 33-bus system. The simulation result shows that the efficient I-CAES plant participating in dispatching can greatly save the operation cost of distribution network. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: distribution network; isothermal compressed air energy storage; minimum operation cost; optimal scheduling; particle swarm optimization

Authors: Ye J., Xue J., Tao Q., Wang D.
Title: Application Status and Economic Feasibility Analysis of Distributed Energy Storage Technology
Source title: iSPEC 2019 - 2019 IEEE Sustainable Power and Energy Conference: Grid Modernization for Energy Revolution, Proceedings
Affiliations: China Electric Power Research Institute, New Energy Research Department, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Ye, J., China Electric Power Research Institute, New Energy Research Department, Nanjing, China; Xue, J., China Electric Power Research Institute, New Energy Research Department, Nanjing, China; Tao, Q., China Electric Power Research Institute, New Energy Research Department, Nanjing, China; Wang, D., China Electric Power Research Institute, New Energy Research Department, Nanjing, China
Abstract: The customer side energy storage is developing rapidly, which not only brings direct cost-saving benefits to power customers, but also indirectly benefits grid operation. This paper sorts out the relevant policies of customer side energy storage application, and investigates the application status of domestic and foreign customers' energy storage, and introduces the typical demonstration application cases of customer side energy storage in Jiangsu Province. Then, based on the life cycle cost-benefit present value method, the benefit model of the customer side battery energy storage in the whole power system is established, and explores the economic feasibility of customer side battery energy storage through case study. Finally, the market-scale energy storage of the customer side is predicted by combining the break-even point of the economic model. © 2019 IEEE.
