Authors: Abdel-Karim N., Georges S., Fayad F.
Title: Analysis of Primary Distribution Area Expansion by Interconnecting a Wind Turbine
Source title: IECON Proceedings (Industrial Electronics Conference)
Affiliations: Notre Dame University, ECCE Department, Zouk Mosbih, Lebanon; Lebanese University, MIE Department, Saida, Lebanon
Authors with affiliations: Abdel-Karim, N., Notre Dame University, ECCE Department, Zouk Mosbih, Lebanon; Georges, S., Notre Dame University, ECCE Department, Zouk Mosbih, Lebanon; Fayad, F., Lebanese University, MIE Department, Saida, Lebanon
Abstract: Reducing losses and improving voltage profile at the primary distribution level is becoming a challenging issue for distribution engineers because of their impact in electricity cost and the reliability of power networks. Modern distribution systems employ Distributed Energy Resources (DERs) to assist the local networks in terms of CO2 reduction, security of supply and power quality. The economic merits of DERs are numerous and they can include any generator type or energy-storage device connected to the distribution network. The generators in common use are wind turbines and photovoltaic systems. Several scientific contributions tackled recently the issue of connecting distribution energy resources to the primary systems along the main where they are most valuable. In this paper, a new generalized approach is developed to investigate the substation area expansion as affected by the interconnection of a wind turbine generating system at the opposite end of the primary main. Equations are derived based on the permissible voltage drop defined between the substation feed point and the last distribution transformer. Simulation results show that additional area coverage could be achieved by interconnection a wind turbine and a set of curves are drawn to be readily used for linear-dimension areas with uniform load densities. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Li X., Chen G.
Title: Synchronization Strategy for Virtual Synchronous Generator based Energy Storage System
Source title: IECON Proceedings (Industrial Electronics Conference)
Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, X., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Chen, G., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Abstract: Due to the ability to improve system inertia of converter-dominant network, virtual synchronous generator (VSG) control strategy has earned it more concern and wide application recently. However, since the VSG can establish the voltage and phase by itself, it becomes crucial for VSG to switch from islanded mode to grid-connected mode smoothly to reduce the current impact at the point of common coupling (PCC). In this paper, a new seamless transfer method based on the second-order generalized integrator (SOGI) is proposed without the phase lock loop (PLL). In addition, this method is not affected by the power quality problems such as harmonics and DC offset in grid voltage. Simulation and experimental results are presented to verify the feasibility of the proposed method. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy storage system (ESS); seamless transfer; second-order generalized integrator (SOGI); virtual synchronous generator (VSG)

Authors: Wang R., Zhang B., Zhao S., Liang L., Chen Y.
Title: Design of an IGBT-series-based Solid-State Circuit Breaker for Battery Energy Storage System Terminal in Solid-State Transformer
Source title: IECON Proceedings (Industrial Electronics Conference)
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Hubei Wuhan, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, R., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Hubei Wuhan, China; Zhang, B., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Hubei Wuhan, China; Zhao, S., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Hubei Wuhan, China; Liang, L., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Hubei Wuhan, China; Chen, Y., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Hubei Wuhan, China
Abstract: In medium-voltage direct-current (MVDC) distribution grid, the solid-state transformer (SST) with battery energy storage system (BESS) can be used for energy exchange, voltage matching and port power decoupling, etc. However, when dc grid-side short-circuit fault occurs, the energy storage terminal of such transformer should have the ability to prevent from large overcurrent which may violate the safe operation of the system. This paper proposes a cost-efficient solid-state circuit breaker (SSCB) using series-connected IGBTs configured at the terminal of BESS for fault-isolation purpose. A multi-pulse fault-detection method (MPFD) for the SSCB is also proposed, which can not only realize fault-isolation, but also alleviate the thermal dissipation of IGBTs and achieve the voltage-balancing of series-connected switches cycle by cycle. Such an overcurrent protection can contribute to the reliability improvement of the SST system. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Design Methodology of a DC Nanogrid incorporating the V2G Technology
Source title: IECON Proceedings (Industrial Electronics Conference)

Authors with affiliations: Skouros, I., Democritus University of Thrace, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Xanthi, Greece; Karlis, A., Democritus University of Thrace, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Xanthi, Greece
Abstract: Nowadays, microgrids and nanogrids are becoming more and more popular since they facilitate the integration of Distributed Generation (DG) in the utility grid. In the meantime, the technology advancements in power electronics and energy storage systems have increased the interest in Electric Vehicles (EVs). The scope of this study is to describe a design methodology of a DC nanogrid that consists of a photovoltaic system and an EV battery. The design procedure of the bidirectional DC-charger of the EV batteries and the three-phase inverter that are included in the configuration takes into consideration all the requirements of the Vehicle-to-Grid (V2G) technology. The nanogrid was modeled via Matlab/Simulink. The simulation results verify the effectiveness of the proposed configuration. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Boukili Y., Pedro Aguiar A., Carvalho A.
Title: Modelling, Control and Performance Evaluation of an AC/DC Microgrid
Source title: IECON Proceedings (Industrial Electronics Conference)
Affiliations: University of Porto, Faculty of Engineering, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering (DEEC), Porto, 4200-465, Portugal
Authors with affiliations: Boukili, Y., University of Porto, Faculty of Engineering, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering (DEEC), Porto, 4200-465, Portugal; Pedro Aguiar, A., University of Porto, Faculty of Engineering, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering (DEEC), Porto, 4200-465, Portugal; Carvalho, A., University of Porto, Faculty of Engineering, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering (DEEC), Porto, 4200-465, Portugal
Abstract: This work considers an AC/DC microgrid that is composed by an integrated PV/wind microgrid, a storage system (battery), DC and AC loads, and between the two buses there is a bidirectional static converter to transfer power. The PV source is connected into the DC bus through a Booster converter while the double fed induction generator that is used in the wind energy system is connected directly with the AC bus. Using the fact that there is a complementarity role between the renewable sources, the purpose of this work is to analyze and improve the power flow dynamics between the AC and DC buses by designing an appropriate control strategy that stabilizes the microgrid during a lack of power generation at one of the renewable sources. Several simulation studies are presented to illustrate the performance evaluation of the proposed microgrid. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Pavelic L., Lackovic I., Mihic M.S., Prlic I.
Title: SiPM-based detector for high resolution measurements in pulsed radiation fields: Preliminary findings
Source title: 2019 IEEE Nuclear Science Symposium and Medical Imaging Conference, NSS/MIC 2019
Affiliations: Institute for Medical Research and Occupational Health, Zagreb, 10001, Croatia; University of Zagreb, Faculty of Electrical Engineering and Computing, Zagreb, 10000, Croatia; Institute for Medical Research and Oc. Health, Zagreb, 10001, Croatia
Authors with affiliations: Pavelic, L., Institute for Medical Research and Occupational Health, Zagreb, 10001, Croatia; Lackovic, I., University of Zagreb, Faculty of Electrical Engineering and Computing, Zagreb, 10000, Croatia; Mihic, M.S., Institute for Medical Research and Oc. Health, Zagreb, 10001, Croatia; Prlic, I., Institute for Medical Research and Oc. Health, Zagreb, 10001, Croatia
Abstract: Ten years ago, it became evident that commercially available dose and dose rate meters do not measure correctly in pulsed radiation fields. Pulsed fields have become mainstream technology in medical imaging and they are present in nondestructive testing, accelerators, etc. Today, some modern dosimeters perform better with only a slight underestimation in pulsed fields of higher dose rates, but dose rate measurements during the pulse still remain a challenge, especially for scattered radiation. This can also be extended to short exposures, dominant in the medical sector. We developed a detector consisting of a silicon photomultiplier coupled to a 10x10x10 mm3 scintillator. For the current stage of research, a NaI(Tl) scintillation crystal was chosen due to its high light yield and capability to detect low energy X-rays. Signals from the detector are digitized using a digital storage oscilloscope and recorded for offline analysis. Analysis was based on signal integration, which remained invariant to pulse pileup and thus allowed measurements from low to high dose rates several times higher than IEC 61526 requirements. Preliminary results showed sufficient time and dose (H∗(10)) resolution for measurement of scattered radiation pulses down to several ms in width. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Dosimetry; Pulsed fields; Scintillators; Silicon photomultiplier

Authors: Pi W., Hao H., Yang S., Liao Y., Xu C.
Title: RBDR: A distributed routing algorithm in high mobility UAV network
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 International Conference on Networking and Network Applications, NaNA 2019
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Networking and Switching Technology, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Beijing, China; China Academy of Electronics and Information Engineering, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Pi, W., State Key Laboratory of Networking and Switching Technology, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Beijing, China; Hao, H., State Key Laboratory of Networking and Switching Technology, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Beijing, China; Yang, S., State Key Laboratory of Networking and Switching Technology, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Beijing, China; Liao, Y., China Academy of Electronics and Information Engineering, Beijing, China; Xu, C., State Key Laboratory of Networking and Switching Technology, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Beijing, China
Abstract: High Mobility Unmanned Aerial Vehicle(UAV) network is a wireless mobile network with strong mobility of nodes, limited space and energy of nodes and real-time changed of network topology. At present, UAV networks are widely used in military, disaster reconstruction, agricultural and other scenarios. The routing problem as a focus in the research of UAV network has also aroused researcher's extensive attention. The routing algotithm in UAV network mainly include proactive routing algorithm, reactive routing algorithm, auxiliary routing algorithm, etc. However, most of these routing algorithms are centralized, deployment difculties, low stability and poor scalability. And they also require each node to maintain a global routing information table in order to obtain global node information in real time to network flooding, which undoubtedly wastes a lot of storage space for uav nodes with limited space. This paper, a novel and effective distributed routing algorithm is proposed which named reputation-based distributed routing algorithm(RBDR), and deploy it to the high mobility UAV network. In RBDR, we introduce a realtime quota-controlled strategy (which can control the number of message replicates in real time) and defne the concept of reputation for each node, this can avoid network congestion and improve the success rate of messages transmission. Since each node only needs to maintain its own friend list without obtaining the global network status, so the distributed RBDR algorithm can avoid the problem of difcult deployment and difcult information exchange of centralized routing algorithm in the high mobility UAV network. The experimental results show that the RBDR algorithm have higher success rate of message transmission and lower network resource overhead in high mobility UAV network. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Network congestion; Quota-controlled; UAV network; Wireless mobile network
Index Keywords: Agricultural robots; Antennas; Routing algorithms; Wireless networks; Distributed routing algorithm; Information exchanges; Message transmissions; Messages transmission; Network congestions; Proactive routing; Routing problems; Wireless mobile networks; Unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV)

Source title: IEEE Conference on Power Electronics and Renewable Energy, CPERE 2019
Affiliations: Aswan University, Electrical Engineering Department, Aswan, 81542, Egypt; Faculty of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Budapest University of Technology and Economics, Budapest, 1111, Hungary; Solar Energy Research Center (SERC-Chile), Universidad Tecnica Federico Santa Maria, Valparaiso, 2390123, Chile

Abstract: Reliability concerns and continuous availability of superconducting magnetic energy storage (SMES) devices in photovoltaic (PV) power generation systems have been greatly increased. The PV generation systems are highly affected by the continuously changing solar irradiance levels in addition to the operating ambient temperatures. A practical power losses model based on the available experimental measures of SMES devices is proposed in this paper. In addition, this paper presents power losses performance comparison for SMES devices in PV systems with considering the fluctuations in PV generations and the various types of loading. The new proposed model is simple to be integrated with the power management controllers, in addition to being modular for various SMES ratings. A hybrid PV-SMES energy system is selected as a case study with various types of loads for validating the new proposed loss model. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Selim F., Orabi M.
Title: AC/AC Converter with Less Number of Power Switches for SWECS for Stand-alone Applications
Source title: IEEE Conference on Power Electronics and Renewable Energy, CPERE 2019

Authors with affiliations: Selim, F., APEARC, Aswan University, Aswan, 81542, Egypt; Orabi, M., APEARC, Aswan University, Aswan, 81542, Egypt
Abstract: This paper offers a new configuration of power converter with reduced number of power elements to achieve a reduction which reaches to 40% to be the reduced cost topology if it is compared with the others that have been introduced in the previous work. A unity power factor is done with maximum power point extracting for the wind; a battery energy storage system is introduced for load power management. A small size of DC-link capacitor has been used for DC voltage filtering. The converter is used for converting the three phase input power comes from the wind into single phase power for stand-alone load. The simulation results illustrate the efficiency and reliability of the proposed converter in power conversion system. The simulation results have been done on PSIM software. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Elnozahy A., Abdel-Salam M.
Title: Financial Feasibility of Grid-Connected PV/Wind Renewable Power Generation Systems in Egypt
Source title: IEEE Conference on Power Electronics and Renewable Energy, CPERE 2019
Affiliations: Assiut University, Electrical Engineering, Assiut, Egypt
Authors with affiliations: Elnozahy, A., Assiut University, Electrical Engineering, Assiut, Egypt; Abdel-Salam, M., Assiut University, Electrical Engineering, Assiut, Egypt
Abstract: The significant way to support the electricity sector and encourage the consumer to use renewable resources in electricity generation in Egypt is investing energy produced from hybrid renewable sources system with the grid. A hybrid PV/wind turbine system is optimized as a core source of energy for households in Egypt. The storage battery bank and diesel unit are used as secondary energy sources. The surplus and shortage of energy are invested with the utility grid. Optimization results at interest rate of 12% indicate that cost of energy (COE) and loss of power supply probability (LPSP) when connecting PV/wind system with the utility grid are 0.024/kWh and zero against 0.131/kWh and 35.5% for grid-independent PV/wind/battery system, respectively. This corresponding to 81.7% reduction in COE. Thus, it is more economic feasibility to connect PV/wind system with the utility grid than grid-independent PV/wind/battery system. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Shaaban E.F., Hassan A.E.-W., Mansour D.-E.A.
Title: Using SMES for Voltage Stabilization of PMSG Based Wind Energy System
Source title: IEEE Conference on Power Electronics and Renewable Energy, CPERE 2019
Affiliations: Faculty of Engineering, Tanta University, Electrical Power and Machines Engineering Department, Tanta, Egypt
Authors with affiliations: Shaaban, E.F., Faculty of Engineering, Tanta University, Electrical Power and Machines Engineering Department, Tanta, Egypt; Hassan, A.E.-W., Faculty of Engineering, Tanta University, Electrical Power and Machines Engineering Department, Tanta, Egypt; Mansour, D.-E.A., Faculty of Engineering, Tanta University, Electrical Power and Machines Engineering Department, Tanta, Egypt
Abstract: With variable speed wind turbines (VSWT), the maximum power point tracking (MPPT) should be implemented through making the rotor following the optimum rotor speed. But, due to wind variability, there will be fluctuations in the output power of wind turbine generators. If these generators are connected to a DC grid, the power fluctuations will negatively be reflected on the DC voltage. So, Superconducting Magnetic Energy Storage (SMES) is proposed in this study as an effective solution for voltage stabilization of DC grids connected to wind energy systems. The adopted wind turbine generator is Permanent Magnet Synchronous Generator (PMSG). The models of wind turbine, PMSG, and interfacing rectifier are built using PSCAD/EMTDC software. Then, a model for SMES is built including a superconducting coil with large inductance and a DC-DC bidirectional converter. The SMES control is built through PI controller to determine the duty cycle to the DC-DC bidirectional converter to achieve charging, freewheeling and discharging modes for the SMES. Two various operating conditions are considered, operation with variable wind speed and operation with sudden load change. SMES could effectively absorb the excess or deliver the shortage in output power enabling DC voltage stabilization at the desired value. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: DC grids; Permanent magnet synchronous generator; Superconducting magnetic energy storage (SMES); Voltage stabilization

Source title: Proceedings of International Conference on ASIC
Affiliations: Microelectronics Center, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, 150001, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, J.-Q., Microelectronics Center, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, 150001, China; Xiao, L.-Y., Microelectronics Center, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, 150001, China; He, L., Microelectronics Center, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, 150001, China; Wu, H.-T., Microelectronics Center, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, 150001, China
Abstract: Space applications face severe challenges from soft errors caused by cosmic rays. Soft errors can change the storage state of memories used in electronic system, leading to system failure. To avoid the system corruption, error correction codes (ECCs) as the general mitigation strategy in system level are utilized to eliminate the soft error influence. As the feature size goes down, more memory cells are integrated in the energy deposited range of radiation particles and MBU becomes the main error patterns. In this paper, we propose a new method to design 5-bit burst error correction code against more complex burst error. To achieve that, a technique to design a code with unequal correction ability and a customized interleaving plan combined with the proposed code is presented. The experiment result implies that this method is efficient for MBUs mitigation and a potential option for system designers. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Cosmology; Data communication equipment; Design; Radiation hardening; Space applications; Systems engineering; Burst error corrections; Correction ability; Electronic systems; Error correction codes (ECCs); Mitigation strategy; Multiple bit upset; Radiation particles; System designers; Error correction

Title: Novel smart card soc memory architecture based on embedded stt-mram
Source title: Proceedings of International Conference on ASIC

Ltd., Hangzhou, 311305, China; Liu, B., Zhejiang Hikstor Technology Co. Ltd., Hangzhou, 311305, China
Abstract: In the applications of Internet of Things (IoT), the limitations of the common NVM + RAM hybrid memory architecture cannot simultaneously provided the solution of lower power, low resource consumption and nonvolatile which are critical for IoT designing. Spin Transfer Torque Magnetic Random Access Memory (STT-MRAM) has become a major candidate for on-chip memory because of its ideal memory characteristics, such as nonvolatile, near zero standby leakage power and compatibility with CMOS. Therefore, this paper focuses on the application of STT-MRAM in the storage of IoT. We design the eSTT-MRAM non-hybrid memory architecture for smart card SoCs. The prototype verification results on Xilinx's ARTIX-7 XC7A100T FPGA platform show that the STT-MRAM-based memory architecture can greatly improve the operating efficiency of SoC programs and reduce the dynamic power consumption of the system due to data storage. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Yang X., Yang J.
Title: Research on fault ride-through control strategy for microgrid with wind farms and storages
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 12th International Conference on Intelligent Computation Technology and Automation, ICICTA 2019
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Shenyang University of Technology, Shenyang, 110870, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, X., School of Electrical Engineering, Shenyang University of Technology, Shenyang, 110870, China; Yang, J., School of Electrical Engineering, Shenyang University of Technology, Shenyang, 110870, China
Abstract: As an important distributed power source in the microgrid, wind power generation system brings economic benefits as the penetration rate of wind power increases, which threatens the stable operation of the microgrid. When the grid is faulty, in order to meet the basic requirements of the wind power system not off-grid operation, this paper introduces the battery energy storage system to achieve the purpose of compensating for the grid fault voltage. Firstly, by detecting the degree of voltage transient drop of the grid point after the failure of the distribution network; then, the battery energy storage system in the wind storage combined microgrid system injects appropriate power to support the voltage of the grid point. Finally, the microgrid model is built in MATLABA to simulation verification. The results show that the proposed energy storage control method can effectively support the grid-connected point voltage and effectively measure the power output of the system network to realize the fault voltage traversal of the microgrid. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Ma K., Wang J.
Title: Analysis and prediction of massive electricity information based on hadoop Ha architecture
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 12th International Conference on Intelligent Computation Technology and Automation, ICICTA 2019
Affiliations: School of Computer, Central South University, Changsha, 410083, China
Authors with affiliations: Ma, K., School of Computer, Central South University, Changsha, 410083, China; Wang, J., School of Computer, Central South University, Changsha, 410083, China
Abstract: With the widespread use of smart grids and the Internet of Things, the amount of electricity generated by energy metering equipment is gradually increased. The traditional model has been more difficult to burden the storage, processing and analysis of massive electricity consumption information, and has gradually become the performance bottleneck of the system. Based on Hadoop with the advantages of distributed storage and parallel computing, the current performance bottleneck can be solved. In order to improve the fault tolerance of Hadoop in the production environment, the QJM (Quorum Journal Manager) mode is adopted as the high-availability shared storage mechanism, and the ZooKeeper cluster is introduced to complete the switching between the active and standby nodes to achieve smooth failover and avoidance. In order to fully analyze and explore the potential value in massive electricity consumption information, Hive data warehouse is used to realize complex query and multi-dimensional analysis. Based on statistical analysis data, a gray model is used to predict the trend of some data in future electricity usage information. Through the real-time collection of massive electricity consumption information, data cleaning and classification preprocessing, HDFS cloud storage, MapReduce parallel computing, HiveQL statistical analysis, the proposed scheme is efficient and feasible. It also verifies that the gray model can better predict the future power consumption trend under the Hadoop HA (High Available) architecture. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Big Data about Electricity; Fault Tolerance; Grey Model; Hadoop HA(High Available); Hive Data Warehouse; Statistical Analysis

Authors: Dwi Wicaksono B.G., Iman Malakani A., Arthanto D.H., Purwadi A.
Title: Study and Design of an Off-Grid Hybrid System for Administrative Load at Amaru Village, Asmat, Papua
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd International Conference on High Voltage Engineering and Power Systems: Towards Sustainable and Reliable Power Delivery, ICHVEPS 2019
Affiliations: Institut Teknologi Bandung, Electrical Energy Conversion Research Laboratory, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Dwi Wicaksono, B.G., Institut Teknologi Bandung, Electrical Energy Conversion Research Laboratory, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; Iman Malakani, A., Institut Teknologi Bandung, Electrical Energy Conversion Research Laboratory, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; Arthanto, D.H., Institut Teknologi Bandung, Electrical Energy Conversion Research Laboratory, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; Purwadi, A., Institut Teknologi Bandung, Electrical Energy Conversion Research Laboratory, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia
Abstract: The application of Solar Photovoltaic (PV) has been used in the world in fulfilling renewable energy. Hybrid PV-based electric power systems are the answer to the fulfilment clean energy of electricity and are suitable to be designed in areas that are isolated and far from the main electricity network. The Hybrid systems will be discussed in this paper are the hybrid from PV, Generator and Battery Storage Systems. The design of a Hybrid PV system depends on geographical location, resource potential, and load profile. Looking at the considerations of these parameters, technical and economic analysis is needed regarding the design of the generating system. Overall, this paper will discuss the technical and economical design of Hybrid PV-based electric power systems that will be implemented in the village of Amaru, Asmat, Papua. Technical parameters such as Irradiance, Temperature, Controller and Sizing Components will be the main focus of the discussion. Technical design analysis will use MATLAB/SIMULINK with the application of the Perturbation & Observation (P&O) algorithm on Maximum Power Point Tracker (MPPT) and economical design analysis will use Homer Pro. Based on the result, the output from MATLAB/SIMULINK will be more comprehensive because the input data can adjust by every single time. The results obtained in the feasible and reliable system that can be used as a consideration in the plan to build a Hybrid PV-based power system in the village of Amaru, Asmat, Papua. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Prahastono I., Aimisa R., Atmajaya G.K.M., Sinisuka N.I., Dinata I.S., Nursyamsi F., Supriatna A.
Title: Calculating the Environmental Impact of Energy Consumption in the Oil Depot Using Life Cycle Assessment Method (Case Study: Oil Depot at Tasikmalaya)
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd International Conference on High Voltage Engineering and Power Systems: Towards Sustainable and Reliable Power Delivery, ICHVEPS 2019
Affiliations: Institut Teknologi Bandung, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; PT Pertamina (Persero), TBBM Tasikmalaya, Tasikimalaya, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Prahastono, I., Institut Teknologi Bandung, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; Aimisa, R., Institut Teknologi Bandung, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; Atmajaya, G.K.M., Institut Teknologi Bandung, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; Sinisuka, N.I., Institut Teknologi Bandung, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; Dinata, I.S., Institut Teknologi Bandung, School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; Nursyamsi, F., PT Pertamina (Persero), TBBM Tasikmalaya, Tasikimalaya, Indonesia; Supriatna, A., PT Pertamina (Persero), TBBM Tasikmalaya, Tasikimalaya, Indonesia
Abstract: Oil depot has the important rules in energy distribution to society as end user. Tasikmalaya oil depot has rule to distribute oil to other depots in West Java. This depot shall have good operational performance cause playing a growing and relevant role in million peoples in those provinces. On the other hand, oil depot holds a potential environmental impact that must be assess. One of the assessment methods that can be used is Life Cycle Assessment. This method uses ISO 14040 and 14044 as a standard. LCA also roles as continual improvement as a form of their consistency for environmental preservation effort. LCA in this oil depot use Kilo Liter throughput as a functional unit and has a boundary in operational depot that consist of four subsystem (receiving facility, storage, distribution and support facility) and calculating the environmental impact from energy consumption. Energy consumption data was primary data that taken on site, consist of electricity consumption on each equipment and building. The result showed that electricity consumption contributes 3.064 kg CO2 equivalent per kilo liter oil throughput. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: electricity; energy; global warming potential; Life Cycle Assessment (LCA); Oil depot
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Electric power transmission; Electric power utilization; Electricity; Energy utilization; Environmental impact; Global warming; Electricity-consumption; energy; Energy consumption datum; Environmental preservation; Global warming potential; Life Cycle Assessment (LCA); Oil depot; Operational performance; Life cycle

Authors: Purba Sejati A.E., Hariyanto N., Banjar-Nahor K.M., Saifur Rahman F., Rahmani R.
Title: Increasing Reliability of Coal-Fired Plant by Integrating Battery Energy Storage (Part 1: Heat Rate Side)
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd International Conference on High Voltage Engineering and Power Systems: Towards Sustainable and Reliable Power Delivery, ICHVEPS 2019
Affiliations: ITB, PT PLN (Persero), School of Electrical and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; Institut Teknologi Bandung, School of Electrical and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Purba Sejati, A.E., ITB, PT PLN (Persero), School of Electrical and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; Hariyanto, N., Institut Teknologi Bandung, School of Electrical and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; Banjar-Nahor, K.M., Institut Teknologi Bandung, School of Electrical and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; Saifur Rahman, F., Institut Teknologi Bandung, School of Electrical and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia; Rahmani, R., Institut Teknologi Bandung, School of Electrical and Informatics, Bandung, Indonesia
Abstract: In general, the design of coal-fired power plants is not designed under flexible operating conditions. This flexibility will potentially cause changes in the operating pattern of coal-fired power plants, which operate at a minimum load. This pattern of operation will lead to increased use of coal, reduce the value of thermal efficiency, and possibly reduce equipment reliability. This paper presents an analysis of the impact of the flexibility of the coal-fired plant operation on its reliability. The solution that we propose in this paper is to integrate the coal-fired plant with Battery Energy Storage (BES). On scheme, the battery will be charged in a off-peak and will be discharged when a peak-load. We present several choices of BES in this paper, to find out more about this integration. in part 1 this will focus on how the impact of integration of coal power plants with battery energy storage in terms of heat rate levels, analysis is based on the effects of changes in heat rate levels of coal power plants during the use of BES and compared when not using BES. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery Energy Storage (BES); Economic Evaluation; Flexibility; Heat Rate; Lagrangian Optimization; Reliability
Index Keywords: Coal; Coal fueled furnaces; Coal storage; Electric batteries; Electric power transmission; Fossil fuel power plants; Reliability; Reliability analysis; Battery energy storages (BES); Economic evaluations; Flexibility; Heat rate; Lagrangian optimization; Battery storage

Authors: Rassolkin A., Vaimann T., Kallaste A., Kuts V.
Title: Digital twin for propulsion drive of autonomous electric vehicle
Source title: 2019 IEEE 60th Annual International Scientific Conference on Power and Electrical Engineering of Riga Technical University, RTUCON 2019 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Tallinn University of Technology, Department of Electrical Power Engineering and Mechatronics, Tallinn, Estonia; Tallinn University of Technology, Department of Mechanical and Industrial Engineering, Tallinn, Estonia
Authors with affiliations: Rassolkin, A., Tallinn University of Technology, Department of Electrical Power Engineering and Mechatronics, Tallinn, Estonia; Vaimann, T., Tallinn University of Technology, Department of Electrical Power Engineering and Mechatronics, Tallinn, Estonia; Kallaste, A., Tallinn University of Technology, Department of Electrical Power Engineering and Mechatronics, Tallinn, Estonia; Kuts, V., Tallinn University of Technology, Department of Mechanical and Industrial Engineering, Tallinn, Estonia
Abstract: Autonomous driving is no longer just an idea of technology vision, instead a real technical trend all over the world. The continuing development to a further level of autonomy requires more from energy optimization. The optimization of electric propulsion drive systems of self-driving electric vehicles by using autonomous and monitoring sensors are not often discussed. The goal of the paper is to specify tasks required for a specialized unsupervised prognosis and control platform for energy system performance estimation. Final goal requires the development of several test platforms and digital twins. A digital twin is composed of three components-the physical entities in the real world, their virtual models, and the connected data/view that ties the two worlds together. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Autonomous automobiles; Intelligent vehicles; Predictive models
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Digital twin; Electric vehicles; Propulsion; Autonomous driving; Continuing development; Control platform; Energy optimization; Level of autonomies; Monitoring sensors; Performance estimation; Propulsion drives; Autonomous vehicles

Title: Method to Calculate and Take Control Maximum Speed of Turbine Expander of CAES after Load Rejection

Ltd., China, Chongqing University, Guiyang, China
Abstract: It is considered to be one of the most promising large-scale energy storage technologies by applying compressed air energy storage (CAES). But there is no method to calculate and take control the maximum speed after load rejection. By research on the process of load rejection, the over-speed process is divided into three phases. The method to calculate the maximum speed is also worked out, this will provide an emergency emission system and method for over-speeding of an expansion generator. And it supports the manufacture and the operation of CAES. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Zhang W., Zhang H., Lu J., Wu L.
Title: Robust Verification of an Improved TEC Method based on real-time simulation system
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd Advanced Information Management, Communicates, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IMCEC 2019
Affiliations: Xiamen University, School of Aerospace Engineering, Xiamen, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, W., Xiamen University, School of Aerospace Engineering, Xiamen, China; Zhang, H., Xiamen University, School of Aerospace Engineering, Xiamen, China; Lu, J., Xiamen University, School of Aerospace Engineering, Xiamen, China; Wu, L., Xiamen University, School of Aerospace Engineering, Xiamen, China
Abstract: This paper builds a real-time display simulation platform that integrates aircraft model, real-time dynamic display, route management, and control strategy selection. In order to use FlightGear to dynamically show the flight status of the Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) in real time, this paper create a geometric model of a certain type of UAV in FlightGear, and build the communication between Matlab and FlightGear. Based on the theory of total energy control (TEC), a modified total energy method is used to simulate the landing process in real time that use FlighGear for real-time display. After considering the parameter deviation, the Monte Carlo method is used to the simulation for providing the histograms of parameters such as touchdown speed and touchdown height rate are given, which proves that the algorithm is robust to the parameter uncertainty of the UAV. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Xiaochun M., Xiaohong W., Yang L., Shouxin S., Chao Z.
Title: Research on Improvement of Voltage Fluctuation in Micro-grid Based on Improved Double Closed Loop Control of Flywheel Battery
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd Advanced Information Management, Communicates, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IMCEC 2019
Affiliations: NARI Group Corporation, State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; State Grid Hangzhou Fuyang Power Supply CO. Ltd., Fuyang, 311400, China; State Grid Weifang Power Supply Company, Weifang, 261000, China
Authors with affiliations: Xiaochun, M., NARI Group Corporation, State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Xiaohong, W., NARI Group Corporation, State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Yang, L., State Grid Hangzhou Fuyang Power Supply CO. Ltd., Fuyang, 311400, China; Shouxin, S., State Grid Weifang Power Supply Company, Weifang, 261000, China; Chao, Z., State Grid Weifang Power Supply Company, Weifang, 261000, China
Abstract: Clean power sources such as wind power and PV have great randomness and volatility, and random changes in wind speed and solar irradiance are prone to voltage fluctuations. Considering the influence of wind power and photovoltaic on the power quality of micro-grid, this paper adopts the method of connecting the flywheel battery in parallel with the micro-source AC output side to adjust the output voltage of each micro-source inverter. According to the double closed-loop control principle of voltage outer loop and current inner loop, the improved fuzzy PID controller is used to replace the traditional double-loop PI regulator, so that the flywheel battery can stabilize the output voltage of the micro-source more quickly and effectively. The simulation results of MATLAB/Simulink software show that the improved double closed-loop control strategy is used to realize the fast storage and release of the energy of the flywheel battery, which achieves the purpose of stabilizing the system voltage and improving the power quality. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: double-loop control; flywheel battery; fuzzy PID controller; micro-grid; voltage fluctuation

Authors: Mingxing G., Mengyao Z., Yan L., Lei Z., Rong Y., Ruanming H.
Title: Study on Submarine Cable Opening Overvoltage Modeling and Its Suppression Technology
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd Advanced Information Management, Communicates, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IMCEC 2019
Affiliations: Electric Economic Research Institute, State Grid Shanghai Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China; State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, Beijing, China; Zhoushan Electric Power Supply Company of State Grid Zhejiang Power Corporation, Zhoushan, China
Authors with affiliations: Mingxing, G., Electric Economic Research Institute, State Grid Shanghai Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China; Mengyao, Z., Electric Economic Research Institute, State Grid Shanghai Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China; Yan, L., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, Beijing, China; Lei, Z., Zhoushan Electric Power Supply Company of State Grid Zhejiang Power Corporation, Zhoushan, China; Rong, Y., Electric Economic Research Institute, State Grid Shanghai Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China; Ruanming, H., Electric Economic Research Institute, State Grid Shanghai Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China
Abstract: Capacitive components of the power system are energy storage components, when the operation or failure to change its working state, there will be a transition process. During the transition, since the power supply continues to supply energy, and the magnetic energy stored in the inductor translates into a capacitance in the form of electrostatic field energy stored in the system at some point, an overvoltage several times greater than the supply voltage, this is the operation over voltage. In the transmission line, the common overvoltage operation has cut off the no-load line overvoltage and closing no-load line overvoltage. Due to the obvious effect of capacitance of submarine cable used by offshore wind farms and the reactive voltage distribution characteristics of offshore submarine cables connected to the grid with onshore wind farms, there are significant differences in fault characteristics and overvoltage problems are prone to occur. In particular, the overvoltage caused by the switch-off of the circuit breaker caused by the system state transition is especially obvious. The overvoltage of the sub-gate is especially obvious. It is urgent to analyze the transmission line overvoltage of large-scale offshore submarine wind farms and explain the generating mechanism of overvoltage and its restraining measures. It provides a theoretical basis for the study of engineering overvoltage suppression and engineering calculation and analysis. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Opening Overvoltage Modeling; Submarine Cable; Suppression Technology
Index Keywords: Capacitance; Electric circuit breakers; Electric lines; Electric utilities; Electrolysis; Information management; Navigation; Offshore oil well production; Onshore wind farms; Submarine cables; Submarines; Transmissions; Capacitive components; Energy storage components; Engineering calculation; Fault characteristics; Generating mechanism; Over-voltages; Overvoltage suppression; Transition process; Offshore wind farms

Authors: Hongyu P., Tianlu H.
Title: An apriori-based energy-efficient algorithm for SDN data center
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 IEEE International Conferences on Ubiquitous Computing and Communications and Data Science and Computational Intelligence and Smart Computing, Networking and Services, IUCC/DSCI/SmartCNS 2019
Affiliations: Computer School. TangShan College, TangShan, China; Compute Center. TangShan College, TangShan, China
Authors with affiliations: Hongyu, P., Computer School. TangShan College, TangShan, China; Tianlu, H., Compute Center. TangShan College, TangShan, China
Abstract: This paper targets on energy saving for SDN-based datacenter. A SApriori energy-efficient Algorithm is provided. Though full considering the user request, response and relationships between various factors, SApriori is more practical and more valuable than other typical energy-efficient Algorithm. Access efficiency is improved and overall storage requirements are reduced by running the SApriori. The datacenter network's control and forwarding is separated effectively by adopting SDN. Therefore, efficient deployment and implementation of energy saving strategy is possible in SDN structure. Simulation result shows that the strategy proposed by this paper can save more energy than other typical energy-efficient Algorithm and overall storage is reduced. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Al-Saadi M., Pestana R., Pastor R., Gloria G., Egorov A., Reis F., Simao T.
Title: Survey analysis on existing tools and services for grid and market stakeholders and requirements to improve TSO/DSO coordination
Source title: ISSE 2019 - 5th IEEE International Symposium on Systems Engineering, Proceedings
Affiliations: Centro de Investigação em Energia REN-State Grid, S.A., RD NESTER, Lisbon, Portugal; REN Rede Eléctrica Nacional, S.A., Lisbon, Portugal; EDPD EDP Distribuição, S.A., Lisbon, Portugal
Authors with affiliations: Al-Saadi, M., Centro de Investigação em Energia REN-State Grid, S.A., RD NESTER, Lisbon, Portugal; Pestana, R., REN Rede Eléctrica Nacional, S.A., Lisbon, Portugal; Pastor, R., Centro de Investigação em Energia REN-State Grid, S.A., RD NESTER, Lisbon, Portugal; Gloria, G., Centro de Investigação em Energia REN-State Grid, S.A., RD NESTER, Lisbon, Portugal; Egorov, A., Centro de Investigação em Energia REN-State Grid, S.A., RD NESTER, Lisbon, Portugal; Reis, F., Centro de Investigação em Energia REN-State Grid, S.A., RD NESTER, Lisbon, Portugal; Simao, T., EDPD EDP Distribuição, S.A., Lisbon, Portugal
Abstract: In this work, a survey was carried out to identify the current European landscape from grid and market stakeholders' point of view and to improve the coordination between the Transmission System Operators (TSOs) and Distribution System Operators (DSOs). The survey includes two parts, one dedicated to grid's tools and services and other to the market's tools and services. This survey aims to identify exists tools and services in order to adapt them to the future challenges. Based on the survey results, it was identified that major concerns of the energy stakeholders are related with the integration of different platforms used for different purposes (for example, operational planning and real time systems), and how to exchange information/data between parties in an expedited and standardized way. The survey participants see energy storage as the most essential technology in the future energy system, followed by the smart metering, online voltage regulation and demand response services. However, on the market landscape, survey results suggest that the creation of limited number of fully integrated regulated markets is the most consensual solution to avoid the fragmentation in many different markets and products. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Ma S., Lu J.
Title: An Adaptive Mission Planning Method for UUV Combat Operations under Uncertain Conditions
Source title: Proceedings of the 2019 IEEE International Conference on Unmanned Systems, ICUS 2019
Affiliations: Naval Research Academy, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Ma, S., Naval Research Academy, Beijing, China; Lu, J., Naval Research Academy, Beijing, China
Abstract: This paper presents a novel method of mission planning under uncertain conditions for UUV combat operations. Planning within this domain is challenging because complex combat environment prevents computation of an optimal strategy in advance. Based on the analysis of the key factors affecting the execution of combat missions, such as combat environment, operation objectives and UUV system, the mission planning method which combines online monitoring, evaluation, prediction and adaptive adjustment is designed. This method has the ability of revising the initial plan in respond to observed information. The energy, data storage space and weapon loads evaluation models related to combat missions are established respectively. The mission goals selection algorithm is studied to enable UUV to adjust the plan autonomously. The simulation results show that the method has good adaptability to complex operation conditions, which can effectively reduce the operational risk of UUV. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: adaptive mission; combat operation; planning; UUV
Index Keywords: Planning; Adaptive adjustment; adaptive mission; Combat environments; Combat operations; Complex operations; Optimal strategies; Selection algorithm; Uncertain condition; Digital storage

Authors: Chen Y., Zhao Y., Geng G., Jiang Q., Liu W., Li L.
Title: Suppression Strategy of Ultra-Low Frequency Oscillation in Yunnan Power Grid with BESS
Source title: 51st North American Power Symposium, NAPS 2019
Affiliations: Yunnan Grid Planning Research Center, Kunming, China; College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, Y., Yunnan Grid Planning Research Center, Kunming, China; Zhao, Y., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Geng, G., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Jiang, Q., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Liu, W., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Li, L., Yunnan Grid Planning Research Center, Kunming, China
Abstract: Many problems related to power system frequency have occurred in Yunnan Province ─a province in southwestern China with high proportion of hydro-turbine generators. Yunnan Power Grid is a typical direct-current (DC) sending grid and the installed capacity of hydro-generators has accounted for more than 70% of the total capacity after asynchronous interconnection between Yunnan Power Grid and China Southern Power Grid in 2016. But the high hydropower proportion of Yunnan Power Grid makes ultra-low frequency oscillation (ULFO) more prone to occur. Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) has broad application prospects in frequency regulation. Aiming at the ULFO problem caused by AGC daily operation, a coordinated AGC strategy based on BESS is proposed. It is able to eliminate ULFO caused by AGC action by ramping the AGC signal assigned to the units and self-adaptive action of BESS with a small energy storage capacity once the system is judged to be at risk of oscillation. The effectiveness of the proposed method is verified using real-world data from Yunnan Power Grid in China based on MATLAB\SINMULINK. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Automatic Generation Control (AGC); Battery Energy Storage System (BEES); Ultra-Low Frequency Oscillation (ULFO); Yunnan Power Grid
Index Keywords: Battery storage; Digital storage; Electric power transmission networks; Hydroelectric generators; Asynchronous interconnections; Automatic generation control; Battery energy storage systems; Frequency regulations; Hydro turbine generator; Power system frequencies; Ultra low frequencies; Yunnan power grid; Electric power system control

Authors: Zhang H., Yang Y., Chang H.
Title: A high-performance mettalic aerogel based aluminum-hydrogen peroxide fuel cell
Source title: Proceedings of the 2019 IEEE International Conference on Unmanned Systems, ICUS 2019
Affiliations: Northwestern Polytechnical University, School of Mechnical Engineering, Xi'an, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, H., Northwestern Polytechnical University, School of Mechnical Engineering, Xi'an, China; Yang, Y., Northwestern Polytechnical University, School of Mechnical Engineering, Xi'an, China; Chang, H., Northwestern Polytechnical University, School of Mechnical Engineering, Xi'an, China
Abstract: Batteries with high energy densities and high power densities are desired by all mobile platforms, especially for unmanned aerial vehicles. One of a key condition for advancing battery systems is a highly efficient conversion of energy. Fuel cells, such as electrochemical devices, are capable of directly converting of chemical energy accumulated in fuel into electrical energy. The efficient energy conversion system of fuel cells makes it a suitable alternative for current power systems. In this paper, we report a facile aluminum-hydrogen peroxide (Al-H2O2) fuel cell using ultra-light silver nanowire (Ag NW) aerogel as the cathode. Ag NW aerogel is a type of hierarchically porous silver foam possessing high specific area and porosity, which are beneficial for the electrochemical energy storage and conversion system in a more efficient way. The Al-H2O2 fuel cell equipped with Ag NW aerogel as cathode is fabricated, and delivers a 46.8-folds higher power density than commercial Ag-rod cathode. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Al-H2O2 fuel cell; battery systems; high-performance; silver nanowire aerogel

Authors: Li Y., Zheng Y., Zhu N., Zhao F.
Title: Wind turbine kinetic energy accumulation and release regulation for wind farm optimization
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 4th International Conference on Mechanical, Control and Computer Engineering, ICMCCE 2019
Affiliations: College of Computer and Communication, Lanzhou University of Technology, Lanzhou, 730050, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, Y., College of Computer and Communication, Lanzhou University of Technology, Lanzhou, 730050, China; Zheng, Y., College of Computer and Communication, Lanzhou University of Technology, Lanzhou, 730050, China; Zhu, N., College of Computer and Communication, Lanzhou University of Technology, Lanzhou, 730050, China; Zhao, F., College of Computer and Communication, Lanzhou University of Technology, Lanzhou, 730050, China
Abstract: Based on wind turbine rotation kinetic energy accumulation and release, wind farm optimization operation was introduced in this paper. The wind turbines in the wind farm have a certain kinetic energy storage capacity, which can be used to implement energy accumulation and release. This is beneficial to wind farm and electricity grid regulation. First, power conversion efficiency under middle and low wind speed can be improved by this method, which includes kinetic energy of wind turbine accumulation and release. This method transfers turbine kinetic energy from lower rotation speed to higher rotation speed to convert mechanical energy into electrical energy by generator, which has higher efficiency. Second, kinetic energy accumulation and release of wind turbine, can be used to regulate electricity grid fluctuation with quick response. In conclusion, utilization of wind turbine based kinetic energy accumulation and release, is a useful method to optimize the wind farm and electricity grid system. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Yu Y., Qin H.
Title: The design of treadmill with distributed generation function
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 4th International Conference on Mechanical, Control and Computer Engineering, ICMCCE 2019
Affiliations: College of Automation and Electronic Engineering, Qingdao University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, China
Authors with affiliations: Yu, Y., College of Automation and Electronic Engineering, Qingdao University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, China; Qin, H., College of Automation and Electronic Engineering, Qingdao University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, China
Abstract: Physical health is very important to economic development, and with the improvement of the living standard, indoor treadmills are more and more popular. However, traditional treadmill drive system has many drawbacks. In order to meet the requirements of low-carbon environmental protection, it is necessary to develop an electromagnetic damping control system capable of distributed generation to improve the shortcomings of traditional treadmill drive system. Therefore, we designed a treadmill that uses PWM mode to adjust the electromagnetic damping, which can guarantee the accuracy of damping adjustment during the movement process. This system integrated intelligent charging management and data networking function together, which can greatly enhance the practicability of the treadmill. If a large number of such treadmills are brought together and the electricity generated from the treadmills is so large that could be connected to the grid, which will effectively alleviate the energy shortage. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Ansari A.A., Ahmed J., Arif H., Iqbal A., Nizami H.A., Ayaz Y.
Title: Investigating Series-Parallel Actuation Arrangement in a Bioinspired Biped Robot
Source title: 2019 International Conference on Robotics and Automation in Industry, ICRAI 2019
Affiliations: National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST), Department of Robotics and Artificial Intelligence, Islamabad, Pakistan
Authors with affiliations: Ansari, A.A., National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST), Department of Robotics and Artificial Intelligence, Islamabad, Pakistan; Ahmed, J., National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST), Department of Robotics and Artificial Intelligence, Islamabad, Pakistan; Arif, H., National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST), Department of Robotics and Artificial Intelligence, Islamabad, Pakistan; Iqbal, A., National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST), Department of Robotics and Artificial Intelligence, Islamabad, Pakistan; Nizami, H.A., National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST), Department of Robotics and Artificial Intelligence, Islamabad, Pakistan; Ayaz, Y., National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST), Department of Robotics and Artificial Intelligence, Islamabad, Pakistan
Abstract: A bipedal robot with serial linkage legs having passive energy storage elements distal to the knee in a Series Parallel Elastic Actuation (SPEA) arrangement is presented to demonstrate and experiment on energy input and recovery during energy-intensive low frequency squatting. The robot is based on the hind legs of the Felidae family with bio-inspired linkage ratios and spring locations. The design places special emphasis on reduction of leg inertia by qualitative assessment of placement of heavier components including motors. Natural dynamics of the system are explored by allowing the assembly to fall from a height and observing its passive spring-damping characteristics and oscillatory frequency. The same is also investigated through computational simulations in the absence of real-world constraints such as joint friction. The effects of SPEA at the knee and ankle joint is observed on the ground-reaction force through the simulation environment. An interesting proposal of incorporating an engage-disengage spring at the knee joint is discussed. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: bipedal; Hip Flexion Extension Actuators; Knee Flexion Extension Actuators; robot; Series Parallel Elastic Actuation; Simulink; squatting

Authors: Luo G., Zhang M., Li H., Li G.
Title: A Real-Time Perception Information Security Algorithm in Internet of Things
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 12th International Congress on Image and Signal Processing, BioMedical Engineering and Informatics, CISP-BMEI 2019
Affiliations: Institute of mathematics and computer, Dali University, Dali, Yunnan, China
Authors with affiliations: Luo, G., Institute of mathematics and computer, Dali University, Dali, Yunnan, China; Zhang, M., Institute of mathematics and computer, Dali University, Dali, Yunnan, China; Li, H., Institute of mathematics and computer, Dali University, Dali, Yunnan, China; Li, G., Institute of mathematics and computer, Dali University, Dali, Yunnan, China
Abstract: In the real-time monitoring of insect ecological environment in Erhai wetland, Internet of Things technology is used by us. But information perception of embedded devices has privacy security problems. Therefore, based on RSA asymmetric encryption algorithm, we propose a real-time perception information security algorithm for Internet of Things. The algorithm is based on selection of large power prime number with probability two, linear private key calculation, modular power operation and so on. It solves bottleneck problems of RSA algorithm such as low efficiency of large prime number generation, slow code implementation, large amount of modular power calculation and large data storage capacity. Through simulation test and analysis of time complexity, the results show that the algorithm has better performance than other improved RSA algorithms in computer. It meets the real-time, energy-saving, privacy and other performance requirements in the application of Internet of Things. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Panapongpakorn T., Banjerdpongchai D.
Title: Model Predictive Control of Energy Management System for Economic Dispatch with Application to MHS Microgrid in Normal Operation
Source title: International Conference on Control, Automation and Systems
Affiliations: Faculty of Engineering, Chulalongkorn University, Department of Electrical Engineering, 254 Phayathai Road, Pathumwan, Bangkok, 10330, Thailand
Authors with affiliations: Panapongpakorn, T., Faculty of Engineering, Chulalongkorn University, Department of Electrical Engineering, 254 Phayathai Road, Pathumwan, Bangkok, 10330, Thailand; Banjerdpongchai, D., Faculty of Engineering, Chulalongkorn University, Department of Electrical Engineering, 254 Phayathai Road, Pathumwan, Bangkok, 10330, Thailand
Abstract: Power generation in microgrid are conventionally decentralized making the grid management increasingly complex. Energy management system (EMS) is very important for power system planning and operation of microgrid. To make sure that the generation meets challenges of load profile requires more robust and effective EMS of microgrid. Specifically, the planning and operation of power supply needs to incorporate the load forecast for the optimal dispatch strategy. This paper proposes Model Predictive Control (MPC) of EMS to dispatch generation power in microgrid for minimum total operating cost. The load forecast is obtained by recurrent neural network for one day ahead. The efficiency and accuracy of load forecasting model affects the efficiency of dispatch algorithm of microgrid. The proposed algorithm is applied to a case study of Mae Hong Son (MHS) microgrid including battery energy storage system and power exchange with utility grid to satisfy load demand for both actual load and forecasted load profiles. We apply MPC to dispatch energy in normal operation and compare the total operating cost (TOC) with that of the previous EMS. It is found that the proposed MPC can significantly reduce TOC ranging from 25% to 45%. © 2019 Institute of Control, Robotics and Systems - ICROS.
Author Keywords: economic dispatch; energy management system; load forecast; microgrid; model predictive control; recurrent neural network

Oceanography and Physical Oceanography Laboratory, Qingdao, China
Abstract: The method based on potential driven and distributed design can theoretically solve a series of bottlenecks in the current deep-sea profile observation technology (such as difficult to achieve large depth, high speed, long range, carrying large sensors, etc.). Based on this method, a set of deep-sea profile observation prototype with SBE37 CTD is designed and developed, and the key technology of designing the prototype is introduced in detail. The prototype has been tested in the South China Sea for 5 days, and 11 CTD data of reciprocating profiles have been obtained. The length of each section is 1000 meters, and the reciprocating velocity of the platform reaches 0.3 m/s. The results of the sea test fully validate the feasibility of the potential drive and distributed design method, so that the mooring reciprocating profile observation system can be continuously observed without the power provided by batteries, which fundamentally solves a series of bottlenecks caused by the previous integrated design and battery power supply. From the technical point of view, this distributed potential energy driven reciprocating profile observation system can meet the higher requirements of ocean observation, such as full depth, high speed, long range, real-time data transmission. © 2019 Marine Technology Society.

Title: Long-endurance green energy autonomous surface vehicle control architecture
Source title: OCEANS 2019 MTS/IEEE Seattle, OCEANS 2019

Abstract: This paper presents the system design and architecture of a wave-powered Autonomous Surface Vehicle (ASV). The proposed solution complies with the self-powering nature of the vehicle, ensuring long-duration operations in the open ocean. In our field-tested concept, the vehicle is equipped with the instruments and capabilities to deal with the environmental uncertainties, while serving as an in-situ data provider for oceanographers and biologists. Robustness to mission failure and a high degree of redundancy are achieved by allocating computational efforts and responsibilities to independent subsystems. A three-layered system subdivision facilitates the implementation of several capabilities involving solar energy harvesting, storage and distribution, radio communication, autonomous navigation, AIS-based collision avoidance and onboard autonomy to supervise both the mission execution and the scientific payload employment. © 2019 Marine Technology Society.

Title: Secondary frequency control of an islanded microgrid by combined GA-TLBO algorithm
Source title: 2019 8th International Conference on Systems and Control, ICSC 2019

Abstract: Microgrid (MG) is considered as one of solutions proposed to reduce the deep dependency on fuel and its fluctuant cost and to decrease the greenhouse emission in the atmosphere. These MGs are basically constituted by renewable sources (e.g. solar, wind), energy storage system and controllable sources (e.g. diesel generator (DG), fuel cell (FC), micro turbine (MT)). The main role of controllable sources and storage in MG is to maintain MG reliability, transparency, efficiency and the quality of energy especially by maintaining frequency of system. against the intermittence of sources and the fluctuation of load. In fact, renewable resources are known by their intermittence according to weather data (e.g. solar irradiation, wind speed, temperature). This paper presents a novel approach of a secondary control based on a PI control which its parameters are designed by combined evolutionary algorithms (EA) and proposes a combined method of EA to improve robustness of MG frequency control. A simulated isolated MG is tested in scenarios to validate the accuracy of the proposed method. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: This paper presents a low voltage DC stand-alone distributed system (LVDC) which is fed by Distributed Generation (DG) based on photovoltaic (PV) renewable sources for supplying unbalanced AC loads.In the proposed system, when the battery is fully charged, the excess power is dissipated. To solve this problem, a power sharing management strategy, also named energy cluster management strategy, acting on the load consumption for stand- alone photovoltaic system was developed. It includes many PV subsystems that are connected to a shared storage system and each one of these subsystems consists of PV panels, a DC/DC converter and an unbalanced load. The advantages of this system are found to be the high efficiency, minimum use of the storage system and low cost compared with conventional individual PV systems.For these reasons and to simplify the study, we adopt three basic operation conditions, which are the functions of the relative powers of the PV panel output, the corresponding loads for each subsystem and the SOC of the battery storage system. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: This paper presents the best Energy Management Strategy (EMS) presented to the IEEE VTS motor vehicleschallenge 2019 - Energy Management of a dual-mode locomotive. The proposed solution aims to minimize the consumption of electricity and hydrogen; and to increase the lifetime of the fuel cell and energy storage system in a dual mode locomotive. The proposed EMS is based on rules that consider the energy and power densities of the energy sources. The paper proposes a global EMS, local EMS for each source and simulation results for four different speed and power profiles. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Oletic D., Bilas V.
Title: Piezoelectric sensor front-end for energy-efficient acquisition of ultrasonic emissions related to water-stress in plants
Source title: Proceedings of IEEE Sensors
Affiliations: University of Zagreb, Faculty of Electrical Engineering and Computing, Zagreb, Croatia
Authors with affiliations: Oletic, D., University of Zagreb, Faculty of Electrical Engineering and Computing, Zagreb, Croatia; Bilas, V., University of Zagreb, Faculty of Electrical Engineering and Computing, Zagreb, Croatia
Abstract: Formation of embolisms in plant's xylem water transport vessels is considered a major cause of plant mortality due to water-stress. Passive ultrasonic acoustic emissions (AE) monitoring shows the most potential for field-quantification of embolism level. However, this requires designing energy-efficient embedded hardware for autonomous high-speed ultrasonic AE acquisition, processing, and storage. In this paper we present a piezoelectric sensor interface for triggered AE acquisition at 2 MS/s. Its design requirements were assessed by laboratory dehydration experiments on grapevine pot-plants. An embedded prototype was design and characterized. The proposed architecture enables event-based acquisition of AE within 120-550 kHz band, at 5.7 mW average power, and 717 ns wakeup-latency. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Yussif N., Abdel-Khalik A.S., Mohamed A.M.
Title: An Improved Quadratic V/f-Based Control of Photovoltaic Battery-Less Induction Motor Driven Water Pumping System
Source title: Proceeding - 2019 International Conference on Sustainable Energy Engineering and Application: Innovative Technology Toward Energy Resilience, ICSEEA 2019
Affiliations: Egypt-Japan University of Science and Technology, Dept. of Energy Resources Engineering, Alexanria, Egypt; Alexandria University, Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Alexandria, Egypt; Electrical Engineering Department, Assiut University, Egypt

Abstract: This paper proposes a new quadratic V/f-based control of a PV induction motor driven water pumping system without storage batteries. The system consists of PV array, DC-DC boost converter, voltage source inverter (VSI), induction motor, and water pump. In order to extract the maximum power from the PV array, the incremental conductance (INC) method is simply utilized. The dc-link voltage is maintained constant using a proportional-integral (PI) controller by controlling the induction motor speed using simple open loop quadratic scalar V/f control. The proposed quadratic scalar V/f control is compared with the widely used linear V/f control using a simulation case study based on MATLAB/SIMULINK. The performance of the proposed method is examined under variable values of solar radiation. When compared with the available scalar controllers, the proposed controller generally improves the system dynamics as well as the overall system efficiency especially under low speed (low discharge) operation. The simulation results have proved that the system output power and the corresponding overall efficiency have been approximately doubled under low speed operation. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: The aim of this paper is to develop an optimal control (OC) for energy scheduling of a grid-connected photovoltaic (PV)-wind turbine (WT)-battery storage system. The objective of the model is to reduce the electricity cost and maximizing the sale of electricity to the grid. The time-of-use (TOU) electricity tariff is evaluated in the optimal control computation. Two optimization methods involving 'Linear Programming (LP)' and 'Genetic algorithm (GA)' techniques are used to solve this problem. A case study is performed based on an industrial load and the simulation results demonstrate that the developed control reduces the operational cost of the studied system and the customers can receive an important income from the renewable energy sale. In addition, the simulation results demonstrate that using the LP based OC, a significant cost and energy savings can be attained when compared with using the GA. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Calin M.D., Sebastian M., Opris V., Eugen A.L.
Title: Experimental analysis of the unsteady pressure field induced by a simplified geometry of the suction elbow at the pump inlet
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on ENERGY and ENVIRONMENT, CIEM 2019
Affiliations: University Politehnica Timişoara, Mechanical Machines Equipment and Transportation, Timişoara, Romania; Romanian Academy-Timişoara Branch, Center for Advanced Research in Engineering Sciences, Timişoara, Romania; University Politehnica Timişoara Bachelor Student, Timişoara, Romania

Abstract: The actual conditions imposed by the energy market require to storage energy when the energy cost is cheap. The storage pumps (double flux or multistage pumps) are structurally different from the regular ones. As a particularity, these types of pumps are equipped with a suction elbow with complex geometrical configuration. The suction elbow generates unsteady hydrodynamic phenomena, which are ingested by the impeller, leading to severe structural and cavitational issues. A suction elbow with a simplified geometry is experimentally investigated to assess the unsteady field at the pump inlet. The unsteady pressure signals acquired on both inlet and outlet walls of the suction elbow are analyzed for nine discharge values from 16.6 l/s to 43.7 l/s. The maximum amplitudes are identified on the power spectra corresponding to the largest discharge values. Both plunging and rotating components are discriminated in each cross section. The plunging component is dominant underling that the interaction of the flow with the suction elbow is the main cause of the unsteady phenomena. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Simplified geometry; Suction elbow; Unsteady pressure field; Variable discharge values
Index Keywords: Geometry; Experimental analysis; Geometrical configurations; Maximum amplitude; Suction elbow; Unsteady phenomena; Unsteady pressure fields; Unsteady pressures; Variable discharge values; Pumps

Authors: Sukmono C.B., Darussalam R., Kuncoro M., Garniwa I.
Title: Simulation of Enhancement PV Power Stabilization with Dynamic Power Injection
Source title: Proceeding - 2019 International Conference on Sustainable Energy Engineering and Application: Innovative Technology Toward Energy Resilience, ICSEEA 2019
Affiliations: University of Indonesia, Department of Energy System Engineering, Depok, Indonesia; Research Center for Electrical Power and Mechatronics, Indonesian Institute of Sciences, Bandung, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukmono, C.B., University of Indonesia, Department of Energy System Engineering, Depok, Indonesia; Darussalam, R., University of Indonesia, Department of Energy System Engineering, Depok, Indonesia, Research Center for Electrical Power and Mechatronics, Indonesian Institute of Sciences, Bandung, Indonesia; Kuncoro, M., University of Indonesia, Department of Energy System Engineering, Depok, Indonesia; Garniwa, I., University of Indonesia, Department of Energy System Engineering, Depok, Indonesia
Abstract: The use of PV for harvesting solar energy as electrical energy has been done globally. On a large scale PV is connected to the distribution as a peak load generator during the day. Integration of PV with grid has several issues, especially because of the intermittent solar energy problems due to the influence of irradiance and environmental temperature. It's causes the energy produced to fluctuate and be unstable. These power fluctuations affect system stability and frequency. To overcome this problem, several methods for PV power stabilization have been developed. One of them is Constant Power Generation (CPG) where PV output power is limited to certain P value settings so as to reduce PV power fluctuations. In this paper the Dynamic Power Injection method is proposed which is a modification of the CPG method with the dynamic action of charge and discharge using batteries as energy storage. The principle of DPI is same with CPG that determines P setting as P output of PV Power, but stabilization of PV Power Outputis also support by active power management. Charge when PV power bigger than P setting and injection when PV power less than P setting. Thus the output power in each condition of PV power same with P setting. By using matlab simulink a DPI circuit simulation is carried out to increase the stability of the power and frequency of the system. The simulation results show that DPI is able to produce stable PV output power on 30 kW and the frequency of the system can be maintained at 50 Hz. © 2019 IEEE.

Index Keywords: Circuit simulation; Energy conservation; MATLAB; Solar energy; Stabilization; Charge and discharge; Dynamic actions; Electrical energy; Environmental temperature; MATLAB/ SIMULINK; Power fluctuations; Power stabilization; Simulink; System stability
