The Thai mediation building requires zero energy from the grid because the main source of energy comes from the solar energy via photovoltaic system. Energy budget is used to calculate the relationship among energy generation, energy load, and energy storage, which is useful to construct any zero energy building. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Yassine S., Najib E.K., Fatima L.
Title: A Survey: Centralized, Decentralized, and Distributed Control Scheme in Smart Grid Systems
Source title: 7th Mediterranean Congress of Telecommunications 2019, CMT 2019
Affiliations: Groupe ISGA, LIMIE Laboratory, El Jadida, Morocco; Chouaib Doukkali University, STIC Laboratory, B.P: 20, El, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: Yassine, S., Groupe ISGA, LIMIE Laboratory, El Jadida, Morocco, Chouaib Doukkali University, STIC Laboratory, B.P: 20, El, Morocco; Najib, E.K., Chouaib Doukkali University, STIC Laboratory, B.P: 20, El, Morocco; Fatima, L., Chouaib Doukkali University, STIC Laboratory, B.P: 20, El, Morocco
Abstract: When electricity was fist made available in the late nineteenth century, it was through central stations serving a group of nearby customers. Generation and distribution were localized, and long-distance transmission was not yet necessary. As demand for electricity service increased, distribution networks expanded in capacity and geography. Systems once isolated from one another were becoming interconnected. Recently, the integration of the distributed renewable energy resources is evolving as an emerging and promising power scenario for the energy system. Smart grid, as a modernized electrical grid, uses information and communication technology to improve the efficiency, reliability, and economics of the production and distribution of electricity [9, 10, 11]. As the main building block of the smart grid, microgrid (MG) integrates a number of local DG units, energy storage systems, and local loads together to form a small-scale power system. In this paper, we will propose some distributed control schemes for the MG control. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Habib H.U.R., Wang S., Farhan B.S., Salih H.W., Waqar A., Kotb K.M.
Title: Load Power Smoothing and DC Bus Voltage Control of PV-SMES Standalone Microgrid based Variable Speed DG using FLC-MPC Approach
Source title: 2019 3rd International Conference on Energy Conservation and Efficiency, ICECE 2019 - Proceedings
Affiliations: University of Engineering and Technology Taxila, Department of Electrical Engineering, Pakistan; Huazhong University of Science and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Wuhan, 430074, China; Baghdad Governorate, Baghdad Governorate Directorate of Water, Iraq; Ministry of Electricity, Najaf Power Plant, Iraq; Bahria University, Department of Electrical Engineering, Islamabad, Pakistan; Tanta University, Department of Electrical Power and Machines Engineering, Egypt; Budapest University of Technology and Economics, Budapest, Hungary

Abstract: Microgrids (MGs) are small scale power grids which comprised of local clean and green energy generation as well as smart energy management units. These systems represent promising solutions for the development of future smart cities. This paper proposes a stand-Alone hybrid microgrid system comprising of a variable speed diesel generator (VSDG) and photovoltaic (PV) system in order to reduce the fuel consumption and carbon emissions. Maximum power point tracking (MPPT) is applied to the PV system in coordination with a superconducting magnetic energy storage (SMES) unit since the output power affects the speed response of the generator. A fuzzy logic controller (FLC) is developed to track the speed response. A Load Power Tracking (LPT) algorithm is proposed to extract the exact amount of required power from the generation side based on the load demand. Furthermore, this study compares the system performance and load power quality by applying space vector pulse width modulation-based PI controller (SVPWM-PI) against model predictive control (MPC) to the interlinking inverter. Simulation results show the superior performance of MPC with fewer voltage harmonics and better load power quality. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Azzam S.M., Salah M., Elshabrawy T., Ashour M.
Title: A Decentralized Optimization Algorithm for Residential Demand Side Management in Smart Grids
Source title: 2019 6th International Conference on Internet of Things: Systems, Management and Security, IOTSMS 2019
Affiliations: German University in Cairo, Communications Department, Cairo, Egypt; German University in Cairo, Networks Department, Cairo, Egypt
Authors with affiliations: Azzam, S.M., German University in Cairo, Communications Department, Cairo, Egypt; Salah, M., German University in Cairo, Networks Department, Cairo, Egypt; Elshabrawy, T., German University in Cairo, Networks Department, Cairo, Egypt; Ashour, M., German University in Cairo, Networks Department, Cairo, Egypt
Abstract: In this paper, a decentralized demand response (DR) optimization algorithm for home appliance scheduling is proposed. The algorithm aims at minimizing the user's electricity bill by shifting the appliances' time of operation to off-peak periods based on the pricing scheme used. The users are divided into three categories according to their appliances' operation time flexibility. The proposed algorithm performance is evaluated under Time of Use (TOU) and Quadratic Pricing Function (QPF). The results are then compared to those obtained by the centralized approach. The user's electricity bill is minimized in case of applying TOU and QPF pricing schemes but QPF yielded lower peak-to-average ratio (PAR). The performance of the algorithm is tested in case of existence of energy storage system (ESS) in homes. Moreover, simulation results showed that obtaining a battery as an energy storage device is beneficial for the users in terms of electricity bill reduction. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Novel and Necessary Applications of Plasma and Terahertz Technology in Electric Power System
Source title: Proceedings of the 2019 5th International Conference on Electric Power Equipment - Switching Technology: Frontiers of Switching Technology for a Future Sustainable Power System, ICEPE-ST 2019
Affiliations: Shaanxi Electric Power Research Institute, SGCC Power Equipment Evaluation Center, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, Y., Shaanxi Electric Power Research Institute, SGCC Power Equipment Evaluation Center, China
Abstract: It was foreseeable that human societies would be connected by data links and power grids with more and more novel fusion technologies been utilized. The study of plasma and Terahertz could be traced back to the discovery of electric power. Our teamwork focused on application of plasma/terahertz technology into electric power systems. For each of the five segments of electric power system, i.e. power generation, power transformation, power transmission, power distribution, and power consumption with storage. At least one plasma/terahertz application was demonstrated with more possible applications introduced. For each application in each of the five segments, a basic application model, an advanced application model and a full application sketch were given, publishable application examples and general evaluation model were also included. Several application rules were concluded, methods to cross barriers between plasma/terahertz and electric power systems were summarized and suggestion about decreasing the cost of technology fusion trial were suggested. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Zhang M., Liu D., Ren W., Zhou W.
Title: Temporal Netgrid Model Based Energy-Efficient Broadcast in Satellite Networks
Source title: 2019 11th International Conference on Wireless Communications and Signal Processing, WCSP 2019
Affiliations: CAS Key Laboratory of Wireless-Optical Communications, University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei, 230027, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, M., CAS Key Laboratory of Wireless-Optical Communications, University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei, 230027, China; Liu, D., CAS Key Laboratory of Wireless-Optical Communications, University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei, 230027, China; Ren, W., CAS Key Laboratory of Wireless-Optical Communications, University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei, 230027, China; Zhou, W., CAS Key Laboratory of Wireless-Optical Communications, University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei, 230027, China
Abstract: In recent years, satellite systems have attracted explosive attention for their ability of providing seamless connectivity. Many satellite applications require the broadcast delay to be limited to a certain value. However, due to the high-speed movement of satellites, the network topology changes frequently, making the broadcast routing problem NP-hard. In this paper, we study the delay-constrained minimum energy broadcast problem in satellite networks. Considering the limited-sources in satellite systems, in order to reduce computation complexity and storage requirements, we propose the temporal netgrid model based multi-power level flow graph (MLFG) to describe the time-varying topology instead of using existing space-time graphs. Based on MLFG, an iterative algorithm is proposed to minimize the broadcasting energy consumption while satisfying the delay requirement. Simulations show that our proposed scheme can achieve higher energy efficiency while comparing with other existing methods. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: broadcast routing; delay-constrained broadcast; minimum energy broadcast; Satellite networks

Authors: Wei Q., Wang L., Fei A.
Title: Energy Minimization for Infrastructure-to-Vehicle Communications with Multiple Roadside Units
Source title: 2019 11th International Conference on Wireless Communications and Signal Processing, WCSP 2019
Affiliations: School of Electronic Engineering, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications (BUPT), China; Key Laboratory of the Universal Wireless Communications, Ministry of Education, China; School of Software Engineering, BUPT, China
Authors with affiliations: Wei, Q., School of Electronic Engineering, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications (BUPT), China; Wang, L., Key Laboratory of the Universal Wireless Communications, Ministry of Education, China; Fei, A., School of Software Engineering, BUPT, China
Abstract: Nowadays, roadside units (RSUs)assisted message propagation in vehicular networks has aroused the widespread concern due to their ability of extending communication coverage or connectivity. This paper considers a vehicular service radio network consisting of multiple RSUs tasked to push traffic information to passing vehicles, and analyzes the energy efficiency of data transmission. Each RSU has a finite storage room, and vehicles entering the coverage of RSUs would receive packets with service rate determined by their downlink channel conditions. We consider the energy consumption minimization problem over multiple RSUs, under average packet loss probability and average system time constraints. Then, a low complexity algorithm is proposed with joint optimization of the number of RSUs, transmission power, and storage room. Simulation results closely corroborate the analytical results and validate the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm in terms of energy minimization and computation complexity. Practically, our proposed approach can help decide proper deployment of RSUs to achieve energy saving. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Frequency Response and Its Improvement Using BESS in a Low Inertia Power System
Source title: IEEE Region 10 Annual International Conference, Proceedings/TENCON
Affiliations: Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Department of EEE, Dhaka, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Shazon, M.N.H., Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Department of EEE, Dhaka, Bangladesh; Ahmed, H.M., Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Department of EEE, Dhaka, Bangladesh; Tasnim, Z., Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Department of EEE, Dhaka, Bangladesh; Rahman, M.A., Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Department of EEE, Dhaka, Bangladesh; Masood, N.-A., Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Department of EEE, Dhaka, Bangladesh
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to explore the role of Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) in improving the frequency response of a low inertia power system. For the recent years, prolific amount of renewable energy resources that include wind and photovoltaic (PV) sources have been introduced in South Australian power system. These wind generators are mostly variable speed machines, hence they neither have inertia response nor can they perform governor like response following a contingency. The demand in South Australia can be significantly catered utilizing renewable sources and considerable power import from the adjacent state Victoria. Therefore, the number of synchronous generators in the South Australian network can be small. In such situations, the frequency response following a contingency can be concerning and the network may undergo substantial under frequency load shedding. To overcome this challenge, this paper proposes a frequency responsive BESS model to improve the frequency response of a low inertia power system that resembles the South Australian network. The network is investigated under various operating conditions to explore the performance of BESS regarding frequency response enhancement. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Garcia G., Andaverde J., Herrera J., Alcala G., Ramirez C.
Title: Implemented strategies for the saving of energy in a liquid sulfur tank: Case of the maritime terminal of Coatzacoalcos, Mexico
Source title: 2019 IEEE International Conference on Engineering Veracruz, ICEV 2019
Affiliations: Centro Procesador de Gas y Petroquímicos, Petróleos Mexicanos, Coatzacoalcos, Mexico; Universidad Veracruzana, Coatzacoalcos, Mexico; Centro de Investigación en Recursos Energetécos y Sustentables, Coatzacoalcos, Mexico
Authors with affiliations: Garcia, G., Centro Procesador de Gas y Petroquímicos, Petróleos Mexicanos, Coatzacoalcos, Mexico; Andaverde, J., Universidad Veracruzana, Coatzacoalcos, Mexico; Herrera, J., Universidad Veracruzana, Coatzacoalcos, Mexico; Alcala, G., Centro de Investigación en Recursos Energetécos y Sustentables, Coatzacoalcos, Mexico; Ramirez, C., Universidad Veracruzana, Coatzacoalcos, Mexico
Abstract: The present work describes the reconstruction of a tank of liquid sulfur with a capacity of 7,500 metric tons, which has its interior serpentines operating as heat exchangers, the steam that flows into the coils exchanges heat with liquid sulfur. This tank is located in the Maritime Terminal of Storage and Distribution of Sulfur in the port of Coatzacoalcos, Mexico. The container had a useful life of more than 40 years and had high energy consumption for the exchange of heat between steam and sulfur. In addition, it had structural wear due to years of operation without adequate maintenance, which represented a technical and environmental risk. The objective of this work is to make the modifications corresponding to the tank specifically in the thermal insulation, which has been replaced by one with a lower coefficient of heat transfer and greater efficiency, the foundation is modified to guarantee a greater structural support, the traps of steam were replaced to take advantage of a greater heat transfer, the tank is reconstructed in its entirety (Base, walls and dome). With the modifications, steam consumption for the operation of the tank was reduced from approximately 14 tons to 11 tons of steam per day. In addition, the sulfur temperature increased from 126°C to 139 °C, this allows complying with export parameters abroad that are 133°C for sale. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: Due to the improvement of technology, most of the devices used nowadays are connected to the internet, therefore a huge amount of data is generated, transmitted, and used by these devices. In general, these devices are limited in resources such as memory, processors, and battery lifetime. Reducing the data size reduces the energy required to process this data, minimizes the storage of this, data and the energy required to transmit this data. The need for applying data compression techniques on these devices will come in handy. This paper provides a survey and a comparative study among most commonly used IoT compression techniques. The study addresses the techniques in terms of different attributes such as the compression type, lossless or lossy, the limitations of the compression technique, the location of where the compression is applied, and the implementation of the compression technique. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: This paper deals with systems for storage of electric energy (ESS). Precisely, it analyses the influence of the location of ESS on the total cost of energy production. In that goal, in this paper, three are observed: total cost production of electric energy system (EES) without ESS, total cost production when there is one ESS, and case when there are more ESSs of different powers. As a test grid, IEEE24 test bus system is used. Results indicate that the position and power of each ESS have impact on total production cost of EES. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Zhao Z., Wang Y., Zhang X., Cui X., Huang R.
Title: An Energy-Efficient Computing-in-Memory Neuromorphic System with On-Chip Training
Source title: BioCAS 2019 - Biomedical Circuits and Systems Conference, Proceedings
Affiliations: Peking University, Institute of Microelectronics and Key Laboratory of Microelectronics Devices and Circuits (MoE), Beijing, 100871, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, Z., Peking University, Institute of Microelectronics and Key Laboratory of Microelectronics Devices and Circuits (MoE), Beijing, 100871, China; Wang, Y., Peking University, Institute of Microelectronics and Key Laboratory of Microelectronics Devices and Circuits (MoE), Beijing, 100871, China; Zhang, X., Peking University, Institute of Microelectronics and Key Laboratory of Microelectronics Devices and Circuits (MoE), Beijing, 100871, China; Cui, X., Peking University, Institute of Microelectronics and Key Laboratory of Microelectronics Devices and Circuits (MoE), Beijing, 100871, China; Huang, R., Peking University, Institute of Microelectronics and Key Laboratory of Microelectronics Devices and Circuits (MoE), Beijing, 100871, China
Abstract: The aim of neuromorphic computing system is to implement the computational power and efficiency of the human brain. Computing-in-memory (CIM) is a promising and energy-efficient way to perform intensive computations, whose structure is similar to human brain synapse. A 8.78TOPS/W biologically-inspired neuromorphic computing system for pattern recognition based on CIM architecture is presented in this work. The proposed system supports on-chip training with energy-efficient bio-plausible spike-Timing-dependent plasticity (STDP) rule and performs multiply-And-Accumulate (MAC) computations inside SRAM array during inference, which greatly reduces the energy consumption. Simulated in 65-nm technology, the proposed system achieves good performance and energy efficiency for pattern recognition. The total energy consumption of training and classifying per image of the proposed system is 0.20 nJ. And the proposed spiking neural network (SNN) just consumes 0.074mW at 1.0V with the throughput of 2.5M images/s in inference phase. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Sinni R.A., Daniel R.
Title: Biophysical analysis for implementing genetic associative memory using hopfield networks
Source title: BioCAS 2019 - Biomedical Circuits and Systems Conference, Proceedings

Authors with affiliations: Sinni, R.A., Technion-Israel Institute of Technology, Department of Biomedical Engineering Haifa, Haifa, 32000, Israel; Daniel, R., Technion-Israel Institute of Technology, Department of Biomedical Engineering Haifa, Haifa, 32000, Israel
Abstract: To date, no reliable computing paradigms offer easy scaling of genetic networks with characteristics that are similar to natural systems. Recently, neuromorphic design has been investigated as a solution. Furthermore, the construction of biological systems with memory abilities having more than two-bits has not yet been accomplished. This work investigates the implementation of Hopfield networks in genetic circuits, which are capable of implementing associative memory and solving optimization problems. We developed a fundamental transformation to convert Hopfield networks to molecular and protein networks. Our approach transforms biochemical reactions to neural-like nodes having weights, biases, thresholds and activation functions. An energy function to such networks was derived and the convergence to a local minimum of the energy was proven. This work gives a proof of concept that neuro-inspired architecture can be implemented in genetic networks. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Liu C., Kou L., Cai G.-W., Zhou J.-N., Meng Y.-Q., Yan Y.-H.
Title: Knowledge-based and data-driven approach based fault diagnosis for power-electronics energy conversion system
Source title: 2019 IEEE International Conference on Communications, Control, and Computing Technologies for Smart Grids, SmartGridComm 2019
Affiliations: Northeast Electric Power University, School of Electrical Engineering, Jilin, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, C., Northeast Electric Power University, School of Electrical Engineering, Jilin, China; Kou, L., Northeast Electric Power University, School of Electrical Engineering, Jilin, China; Cai, G.-W., Northeast Electric Power University, School of Electrical Engineering, Jilin, China; Zhou, J.-N., Northeast Electric Power University, School of Electrical Engineering, Jilin, China; Meng, Y.-Q., Northeast Electric Power University, School of Electrical Engineering, Jilin, China; Yan, Y.-H., Northeast Electric Power University, School of Electrical Engineering, Jilin, China
Abstract: Recently, power electronic converters have been widely used since more renewable energy systems have been interconnected with the power grid, among which three-phase PWM rectifier is one of the most widely used in drives of electrical motors, AC and DC transmission, and other energy conversion fields. Like any other power electronic converter, three-phase PWM rectifier may be affected by various faults like open-circuit faults. Therefore, fault diagnosis is extremely important to reduce the maintenance costs and improve the stability of the system. A novel open-circuit faults diagnosis method is proposed. The fault diagnosis method only requires the three-phase AC currents, and then Concordia transform is used to calculate the slopes of the current trajectories (knowledge-based). After that the data-driven method of random forest algorithm is used to train the fault diagnosis classifier with slopes data. Finally the knowledge-based and data-driven fault diagnosis methods are combined to achieve fault diagnosis and location. Experiments are carried out and the experimental results are presented to validate effectiveness, robustness of the proposed fault diagnosis method. Furthermore, the proposed method is suitable for vast majority of three-phase energy conversion systems. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Tian Y., Lu Z., Sun C., Jing W.
Title: Locality-balanced energy community aggregations considering net energy predictions of microgrids
Source title: 2019 IEEE International Conference on Communications, Control, and Computing Technologies for Smart Grids, SmartGridComm 2019
Affiliations: Laboratory of Advanced Information Networks, Beijing, China; Beijing Key Laboratory of Network System Architecture and Convergence, Beijing, China; School of Information and Communication Engineering, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Tian, Y., Laboratory of Advanced Information Networks, Beijing, China, Beijing Key Laboratory of Network System Architecture and Convergence, Beijing, China, School of Information and Communication Engineering, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Beijing, China; Lu, Z., Laboratory of Advanced Information Networks, Beijing, China, Beijing Key Laboratory of Network System Architecture and Convergence, Beijing, China, School of Information and Communication Engineering, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Beijing, China; Sun, C., Laboratory of Advanced Information Networks, Beijing, China, Beijing Key Laboratory of Network System Architecture and Convergence, Beijing, China, School of Information and Communication Engineering, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Beijing, China; Jing, W., Laboratory of Advanced Information Networks, Beijing, China, Beijing Key Laboratory of Network System Architecture and Convergence, Beijing, China, School of Information and Communication Engineering, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Beijing, China
Abstract: Microgrids are small entities in the smart grid, which consisting of distributed energy resource, energy consumers, and energy storage systems, etc., and can connect to the main grid or work in off-grid mode. This paper focuses on the aggregations of microgrids to form energy communities, which is beneficial to the management and the locality-balance of energy. Considering the time-varying character of photovoltaic power, we propose a novel algorithm to aggregate microgrids using the predicted data of net energy instead of historical data. The proposed algorithm firstly clusters the microgrids with positive net energy into different communities, based on Kmeans method, and then add the remaining microgrids with negative net energy into one selected cluster one by one according to the information of both location and total net energy of the cluster. Moreover, two evaluation factors are proposed to validate the efficiency of the proposed aggregation algorithm. The experimental results demonstrate that the proposed aggregation algorithm can realize the energy balance of all communities as well as guarantee more communities with positive net energy and minimize the average distance of microgrids to the community center than SECs. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Zhu H., Ouahada K.
Title: Cost minimization energy storage sharing management
Source title: 2019 IEEE International Conference on Communications, Control, and Computing Technologies for Smart Grids, SmartGridComm 2019
Affiliations: University of Johannesburg, Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering Science, Johannesburg, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Zhu, H., University of Johannesburg, Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering Science, Johannesburg, South Africa; Ouahada, K., University of Johannesburg, Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering Science, Johannesburg, South Africa
Abstract: In this paper, energy storage sharing among a group of households with integrated renewable generations in a grid-connected microgrid is studied. In such a microgrid, a shared energy storage management (SESM) system is operated by an aggregator aiming to minimize the long term time-averaged costs of all households, by jointly taking into account the operational constraints of the shared energy storage, the stochastic solar power generations and the time-varying load requests from all households, as well as the fluctuating electricity prices. We formulate this energy management problem, which comprises storage management and load control, as a constrained stochastic programming problem. A centralized real-time sharing control algorithm is designed based on the Lyapunov optimization theory. The performance of the proposed real-time sharing control algorithm is evaluated. By comparing with a greedy sharing algorithm, it is shown that the proposed sharing algorithm outperforms in terms of both cost saving and renewable energy generation utilization. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Habib H.U.R., Wang S., Aziz M.T.
Title: Renewable Energy Resources and Microgrid Management with Smart Battery Storage Control Considering Load Demand of Smart City
Source title: HONET-ICT 2019 - IEEE 16th International Conference on Smart Cities: Improving Quality of Life using ICT, IoT and AI
Affiliations: Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, 430074, China
Authors with affiliations: Habib, H.U.R., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, 430074, China; Wang, S., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, 430074, China; Aziz, M.T., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, 430074, China
Abstract: Remote areas require reliable solutions for fulfilling electricity needs. PV-wind energy utilization is increasing worldwide with wind-battery-load topology as a cost-effective solution for remote area electrification and standalone hybrid microgrid clusters. Intelligent control of voltage source inverter (VSI) ensures high power quality with efficient voltage and frequency profile for sensitive and critical loads. While maximum PV-wind power extraction provides reliable solution with battery energy storage (BSS). In this paper, finite control set model predictive voltage control (FCS-MPVC) is proposed for wind-battery based standalone microgrid to regulate the terminal load voltage in terms of amplitude and frequency. Control hierarchy consists of DC boost convert, DC-DC buck boost converter (bidirectional) and VSI. PV-wind maximum power is extracted by using DC-boost converter and DC bus voltage is stabilized by using bidirectional battery converter. FCS-MPC strategy is used for primary control, which includes power droop control, three phase reference generator, and inner control loop. Fluctuating wind under variable AC load conditions are simulated. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Gaonwe T.P., Kusakana K., Hohne P.A.
Title: Walk-through Energy Audit and Savings opportunities: Case of Water Heaters at CUT Residential Buildings
Source title: 2019 Open Innovations Conference, OI 2019
Affiliations: Central University of Technology, Department of Electrical, Electronic and Computer Engineering, Free State 20 Pres Brand, Bloemfontein, 9300, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Gaonwe, T.P., Central University of Technology, Department of Electrical, Electronic and Computer Engineering, Free State 20 Pres Brand, Bloemfontein, 9300, South Africa; Kusakana, K., Central University of Technology, Department of Electrical, Electronic and Computer Engineering, Free State 20 Pres Brand, Bloemfontein, 9300, South Africa; Hohne, P.A., Central University of Technology, Department of Electrical, Electronic and Computer Engineering, Free State 20 Pres Brand, Bloemfontein, 9300, South Africa
Abstract: In this work, a walk-through survey for the geysers and boilers used in the residences at the Central University of Technology has been conducted. The survey was conducted based on the rated power, storage tank sizes and period of operation in a day. The aim of the project is to review the energy efficiency and energy consumption of the geysers and boilers. From the survey, it shows that these water heating systems are operated 24 hours without any other control or energy management activities. Which means that power is supplied 24 hours a day and the thermostats automatically switch on to heat water whenever the water temperature decreases, even when there is no hot water demand. Also, seeing that load shifting can be a challenge mainly for the morning peak period due to the high hot water demand during that time because the majority of students' classes starts in the mornings. The energy consumption during peak periods is charged more than during normal or off-peak periods. Energy management activities can be applied to water heating processes in order to reduce the energy consumption and can therefore reduce the institution's energy costs. However, the hot water consumption and human behaviour profiles of the occupants are the most important precondition to a potential energy saving. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy audit; Energy usage; University residences; Water heating

Authors: Siecker J., Kusakana K., Numbi B.P.
Title: Innovative Energy Management of an Integrated Space and Water Heating System: Case of a Residential Building at CUT
Source title: 2019 Open Innovations Conference, OI 2019
Affiliations: Central University of Technology Free State, Department of Electrical, Electronic and Computer Engineering, Bloemfontein, South Africa; Mangosuthu University of Technology, Department of Electrical Engineering, Durban, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Siecker, J., Central University of Technology Free State, Department of Electrical, Electronic and Computer Engineering, Bloemfontein, South Africa; Kusakana, K., Mangosuthu University of Technology, Department of Electrical Engineering, Durban, South Africa; Numbi, B.P., Central University of Technology Free State, Department of Electrical, Electronic and Computer Engineering, Bloemfontein, South Africa
Abstract: The energy usage of space heating (SH) and water heating (WH) processes may account for approximately 60% and 24% of the total energy consumption in residential buildings, respectively. This paper proposes the optimal control of an integrated system for water and space heating at the Central University of Technology student residence. The system consists of solar PV modules, batteries, electrolyser, hydrogen storage vessel, fuel-cell, heat pump and domestic hot water storage. The main aim of this study is to propose a method to reduce the energy cost, by applying optimal control of the integrated system operating under the variable Time of Use tariff. The background on the problem statement, the literature review, aim, objective, methodology as well as expected results of the study will be discussed in the sections below. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Gaonwe T.P., Kusakana K., Hohne P.A.
Title: Prospect of Solar-assisted Heat Pump Water Heating Systems for Student Residences
Source title: 2019 Open Innovations Conference, OI 2019
Affiliations: Central University of Technology, Department of Electrical, Electronic and Computer Engineering, Bloemfontein, 9300, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Gaonwe, T.P., Central University of Technology, Department of Electrical, Electronic and Computer Engineering, Bloemfontein, 9300, South Africa; Kusakana, K., Central University of Technology, Department of Electrical, Electronic and Computer Engineering, Bloemfontein, 9300, South Africa; Hohne, P.A., Central University of Technology, Department of Electrical, Electronic and Computer Engineering, Bloemfontein, 9300, South Africa
Abstract: Water heating is the major energy user in the residential sector. The hot water contribution in the residential sector of South Africa is up to 60% on an average monthly basis and accounts for more than 50% of the monthly electricity cost. Electric storage tank water waters are the main contributors to the high energy consumption in the residences and most of the heating process takes place during the peak times, when electricity is more expensive than off-peak and normal time. This and the growing population and living standards of the economy has led to the high demand of electricity and energy shortage in the country. Reducing the desired end users' water temperature has been proposed as a solution to reduce the energy consumption this practice increases chances of diseases like legionella pneumophila. The water heating process could be incorporated with the time-of-use (TOU) tariff to reduce the energy consumption by load shifting from peak demand to off-peak or normal time. Renewable energy source technologies can also be used to reduce the energy consumption; however, the renewable energy systems show a common disadvantage in meeting the energy demand during certain climate conditions. And therefore, the hybrid energy systems can be implemented to promote energy conservation and energy efficiency of the renewable energy system. To further reduce the energy consumption, the TOU tariff can be used for optimal control and energy management of the hybrid system. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Heat pump; Residential demand; Solar system; South Africa; Water heating

Authors: Iurie E., Vladimir B., Sergiu I.
Title: Single Phase to Three Phase Converter
Source title: 2019 International Conference on Electromechanical and Energy Systems, SIELMEN 2019 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Institute of Power Engineering, Ministry of Education, Culture and Research, Chisinau, Moldova; Craiova University, Department of Electromechanics, Environment and Industrial Informatics, Craiova, Romania
Authors with affiliations: Iurie, E., Institute of Power Engineering, Ministry of Education, Culture and Research, Chisinau, Moldova; Vladimir, B., Institute of Power Engineering, Ministry of Education, Culture and Research, Chisinau, Moldova; Sergiu, I., Craiova University, Department of Electromechanics, Environment and Industrial Informatics, Craiova, Romania
Abstract: The paper addressing the problem of increasing the energy efficiency indices and the lifetime of the mono/ three phase inverters powered from the single phase AC grid. The actuality of this problem regarding the efficiency of the use of electricity is determined by the fact that at present most of the receivers in the residential sector are of single-phase type (washing machines, air conditioners, electric pumps, refrigerators, kitchen equipment, etc As a solution to increase the efficiency of the use of electricity in the consumption phase, the use of three-phase asynchronous motors is examined, which have higher energy performance indices compared to single-phase asynchronous motors. For the control of three-phase motors when supplying them from the single-phase network, a new three-phase inverter control algorithm is proposed, which has been called frequency-pulse-width-modulation (FPWM). The simultaneous modulation of the frequency and the width of the control impulses leads to the decrease of approximately 25% of the number of the control impulses of the transistors of the three-phase inverter. This ensures quality indices of electricity supplied to the three-phase asynchronous motor and minimal pollution of single-phase grid with the higher current harmonics. The proposed frequency-pulse-width-modulation algorithm excluded the function of intermediate energy storage in the electrolytic type DC filter capacitors, which have a shorter lifetime compared to other components of the voltage inverter. As a filter capacitor of the proposed three-phase inverter, only capacitors with dielectric film are used, which have a much smaller capacity value compared to the previously used electrolytic capacitors. The substitution of the electrolytic capacitors was possible because in the proposed inverter the dielectric film capacitors filter switching harmonics of the transistors. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: AC-AC converters; energy efficiency; frequency-pulse-width-modulation; power conversion; pulse width modulation converters

Authors: Zakaria H., Hamid M., Abdellatif E.M.
Title: Modelisation of Hydrogen Production using Photovoltaic Electrolysis
Source title: 2019 Electric Vehicles International Conference, EV 2019
Affiliations: EMISys Research Team, Engineering 3S Research Center, Mohammadia School of Engineers, University Mohammed v in Rabat, Rabat, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: Zakaria, H., EMISys Research Team, Engineering 3S Research Center, Mohammadia School of Engineers, University Mohammed v in Rabat, Rabat, Morocco; Hamid, M., EMISys Research Team, Engineering 3S Research Center, Mohammadia School of Engineers, University Mohammed v in Rabat, Rabat, Morocco; Abdellatif, E.M., EMISys Research Team, Engineering 3S Research Center, Mohammadia School of Engineers, University Mohammed v in Rabat, Rabat, Morocco
Abstract: The Electric Vehicle (EV)technology addresses the issue of the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions (GHG). Normally, EVs are recharged with electricity generated from conventional energy sources. For full clean mobility and to have zero emissions and favorable environmental impact, it is better to charge the vehicles from Renewable Energies Systems (RESs). Using RESs for producing hydrogen is a main method to store RESs. This option is required to integrate energy storage system based on hydrogen storage. Hydrogen can be produced by using solar photovoltaic energy for the electrolysis of water. This paper focuses on the Proton Exchange Membrane Electrolyzer (PEME)and covers a board array of subjects linked to this electrolyzer. Gives a control oriented modeling of the PEME, as well as the auxiliary system for the hydrogen production process. In fact, PEME is the most suitable for transforming electricity from RESs. In this context, the present paper describes the essential steps of hydrogen production from the photovoltaic solar energy through PEME, in order to describe the various phenomena related to this technology. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Nicolae B., Vlad B.G.
Title: Low Emission Infrastructure for Powered EVs
Source title: 2019 Electric Vehicles International Conference, EV 2019
Affiliations: Dunarea de Jos University of Galati, Automation and Electrical Department, Galati, Romania; BGV Energy Consultancy, Bucharest, Romania
Authors with affiliations: Nicolae, B., Dunarea de Jos University of Galati, Automation and Electrical Department, Galati, Romania; Vlad, B.G., BGV Energy Consultancy, Bucharest, Romania
Abstract: One of the challenges facing the increased usage of EVs is the possibility to add energy to them, be it in the form of gas (hydrogen) or electricity. The standard is set by classic petrol and diesel fueling system. Motor vehicles powered by hydrogen have currently quite a low market penetration. However, hydrogen refueling infrastructure is starting to build-up in order to make larger-scale hydrogen-powered motor vehicle deployment possible. The European Directive on the deployment of alternative fuels infrastructure requires states to create and submit national policy frameworks in order to develop the widespread use of alternative fuels and the required infrastructure, charging points for Electric Vehicles (EVs) and hydrogen refueling points. In present the fueling hydrogen stations for FCEV is separate of recharging points for EVs as BEV and PHEV. The paper deals the dual electricity - hydrogen charge station in interaction with smart grid and renewable energy sources all controlled by Energy Management System (EMS). The refueling stations have options for all-EVs: as BEV and PHEV or FCEVs. The EMS has the ability to control the loading and unloading of a hydrogen storage system and electricity production by fuel cell, managing the energy flow in order to maintain grid stability and could be solved if charging is used on times of low electricity demand and/or high supply. The principal elements of the charging station are the EMS and controller, photovoltaic setting with Maximum Power Point Tracking (MPPT), energy storage unit in DC link, two DC/DC isolated for elecrolyzer and fuel cell, hydrogen storage and bidirectional inverter to grid connection. Because the refueling stations for FCEV and the recharging points for EVs are regulated by the international standards the novelty of this paper is use and connection of the elecrolyzer and the fuel cells of types Proton Exchange Membrane (PEM) for configuration of the EMS and controller. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: The paper presents a new mobile charging station, capable to use the energy from the ac grid, as well as from the one from the dc grid (used in the electrified transportation), to store the energy on a hybrid storage source (battery, fuel cell and ultracapacitor) and to deliver it to electric vehicles. Such a mobile charging station is to be used within the cities and resort areas, where (especially) people need independent mobility within a cleaner environment. The proposed mobile charging station architecture is depicted, as well as its operation through simulations. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Radu A.-T., Eremia M., Toma L.
Title: Participation of the Electric Vehicles in the Balancing Market
Source title: 2019 Electric Vehicles International Conference, EV 2019
Affiliations: University Politehnica of Bucharest, Department of Electrical Power Systems, Bucharest, Romania
Authors with affiliations: Radu, A.-T., University Politehnica of Bucharest, Department of Electrical Power Systems, Bucharest, Romania; Eremia, M., University Politehnica of Bucharest, Department of Electrical Power Systems, Bucharest, Romania; Toma, L., University Politehnica of Bucharest, Department of Electrical Power Systems, Bucharest, Romania
Abstract: In the context of the massive increase in share of generation from renewable energy sources (RES), the network operators face increasing challenges related to the reliable and stable operation of the power system, at the same time with ensuring the balancing between generation and load. Electric Vehicles (EVs) can support RES integration by appropriate design of the electricity markets, allowing their owner of the aggregators to use their energy storage capability to balance the load. In this paper, we propose an optimization model aiming to determine the available power reserved that allow the EVs to participate in the balancing market. The aim is also to maximize the expected revenue of the aggregator and minimize the imbalances between the forecasted and the real load. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Sǎpunaru A.-A., Ionescu V.-M., Popescu M.O., Popescu C.L.
Title: Study of Radiated Emissions Produced by An Electric Vehicle in Different Operating Modes
Source title: 2019 Electric Vehicles International Conference, EV 2019
Affiliations: University Politehnica of Bucharest, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Bucharest, Romania
Authors with affiliations: Sǎpunaru, A.-A., University Politehnica of Bucharest, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Bucharest, Romania; Ionescu, V.-M., University Politehnica of Bucharest, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Bucharest, Romania; Popescu, M.O., University Politehnica of Bucharest, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Bucharest, Romania; Popescu, C.L., University Politehnica of Bucharest, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Bucharest, Romania
Abstract: Nowadays, the global shift towards living a more eco-friendly life is changing the content of vehicles by means of utilizing more and more electric propulsion systems that use high voltage components with safety aspects that may make automotive electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) more difficult. Vehicles with electric propulsion systems, as well as those that use internal combustion engines (ICE) need to comply with certain EMC rules and not overtake an acceptable level of radiated emissions. Compared to ICE vehicles, electric vehicles (EVs) need recharging of the battery after driving and this simple action may cause EMC issues by producing big levels of radiated emissions that are not acceptable for residential, commercial or light industrial environments. Also, while driving, all vehicles have to be compliant with EMC regulations, so that every electric/electronic system and subsystem inside the vehicle or in the proximity of the vehicle, to function as designed and not be harmful or affect in any way human beings or the environment. This study presents the different operating modes an EV should be tested from EMC point of view to check the generated level of radiated emissions. One of the operating modes is 'rechargeable energy storage system (REESS) in charging mode coupled to the power grid'. Another one is 'other than REESS in charging mode coupled to the power grid', but this operating mode can be split in two: 'driving mode' and 'ready to drive mode'. By analyzing the results obtained from performing real radiated emissions tests in a semi-anechoic chamber on an EV will show the differences between different operating modes, different location of the charging inlet and as well as different types of charging cables. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: This paper presents the results of an ongoing project involving the monitoring of micro phasor measurement units (micro-PMU) at Universidade Federal do Paraná (UFPR). The infrastructure for receiving, processing and storing data from micro-PMUs, energy meters and power quality analysers was deployed. Free software were tested for data storage and visualization. We modified an existing open-source Energy Monitoring System (EMS) for proper use with PMUs. The software native communication protocol was adapted from hypertext protocol (HTTP) to direct reception of user datagram protocol (UDP) in IEEE Std. C37.118.2-2011 format to receive micro-PMUs transmission at 120 phasor per second. We modified data storage format to efficiently deal with time information allowing reduction of 60% of storage space in comparison to commonly used phasor data concentrator (openPDC). © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Network traffic analysis of micro PMU communication at university campus
Source title: WCNPS 2019 - Workshop on Communication Networks and Power Systems

Abstract: This paper describes the traffic analyses of syn-crophasor transmissions from micro phasor measurement units (micro-PMU). A monitoring infrastructure at Universidade Federal do Paraná is responsible for communication, processing and storage of electric measurements from PMUs, phasor data concentrator (PDCs), power meters, and energy quality analysers. Investigation of packet loss and delay were performed. Good characterization of data traffic should allow appropriate design and correct deployment of larger monitoring and control infrastructures. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Nichiforov C., Stamatescu G., Stamatescu I., Fagarasan I., Iliescu S.S.
Title: Building electrical load forecasting through neural network models with exogenous inputs
Source title: 2019 23rd International Conference on System Theory, Control and Computing, ICSTCC 2019 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Automatic Control and Industrial Informatics, University Politehnica of Bucharest, Romania; Institute of Technical Informatics, Graz University of Technology, Austria
Authors with affiliations: Nichiforov, C., Department of Automatic Control and Industrial Informatics, University Politehnica of Bucharest, Romania; Stamatescu, G., Department of Automatic Control and Industrial Informatics, University Politehnica of Bucharest, Romania, Institute of Technical Informatics, Graz University of Technology, Austria; Stamatescu, I., Department of Automatic Control and Industrial Informatics, University Politehnica of Bucharest, Romania; Fagarasan, I., Department of Automatic Control and Industrial Informatics, University Politehnica of Bucharest, Romania; Iliescu, S.S., Department of Automatic Control and Industrial Informatics, University Politehnica of Bucharest, Romania
Abstract: As buildings become key actors in the economic and sustainable operation of future electrical grids and smart cities, reliable models which capture the underlying electrical energy consumption become an important factor for robust control algorithms. Current ubiquitous field devices supported by complex data infrastructures allow generation, storage and online analysis of large quantities of data for deriving usable black-box models of building energy patterns. The paper presents an approach to model the energy consumption of medium and large sized buildings using Non-linear Autoregressive Neural Networks with eXogenous Input (NARX). We show that the chosen network architectures offers good performance for time series prediction from historical values and external input signals such as outdoor temperature in comparison to a baseline approach. Model evaluation and validation are carried out on public dataset for replicable research outcomes. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Three-phase Unidirectional Quasi-Single-Stage Delta-Switch Rectifier + DC-DC Buck Converter

Abstract: This work presents a unidirectional three-phase PFC rectifier well-suited for application targeting high efficiency and/or high power density, such as DC-type electric vehicle chargers. Herein, a quasi-single stage AC-DC converter is proposed where a conventional three-phase DELTA-switch voltage source rectifier is cascaded to a PWM interleaved buck-type DC-DC converter by means of a low energy storage DC-link. The characteristics of the presented power electronics, including the principles of operation, modulation strategy, suitable PWM control scheme, and dimensioning equations are described in this paper. The presented circuit is benchmarked against other solutions for a 50 kW power capability battery charger. The results show a superior power efficiency of the proposed system. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Shang X., Ling M., Shen S., Shao T., Yang J.
Title: RRS Cache: A low voltage cache based on timing speculation SRAM with a reuse-aware cacheline remapping mechanism
Source title: PervasiveHealth: Pervasive Computing Technologies for Healthcare
Affiliations: National ASIC Research Center, Southeast University, China
Authors with affiliations: Shang, X., National ASIC Research Center, Southeast University, China; Ling, M., National ASIC Research Center, Southeast University, China; Shen, S., National ASIC Research Center, Southeast University, China; Shao, T., National ASIC Research Center, Southeast University, China; Yang, J., National ASIC Research Center, Southeast University, China
Abstract: More and more applications are expanding their power supply to the near-threshold region to mitigate the ever-worsening “Power Wall” problem. However, the probability of timing failure in SRAM accessing becomes unacceptably high at low voltage, which makes the SRAM bottleneck of the system performance. The timing speculation SRAM (SSRAM) can recognize the timing failures and correct them by extending the bitline discharging time. But for the cache with an operation granularity of a cacheline, even one-bit cell with timing failure makes the whole cacheline to be accessed with the conservative timing margin, which nullifies the advantage of timing speculations. Such weak cachelines, which contain at least one-bit cell with timing failure, bring significant performance degradation in a low-voltage cache. In this paper, we propose RRS cache, a set-associative L1 cache based on the SSRAM, to reduce the weak cacheline access penalty under low supply voltages. RRS cache improves the proportion of the error-free cachelines (or strong cachelines) by clustering as more as possible bit cells with timing failures into weak cachelines. In addition, it swaps the frequently reused data to the strong cachelines to further reduce the average access latency and the energy consumption by an optimized filling/replacement policy. According to the simulation results, RRS cache improves the performance by 29.79% and reduces the energy consumption by 17.64% for a four-core processor with only 4.12% extra area overhead compared to the cache design with the raw timing speculation SRAM. © 2019 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: Cacheline remapping; Low-voltage cache; Near-threshold voltage; Replacement policy; Timing speculation SRAM
Index Keywords: Energy policy; Energy utilization; Outages; Threshold voltage; Timing circuits; Low supply voltages; Low voltages; Near thresholds; Performance degradation; Remapping; Replacement policy; Timing failures; Timing speculations; Static random access storage

Authors: Lemic F., Akbar R.U., Marquez-Barja J., Famaey J.
Title: Assessing the reliability of energy harvesting terahertz nanonetworks for controlling software-defined metamaterials
Source title: Proceedings of the 6th ACM International Conference on Nanoscale Computing and Communication, NANOCOM 2019
Affiliations: Internet Technology and Data Science Lab (IDLab), University of Antwerpen -, imec, Belgium
Authors with affiliations: Lemic, F., Internet Technology and Data Science Lab (IDLab), University of Antwerpen -, imec, Belgium; Akbar, R.U., Internet Technology and Data Science Lab (IDLab), University of Antwerpen -, imec, Belgium; Marquez-Barja, J., Internet Technology and Data Science Lab (IDLab), University of Antwerpen -, imec, Belgium; Famaey, J., Internet Technology and Data Science Lab (IDLab), University of Antwerpen -, imec, Belgium
Abstract: Electromagnetic nanonetworks operating in the terahertz (THz) frequency band are emerging as a promising technology for supporting a variety of nanoscale applications. At such scales, the use of batteries is in many cases infeasible, thus the nanonodes are envisioned to operate using only capacitors that rely on energy harvesting. This will result in constrained energy storage capacity with unpredictable charging rate, which will in turn yield non-periodic intermittent on-off behavior of the nanonodes. This paradigm is currently largely unexplored, hence it is challenging to make claims about the achievable network reliability. To provide initial insights, we investigate the reliability of nanoscale THz communication in a one-hop downlink broadcast scenario in face of intermittent on-off behavior of the receiving nanonodes. We do that because we believe that the reliable communication will be highly relevant for software-controlled metamaterial applications. Our results demonstrate the need for intelligent selection of energy levels for turning on and off the battery-less nanonodes. In addition and perhaps counter-intuitively, we demonstrate that the repetitions of packets substantially degrade the reliability of the considered nanonetwork. © 2019 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: Energy-harvesting; Metamaterials; Nanonetwork; Reliability; THz
Index Keywords: Application programs; Energy harvesting; Metamaterials; Reliability; Secondary batteries; Software reliability; Constrained energy; Nano-networks; Nanonetwork; Nanoscale applications; Network reliability; Reliable communication; Terahertz frequencies; THz communications; Nanotechnology

Authors: Ouyang Y., Guo Y., Chen H.
Title: Control and simulation of power balance in optical storage microgrid based on photovoltaic power supply
Source title: PervasiveHealth: Pervasive Computing Technologies for Healthcare
Affiliations: Shanghai University of Engineering Science, School of Mechanical and Automotive Engineering, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Ouyang, Y., Shanghai University of Engineering Science, School of Mechanical and Automotive Engineering, Shanghai, China; Guo, Y., Shanghai University of Engineering Science, School of Mechanical and Automotive Engineering, Shanghai, China; Chen, H., Shanghai University of Engineering Science, School of Mechanical and Automotive Engineering, Shanghai, China
Abstract: Micro-grid is one of the most effective ways to utilize renewable energy. It is of great significance to study how to realize the energy management of micro-grid and optimize the utilization of energy. Micro-grid is a system unit composed of distributed power generation, energy storage device, energy conversion device, load, control and protection device, etc. It is an autonomous system that can realize self-control, protection and management. Most of the power sources in the micro-grid are distributed power sources, such as wind turbine, photovoltaic power generation, micro gas turbine, fuel cell, super-capacitor, flywheel battery and other energy storage devices. Connecting them to the user end has the characteristics of low cost, low voltage and low pollution, and is the mainstream development direction of the current power system. This paper introduces the composition and control technology of micro-grid, as well as the energy management and simulation of optical storage micro-grid in island and grid-connected mode. In this paper, two modes of island and grid connection are simulated by Simulink. The results show that the optical storage micro-grid system with switching mechanism can effectively improve the utilization rate of photovoltaic power, realize the efficient integration and utilization of distributed power supply, and carry out load side operation management autonomously by switching switch. © 2019 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: Grid-connected; Intelligent control; Island mode; Micro-grid; Photovoltaic power generation

Abstract: The proceedings contain 52 papers. The topics discussed include: analysis of voltage dip source location methods; metaidentification of the modern polish power exchange control system; energy management in a real microgrid with hydroelectric power plant and battery storage unit; development of intellectual information-measuring system for Azerbaijan power system regime reliability control; elimination of aperiodic components of measuring elements of relay protection; diagnosis of challenges for power system protection – selected aspects of transformation of power systems; technological conditions for VSC and LCC HVDC systems in reference to network code requirements; hybrid predictive models dedicated to wind farms; CGMES as an interface for multilateral grid modelling data exchange; and operational degradation of HTS tape parameters used in SFCL and its impact on the coordination of power system protection.

Authors: Zhang Z., Jia P.
Title: Design and analysis of independent power supply system for three-dimensional parking lot
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, 450001, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, Z., School of Electrical Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, 450001, China; Jia, P., School of Electrical Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, 450001, China
Abstract: In this paper, the average daily power consumption is calculated as an example of a three-dimensional parking lot in zhengzhou. For its features, a photo-hydrogen complementary independent power supply system is designed, including PV system, controller, energy storage system and hydrogen energy system, etc. Firstly, according to the weather information of Zhengzhou City, the average daily power generation is predicted by the PVsyst software. Secondly, the capacity of the energy storage battery and the hydrogen energy system are determined through calculation. Lastly, the simulation model of photo-hydrogen complementary independent power supply system is built by Simulink. The result shows that the photo-hydrogen complementary power supply system proposed in this paper can effectively achieve energy complementation, can ensure the reliability of power supply, and can still meet the electricity demand of the three- dimensional parking lot through hydrogen energy system power generation in continuous rainy weather. © 2019 Author(s).
Author Keywords: Independent Power Supply System; Photo-Hydrogen Complementation; Power Generation Forecast; Three-dimensional Parking Lot

Abstract: The auxiliary device was designed for household gas stoves. It has simple structure, intelligent automatic control of water supply, heat preservation, circulation and other functions. By using the waste heat of gas for 30 minutes, the 20L water can be increased by 20 degrees Celsius. The utilization rate of natural gas can be increased by 10%. In 24 hours, the water temperature in the heat preservation water tank decreases below 18 degrees Celsius, which can make the continuous utilization of waste heat storage of gas. After long-term operation and testing, the thermal cycle system did not fail. It is in line with the development direction of energy saving and environmental protection in the world. © 2019 Author(s).
Author Keywords: Energy conservation; Heat exchanger; Intelligent; Nature Gas

Authors: Chen Q., Xia M., Wang H., Liu W., Wang Z., Zhang X., Li X., Sun Q., Niu X.
Title: Evaluation indices set and decision-making method for regional "coal to electricity" optimal development mode
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, 100044, China; State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Source, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China; State Grid Beijing Electric Power Company, Xicheng District, Beijing, 100031, China; Jilin Electric Power Supply Company, State Grid Jilin Electric Power Co., Ltd, Jilin Province, 13200, China

Abstract: Heating by electricity, replacing coal by electricity, is regarded as an effective way to solve the environment problem. Thus electric heating load is growing rapidly, which may result in some undesired problem to distribution grid due to its randomness and dispersed integration. However, electric heating load may be a kind of energy storage system by optimal control of its operation. So the optimal modeling of electric heating load characteristic considering its randomness is of important for grid planning and construction. In this paper, the heating loads of distributed residential users in a certain area are modeled based on Fanger Thermal Comfort Equation (FTCE) and the PMV thermal comfort index calculation method. Different temperatures are taken into consideration during modeling users' heating loads. According to the time- varying equation of inside temperature, the heat load demand curve is estimated. And then a multi-objective optimization model for electric heating load with heat energy storage is studied considering demand response (DR), which optimizes economy and comfort index. A fuzzy decision method is proposed considering the influence factors of DR behavior. Finally, the validity of the proposed model is verified by simulations. The results show that the proposed model performances better than the traditional method. © 2019 Author(s).
Author Keywords: Coal to electricity; demand response; fuzzy decision; thermostatically-controlled load

Authors: Popoola O., Beye M., Binini G.
Title: Cost Assessment Modelling for Solar Powered Locomotive
Source title: IEEE AFRICON Conference
Affiliations: Tshwane University of Technology, Electrical Engineering Department, Pretoria, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Popoola, O., Tshwane University of Technology, Electrical Engineering Department, Pretoria, South Africa; Beye, M., Tshwane University of Technology, Electrical Engineering Department, Pretoria, South Africa; Binini, G., Tshwane University of Technology, Electrical Engineering Department, Pretoria, South Africa
Abstract: Reducing the operating costs of fossil fuels with other alternative energy sources, particularly in the transport sector, is now of national importance. The study presents a modelling approach for assessment of optimal operation of solar PV system for locomotive schedule operation in South Africa. The study approach entails indirect and direct system solar powered system (SPS) modelling, train loading modelling and cost evaluation model implication for economic assessment of its operation. In this study, a diesel-grid-SPS hybridisation in different configurations (three) was designed, simulated and analysed. The aim was to assess the most efficient and cost effective operation in relation to power provision to the locomotive while also addressing the issue of excess (surplus) supply back to the gird and its profitability. The operational running cost of the indirect systems seemed to present the cheapest alternative to fossil fuel energy usage for the train. However, energy storage technology capacity (battery weight) in respect of the indirect system makes it ideally not feasible for such purpose. From the result analysis, it can be deduced that the direct system is more economical from the point of energy cost performance characterization. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: diesel-grid-SPS hybridisation; energy cost; locomotive schedule operation; SPS modelling; train-loading modelling

Abstract: Energy and Power Topics around the decentralization from the grid seem to be gathering momentum. Considering that there are wide reticulation networks already electrified, it is evident that the use of renewable energy reaches beyond income parity lines. The purpose of this paper is to size a photovoltaic (PV), battery and diesel generator sizing tool for electrification for local and isolated villages, townships and communities. Although strides were made to electrify a greater part of not only Hammanskraal but South Africa, the community of Hammanskraal has intermittent electricity supply. The application of the tool is demonstrated through MATLAB. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Zhu H., Ouahada K.
Title: Dynamic Energy Storage and Control Management
Source title: IEEE AFRICON Conference
Affiliations: University of Johannesburg, Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering Science, P.O. Box 524, Auckland Park, 2006, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Zhu, H., University of Johannesburg, Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering Science, P.O. Box 524, Auckland Park, 2006, South Africa; Ouahada, K., University of Johannesburg, Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering Science, P.O. Box 524, Auckland Park, 2006, South Africa
Abstract: In this paper, the problem of dynamic energy management for power consumers with renewable energy generators and energy storage devices is studied. The objective of such a power consumer is to minimize its long term time-averaged cost by jointly taking into account the operational constraints of its energy storage device, its stochastic solar power generation and time-varying load, as well as the fluctuating electricity prices. We formulate this energy management problem as a constrained stochastic programming problem. A real-time control algorithm is designed based on the Lyapunov optimization theory to provide an asymptotically optimal solution that can quickly adapt to the system dynamics without requiring any statistics of the system. The performance of the proposed real-time control algorithm is evaluated via both theoretical analysis and numerical simulations. By comparing with a greedy algorithm, it is shown that the proposed control algorithm can save power consumption cost while improving the utilization of renewable energy generation. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy Management; Energy Storage Sharing; Lyapunov Optimization; Microgrids; Stochastic System
Index Keywords: Costs; Electric energy storage; Electric power utilization; Energy management; Real time control; Solar energy; Solar power generation; Stochastic programming; Stochastic systems; Asymptotically optimal; Dynamic energy managements; Electricity prices; Management problems; Operational constraints; Optimization theory; Renewable energy generation; Renewable energy generators; Storage management

Authors: Huang K., Qin C.
Title: ENVM based In-memory Computing for Intelligent and Secure Computing Systems
Source title: International System on Chip Conference
Affiliations: College of Information Science and Electronic Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Huang, K., College of Information Science and Electronic Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Qin, C., College of Information Science and Electronic Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Abstract: The recent breakthrough in Artificial Intelligence (AI) largely relies on the advance of hardware performance. However, energy and security have been primary concerns in the design and management of modern computing systems and data centers. The emerging embedded Non-Volatile Memories (eNVMs) have drawn great attention to various applications to improve both computing speed and security with much lower power consumption. In this paper, we review and discuss several application cases of the in-memory computing techniques, including Deep Neural Network (DNN) accelerators and neuromorphic computing circuits. Moreover, we also explore the in-memory computing techniques for the security enhancement, especially for machine learning attack. The emerging security issues raised by eNVMs and possible solutions are also discussed. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: deep learning; in-memory computing; neuromorphic; resistive non-volatile memory; security

Abstract: The loss and life prediction of batteries are mainly based on experience and performance. The experience-based method of loss modeling and life prediction is carried out by the experience knowledge accumulated during battery use. The method is simple and fast, but it is only suitable for the battery technology to be mature and the experience knowledge fully used in a particular situation. The construction of virtual power plant energy storage system consists of lead-acid battery and Ni MH battery, taking into account the experience and knowledge of these two kinds of battery technology, which has been very mature and the application is also very good. In addition to the virtual power plant operators, it also have economic benefits and efficiency requirements. So this paper, based on the number of cycles of experience method and weighted method of virtual storage battery KWH of power plant, it can be predicted by life loss modeling system. At the same time, the cost of battery is considered by operators in order to analyze the impact of the factors on the storage life of battery storage system and the optimal dispatching decision of virtual power plant. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Wu F., Zhou Y., Feng D., Shi Y., Lei T., Fang C.
Title: Day-Ahead Scheduling of a Microgrid-Like Fast Charging Station
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019
Affiliations: Shanghai Jiao Tong University, School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering, Shanghai, China; State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Wu, F., Shanghai Jiao Tong University, School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering, Shanghai, China; Zhou, Y., Shanghai Jiao Tong University, School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering, Shanghai, China; Feng, D., Shanghai Jiao Tong University, School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering, Shanghai, China; Shi, Y., Shanghai Jiao Tong University, School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering, Shanghai, China; Lei, T., State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China; Fang, C., State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China
Abstract: With the fast spreading of electric vehicles (EVs), the demand for EV fast charging station (FCS) is increasing fast. In this paper, a day-ahead scheduling strategy for a microgrid-like FCS with an in-station photovoltaic system (PVS) and a battery energy storage system (BESS) is proposed. The strategy is modeled as a scenario-based stochastic optimization problem whose objective is to minimize the expected total operation cost in the next day. Considering the power exchange between the FCS and the grid, the operation cost contains the cost of buying power in the day-ahead market, the expected adjustment cost and penalty in the real-time market and the life loss cost of the BESS. A piecewise linear life loss calculation model of the BESS is adopted. The uncertainty of the PVS output and the fast charging demand are considered in the model through randomly generated scenarios. In each scenario the PVS output and fast charging demand are generated using a Monte Carlo simulation method. This strategy considers the life loss cost of the BESS effectively and provide reasonable day-ahead schedules. In the case study, a simulation of the proposed day-ahead scheduling method is demonstrated. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: day-ahead schedule; life loss calculation model; microgrid-like fast charging station; Monte Carlo method
Index Keywords: Commerce; Intelligent systems; Microgrids; Monte Carlo methods; Operating costs; Optimization; Photovoltaic cells; Piecewise linear techniques; Scheduling; Battery energy storage systems; Day-ahead scheduling; Electric Vehicles (EVs); Fast charging stations; Monte Carlo simulation methods; Photovoltaic system (PVS); Stochastic optimization problems; Total operation costs; Fast charging (Batteries)

Abstract: Aiming at the demand of microgrid community energy management and coordination control system for adaption to flexible adjustment of inter-microgrid, multi-working condition control strategy, a fuzzy Least Squares Support Vector Machine based low-voltage microgrid community operating state real-time assessment model is proposed. Based on traditional electricity system operating state description method, the model establishes the boundary condition for safe, normal operating state of microgrid community and sub-microgrid, classifying the state of microgrid with multidimensional characteristic vectors such as voltage deviation rate, residual energy storage capacity, charging and discharging time, power generation, power consumption, evaluating re-al-time operating state by using fuzzy Least Squares Support Vector Machine, finally judging the operating state of microgrid community. Case calculation and analysis show that the model can make a real-time evaluation in line with system sampling period, accurately and effectively classify the operating state of sub-microgrid both on-grid or off-grid, providing reliable basis for microgrid community to quick judge the condition of the grid and flexibly adjust control strategy. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Research on the Market Trading Model of Ancillary Services of Diversified Flexible Ramping

Abstract: With the development of clean energy, the penetration of renewable energy has increased the difficulty of regulation of the power grid. Flexible resource support services provide a feasible means to solve this problem. Considering multiple flexible resources such as generators, electric vehicles, energy storage and so on, and aiming at minimizing the economic cost of the system, this paper proposes a method that clearing multiple flexible resources together, and constructs a real-time market flexible ramping products (FRP) clearing model with the participation of various aggregators(VA). Finally, the feasibility and applicability of the model are verified by the case analysis. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Lu Z., Li M., Wang J.
Title: Virtual Synchronous Generator Control Strategy Based on Improved Inner Loop Applied to Power Storage Converter
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019
Affiliations: Electric Power Research Institute, China Southern Power Grid, Guangzhou, 510080, China; Beijing Sifang Automation Co. LTD., Beijing, 100085, China
