Abstract: The power storage converter(PSC) using the virtual synchronous generator(VSG) control strategy has the dual droop characteristics of active-frequency, reactiveamplitude. The VSG control strategy of the improved inner loop proposed in this paper can make the grid-connected energy storage converter adopting the control strategy have fast power response characteristics. The power level caused by the frequency step, the amplitude step or the instruction order is completed within 20ms. The voltage loop of the improved inner loop adopts the control mode of dq decoupling, and the current loop adopts the control method of deadbeat. This paper will theoretically derive the control strategy and verify the effectiveness of the control strategy through PSCAD simulation. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: The paper discusses the benefits and shortcomings of two existing direct current optimal power flow (DCOPF) models in the context of financial storage rights. According to the case study results, the FSRs may not be able to provide confident incentives for storage owners to transfer their operation rights to system operators. The paper proposes possible solutions to solve this issue. The simulation results indicate the proposed schemes not only create motivations for storage owners to transfer their operations to the system operator but also reinforce the storage devices owners' profits. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Bi-Level Method of Islanded Microgrid Optimal Sizing Based on Life Cycle Cost
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019
Affiliations: China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Nanjing Normal University, School of Electrical and Automation Engineering, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Ji, Y., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Hou, X., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Pang, C., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Liu, J., Nanjing Normal University, School of Electrical and Automation Engineering, Nanjing, China; Lv, Z., Nanjing Normal University, School of Electrical and Automation Engineering, Nanjing, China
Abstract: To solve the problem of optimal allocation of islanded microgrid, a bi-level method based optimal sizing model is proposed in this paper. The optimal sizing model in upper level gives the optimal configuration strategy. The upper level optimization aiming at the annual investment cost during the life cycle is solved by the improved decimal genetic algorithm. Daily operation cost minimization and renewable energy utilization rate maximization of the microgrid is conducted in lower level based on the optimal dispatch model, which can be solved through a mixed integer linear programming method. Considering the operation constraints of microgrid, the proposed algorithm is applied to an islanded microgrid in Nanchang, Jiangxi province, showing the effectiveness and accuracy of the proposed optimal configuration strategy. Meanwhile, the impacts on the optimal configuration strategy brought by the energy storage system is also analyzed. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Voltage Control of Rural Grid with High Proportion of Residential PV plants
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019
Affiliations: University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Gao, X., University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; Wang, Y., Chinese Academy of Sciences, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China
Abstract: Due to large-scale residential photovoltaic (PV) plants connecting to the grid, the problem of voltage offset at the end of rural power grid is very serious. A novel priority control strategy is proposed in this paper in order to solve this problem. The strategy considers the voltage sensitivity and voltage offset of each node, as well as the state of charge (SOC) and capacity of each energy storage device to determine the action priority and action threshold voltage of each energy storage device. According to the action threshold voltage and voltage data collected locally, each energy storage device discharges or charges to solve the voltage offset problem. Finally, a simulation model is built in MATLAB and the simulation results fully prove the effectiveness of this method. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: As the proportion of renewable energy generation continues to increase, the system's demand for flexible peak-regulation resources is increasing. In order to promote energy transformation, nuclear power and other power sources that originally only bear the base load will gradually share the burden of peak-regulation. With the advancement of nuclear power technology, its load-following performance has gradually improved. Nuclear power companies need to study their possible peak-regulation measures to prepare for the subsequent nuclear power to actively participate in the system load regulation. This paper explores the feasibility of nuclear-BESS hybrid systems for peak regulation and compares the economics under two different regulation modes (alternative peak-regulation mode and joint peak-regulation mode). The simulation results show that alternative peak-regulation mode has a better economy. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Analysis of operation characteristics of adjustable-speed pumped storage hydropower unit with AC excitation
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019

Abstract: The safe and stable operation of the continuing developed power grid can be guaranteed depending largely on the adjustable speed pumped storage hydropower unit (AS-PSH) for its highly efficient peak-frequency modulation ability. In this paper, the design and control strategies of the AS-PSH with AC excitation are proposed. For the evaluation of flexibility and storage capacity, the operation characteristics of the AS-PSH unit are determined through establishing corresponding mathematical models and RTDS simulation tests. The stable operation range and the response speed characteristics of AS-PSH in term of active/reactive power regulation under different working conditions are studied. Results show that the AS-PSH with AC excitation possesses great leading phase capacity and the established de-coupling control system using both AC excitation and governor achieves high response speed. The present study could provide a reliable control basis for the realization of the smooth integration of the intermittent renewable energy sources into the grid. © 2019 IEEE.

LTD, Beijing, China; Liu, W., Nanjing University of Science and Technology, China; Han, J., State Grid Jiangsu Electric Power CO. LTD, Nanjing, China
Abstract: In this study, a new evaluation method using improved grey relational degree analysis (GRA) is proposed to evaluate the autonomous operation capacity of an AC/DC distribution system. The proposed scheme is implemented based on the entropy method and an improved GRA. This paper considers that: 1) analyzing the key factors affecting the autonomous operation capability of AC/DC power distribution system; 2) establishing a comprehensive evaluation index system from generation side, grid side, load side and storage side; and 3) using an improved GRA based on entropy method to achieve quantitative assessment. Simulation results are presented and compared to verify the effectiveness of the evaluation method. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: AC/DC distribution system; entropy method; evaluation; improved GRA

Authors: Zhang H., Chen M., Peng Y., Zhou J., He R.
Title: Technology Summary on the Application of Variable-Speed Pump-Turbine Units for Wind Storage Operation
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019
Affiliations: CSG Power Generation Company Co. LTD, Guangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, H., CSG Power Generation Company Co. LTD, Guangzhou, China; Chen, M., CSG Power Generation Company Co. LTD, Guangzhou, China; Peng, Y., CSG Power Generation Company Co. LTD, Guangzhou, China; Zhou, J., CSG Power Generation Company Co. LTD, Guangzhou, China; He, R., CSG Power Generation Company Co. LTD, Guangzhou, China
Abstract: Variable-speed pump-turbine units are used as the large capacity flexible and fast storage system for peak and frequency modulation in grid. There are several advantages as follows: the total energy conversion efficiency is nearly 80%. The modulation performance that ms-level time can be achieve MWlevel power response. Possibility of active power control in pumping mode. In the generating mode, the range of unit output is wide than conventional units. With the help of flywheel effect, network stability improvement by instantaneous active power injection in the grid. Summing up the above, variable-speed pump-turbine units are useful in concentration area of wind power and other new energy. And it can be used to solve the problem of large-scale wind power integration. The operation characteristics of Variable-speed pump-turbine units and the operation characteristics of wind power output is taken into account in this paper. Variable-speed principle, physical operating characteristics, operating parameters and economic investment of variable-speed pump-turbine units is presented. And the combined operation technology of variable-speed pumpturbine units and wind power is summarized. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: operation technology; pumped storage; variable-speed pump-turbine units; wind storage

Authors: Song J., Suo L.
Title: Optimal Energy for Grid-Connected Microgrid with Battery Swapping Station and Wind Photovoltaic and Energy Storage
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019

Authors with affiliations: Song, J., Inner Mongolia University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Inner, Mongolia, China; Suo, L., Inner Mongolia University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Inner, Mongolia, China
Abstract: In this paper, an optimal dispatch strategy, which can take into account the period division of time of use, the output power of renewable energy sources (RES) and replacement demand for batteries, is proposed. On this basis, by optimizing the battery swapping station (BSS) load in each period, an optimization model is established to minimize the power interaction between microgrid and the distribution network. An optimization algorithm is developed based on the well-established particle swarm optimization (PSO) and penalty function method to solve the power dispatch model. The proposed approach is demonstrated through an existing microgrid. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: BSS; Microgrid; Optimal energy management; PSO; RES
Index Keywords: Electric batteries; Microgrids; Particle swarm optimization (PSO); Renewable energy resources; Battery swapping; Grid-connected; Optimal dispatch; Optimal energy; Optimization algorithms; Optimization modeling; Penalty function methods; Renewable energy source; Electric load dispatching

Authors: Ding K., Li W., Hu P., Hu A., Tao Y., Zhuang J., Lu H.
Title: The Voltage Sag Mitigation Method Based on Hybrid SMES-BES Dynamic Voltage Restorer(DVR)
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019
Affiliations: State Grid, Hubei Electric Power Research Institute, Wuhan, China; Sichuan University, College of Electrical Engineering, Chengdu, China
Authors with affiliations: Ding, K., State Grid, Hubei Electric Power Research Institute, Wuhan, China; Li, W., State Grid, Hubei Electric Power Research Institute, Wuhan, China; Hu, P., State Grid, Hubei Electric Power Research Institute, Wuhan, China; Hu, A., State Grid, Hubei Electric Power Research Institute, Wuhan, China; Tao, Y., State Grid, Hubei Electric Power Research Institute, Wuhan, China; Zhuang, J., State Grid, Hubei Electric Power Research Institute, Wuhan, China; Lu, H., Sichuan University, College of Electrical Engineering, Chengdu, China
Abstract: The research of voltage sag mitigation method is an important task. A new method using hybrid energy storage (HES) strategy is proposed, which consists of Superconducting Magnetic Energy Storage (SMES), Battery Energy Storage (BES) and Dynamic Voltage Restorer (DVR). In addition, a power allocation optimization strategy for HES-based DVR is proposed and validated using the life cycle cost (LCC) theory. LCC is the objective function, which can be used to establish the optimization model. The constraint conditions of the model include the power of the throughput, the state of charge (SOC) and the power allocation optimization strategy. Finally, the cost analysis and the compensation performance are implemented using the SEMI F47 curve for the single BES, single SMES and SMES-BES device. The compared results show the superiority and effectiveness of the proposed method on the voltage sag mitigation. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Dynamic Voltage Restorer (DVR); hybrid energy storage (HES); life cycle cost theory; SMES-BES; Voltage sag mitigation
Index Keywords: Charging (batteries); Cost benefit analysis; Life cycle; Magnetic storage; Superconducting magnets; Voltage regulators; Battery energy storages (BES); Compensation performance; Dynamic voltage restorer (DVR); Hybrid energy storage; Life cycle costs (LCC); Optimization modeling; Superconducting magnetic energy storages; Voltage sag mitigation; Electric energy storage

Authors: Sun H., Ding C., Hu S., Zhou W.
Title: Optimal Dispatch of Integrated Electricity and Natural Gas Energy Systems with Long-Distance Pipeline Networks
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019
Affiliations: Dalian University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Dalian, China
Authors with affiliations: Sun, H., Dalian University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Dalian, China; Ding, C., Dalian University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Dalian, China; Hu, S., Dalian University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Dalian, China; Zhou, W., Dalian University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Dalian, China
Abstract: With the large-scale application of gas turbines in power system and the development of P2G technology, integrated electricity and natural gas energy systems is the development trend of future. However, in the case of long-distance natural gas network, the dynamic characteristics of natural gas network can't be neglected in joint dispatch due to the calculation errors under the steady model and the neglect of natural gas network's storage capacity, which leads to the adjustment space of gas well output to reduce. In order to describe the dynamic characteristics, based on the fluid equations of natural gas flow, the equations are simplified, and in order to avoid the influence of large time step selection on numerical stability, the central implicit difference method is used to difference partial differential equations. Therefore, an optimal dispatch model of integrated electricity and natural gas energy systems with long-distance natural gas network is proposed in this paper. Finally, the rationality and correctness of the proposed model are verified by IEEE-39 nodes and Belgian natural gas 20-node example. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: dynamic model; integrated electricity and natural gas energy systems; long-distance pipeline network; optimal dispatch; output of gas well
Index Keywords: Electric load dispatching; Flow of gases; Gases; Natural gas; Numerical methods; Calculation error; Development trends; Difference method; Dynamic characteristics; Large-scale applications; Long distance pipelines; Natural gas energy; Natural gas networks; Natural gas wells

Authors: Zhao L., Tang Y., Zhang Y.
Title: Coordinated Control of Active and Reactive Power of Distribution Network with Distributed Photovoltaic Based on Scene Analysis
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019
Affiliations: China Agricultural University, College of Information and Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, L., China Agricultural University, College of Information and Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Tang, Y., China Agricultural University, College of Information and Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Zhang, Y., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China
Abstract: Variables such as distributed generation (DG) output and load demand have randomness and volatility, brings large challenges to operation and control of distribution network. In order to solve this problem, this paper generates multiple scene samples through Latin hypercube sampling (LHS) based on mathematical distribution model of variables, then reduces the scene samples by K-means clustering, typical scenes and the probability of each typical scene are obtained. Considering the adjustable capabilities of distributed photovoltaic (PV) and energy storage system (ESS), a multi-objective optimization model based on scene analysis for coordinated control of active and reactive power in distribution network is established, and the mixed integer nonlinear programming model is solved by second-order cone relaxation (SOCR) technique. Finally, the improved IEEE 33-node system is taken as an example for simulation with results confirming accuracy and rationality of the proposed algorithm. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: coordinated control of active and reactive power; distributed generation; scene analysis; second-order cone relaxation
Index Keywords: Data storage equipment; Integer programming; K-means clustering; Multiobjective optimization; Nonlinear programming; Reactive power; Active and Reactive Power; Co-ordinated control; Distribution models; Energy storage systems; Latin hypercube sampling; Mixed integer nonlinear programming models; Multi-objective optimization models; Operation and control; Probability distributions

Authors: Ye X., Tang Q., Li T., Tong X., Yang O., Wen F., Li H.
Title: Planning for Energy Storage System Considering Risk of Inflexibility in Active Distribution Network
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Sichuan Economic Research Institute, Department of Transmission Network Planning, Chengdu, China; Sichuan University, College of Electrical Engineering and Information Technology, Chengdu, China

Abstract: To cope with the stochastic power fluctuation of active distribution system (ADN) under high-penetration photovoltaic(PV), based on the flexibility planning theory, an ESS planning method that takes into account risk of inflexibility is proposed. Firstly, the confidence interval calculation method is improved based on the conditional value-at-risk (CVaR), and the inflexibility risk cost model is constructed from the perspective of flexibility resource and demand balance to evaluate the potential loss caused by the stochastic fluctuation of flexibility demands exceeding the flexibility boundary threshold. Then, considering the flexibility improvement methods such as grid reconstruction, voltage control and ESS output adjustment, a bi-level optimal ESS planning model considering flexibility, safety and economy is established. The upper-level focuses on obtaining minimum capacity and appropriate distribution of ESS; the lower-level focuses on solving the coordinated operation strategy of flexibility resources. Finally, The IEEE 33 system is selected for example, and results verify the rationality and validity of the proposed method. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: active distribution network; bi-level scenario programming; conditional value at risk; energy storage system planning; flexibility; style
Index Keywords: Stochastic models; Stochastic systems; Value engineering; Active distribution networks; Active distribution systems; Conditional Value-at-Risk; Confidence interval; Coordinated operation; Energy storage systems; Improvement methods; Stochastic fluctuation; Data storage equipment

Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019

Ltd., Training Center, Ji Lin, China
Abstract: Energy crisis and environmental pollution are becoming increasingly serious. Increasing the penetration rate of renewable energy in the power system can effectively solve this problem. Wind power and photovoltaic power generation are fluctuating power sources, and their large-scale interconnection will increase the difficulty of grid scheduling. Therefore, based on the regulation characteristics of concentrating solar power station, this paper proposes a green power dispatching strategy for power system with full renewable energy. The purpose of this strategy is to promote the consumption of renewable energy. The cost of power generation of each unit of the system and the security operation constraints of the grid are considered comprehensively. Finally, CPLEX optimization software was used to solve the model. The results verify the feasibility and validity of the proposed model. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: concentrating solar power; green power dispatch; photovoltaic; pumped storage; wind power

Authors: Yang J., Yang M., Du P., Yan F., Yu Y.

Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019

Abstract: In electricity market, the wind power producers face the challenge that how to maximize their income with the uncertainty of wind power. This paper proposes an integrated scheduling mode that integrates the wind power prediction and the energy storage system (ESS) decision making, avoiding the loss of decision-making information in the wind power prediction. Secondly, deep Q network, a deep reinforcement learning (DRL) algorithm, is introduced to construct the end-to-end ESS controller. The uncertainty of wind power is automatically considered during the DRL-based optimization, without any assumption. Finally, the superiority of the proposed method is verified through the analysis of the case wind farm located in Jiangsu Province. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Hu A., Zhuang J., Tao Y., Yang J., Zhou C.
Title: A Voltage Sag Suppression Method with Short Response Time Based on Energy Storage System
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019
Affiliations: China Electric Power Research Institute, State Key Laboratory of New Energy and Energy Storage Operation, Nanjing, 210003, China; Hohai University, College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Hu, A., China Electric Power Research Institute, State Key Laboratory of New Energy and Energy Storage Operation, Nanjing, 210003, China; Zhuang, J., China Electric Power Research Institute, State Key Laboratory of New Energy and Energy Storage Operation, Nanjing, 210003, China; Tao, Y., China Electric Power Research Institute, State Key Laboratory of New Energy and Energy Storage Operation, Nanjing, 210003, China; Yang, J., Hohai University, College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, China; Zhou, C., China Electric Power Research Institute, State Key Laboratory of New Energy and Energy Storage Operation, Nanjing, 210003, China
Abstract: A control strategy for voltage sag suppression with short response time was proposed in this paper. The power conversion system (PCS) is controlled in voltage-source mode with voltage control loop both in standby state and transient state. The SCR based static switches are controlled to forced commutation by reducing the conducting current of SCRs to zero value, and keeping the output voltage of PCS following the reference value automatically when the voltage sag happens. The SCRs are forced to turn off by increasing the output power of the PCS. The forced commutation time and the voltage response time can be controlled in few milliseconds. The simulation and experiment are conducted, and the obtained results are provided to verify the proposed concepts. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy storage system; forced commutation; power conditioning system; voltage sag suppression; voltage-source mode
Index Keywords: Standby power systems; Control strategies; Energy storage systems; Forced commutation; Power conversion systems; Reference values; Short response time; Suppression method; Voltage control loop; Response time (computer systems)

Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019
Affiliations: Tsinghua University, Environment Management and Policy Research Center, Beijing, China; China Southern Power Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Guangzhou, China

Abstract: With the rapid development of ancillary service market in China Southern Region, the battery energy storage attracts much more attention serving as an excellent regulating resource. There have been several bundle cases of thermal power and battery energy storage that show outstanding performance cooperatively serving in frequency regulation market. It is proposed that battery energy storage stations (BESS) on the grid side should be installed and would provide better ancillary service capability. However, the actual operation benefit and market performance of BESS is unknown and therefore the financial risk cannot be reasonably estimated. This paper develops a full-life-cycle operation simulation method for BESS in the ancillary service market, getting detailed service performance and participating benefit. This method could help investors make investment decisions that whether and what configuration of a BESS should be installed, and how much profit they could achieve. Two BESS cases in Guangdong ancillary service market are carried out to prove the effectiveness of the proposed method. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: ancillary service; battery energy storage station; benefit estimation; full life cycle

Abstract: The range of equipment that needs to be operated in the startup process of the pumped storage unit in back-to-back mode is discussed in this article, and the analysis of the security lockout relationship and sequence between devices is also discussed in the article. The driven machine is the master, which can ensure the synchronization and safety of the startup process. Moreover, the interaction information between the two units in the back-to-back mode is reasonably set. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Zhang N., Liu L., Liu K., Mao J.
Title: A novel integrated power-gas-heat system planning model considering energy sources, demand response, storage and energy converters
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 3rd International Electrical and Energy Conference, CIEEC 2019

Abstract: With the development of energy internet and integrated energy system (IES), there will be more couplings between different energy systems, i.e. the power system, the gas system and the heat system. Moreover, there will be more interactions among different parts of the energy system, i.e. source, grid, load, storage and energy converters. Based on this background, this paper puts forward a novel integrated power-gas-heat system planning model considering energy sources, demand response, storages and energy converters. By means of this model, various energy demand is met with the minimum system cost, realizing the most effective allocation of funds and the optimal use of energy. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Totev V., Gueorgiev V., Rizov P.
Title: Regenerative braking of electric vehicles
Source title: 2019 11th Electrical Engineering Faculty Conference, BulEF 2019
Affiliations: Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Technical University-Sofia, Sofia, Bulgaria
Authors with affiliations: Totev, V., Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Technical University-Sofia, Sofia, Bulgaria; Gueorgiev, V., Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Technical University-Sofia, Sofia, Bulgaria; Rizov, P., Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Technical University-Sofia, Sofia, Bulgaria
Abstract: This paper presents a discussion about regenerative braking of electric vehicles (EVs). The paper is made with a purpose to inform in a concise way the essence of regenerative braking and different methods, utilized to accumulate recuperated energy. Electric vehicles are a broad but very exciting and rapidly spreading topic concerning the following needs and factors: To lower emissions in the environment, to use green energy sources, increased energy demand and consumption etc. Regenerative braking is a process of deceleration of an electric vehicle (plug-in or hybrid) by converting mechanical energy to electrical via generator operation of its motor, while also providing brake torque, and further accumulating it in storage systems. This process extends their range or lowers fuel consumption respectively. With expanding research and development of EVs on a worldwide scale regenerative braking of those vehicles as a topic is notably relevant. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: electric cars; electric vehicles; plug-in EV; regenerative braking

Authors: Rahman S., Chowdhury T.T.
Title: Design and control of a standalone microgrid system for Saint Martin's Island in Bangladesh
Source title: 2019 5th International Conference on Advances in Electrical Engineering, ICAEE 2019
Affiliations: University of Asia Pacific, Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Dhaka, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Rahman, S., University of Asia Pacific, Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Dhaka, Bangladesh; Chowdhury, T.T., University of Asia Pacific, Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Dhaka, Bangladesh
Abstract: A standalone Microgrid system, consists of renewable energy resources is one of the promising solutions to supply electricity to remote areas where power grid extension is difficult or impossible to reach. However, generation uncertainties associated with the renewable power generation deteriorate the quality of power. In this paper, a standalone microgrid system, consists of Photovoltaic (PV) resources and energy storage system (ESS) is proposed to supply continuous and quality power to the local people of the Saint Martin's island in Bangladesh. This paper investigates the energy management between PV, ESS, and loads and explores a decentralized active power control scheme to maintain the DC-link voltage and track consumer-end voltage and frequency set-point target. A microgrid and associated controllers are modeled in Matlab/Simulink software and run a dynamic simulation to investigate the usefulness of the proposed control strategy. This work offers several advantages: 1) utilizes significant amounts of solar energy, 2) reduces uncertainties of renewable power generation, 3) provides smooth and fast voltage and frequency regulation without extra communication infrastructure, 4) decreases CO 2 emission, and 5) supplies safe and affordable electricity in remote, rural areas and islands. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: DC-link voltage; Energy Storage System; Photovoltaic; Renewable energy resources; Standalone microgrid; Voltage and frequency stability
Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; MATLAB; Microgrids; Power control; Renewable energy resources; Solar energy; Communication infrastructure; DC-link voltages; Energy storage systems; Generation uncertainty; Matlab/Simulink software; Micro grid; Photovoltaic; Renewable power generation; Electric power transmission networks

Authors: Saha A., Misra S., Progya P.M.
Title: Design and simulation based stand-alone solar micro grid system for island areas
Source title: 2019 5th International Conference on Advances in Electrical Engineering, ICAEE 2019
Affiliations: Faculty of Engineering, American International University-Bangladesh, 408/1, Kuratoli, Dhaka, 1229, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Saha, A., Faculty of Engineering, American International University-Bangladesh, 408/1, Kuratoli, Dhaka, 1229, Bangladesh; Misra, S., Faculty of Engineering, American International University-Bangladesh, 408/1, Kuratoli, Dhaka, 1229, Bangladesh; Progya, P.M., Faculty of Engineering, American International University-Bangladesh, 408/1, Kuratoli, Dhaka, 1229, Bangladesh
Abstract: Nowadays photovoltaic (PV) based power generation is developing progressively fast as a sustainable power source. This paper presents the designing of a smart distributed of stand-alone solar Micro-grid system, which is suitable for islanding areas as conventional power system is very tough and costly to supply electricity in island areas. The proposed method can offer improvement of system reliability and efficiency for the stand-alone solar micro-grid which is composed of circulated load, generation and energy storage device combined together in the region to one another. All these models of Micro-grid system are simulated by using MATLAB/Simulink. The stand-alone solar micro-grid has been analyzed with single phase full bridge DC to AC inverter, DC to DC Boost converters, battery discharge condition, and backup condition. Finally, different cases of this method are analyzed by simulated in this paper and the results have verified the validity of models successfully. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Kutila M., Virtanen A., Tarkiainen M., Peussa P.
Title: Sensor System Power Adaptation for Automated Vehicles
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 IEEE 15th International Conference on Intelligent Computer Communication and Processing, ICCP 2019
Affiliations: VTT Technical Research Center of Finland Ltd., Tampere, Finland
Authors with affiliations: Kutila, M., VTT Technical Research Center of Finland Ltd., Tampere, Finland; Virtanen, A., VTT Technical Research Center of Finland Ltd., Tampere, Finland; Tarkiainen, M., VTT Technical Research Center of Finland Ltd., Tampere, Finland; Peussa, P., VTT Technical Research Center of Finland Ltd., Tampere, Finland
Abstract: There are two mega-trends in the automotive industry for converting the way of traveling in the future. One is the transition from combustion engines to electric vehicles and the second promotes an increased level of automation in future cars. However, automation requires exceptionally high quality environment perception data and various sensor devices, each taking their own share from the vehicle energy storage, which reduces the driving range of electric vehicles. This article proposes an improved ability to save the energy of a vehicle through advanced sensor systems with an adaptive power management of the environment perception system. At low speeds the sensor system is set to a minimal power scheme and at high speed or in adverse weather conditions a high power scheme is used to increase the available sensing range. In addition, it also makes it possible to use V2X communication to restrict sensor power or prohibit the use of certain sensors in radiation sensitive environments. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Automated Driving; Connectivity; Electric vehicle; Mobility; Power; Sensor
Index Keywords: Automation; Automotive industry; Carrier mobility; Digital storage; Electric vehicles; Sensors; Adaptive power management; Automated driving; Automated vehicles; Combustion engines; Connectivity; Environment perceptions; Level of automations; Power; Vehicles

Authors: Sun M., Li F., Jin X.
Title: Research on the Information and Communication System Architecture for Global Analysis of Wide Area Distributed Photovoltaic Power Industry
Source title: 2019 2nd IEEE International Conference on Information Communication and Signal Processing, ICICSP 2019
Affiliations: China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; State Grid Jiangsu Electric Power Company, Yancheng, China
Authors with affiliations: Sun, M., China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Li, F., China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Jin, X., State Grid Jiangsu Electric Power Company, Yancheng, China
Abstract: The new energy power generation, especially represented by photovoltaic (PV) power generation, has a wide distribution of power generation units, and it is affected by meteorological and environmental impacts, and has poor stability and continuity. The application of electric power Internet of Thing (IoT) technology will make it possible to evaluate of PV power generation in quasi-real-time. However, at present, the traditional distributed PV information and communication model lacks a unified standard. And the cost for distributed data collection is high and the channel maintenance is difficult. So, it is hard to realize economic, efficient, safe and real-time monitoring for distributed PV data. This paper studies on the issues about the information model, communication protocol, data and application service in panoramic data acquisition and data communication of distributed PV power industry, and proposes an intelligent monitoring information and communication system architecture, which consists of sensing layer, network layer, data layer and application layer, and also a business based modeling method for intelligent monitoring, so as to achieve standardized data collection, transmission and standardized storage, processing, digging, and finally lay the foundation to fully support PV business applications and intelligent decision analysis in smart grid. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Communication protocal; Inforamtion model; Internet of Things; Photovoltaic technology; System artchitecure
