Authors: Langiu A., Boano C.A., Schub M., Romer K.
Title: UpKit: An open-source, portable, and lightweight update framework for constrained IoT devices
Source title: Proceedings - International Conference on Distributed Computing Systems
Affiliations: Institute of Technical Informatics, Graz University of Technology, Austria
Authors with affiliations: Langiu, A., Institute of Technical Informatics, Graz University of Technology, Austria; Boano, C.A., Institute of Technical Informatics, Graz University of Technology, Austria; Schub, M., Institute of Technical Informatics, Graz University of Technology, Austria; Romer, K., Institute of Technical Informatics, Graz University of Technology, Austria
Abstract: Updating the software running on constrained IoT devices such as low-power sensors and actuators in a secure and efficient way is an open problem. The limited computational, memory, and storage capabilities of these devices, together with their small energy budget, indeed, restrict the number of features that can be embedded into an update system and make it also difficult to build a generic and compact solution. As a result, existing update systems for constrained IoT devices are often not portable, do not perform a proper verification of the downloaded firmware, or focus only on a single phase of the update process, which exposes them to security threats and calls for new solutions. In this paper we present UpKit, a portable and lightweight software update framework for constrained IoT devices encompassing all phases of the update process: from the generation and signature of a new firmware, to the transmission of the latter to an IoT device, its verification and installation. UpKit employs a novel update architecture that is agnostic to how new firmware images are distributed and that introduces a double-signature process to guarantee the freshness of a new firmware. This, together with an additional verification step, allows also to reject invalid software at an early stage and to prevent an unnecessary reboot of the device. We keep UpKit's design modular and provide an open-source implementation for several operating systems, hardware platforms, as well as cryptographic libraries. We further include support for differential updates and flexible memory slots, which allows to significantly increase the efficiency of the update process. An experimental evaluation shows that UpKit can be used to efficiently update highly-constrained IoT devices, and that it has a comparable memory footprint to state-of-the-art solutions, despite the introduction of several features. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Constrained devices; Contiki; Internet of Things; Pull and Push approach; RIOT; Software Updates; Zephyr
Index Keywords: Budget control; Distributed computer systems; Firmware; Open source software; Open systems; Verification; Constrained devices; Contiki; Pull and push approach; RIOT; Software updates; Zephyr; Internet of things

Authors: Yu H., Shan G., Yu L.
Title: Source-storage interaction optimization and scheduling based on centralized control virtual power plant
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, Jiangsu Province, 210018, China; Jiangsu Provincial Key Laboratory of Smart Grid Technology and Equipment, Nanjing, Jiangsu Province, 210018, China
Authors with affiliations: Yu, H., School of Electrical Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, Jiangsu Province, 210018, China, Jiangsu Provincial Key Laboratory of Smart Grid Technology and Equipment, Nanjing, Jiangsu Province, 210018, China; Shan, G., School of Electrical Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, Jiangsu Province, 210018, China, Jiangsu Provincial Key Laboratory of Smart Grid Technology and Equipment, Nanjing, Jiangsu Province, 210018, China; Yu, L., School of Electrical Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, Jiangsu Province, 210018, China, Jiangsu Provincial Key Laboratory of Smart Grid Technology and Equipment, Nanjing, Jiangsu Province, 210018, China
Abstract: In view of the coordinated control and scheduling of distributed energy, such as controllable units, energy storage devices and fans in distribution networks, a virtual power plant source and load storage optimization scheduling model with uncertainties, demand response and network security constraints under centralized control is proposed. Firstly, the wind turbine, gas turbine, energy storage battery and load are integrated into a virtual power plant, and price-type demand response measures are implemented on the user side to improve the load curve. Then, aiming at maximizing the operating profit of the virtual power plant, the opportunity constraint model is used to describe the uncertainty of the wind turbine, load forecasting and internal power balance, and consider the operational constraints and network security constraints of each unit. The scheduling scheme is generated based on the reasonable control and coordination of the output of each component. Finally, the quantum particle swarm optimization algorithm with inertia weight adaptive adjustment is used to solve the model. The feasibility of the model and the effectiveness of the algorithm are verified by an example analysis of the IEEE 9 node improved system. © 2019 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: Demand response; Optimal scheduling; Quantum particle swarm; Stochastic programming; Virtual power plant

Authors: Shao Z., Zhai Q., Guan X.
Title: All-scenario-feasible optimization method for coordinated scheduling of security constrained power grids with uncertain renewable and storable energy sources
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: MOE KLINNS Lab, Systems Engineering Institute, Xian Jiaotong University, Xian, 710049, China
Authors with affiliations: Shao, Z., MOE KLINNS Lab, Systems Engineering Institute, Xian Jiaotong University, Xian, 710049, China; Zhai, Q., MOE KLINNS Lab, Systems Engineering Institute, Xian Jiaotong University, Xian, 710049, China; Guan, X., MOE KLINNS Lab, Systems Engineering Institute, Xian Jiaotong University, Xian, 710049, China
Abstract: The energy structure of China's power grids is under great changes. The participation of renewable energy and the construction of storable energy have brought new challenges to the operation of power grids. These make the scheduling of multiple power sources become very valuable to both system operators and researchers. Hence, this paper proposed an all-scenario-feasible (ASF) optimization method for the coordinated scheduling of security constrained power grids with uncertain renewable and storable energy sources. The method of this paper has a good performance in the accommodation of renewable energy. It is able to guarantee the nonanticipativity of storable energy while coping with the random fluctuation of renewable energy. Besides, this method is based on the mixed-integer linear programming (MILP) and it will be explained on the typical power grid in this paper, which has wind power, thermal power and pumped storage plants (PSPs). The conclusions of this method are also applicable to other similar sources and the optimization results obtained from the case study demonstrate that our method is effective and of good performance in dealing with uncertainty of renewable energy. © 2019 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: Coordinated Scheduling; Mixed-Integer Linear Programming; Nonanticipativity; Renewable Energy; Storable Energy Sources

Authors: DIng K., Li F., Zhang X.
Title: Power smoothing control of DC microgrid hybrid energy storage system based on fuzzy control
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Jiangsu University, Zhenjiang, Jiangsu, 212013, China
Authors with affiliations: DIng, K., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Jiangsu University, Zhenjiang, Jiangsu, 212013, China; Li, F., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Jiangsu University, Zhenjiang, Jiangsu, 212013, China; Zhang, X., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Jiangsu University, Zhenjiang, Jiangsu, 212013, China
Abstract: Flywheel energy storage and lead-acid battery have complementary advantages, the hybrid energy storage system composed of them can effectively inhibit the fluctuating power and improve the power quality of microgrid. In order to reasonably distribute the charging and discharging power of flywheel energy storage and battery, a power smoothing control scheme based on fuzzy control was proposed, and a power distribution controller was designed. Firstly, the control strategy of charge and discharge of battery and flywheel is designed. Low-pass filter are used to get the battery and flywheel energy storage power allocation reference; At the same time, in order to prevent overcharge discharge, according to the flywheel energy storage equation, bus capacitance energy storage change equation and voltage change equation, the relationship between the flywheel speed and bus voltage is derived, and based on this, the flywheel energy storage state optimization module based on bus voltage change is established. Then, the reference power of storage battery and flywheel is corrected in real time by fuzzy control, and the corrected power acts on the control of flywheel and battery converter respectively. Finally, the simulation results show that the method is feasible and effective, and improves the capacity and accuracy of the hybrid energy storage system. © 2019 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: Battery; DC microgrid; Flywheel energy storage; Fuzzy control; Hybrid energy storage; Power distribution

Authors: Ren S., Wang J., Ma M.
Title: Multi-objective optimal control of micro-grid based on economic model predictive control
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: School of Control Computer Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China; State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China
Authors with affiliations: Ren, S., School of Control Computer Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China; Wang, J., School of Control Computer Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China; Ma, M., School of Control Computer Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China
Abstract: This paper presents an economic model predictive control (EMPC) scheme to manage the grid-connected micro-grid in an economic way. The grid-connected micro-grid system is composed of wind generation unit, photovoltaic generation unit, energy storage battery, micro-turbines and load. The generation units are scheduled optimally to achieve the three objectives of power balance, economic performance and environmental protection. Moreover, the analytic hierarchy process (AHP) is used to determine the weight coefficients of the objective function. Simulation and analysis results for the economic optimization of micro-grid system are given to illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed economic model predictive control framework. © 2019 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: AHP; EMPC; Micro-grid; Multi-objective optimization; Power balance

Authors: Shu C., Pang W., Liu H., Lu S.
Title: High energy efficiency FPGA-based accelerator for convolutional neural networks using weight combination
Source title: 2019 IEEE 4th International Conference on Signal and Image Processing, ICSIP 2019
Affiliations: National ASIC System Engineering Research Center, Southeast University, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Shu, C., National ASIC System Engineering Research Center, Southeast University, Nanjing, China; Pang, W., National ASIC System Engineering Research Center, Southeast University, Nanjing, China; Liu, H., National ASIC System Engineering Research Center, Southeast University, Nanjing, China; Lu, S., National ASIC System Engineering Research Center, Southeast University, Nanjing, China
Abstract: Convolutional neural network (CNN) has achieved excellent achievements in the field of image recognition. Because of the better energy efficiency and fewer development cycle, FPGA has been widely used as the implementation platform of CNN. The quantized CNN reduces the demand for storage and transmission bandwidth, and is easier to be implemented on FPGA platforms. And the weights of the quantized network contain a lot of repetitions and zeros. The repeatability and sparsity of these weight parameters can be well utilized in the hardware implementation of CNN. In this paper, a CNN accelerator is designed and implemented on the Virtex-7 FPGA, and the test network is AlexNet with 17 unique weights after quantization. By using weight combination method, the accelerator redesigned the calculation pattern of the processing elements (PEs), reducing the multiplication by 92.25%. The experiment result shows that our accelerator achieves 179 GOPS under 200 MHz clock frequency. The energy efficiency of 32.72 GOPS/Watt is obtained by combining the new PE with the systolic array architecture. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Accelerator; Convolutional neural network; Quantization
Index Keywords: Acceleration; Convolution; Field programmable gate arrays (FPGA); Image processing; Image recognition; Neural networks; Particle accelerators; Systolic arrays; Convolutional neural network; Hardware implementations; High energy efficiency; Implementation platforms; Processing elements; Quantization; Systolic array architecture; Transmission bandwidth; Energy efficiency

Authors: Tu G., Li Y., Xiang J.
Title: Analysis and control of energy storage systems for power system stability enhancement
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: Department of System Science and Engineering, College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, China; School of Information and Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University City College, China
Authors with affiliations: Tu, G., Department of System Science and Engineering, College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, China; Li, Y., School of Information and Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University City College, China; Xiang, J., Department of System Science and Engineering, College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, China
Abstract: Utility-scale energy storage systems (ESSs) have been widely used in power system to facilitate its secure and economic operation. This paper investigates the transient influence of ESSs on bulk power systems. ESSs are treated as a controllable current source, whose dynamic response is represented by a first order transfer function. The influence of ESSs on the system dynamics is analyzed on a single machine infinite bus (SMIB) system with a ESS connected at its transmission line. The analytical result indicates that the deviated electrical power of synchronous machine (SG) caused by ESS is linear to both the d-axis and q-axis current of ESS. Based on this result, a control strategy of ESS's reference current is proposed to improve the system damping. Case studies are performed on both SMIB system and the 2-Area 4-Generator system to validate the correctness of the analysis and the effectiveness of proposed ESS control strategy. © 2019 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: Energy Storage System; Oscillation Damping; Power System Stability; Transient Analysis

Authors: Du Y., Wu J., Li S., Long C.
Title: Coordinated energy scheduling for autonomous microgrids based on multi-layer control architecture
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, 200240, China
Authors with affiliations: Du, Y., Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, 200240, China; Wu, J., Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, 200240, China; Li, S., Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, 200240, China; Long, C., Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, 200240, China
Abstract: With the increasing presence of intermittent Renewable Energy Sources (RESs), energy scheduling over loads and Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) in the MicroGrid (MG) become even more important. Especially in autonomous mode, MG will face the difficulties while local RESs production cannot satisfy critical loads' requests. In this paper, a two-stage control scheme based on Model Predictive Control (MPC) is proposed for coordinating energy scheduling and optimizing Demand Response (DR) of Autonomous MicroGrids (AMGs) when there is an imbalance between the RES supply and demand. Firstly, Distributed Network Operator (DNO) will make an optimal decision based on the information received, which include trading with the other MGs, using the energy from BESS, or adjusting the controllable loads. Secondly, the optimized operational options will be tracked by each MG over a long time horizon, typically one day. With the proposed scheme, not only we maintain a supply-demand balance with load cutting or shifting, but also minimize the discomfort of active users. Detailed algorithm and simulations of the overall system are presented. © 2019 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: Autonomous Microgrids; Demand Response; Multi-layer Control; Renewable Energy Sources

Authors: Liu S., Jiang J.
Title: Technical evolution of advanced flywheel energy storage system
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: School of Mechanical and Electrical Eng, Huangshan University, Huangshan, 245041, China; Anhui Dorje Electric Co., Ltd., Huangshan, 245000, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, S., School of Mechanical and Electrical Eng, Huangshan University, Huangshan, 245041, China; Jiang, J., Anhui Dorje Electric Co., Ltd., Huangshan, 245000, China
Abstract: The flywheel energy storage system (FESS) is a new type of technology of energy storage, which has high value of the research and vast potential for future development. The FESS has distinct advantages such as high energy storage, high efficiency, pollution-free, wide in application, absence of noise, long lifetime, easy maintenance and continuous working and so on, which provides a new way to solve the terrible energy problem. Its operation principle, and five key technologies including the flywheel rotor, bearing system, energy conversion aspect, motor/generator and vacuum chamber are expounded. Then, the technical evolution of FESS at home and abroad is presented in detail, the application prospect of FESS is also given, and moreover, the research outlook of FESS is pointed out. © 2019 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: Flywheel energy storage system; Key technologies; Operational principle; Project application; Technical evolution

Authors: Yunhao H., Xin C., Erde W., Jianfeng C., Tingting H., Yang M.
Title: Hierarchical control strategy for distributed energy storage units in isolated DC microgrid
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: Shanghai University of Electric Power, Yangpu District, Shanghai, 200090, China
Authors with affiliations: Yunhao, H., Shanghai University of Electric Power, Yangpu District, Shanghai, 200090, China; Xin, C., Shanghai University of Electric Power, Yangpu District, Shanghai, 200090, China; Erde, W., Shanghai University of Electric Power, Yangpu District, Shanghai, 200090, China; Jianfeng, C., Shanghai University of Electric Power, Yangpu District, Shanghai, 200090, China; Tingting, H., Shanghai University of Electric Power, Yangpu District, Shanghai, 200090, China; Yang, M., Shanghai University of Electric Power, Yangpu District, Shanghai, 200090, China
Abstract: The hierarchical control strategy of distributed energy storage units (DESUs) with mismatched line impedance and energy storage capacity is proposed for isolated DC microgrid. Firstly, the virtual impedance is dynamically adjusted by balance control to eliminate the influence of mismatched line impedance for the accuracy of current sharing. Then, each distributed energy storage unit can adjust current through SoC balance control according to its capacity and state of charge (SoC), make the error of SoC decrease, and gradually realize the SoC balance of DESUs during charging and discharging process. Finally, three simulation schemes based on Matlab are normal charging and discharging of DESUs, fluctuation of photovoltaic power and load change in DC microgrid. The results show that the proposed method can make current allocate reasonably according to capacity of DESUs. © 2019 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: DC microgrid; Droop control; Energy storage balance; Hierarchical control; State of charge (SoC)

Authors: He Y., Li S.
Title: Guaranteed performance of decentralized model predictive control for power flow systems
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: Department of Automation, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, 200240, China
Authors with affiliations: He, Y., Department of Automation, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, 200240, China; Li, S., Department of Automation, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, 200240, China
Abstract: The dynamics of the Power Flow Systems(PLSs) can be described by the transportation, conversion, and storage of energy among each subsystem. By strategically choosing the passive output for each subsystem in the PLS and augmenting each local Model Predictive Control(MPC) controller with a special passivity-reinforcement constraint, local passivity of each closed-loop subsystem can be guaranteed. If the subsystem is zero-state detectable(ZSD), local stability can be ensured by local passivity, which is characterized by two parameters that can define the upper bound of L2 gain of the subsystem. The structured and passivity-preserving coupling between subsystems in the PLS can be used to prove the passivity property of the global system, which can be expressed by the transition of the two parameters. Then, the L2 gain bound of the entire PLS can be guaranteed as well. As the design procedure of the proposed performance-guaranteed passivity-based decentralized MPC is totally decentralized, even if the structure of the PLS is changing, the entire system can remain stable and achieve high performance. © 2019 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: Model Predictive Control; Passivity-based Control; Power Flow Systems

Authors: Li G., Chen L., Xie Y., Gao B., Zheng T., Mei S.
Title: Risk-constrained economic dispatch for power systems with renewable energy sources and compressed air energy storage
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: State Key Lab of Control and Simulation of Power Systems and Generation Equipments, Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Haidian District, Beijing, 100084, China; State Grid Anhui Electric Power Research Institute, Hefei, 230601, China; Sichuan Energy Internet Research Institute, Tsinghua University, Chengdu, 610213, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, G., State Key Lab of Control and Simulation of Power Systems and Generation Equipments, Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Haidian District, Beijing, 100084, China; Chen, L., State Key Lab of Control and Simulation of Power Systems and Generation Equipments, Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Haidian District, Beijing, 100084, China; Xie, Y., State Grid Anhui Electric Power Research Institute, Hefei, 230601, China; Gao, B., State Grid Anhui Electric Power Research Institute, Hefei, 230601, China; Zheng, T., Sichuan Energy Internet Research Institute, Tsinghua University, Chengdu, 610213, China; Mei, S., State Key Lab of Control and Simulation of Power Systems and Generation Equipments, Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Haidian District, Beijing, 100084, China
Abstract: Energy crisis and environmental concerns have led to the rapid development of renewable energy sources (RES). However, the fluctuating and unpredictable nature of RES reduce the reliability of the power systems. Using compressed air energy storage (CAES) is one of the main solutions to this problem. In this paper, three typical operation modes of CAES are adopted to improve the flexibility of the wind-CAES hybrid system, and a risk-constrained economic dispatch model considering the uncertainty of wind power and the part-load characteristics of CAES is proposed. Scenario generation and reduction technique is applied to model the uncertainties and a piecewise linearization method is used to incorporate the part-load features into the mixed integer linear programming model. The effectiveness of the proposed methodology is studied in a modified IEEE RTS 24-bus system. © 2019 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: Compressed air energy storage; Conditional value at risk; Economic dispatch; Uncertainty; Wind generation

Abstract: This paper presents some results and discussions on the use of phase change materials (PCM) performance for energy storage. Different parameters which affect the energy distribution and also the distribution of thermal energy will be illustrated. Future work has also been discussed on the importance of local distributed energy trading in the hope to reduce energy losses and maximize energy efficiency. © 2019 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.

Authors: Li X., Jia X., Yan S., Wang S.
Title: Data-driven model-free adaptive control of high power converters in super-large-scale energy storage station
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Control and Operation of Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China; College of Information and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, 110819, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, X., State Key Laboratory of Control and Operation of Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China; Jia, X., State Key Laboratory of Control and Operation of Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China; Yan, S., College of Information and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, 110819, China; Wang, S., State Key Laboratory of Control and Operation of Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China
Abstract: A data-driven control method is proposed in super-large-scale energy storage station. This control strategy is embedded in power converter and can solve the serious parallel control problems, that is, the output voltage amplitude, phase angle and frequency may be different due to their model mismatch and unknown dynamics, when high power converters are connected in parallel. Based on the model free adaptive control algorithm, the data-driven controller is designed in high power converter system. The parallel power converter system is dynamically linearized by introducing the pseudo partial derivative. In order to keep that output voltage amplitude, frequency and phase of each power converters are equal at the point of common connection in super-large-scale energy storage station, the control parameters of power converter are updated through the input and output data acquired in real time, when the parallel power converters is running. The simulation results show that the model free adaptive algorithm of power converter is effective in super-large-scale energy storage station. © 2019 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: Droop Control; High Power Converter; Model Free Adaptive Control; Pseudo Partial Derivative; Super-large-scale Energy Storage Station

Authors: Savić N., Katić V., Dumnić B., Milićević D., Čorba Z., Katić N.
Title: Cost-benefit analysis of the application of a distributed energy sources in the university campus microgrid proposal
Source title: EUROCON 2019 - 18th International Conference on Smart Technologies
Affiliations: University of Novi Sad, Faculty of Technical Sciences, Novi Sad, Serbia
Authors with affiliations: Savić, N., University of Novi Sad, Faculty of Technical Sciences, Novi Sad, Serbia; Katić, V., University of Novi Sad, Faculty of Technical Sciences, Novi Sad, Serbia; Dumnić, B., University of Novi Sad, Faculty of Technical Sciences, Novi Sad, Serbia; Milićević, D., University of Novi Sad, Faculty of Technical Sciences, Novi Sad, Serbia; Čorba, Z., University of Novi Sad, Faculty of Technical Sciences, Novi Sad, Serbia; Katić, N., University of Novi Sad, Faculty of Technical Sciences, Novi Sad, Serbia
Abstract: This paper presents a cost-benefit analysis (CBA) of the justification of the proposal for a university campus microgrid (UCMG) based on different types of distributed energy sources (DESs) built and planned at the Faculty of Technical Sciences Novi Sad (FTN NS). The UCMG 'FTN-NS' proposal is based on the application of distributed generator technologies that represent 2 photovoltaic (PV) power plants, 1 wind power plant, 1 combined heat and power plant, a technology of distributed energy storage systems that represents a battery energy storage system, devices for connection, operation and control of the microgrid, and electricity consumers. The CBA calculates the technical and ecological parameters of the case study UCMG 'FTN-NS' taking into account 5 different scenarios in terms of changing economic conditions and factors. In order to verify the justification of the implementation of the UCMG proposal, the verification of the scientific-technological aspects of the application of different DESs, and the obtaining of as much as possible CBA analysis, the potentials of renewable energy sources (RES) in the Republic of Serbia are processed, analyzed and presented, technical conditions and technical recommendations connection of small power plants to the main distribution grid, and economic mechanisms for stimulating the production of electricity from various RES. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: cost-benefit analysis; distributed energy sources; distributed generation; microgrid; renewable energy sources

Authors: Herenčić L., Ilak P., Rajšl I., Zmijarević Z., Cvitanović M., Delimar M., Pećanac B.
Title: Overview of the main challenges and threats for implementation of the advanced concept for decentralized trading in microgrids
Source title: EUROCON 2019 - 18th International Conference on Smart Technologies

Abstract: Current trends of decentralization, digitalization, decarbonization and democratization in the power sector enable new business models featuring active participation of the distributed energy resources and distributed storage systems. Moreover, individual and small market participants acting as peers want to trade electricity within local communities. Peer-to-peer decentralized electricity trading in microgrids using distributed ledger technology could be a solution for establishing local markets and accelerating the integration of distributed energy resources. In this paper, main technical, economic, social and regulatory challenges and threats for implementation of the peer-to-peer concept for electricity trading in microgrids are stated and discussed. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Van Vuuren C.Y.J., Vermeulen H.J.
Title: Temperature Distributions and Bacterial Growth Implications in a Hot Water Storage Tank under Scheduled Draw-off and Heating Cycles
Source title: EUROCON 2019 - 18th International Conference on Smart Technologies
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Stellenbosch University, Stellenbosch, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Van Vuuren, C.Y.J., Department of Electrical Engineering, Stellenbosch University, Stellenbosch, South Africa; Vermeulen, H.J., Department of Electrical Engineering, Stellenbosch University, Stellenbosch, South Africa
Abstract: In the context of sustainable energy and smart grid technologies, the sanitary water-heating load represents an important target for load control interventions aimed at energy conservation and implementing demand response. These interventions typically include measures such as, lowering hot water set point temperatures and implementing hot water drawoff and heating cycle scheduling. Utilities can, furthermore, implement demand response measures by automated control of hot water loads. These scheduling interventions generally give rise to lower average water temperatures inside the storage vessels, which can encourage the growth of pathogens such as Legionnaire bacteria. This paper presents the results of an experimental investigation to determine the internal temperature distributions of a domestic water heater for predetermined hot water draw-off and heating cycle scheduling. The development of a dedicated system for measuring the internal water temperature distribution of a cylindrical water heater is discussed. Measured temperature distribution results are presented for horizontal and vertical distributions, using daily draw-off and heating cycle patterns aimed at reducing standing losses. The results show that the scheduling methodology can give rise to increased risk of the bacterial growth, especially for horizontally orientated cylinders. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Hot water storage tank; Legionella bacteria; thermal stratification
Index Keywords: Bacteria; Energy conservation; Heat pump systems; Heating; Scheduling; Smart power grids; Tanks (containers); Temperature distribution; Thermal stratification; Water; Water heaters; Domestic water heaters; Experimental investigations; Hot water storage tanks; Internal temperature distribution; Legionella; Set-point temperatures; Smart Grid technologies; Water temperature distribution; Water conservation

Authors: Petrovic N., Strezoski L., Dumnic B.
Title: Overview of software tools for integration and active management of high penetration of DERs in emerging distribution networks
Source title: EUROCON 2019 - 18th International Conference on Smart Technologies
Affiliations: Higher Education Technical School of Professional Studies in Novi Sad, Novi Sad, Serbia; Department of Power, Electronics and Comunication Engineering, University of Novi Sad, Faculty of Technical Sciences, Novi Sad, Serbia
Authors with affiliations: Petrovic, N., Higher Education Technical School of Professional Studies in Novi Sad, Novi Sad, Serbia; Strezoski, L., Department of Power, Electronics and Comunication Engineering, University of Novi Sad, Faculty of Technical Sciences, Novi Sad, Serbia; Dumnic, B., Department of Power, Electronics and Comunication Engineering, University of Novi Sad, Faculty of Technical Sciences, Novi Sad, Serbia
Abstract: Emerging types of software and communication systems that manage distributed energy resources (DERs) such as solar photovoltaic, wind turbines, flywheels, battery storage systems, etc. are termed Distributed Energy Resources Management Systems (DERMS). When properly deployed, their capabilities provide multiple benefits to both, utilities and their customers. DERMS consists of a set of software management tools that allow distribution companies and operators to manage a range of DERs, and offer almost real-time network control. DERMS can help tremendously in integrating, managing, and controlling flexible and intermittent DERs and electric demand. These analyses contribute to keeping the transmission and distribution system in sync with the efficient and reliable balance of supply and demand that should lead to ideally optimization of power flows, electric demand, DERs, and traditional centralized generation. Moreover, in order to handle distributed generation (DG) and to intensify its visibility within power markets, the idea of virtual power plant (VPP) has emerged. Dynamic, automated, and cost-effective management of the distribution system is achieved with DERMS tools that are presented in this paper. Moreover, various hierarchy-levels of DERMS tools co-exist nowadays, such as DER aggregator, VPP, Utility DERMS, and they all can tremendously improve efficiency of Active Distribution Networks (ADN). This paper presents an overview of the current state-of-the-art regarding various DERMS tools, and their capabilities to increase the overall distribution system efficiency. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: DER aggregator; Distributed Energy Resource Management System; Utility DERMS; Virtual Power Plant; VPP
Index Keywords: Cost effectiveness; Electric power distribution; Energy resources; Power plants; Solar power generation; Active distribution network (ADN); DER aggregator; Distributed Energy Resources; Distribution system efficiency; Transmission and distribution systems; Utility DERMS; Virtual power plants; Virtual power plants (VPP); Energy management systems

Authors: Kleijer M., Friedrich L.A.J., Gysen B.L.J., Lomonova E.A.
Title: Dynamic analysis of a tubular generator for automotive suspension applications
Source title: 2019 12th International Symposium on Linear Drives for Industry Applications, LDIA 2019
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Eindhoven University of Technology, Netherlands
Authors with affiliations: Kleijer, M., Department of Electrical Engineering, Eindhoven University of Technology, Netherlands; Friedrich, L.A.J., Department of Electrical Engineering, Eindhoven University of Technology, Netherlands; Gysen, B.L.J., Department of Electrical Engineering, Eindhoven University of Technology, Netherlands; Lomonova, E.A., Department of Electrical Engineering, Eindhoven University of Technology, Netherlands
Abstract: In this paper, a slotless three-phase tubular permanent magnet generator applied to vibration energy harvesting in automotive suspensions is considered. A two-dimensional finite element method model of the harvester is created as well as an experimental setup, containing the generator. Signal decomposition utilizing Fourier series is applied to suspension displacement data and the resulting signal components are applied to the model. The individual responses of the model are superposed, from which the corresponding harvested energy is derived. Comparisons are made with measurements on the setup that act as reference to determine the error of the harmonic reconstruction. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Siskos S., Gogolou V., Tsamis C., Kerasidou A., Doumenis G., Tsiapali K., Katsikas S., Sakellariou A.
Title: Design of a flexible multi-source energy harvesting system for autonomously powered IoT : The PERPS project
Source title: 2019 IEEE 29th International Symposium on Power and Timing Modeling, Optimization and Simulation, PATMOS 2019
Affiliations: Electronics Lab, Physics Dept., Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, Thessaloniki, Greece; Institute of Nanoscience and Nanotechnology, NCSR 'Demokritos', Athens, Greece; Dept. of Informatics and Telecommunications, University of Ioannina, Arta, Greece; GDT IKE, Preveza, Greece; METIS Cyberspace Technology, Athens, Greece
Authors with affiliations: Siskos, S., Electronics Lab, Physics Dept., Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, Thessaloniki, Greece; Gogolou, V., Electronics Lab, Physics Dept., Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, Thessaloniki, Greece; Tsamis, C., Institute of Nanoscience and Nanotechnology, NCSR 'Demokritos', Athens, Greece; Kerasidou, A., Institute of Nanoscience and Nanotechnology, NCSR 'Demokritos', Athens, Greece; Doumenis, G., Dept. of Informatics and Telecommunications, University of Ioannina, Arta, Greece; Tsiapali, K., GDT IKE, Preveza, Greece; Katsikas, S., METIS Cyberspace Technology, Athens, Greece; Sakellariou, A., METIS Cyberspace Technology, Athens, Greece
Abstract: A desired property of an autonomous system is the capability to operate and survive in unforeseen conditions. Wireless IoT (formerly Wireless Sensor Network) applications, pose a series of limitations regarding an embedded system's power consumption and energy autonomy. The PERPS project proposes an innovative approach to energy harvesting systems, aiming to perpetual operation of WSN nodes and portable electronics. A state-of-the-art energy conversion integrated circuit (ENC IC), with real-time S/W algorithms is implemented, to allow the predictive estimation of energy availability at the system's installation site. A multi-source input is employed combining parallel harvesters for various energy sources including (ambient) light, (micro) vibrations and (small) temperature differences, to upgrade the topology's efficiency and versatility. In addition, the newly-introduced concept of harvesting energy via triboelectric microgenerators is studied. Ultra-low power consumption microelectronic circuitries and novel storage structure techniques are employed in order the overall architecture to present optimum energy utilization, therefore maximized efficiency. The final version of the system will be tested on a ship's engine room thus the verification of the PERPS project operational principle will be based on real and demanding environmental conditions. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy harvesting; multi-input; multi-output; multi-source; perpetual power supply

Authors: Yan S., Wu G.
Title: Severe cold weather is valuable to build Northeast China as the largest data and computing centre in china and in the world
Source title: International Conference on Transparent Optical Networks
Affiliations: National Engineering Research Centre for Non-food Biorefinery, Guangxi Academy of Sciences, 98 Daling Road, Nanning, Guangxi, 530007, China
Authors with affiliations: Yan, S., National Engineering Research Centre for Non-food Biorefinery, Guangxi Academy of Sciences, 98 Daling Road, Nanning, Guangxi, 530007, China; Wu, G., National Engineering Research Centre for Non-food Biorefinery, Guangxi Academy of Sciences, 98 Daling Road, Nanning, Guangxi, 530007, China
Abstract: Revitalization of economy in Northeast China is very important for sustainable development in Chinese economy because the economy in Northeast China lags behind most parts of China. An important factor, which impedes the economic development in Northeast China, is its severe cold weather. Consequently, the Northeast China faces a series of issues, for example, less attraction to youth, decline of population, aging of population, lack of investment, out-of-date infrastructure, etc. In this study, we propose to restructure the economy in Northeast China from the labour-intensive heavy industry to the high-tech industry based on data storage and computing. This is possible because the severe cold weather is good for cooling data storage and computing facility, which is highly energy-demanded. Taking this economic advantage, it could transform the Northeast China into the largest data storage and computing centre in China, which would promote the development of green economy in China, and even in the world. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Phan B., Le N., Pham S., Le T.
Title: Multi-Objectives Problem for Load Shedding in Micro Grid
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on System Science and Engineering, ICSSE 2019
Affiliations: Electrical and Electronics Engineering Department Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology, HCMUT, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Electrical and Electronics Engineering Department Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology, (HCMUT), Electrical and Electronics Engineering Department Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology, (HCMUT, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam
Authors with affiliations: Phan, B., Electrical and Electronics Engineering Department Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology, HCMUT, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Le, N., Electrical and Electronics Engineering Department Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology, HCMUT, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Pham, S., Electrical and Electronics Engineering Department Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology, (HCMUT), Electrical and Electronics Engineering Department Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology, (HCMUT, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Le, T., Electrical and Electronics Engineering Department Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology, (HCMUT), Electrical and Electronics Engineering Department Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology, (HCMUT, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam
Abstract: The power management in micro grid (MG) is related to the planning of dispatchable sources such as diesel generator or storage devices due to the fluctuation of output power of renewable sources like wind and solar. The aim of the energy management for micro grid in islanded mode is planning of dispatchable source or storage devices and load shedding. This problem will be considered as a multi-objective problem in this paper such as: minimize cost for electricity production, minimize the amount of load to be shed for a day, minimize the shed load for some specific moments. These objectives are usually conflicted. The paper proposed an approach for solving the multi-objective problems, basing on the Particle Swarm Optimization algorithm (PSO) and membership function of fuzzy set. As the illustration, one medium MG is examined with different objective functions. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: load shedding; membership function; Microgrid; PSO

Authors: Truong D.-N., Thi M.-S.N., Le H.-G., Do V.-D., Ngo V.-T., Hoang A.-Q.
Title: Dynamic stability improvement issues with a grid-connected microgrid system
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on System Science and Engineering, ICSSE 2019
Affiliations: Faculty of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Hochiminh City University of Technology and Education, Hochiminh City, Viet Nam
Authors with affiliations: Truong, D.-N., Faculty of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Hochiminh City University of Technology and Education, Hochiminh City, Viet Nam; Thi, M.-S.N., Faculty of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Hochiminh City University of Technology and Education, Hochiminh City, Viet Nam; Le, H.-G., Faculty of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Hochiminh City University of Technology and Education, Hochiminh City, Viet Nam; Do, V.-D., Faculty of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Hochiminh City University of Technology and Education, Hochiminh City, Viet Nam; Ngo, V.-T., Faculty of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Hochiminh City University of Technology and Education, Hochiminh City, Viet Nam; Hoang, A.-Q., Faculty of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Hochiminh City University of Technology and Education, Hochiminh City, Viet Nam
Abstract: In this paper, a grid-connected Microgrid (MG) system including two popular renewable energy resources which are solar Photovoltaic (PV) and wind generators have been studied. For improving the dynamic stability of a grid-connected MG system, a Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) is connected at the AC side of the power grid that can control and compensate both the active power and reactive power to the load demand. Also in this paper, the MPPT of the PV system and the controller of the Grid Side Converter (GSC) based on Adaptive Neuro-Fuzzy Inference System (ANFIS) algorithm to maintain the voltage and frequency of system are concentrated. Simulation results performed using MATLAB/Simulink platform in time-domain are shown to evaluate the effectiveness of the designed controllers. It can be concluded based on the simulation results that the proposed ANFIS controllers can be applied to enhance the voltage stability of the studied grid-connected MG system. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Abuarqoub A.
Title: A lightweight two-factor authentication scheme for mobile cloud computing
Source title: PervasiveHealth: Pervasive Computing Technologies for Healthcare
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, Middle East University, Amman, Jordan
Authors with affiliations: Abuarqoub, A., Department of Computer Science, Middle East University, Amman, Jordan
Abstract: Mobile Cloud Computing (MCC) offers a new world of promise, and can be leveraged to improve the quality of mobile services. MCC brings cloud storage, processing and communication benefits to resource-constrained mobile devices. While MCC adoption is growing significantly, various key challenges need to be addressed to make MCC-based solutions scale and meet the ever-growing demand for more resource intensive applications. The enormous volume of data that is collected from and stored on mobile devices poses information security and privacy concerns for individuals, enterprises and governments. Limited computing and energy resources makes authentication and encryption a challenging task. To preserve user’s privacy and ensure security, MCC establishes authenticated communication sessions between the mobile device and cloud servers. In this position paper, an overview of MCC authentication approaches is presented. Then, a lightweight two-factor, password and smart card, authentication for mobile cloud-connected devices is described. The proposed authentication scheme aims at increasing authentication security by using multi-factors while offloaded computation to the cloud to reduce battery consumption. © 2019 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: Authentication; MCC Security; Mobile Cloud Computing; Password; Smart card

Authors: Anuththara J.G.M., Edirisinghe E.A.V.U., Amarasinghe B.M.W.P.K., Jayatunga G.K.
Title: Kinetics and Mathematical Modeling of Drying of Parboiled Paddy in a Packed Bed Dryer
Source title: MERCon 2019 - Proceedings, 5th International Multidisciplinary Moratuwa Engineering Research Conference
Affiliations: Department of Chemical and Process Engineering, University of Moratuwa, Moratuwa, Sri Lanka
Authors with affiliations: Anuththara, J.G.M., Department of Chemical and Process Engineering, University of Moratuwa, Moratuwa, Sri Lanka; Edirisinghe, E.A.V.U., Department of Chemical and Process Engineering, University of Moratuwa, Moratuwa, Sri Lanka; Amarasinghe, B.M.W.P.K., Department of Chemical and Process Engineering, University of Moratuwa, Moratuwa, Sri Lanka; Jayatunga, G.K., Department of Chemical and Process Engineering, University of Moratuwa, Moratuwa, Sri Lanka
Abstract: Paddy, the major staple food source used in Sri Lanka is subjected to many thermal treatments before consuming since the moisture content of the paddy must be in a desirable level for milling and storage purposes. Drying characteristics of two types of parboiled paddy ('Nadu' 'Samba') were investigated in a packed bed dryer. Drying experiments for both paddy types were carried out at three different hot air temperatures 35°C, 45°C and 55° C by keeping hot air flow velocity and bed height constant as 0.98 m/s and 0.15 m respectively. Experimental results were fitted to three thin layer drying models; Midilli et al., Weibull et al. and Page. Statistical indicator; Root mean square error (RMSE) showed Midilli et al., Weibull et al. models give better fit to the experimental values. The drying curves lie totally in the falling rate period since the drying rate is controlled by the moisture diffusion of bound water. Maximum drying rates and Effective moisture diffusivity values were determined for different temperatures. The Activation energies of 'Nadu' and 'Samba' calculated based on the Arrhenius equation are 16774 J/mol and 19611 J/mol respectively. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Packed Bed Dryer; Paddy Drying; Thin Layer model

Authors: Weerakoon W.M.S.H., Wasundara Y.H.T., Weerasinghe J.C.M., Weliwita W.A.L.G.K., Wickramasinghe W.M.N.P., Lidula N.W.A., Hemapala K.T.M.U.
Title: Low Voltage DC Microgrid Control Strategy Using Single Phase DQ Transformation
Source title: MERCon 2019 - Proceedings, 5th International Multidisciplinary Moratuwa Engineering Research Conference
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Moratuwa, Moratuwa, Sri Lanka
Authors with affiliations: Weerakoon, W.M.S.H., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Moratuwa, Moratuwa, Sri Lanka; Wasundara, Y.H.T., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Moratuwa, Moratuwa, Sri Lanka; Weerasinghe, J.C.M., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Moratuwa, Moratuwa, Sri Lanka; Weliwita, W.A.L.G.K., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Moratuwa, Moratuwa, Sri Lanka; Wickramasinghe, W.M.N.P., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Moratuwa, Moratuwa, Sri Lanka; Lidula, N.W.A., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Moratuwa, Moratuwa, Sri Lanka; Hemapala, K.T.M.U., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Moratuwa, Moratuwa, Sri Lanka
Abstract: Energy and environmental issues on conventional energy sources has been a serious concern due to greenhouse gas emissions, depletion of energy resources and growing demand for electrical energy. Microgrid is an innovative solution researches are focusing as a sustainable energy supply system to utilize reliable and clean energy sources. With the higher penetration of solar PV, together with the increasing use of electronic loads and Electric Vehicles, researches are focusing back on using DC systems and thus, DC microgrids. The objective of this paper is to present the designing of a control strategy for a 48 V radial unipolar DC microgrid. Power control is the main factor that decides the correct operation of a DC microgrid when considering the power sharing between different types of power sources where some being intermittent in nature. To verify the performances of the proposed design and control scheme of the microgrid, a simulation analysis is conducted using Matlab Simulink. Results indicate proper operation of the designed DC microgrid. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Bahani K., Moujabbir M., Ramdani M.
Title: Prediction of hourly solar radiation using fuzzy clustering and linguistic modifiers
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference of Computer Science and Renewable Energies, ICCSRE 2019
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science Faculty of Sciences and Technics of Mohammedia, Hassan II University Mohammedia, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: Bahani, K., Department of Computer Science Faculty of Sciences and Technics of Mohammedia, Hassan II University Mohammedia, Morocco; Moujabbir, M., Department of Computer Science Faculty of Sciences and Technics of Mohammedia, Hassan II University Mohammedia, Morocco; Ramdani, M., Department of Computer Science Faculty of Sciences and Technics of Mohammedia, Hassan II University Mohammedia, Morocco
Abstract: Solar energy is subject to large temporal and spatial fluctuations. These fluctuations require predicting the share of solar energy and its requirements in energy supply systems for optimal use. These predictions form the basis for various solar management options such as storage and control. However, before predicting the production of solar systems, it is necessary to focus on predicting solar radiation. The global prediction of solar radiation is divided into two broad categories of prediction methods: cloud images associated with physical models and automated learning models. In this paper we present a new leaning MAMDANI fuzzy rules based system FRLC (Fuzzy Rule Learning through Clustering) for solar radiation prediction with meteorological data. FRLC based on linguistic modifiers and fuzzy clustering is compared to the most accurate machine learning algorithms such as multilayer feed-forward neural network, radial basis function neural network, support vector regression, and adaptive neuro-fuzzy inference system. FRLC outperforms all algorithms at interpretability level by offering a linguistic knowledge base to the experts of the domain. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: fuzzy rule-based systems; linguistic modifiers; renewable energy; solar radiation; subtractive clustering
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Forecasting; Fuzzy clustering; Fuzzy neural networks; Fuzzy rules; Inference engines; Learning algorithms; Linguistics; Machine learning; Meteorology; Multilayer neural networks; Radial basis function networks; Solar energy; Solar radiation; Adaptive neuro-fuzzy inference system; Linguistic modifiers; Multilayer feedforward neural networks; Radial basis function neural networks; Renewable energies; Solar radiation predictions; Subtractive clustering; Support vector regression (SVR); Fuzzy inference

Authors: El Boujdaini L., Ait Lahoussine Ouali H., Mezrhab A., Moussaoui M.A.
Title: Techno-economic investigation of parabolic trough solar power plant with indirect molten salt storage
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference of Computer Science and Renewable Energies, ICCSRE 2019
Affiliations: Laboratory of Mechanics and Energy, Mohammed 1st University, Oujda, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: El Boujdaini, L., Laboratory of Mechanics and Energy, Mohammed 1st University, Oujda, Morocco; Ait Lahoussine Ouali, H., Laboratory of Mechanics and Energy, Mohammed 1st University, Oujda, Morocco; Mezrhab, A., Laboratory of Mechanics and Energy, Mohammed 1st University, Oujda, Morocco; Moussaoui, M.A., Laboratory of Mechanics and Energy, Mohammed 1st University, Oujda, Morocco
Abstract: In this paper, we established the mathematical model of a solar parabolic trough plant with a molten salt indirect storage, and then we simulated the model using Matlab software. The reference plant ''Andasol-1" with 50MWe were used to validate the simulated results. After that, we studied the storage size impact on the levelized cost of electricity (LCOE) by developing optimization methods based on hours of storage (TES) and solar multiple (SM). A comparison is achieved for different sites due to the developed option in our code, which gives for any known DNI location the LCOE. We found that the lowest LCOE belongs to Ouarzazate in comparison to Andasol-1 (Spain), Bechar (Algeria), Titaouine (Tunisia) and Oujda (our study case). For Oujda, the different simulated results are approximately the same as the case of Andasol-1 (LCOE is about 0.25 €/KWh with a solar multiple equals to 2). © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: LCOE; Matlab software and Oujda; parabolic trough collector; SM

Ltd, Haidian District Beijing, 100192, China
Abstract: Based on the traditional green power certificate trading system, considering the characteristics and main characteristics of the Internet of vehicles platform, this paper constructs the green power certificate trading system based on the Internet of vehicles platform, and analyzes the green power certificate trading subjects and their coordination trading process in the platform. On this basis, four business models of Internet of vehicles platforms, including the trading platform model, energy storage system model, demand-side management model, and new business service model of electric vehicles, are proposed to adapt to the green power certificate trading market, and the operation mode and revenue source of each mode of dismounted Internet platform are analyzed. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Hanggoro D., Rosyidi L., Sari R.F.
Title: Design and implementation of multi-protocol gateway for internet of things
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 IEEE International Conference on Industry 4.0, Artificial Intelligence, and Communications Technology, IAICT 2019
Affiliations: Faculty of Engineering, Department of Electrical Engineering, Universitas Indonesia, Depok, 16424, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hanggoro, D., Faculty of Engineering, Department of Electrical Engineering, Universitas Indonesia, Depok, 16424, Indonesia; Rosyidi, L., Faculty of Engineering, Department of Electrical Engineering, Universitas Indonesia, Depok, 16424, Indonesia; Sari, R.F., Faculty of Engineering, Department of Electrical Engineering, Universitas Indonesia, Depok, 16424, Indonesia
Abstract: Heterogeneity is one of the top challenges for Internet of Things. One of the cases is the diversity of communication protocol used in IoT devices. This paper discusses the design and implementation of a multi-protocol gateway that can receive several protocols at once, i.e. WiFi, Bluetooth Low Energy and ZigBee from IoT devices. The gateway is powered by a single board computer which is equipped by required transceiver module. A python script is used to control the process in the backend, along with MySQL for data storage and a frontend user interface built by Lazarus. A dashboard that displays the collected data and the network topology is provided to validate the work of the gateway. As the result, the gateway is able to accept all of the three communication protocols at the same time and display the data in real time in the dashboard. The result also shows that each protocol has different delay and packet delivery ratio. The WiFi protocols is found to have the largest delay which is 362 ms, and also the lowest packet delivery ratio which is 97%. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Soeiro T.B., Bauer P.
Title: Fast DC-type electric vehicle charger based on a quasi-direct boost-buck rectifier
Source title: 2019 AEIT International Conference of Electrical and Electronic Technologies for Automotive, AEIT AUTOMOTIVE 2019
Affiliations: Delft University of Technology, Building 36, Mekelweg 4, Delft, Netherlands
Authors with affiliations: Soeiro, T.B., Delft University of Technology, Building 36, Mekelweg 4, Delft, Netherlands; Bauer, P., Delft University of Technology, Building 36, Mekelweg 4, Delft, Netherlands
Abstract: This work presents a DC-type fast electric vehicle battery charger featuring low switching losses. Herein, a conventional three-phase two-level voltage source rectifier with low capacitive energy storage operates with a discontinuous PWM modulation where each phase-legs stops switching for 240° of the grid fundamental period, i.e. only a single phase-leg switch every 60°. In this case, this AC-DC converter loses voltage controllability of the DC-link and thus a buck-type DC-DC converter is cascaded in order to provide the necessary voltage regulation and current limitation for the charging process of the electric vehicle. The presented circuit is benchmarked against other solutions for a designed 50 kW power capability battery charger when considering the charging of a 30 kWh Nissan Leaf. The results show a superior power efficiency of the studied system. © 2019 AEIT.
Author Keywords: Electric Vehicle; Fast Charger; Rectifier
Index Keywords: Charging (batteries); DC-DC converters; Electric automobiles; Electric inverters; Electric losses; Electric vehicles; Rectifying circuits; Secondary batteries; Voltage regulators; Capacitive energy storage; Current limitation; Discontinuous PWM; Electric vehicle batteries; Fast chargers; Fundamental period; Rectifier; Voltage source rectifiers; Electric rectifiers

Authors: Artemenko M.Y., Mykhalskyi V.M., Polishchuk S.Y., Chopyk V.V., Shapoval I.A.
Title: The instantaneous power theory of multiphase power supply systems and its application to energy-saving shunt active filtering
Source title: 2019 IEEE 2nd Ukraine Conference on Electrical and Computer Engineering, UKRCON 2019 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Acoustics and Acoustic Electronics, National Technical University, Igor Sikorsky Ukraine Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, Kyiv, Ukraine; Institute of Electrodynamics, National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Kyiv, Ukraine
Authors with affiliations: Artemenko, M.Y., Department of Acoustics and Acoustic Electronics, National Technical University, Igor Sikorsky Ukraine Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, Kyiv, Ukraine; Mykhalskyi, V.M., Institute of Electrodynamics, National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Kyiv, Ukraine; Polishchuk, S.Y., Institute of Electrodynamics, National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Kyiv, Ukraine; Chopyk, V.V., Institute of Electrodynamics, National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Kyiv, Ukraine; Shapoval, I.A., Institute of Electrodynamics, National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Kyiv, Ukraine
Abstract: In this paper, the instantaneous power theory of multiphase power supply systems has been further developed by substantiating new relations for instantaneous active current and instantaneous apparent power as solutions of the corresponding extreme problems. The application of the formulas of the matrix-vector algebra made it possible to obtain a new decomposition of the load current of the multiphase power system on the instantaneous active current and the inactive current of compensation. It is the theoretical basis for constructing a system of shunt active filtration in real time without the electric energy storage devices with the minimum possible losses. The new calculation ratio for the gain coefficient is obtained for the power loss in the transmission line when using SAF with the specified control strategy. The results of the computer experiment confirm the adequacy of the proposed formulas of the instantaneous power theory of multiphase power systems. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Control strategy; Instantaneous power theory; Minimum power losses; N-phase power system
Index Keywords: Electric losses; Energy conservation; Matrix algebra; Active filtration; Computer experiment; Control strategies; Gain coefficients; Instantaneous power theory; Multi-phase power supply system; Multiphase power systems; Power-losses; Electric power systems

Authors: Jasminská N., Brestovič T., Lázár M., Dobáková R.
Title: Cooling of a metal hydride container with alternate switching between Peltier thermopiles
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: Technical University of Košice, Faculty of Mechanical Engineering, Department of Power Engineering, Vysokoškolská 4, Košice, 042 00, Slovakia
Authors with affiliations: Jasminská, N., Technical University of Košice, Faculty of Mechanical Engineering, Department of Power Engineering, Vysokoškolská 4, Košice, 042 00, Slovakia; Brestovič, T., Technical University of Košice, Faculty of Mechanical Engineering, Department of Power Engineering, Vysokoškolská 4, Košice, 042 00, Slovakia; Lázár, M., Technical University of Košice, Faculty of Mechanical Engineering, Department of Power Engineering, Vysokoškolská 4, Košice, 042 00, Slovakia; Dobáková, R., Technical University of Košice, Faculty of Mechanical Engineering, Department of Power Engineering, Vysokoškolská 4, Košice, 042 00, Slovakia
Abstract: The absorption of hydrogen during the process of the storage thereof in metal hydride containers generates thermal energy. This process occurs due to the dissociation of the hydrogen molecule and the diffusion of the hydrogen atoms into the interstitial space of the crystal lattice of the metal. As a result, it is necessary to provide cooling of this storage unit in order to eliminate the pressure and temperature fluctuations. Therefore, a cooling device was constructed, applying the principle of Peltier thermopiles, which facilitates continuous regulation and optimal temperatures of a metal hydride container. For the purpose of describing the cooling power, a numerical calculation was carried out for constant cooling and for cooling with alternate switching between the Peltier thermopiles. The article also contains a description of experimental measurements of switching between the pairs of Peltier thermopiles in order to confirm the appropriateness of the cooling device control settings. © 2019 Author(s).

Authors: Hečko D., Malcho M., Mičko P., Pafčuga M.
Title: Problems of problems of generation of natural gas hydrates in laboratory conditions
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Power Engineering, University of Zilina, Univerzitná 1, Zilina, 010 26, Slovakia
Authors with affiliations: Hečko, D., Department of Power Engineering, University of Zilina, Univerzitná 1, Zilina, 010 26, Slovakia; Malcho, M., Department of Power Engineering, University of Zilina, Univerzitná 1, Zilina, 010 26, Slovakia; Mičko, P., Department of Power Engineering, University of Zilina, Univerzitná 1, Zilina, 010 26, Slovakia; Pafčuga, M., Department of Power Engineering, University of Zilina, Univerzitná 1, Zilina, 010 26, Slovakia
Abstract: Hydrates have been considered as a potential source of energy for decades, especially for countries with limited access to conventional hydrocarbons or for the strategic interest in creating alternative natural gas reserves. Hydrate is generally a substance containing water and hydrocarbons (or other gases). Natural gas hydrate is found in the solid state, which constitutes about 85% water and 15% gas bound in the clathrate lattice. The gas hydrate can be a great source of energy that begins to be included in the considerations of gas supply for the next decades. In terms of perspective, the accumulation of standard natural gas in the form of synthetically generated hydrates appears to be very advantageous. The storage of natural gas in the form of hydrates and releasing it in the case of peak consumption is beneficial not only in terms of storage capacity, the medium used, but also in terms of the safety of hydrate storage. It is possible to store gas in such a form at relatively high temperatures and low pressures compared to other gaseous hydrocarbon storage technologies. Saving energy in a convenient form for safe storage and its subsequent release is a challenge in processes where energy is needed to accumulate. At present, a high emphasis is placed on the overall efficiency of these processes, in terms of energy use, energy efficiency and energy storage. Hydrates have the potential to provide peak coverage in cogeneration of electricity and heat by natural gas released from hydrates. Hydrate can be produced from a mixture of water and natural gas in a prototype hydrate plant. This paper describes the conditions under which hydrate formation, utilization potential, and experimental equipment design for generating natural gas hydrates. © 2019 Author(s).

Authors: Tefera G., She K., Deeba F., Ahmed A.
Title: Resource-aware decentralized adaptive computational offloading and task-caching for multi-access edge computing
Source title: PervasiveHealth: Pervasive Computing Technologies for Healthcare
Affiliations: School of Information and Software Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Sichuan, Chengdu, China
Authors with affiliations: Tefera, G., School of Information and Software Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Sichuan, Chengdu, China; She, K., School of Information and Software Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Sichuan, Chengdu, China; Deeba, F., School of Information and Software Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Sichuan, Chengdu, China; Ahmed, A., School of Information and Software Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Sichuan, Chengdu, China
Abstract: Smart technologies or IoT devices have been designed to execute intensive applications that request more computational and other computer system resources. However, those devices have a resource constraint. To address the challenge, we adopt Multi- Access Edge Computing which is a new paradigm that transforms and localize Cloud services and capabilities at the Edge of Radio- Access Network based on proximity for mobile subscribers. In this paper, we proposed a Resource-Aware Decentralized Computing and Caching framework for Multi-Access Edge Computing. So, smart end-user devices work collaboratively and independently with resourceful edge devices or peer devices in close proximity during the unreliable network. Moreover, those devices can offload intensive application or access completed cached tasks to provide efficient resource utilization & Quality of User Experience. The drawback is expressed based on Non-Cooperative Game Theory which is NP-hard to solve and we show that the game concedes a Nash Equilibrium. Our Scheme optimizes computational and storage resources efficiently. We have done exhaustive observation the outcome shows that our scheme provides better performance than the conventional scheme in terms of enhanced storage capability, high Quality of User Experience, and low energy consumption. © 2019 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: Cloud Computing; Computational Offloading; Dew Computing; Distributed Computing; Game Theory; Multi-Access Edge Computing

Authors: Singh G., Gómez-Luna J., Mariani G., Oliveira G.F., Corda S., Stuijk S., Mutlu O., Corporaal H.
Title: NAPEL: Near-memory computing application performance prediction via ensemble learning
Source title: Proceedings - Design Automation Conference
Affiliations: Eindhoven University of Technology, Netherlands; ETH Zürich, Chile; IBM Research - Zurich, Switzerland
Authors with affiliations: Singh, G., Eindhoven University of Technology, Netherlands, IBM Research - Zurich, Switzerland; Gómez-Luna, J., ETH Zürich, Chile; Mariani, G., IBM Research - Zurich, Switzerland; Oliveira, G.F., ETH Zürich, Chile; Corda, S., Eindhoven University of Technology, Netherlands, IBM Research - Zurich, Switzerland; Stuijk, S., Eindhoven University of Technology, Netherlands; Mutlu, O., ETH Zürich, Chile; Corporaal, H., Eindhoven University of Technology, Netherlands
Abstract: The cost of moving data between the memory/storage units and the compute units is a major contributor to the execution time and energy consumption of modern workloads in computing systems. A promising paradigm to alleviate this data movement bottleneck is near-memory computing (NMC), which consists of placing compute units close to the memory/storage units. There is substantial research effort that proposesNMCarchitectures and identifiesworkloads that can benefit from NMC. System architects typically use simulation techniques to evaluate the performance and energy consumption of their designs. However, simulation is extremely slow, imposing long times for design space exploration. In order to enable fast early-stage design space exploration of NMC architectures, we need high-level performance and energy models. We present NAPEL, a high-level performance and energy estimation framework for NMC architectures. NAPEL leverages ensemble learning to develop a model that is based on microarchitectural parameters and application characteristics. NAPEL training uses a statistical technique, called design of experiments, to collect representative training data efficiently. NAPEL provides early design space exploration 220× faster than a state-of-the-artNMCsimulator, on average, with error rates of to 8.5% and 11.6% for performance and energy estimations, respectively, compared to the NMC simulator. NAPEL is also capable of making accurate predictions for previously-unseen applications. © 2019 Association for Computing Machinery.
Index Keywords: Computer aided design; Design of experiments; Energy utilization; Green computing; Accurate prediction; Computing applications; Design space exploration; Early stage designs; Energy estimation; Simulation technique; Statistical techniques; System architects; Memory architecture

Authors: Wang Y., Liang S., Li H.
Title: A none-sparse inference accelerator that distills and reuses the computation redundancy in CNNs
Source title: Proceedings - Design Automation Conference
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Computer Architecture, Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, Y., State Key Laboratory of Computer Architecture, Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; Liang, S., State Key Laboratory of Computer Architecture, Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; Li, H., State Key Laboratory of Computer Architecture, Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China
Abstract: Prior research on energy-efficient Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) inference accelerators mostly focus on exploiting the model sparsity, i.e., zero patterns in weight and activations, to reduce the on-chip storage and computation overhead. In this work, we found in addition to zero patterns, a larger group of repetitive patterns and values exists in the working-set of CNN inference task, which is defined as computation redundancy and induces unnecessary performance and storage overhead in CNN accelerators. Based on this observation, we proposed a redundancy-free architecture that detects and eliminates the repetitive computation and storage patterns in CNN for more efficient network inference. The architecture consists of two parts: the off-line parameter analyzer that extracts the repetitive patterns in the 3D tensor of parameters, and the dataflow accelerator. The proposed accelerator at first preprocesses the weight patterns and the dynamically generated activations, and then cache these intermediate results in special P2-cache banks for further usage in convolution or full-connection stage. It is evaluated in experiments that the proposed Cavoluche architecture removes up to 89% of the repetitive operations from the layer inference process and reduce 77% of on-chip storage space to store both redundancy-free weight and activations. It is seen in experiments that the implementation of Cavoluche outperforms the state-of-the-art mobile GPGPU in both performance and energy-efficiency. When compared to the latest sparsity base accelerators, Cavoluche also achieves better operation elimination effects. © 2019 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: Accelerator; Cache; CNN; Sparsity
Index Keywords: Acceleration; Chemical activation; Computer aided design; Convolution; Data flow analysis; Network architecture; Neural networks; Particle accelerators; Program processors; Redundancy; Cache; Computation overheads; Convolutional neural network; Intermediate results; Repetitive computations; Repetitive operations; Repetitive pattern; Sparsity; Energy efficiency

This paper provides information about modeling and control of a Quadrotor. Proportional Integral Derivative (PID) controller is designed for altitude and attitude control of Quadrotor. Abstract: In this paper a comparative analysis of the stored magnetic energy in cylindrical and toroidal superconducting magnetic coils is performed. For a fair comparison, similar dimensions are used for both coils (diameter and cross section), in analytical and numerical modeling. The numerical modeling has been performed using the finite element COMSOL Multiphysics® software. The energy stored in a toroidal coil is compared with an equivalent cylindrical coil and is shown to be higher with 65% and 57% using the analytical and numerical modeling, respectively. Also, the results have highlighted an error of 21 % and 3.7% for the analytical modeling compared to the numerical modeling in case of cylindrical and toroidal magnetic coils, respectively. © 2019 IEEE.
