Authors: Siamwala A., Lochhead Z., Abdulla W.
Title: Environmental noise monitoring using distributed IoT sensor nodes
Source title: ICEIC 2019 - International Conference on Electronics, Information, and Communication
Authors with affiliations: Siamwala, A.; Lochhead, Z.; Abdulla, W.
Abstract: Common issues associated with wireless sensor networks for analysing environmental noise include high power usage, high cost, and limited scalability. In this paper, we present a novel approach to develop an autonomous system for collecting environmental noise information. We designed a system to be highly scalable, easy to use, low-cost, and low-powered to encourage its widespread adoption. Power usage is kept low by investigating the use of Bluetooth Low Energy communication protocol for streaming environmental noise. Beyond merely detecting noise levels, the proposed system can classify the source of the measured noise. Mel-frequency cepstrum coefficients are used to produce features of the noise and model Gaussian mixture models to classify the source of the noise. Information from the system is sent to a cloud storage service in real-time which enables visualization of noise levels, noise sources and battery level of the sensors in our web application. The system was able to reliably collect information over a 4-week field test. It has an average classification accuracy of 72% when subjected to four common environmental noise sources. © 2019 Institute of Electronics and Information Engineers (IEIE).
Index Keywords: Noise pollution; Sensor nodes; Autonomous systems; Bluetooth low energies (BTLE); Classification accuracy; Cloud storage services; Environmental noise; Gaussian Mixture Model; Mel frequency cepstrum coefficients; WEB application; Internet of things

Authors: Jabbar K., Bjørn P.
Title: Blockchain assemblages whiteboxing technology and transforming infrastructural imaginaries
Source title: Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, University of Copenhagen, Copenhagen, Denmark
Authors with affiliations: Jabbar, K., Department of Computer Science, University of Copenhagen, Copenhagen, Denmark; Bjørn, P., Department of Computer Science, University of Copenhagen, Copenhagen, Denmark
Abstract: In this paper we unpack empirical data from two domains within the Blockchain information infrastructure: The cryptocurrency trading domain, and the energy domain. Through these accounts we introduce the relational concepts of Blockchain Assemblages and Whiteboxing. Blockchain assemblages comprise configurations of digital and analogue artefacts that are entangled with imaginaries about the current and future state of the Blockchain information infrastructure. Rather than being a black box, Blockchain assemblages alternate between being dynamic and stable entities. We propose Whiteboxing as the sociomaterial process which drives blockchain assemblages in their dynamic state to be (re)configured, while related artefacts and imaginaries are simultaneously transformed, creating dynamic representations. Whiteboxing is triggered during disconfirming events when representations are discovered as problematic. Complementing existing historical accounts demonstrating technologies in the making, the contribution of this paper, proposes whiteboxing as an analytical concept which allows us to unpack how contemporary technologies are created through entrepreneurial activities. © 2019 Copyright held by the owner/author(s).
Author Keywords: Assemblages; Blockchain; Cryptocurrency; Embeddedness; Entrepreneurship; Information infrastructures; Renewable energy; Sociomaterial
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Electronic money; Human computer interaction; Human engineering; Quantum entanglement; Assemblages; Embeddedness; Entrepreneurship; Information infrastructures; Renewable energies; Sociomaterial; Blockchain

Authors: Kolb T., Dineva A., Vajda I.
Title: Rotor Fault Detection under Fast-varying Dynamic Load based on Adaptive Morlet Wavelet Transform
Source title: SACI 2019 - IEEE 13th International Symposium on Applied Computational Intelligence and Informatics, Proceedings
Affiliations: Institute of Automation, Kálmán Kandó Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Óbuda University, Budapest, Hungary
Authors with affiliations: Kolb, T., Institute of Automation, Kálmán Kandó Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Óbuda University, Budapest, Hungary; Dineva, A., Institute of Automation, Kálmán Kandó Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Óbuda University, Budapest, Hungary; Vajda, I., Institute of Automation, Kálmán Kandó Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Óbuda University, Budapest, Hungary
Abstract: The increasing progress of Electric Vehicles (EVs) is generating considerable interest in terms of Fault Detection and Diagnosis (FDD) methods of electrical machines and drive systems. The FDD techniques are well established for steady state modes, however the continuous intermittent operation of EVs demands the development of new fault recognition approaches which are able to cope with the effects of large transient dynamics. In this paper an adaptive Morlet Wavelet-based method is proposed which is capable of on-line fault detection of induction motors under fast-varying transient regime via Motor Current Signature Analysis. The fundamental frequency of the phase current is removed by using the Hilbert transform. After, the Adaptive Morlet Wavelet Transform is performed in a sliding window. In each window the central frequency of the Morlet Wavelet is adaptively fitted to the estimated error frequency of the phase current determined by using rotor speed measurement data. The State-of-Health of the motor is evaluated by the Wavelet index composed from the adaptively filtered residual current and the original signal's energy. Simulation investigations are performed with the motor operating load conditions prescribed by the New European Driving Cycle (NEDC). The results validate the efficiency and applicability of the proposed method in diagnosis of rotor bar faults. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: adaptive filtering; broken rotor bar; Fault Detection and Diagnosis; fault frequency; Morlet Wavelet; Motor Current Signature Analysis (MCSA); transient operation
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Dynamic loads; Induction motors; Intelligent computing; Traction motors; Wavelet transforms; Electric Vehicles (EVs); Fault detection and diagnosis; Fundamental frequencies; Intermittent operation; Morlet wavelet transform; Motor current signature analysis; New european driving cycles; On-line fault detection; Fault detection

Authors: Oladejo I.O., Folly K.A.
Title: Management of Grid-Connected Micro-grid Using Game Theory Approach
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 Southern African Universities Power Engineering Conference/Robotics and Mechatronics/Pattern Recognition Association of South Africa, SAUPEC/RobMech/PRASA 2019
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Enginering, University of Cape Town, Cape Town, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Oladejo, I.O., Department of Electrical Enginering, University of Cape Town, Cape Town, South Africa; Folly, K.A., Department of Electrical Enginering, University of Cape Town, Cape Town, South Africa
Abstract: A micro-grid consists of distributed energy resources (such as solar PV, Wind turbine, and fuel cell), interconnected load and storage sources. For the micro-grid to achieve better economic outcomes, the connected homes need to cooperate in order to obtain mutual benefit. Therefore, a method based on cooperative game theory, the generalized Nash bargaining solution is proposed. The novelty of the proposed method lies in the new profit distribution to favour certain participant by specifying different values of the negotiation power in the objective function. To demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed work, a case study of 6 sites (buildings of different types, which may be shops, dwelling places and schools with their micro-sources results in micro-grid) is presented. A solution approach based on Teaching-Learning-based Optimization (TLBO) is proposed to achieve optimal results. To validate the feasibility of the method, the results obtained TLBO were compared with genetic algorithm (GA), which shows that the TLBO method is robust and capable of giving quality solution efficiently in solving energy management problem. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Cooperative game theory; Fairness; Micro-grid; Nash bargaining Solution; TLBO Introduction
Index Keywords: Energy efficiency; Energy resources; Fuel cells; Fuel storage; Genetic algorithms; Cooperative game theory; Distributed Energy Resources; Management problems; Nash bargaining solution; Objective functions; Profit distributions; Solution approach; Teaching-learning-based optimizations; Game theory

Authors: Zahur M.I., Rahman M.S., Akther A., Alam K.M.
Title: An IoT Based Green Waste Management System for Bangladesh
Source title: 1st International Conference on Advances in Science, Engineering and Robotics Technology 2019, ICASERT 2019
Affiliations: Khulna University, DGTED Lab, Khulna, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Zahur, M.I., Khulna University, DGTED Lab, Khulna, Bangladesh; Rahman, M.S., Khulna University, DGTED Lab, Khulna, Bangladesh; Akther, A., Khulna University, DGTED Lab, Khulna, Bangladesh; Alam, K.M., Khulna University, DGTED Lab, Khulna, Bangladesh
Abstract: Internet-of-Things (IoT) has introduced new avenues of application development towards the Smart City vision. Urbanization is a common trend of current society and its rapid growth demands smarter solutions for waste management in the cities. A probable solution of this problem is the adoption of IoT based waste management systems. In this case, we have to build smart bins that will be connected with the cloud setup of the city authority and will provide constant updates of the waste status of the bins. A critical issue in this case is to provide power to this smart bin establishments. This problem can further be handled by incorporating reusable energy sources such as solar panels with the smart bin setups. In this paper, we design and develop an IoT and cloud based framework for waste management. We have designed and developed smart bins that are intermittently connected to the cloud data storage to share their waste status. City authority is given required web interfaces to manage smart bin installations. Garbage collectors are given mobile applications to help planning garbage collection routes dynamically. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: The use of Electric Vehicles (EV) as transport is an eco-sustainable and plausible way to protect the reserved energy of developing countries such as Bangladesh. Being a tropical country, Bangladesh is remarkable for its abundance of solar radiation. By using this enormous amount of renewable energy, we can reduce the current power crisis. At present, EVs are running in Bangladesh are auto rickshaw and easy bike. Although these easy bikes and auto rickshaw seem eco - friendly, they are partly responsible for environmental pollution as they use grid power. Under this circumstance, the establishment of Solar Charge Station (SCS) for EVs will be a perfect solution. Because it reduces the additional pressure on the grid by charging directly the EVs and thus saves the environment is polluted. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Wang H., Jia L.
Title: Big data knowledge mining based operation parameters optimization of thermal power
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 8th Data Driven Control and Learning Systems Conference, DDCLS 2019
Affiliations: College of Mechatronics Engineering and Automation, Shanghai University, Department of Automation, Shanghai, 200444, China; Shanghai Key Laboratory of Power Station Automation Technology, College of Mechatronics Engineering and Automation, Shanghai University, Department of Automation, Shanghai, 200444, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, H., College of Mechatronics Engineering and Automation, Shanghai University, Department of Automation, Shanghai, 200444, China; Jia, L., Shanghai Key Laboratory of Power Station Automation Technology, College of Mechatronics Engineering and Automation, Shanghai University, Department of Automation, Shanghai, 200444, China
Abstract: With the development of electric-power industry, a large amount of historical data of thermal power units are accumulated, conventional optimization methods of operation parameters have the limitations in storage and computation for massive data. To solve the problem, this paper proposes a big data analysis architecture for thermal power based on data processing flow. According to this architecture, a big data mining method for operation parameters optimization based on parallel association rules is presented. Firstly, a new distributed adaptive K-means algorithm is proposed to realize the classification of working conditions based on external constraints, which can improve the computing efficiency and avoid the defect of determining the division number artificially. Then, Spark-based FP-growth algorithm is applied to mine the strong association rules under various working conditions, thus the optimization target values of operation parameters can be obtained by the best strong association rules. Lastly, the excavated optimization target values constitute the historical knowledge database to optimize the real-time operating parameters. The experiment results show that the proposed method in this paper is effective, and can improve the accuracy of operation parameters optimization. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Big data architecture; Big data of thermal power; Parallel association rule; Parameter optimization
Index Keywords: Association rules; Big data; Data mining; Digital storage; Electric energy storage; Electric industry; Fossil fuel power plants; K-means clustering; Learning systems; Parallel architectures; Computing efficiency; Conventional optimization; Data architectures; Electric power industries; Operating parameters; Parallel association; Parameter optimization; Thermal power; Parameter estimation

Authors: Munkhtur Z., Bat-Orshikh B., Bat-Orgil T., Dugarjav B.
Title: Technical evaluation of utility-interactive photovoltaic power generation system with energy storage based on the experimental setup
Source title: ITEC Asia-Pacific 2019 - 2019 IEEE Transportation Electrification Conference and Expo, Asia-Pacific: New Paradigm Shift, Sustainable E-Mobility
Affiliations: National University of Mongolia, Dept. of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia
Authors with affiliations: Munkhtur, Z., National University of Mongolia, Dept. of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia; Bat-Orshikh, B., National University of Mongolia, Dept. of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia; Bat-Orgil, T., National University of Mongolia, Dept. of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia; Dugarjav, B., National University of Mongolia, Dept. of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia
Abstract: There is harmful air-pollution which mainly caused by raw-coal firing for heating purpose in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Although dominantly utilization of electricity-powered warmers is good solution for this issue as same as highly developed countries, local power system currently in use has already been in over-stress during sundown interval as most of residents actively use home electric appliances. Therefore, the authors intend to lessen the polluted-ingredients of urban area air by using latest technology development. The distributed-generation system with renewable source and battery storage can be the bright solution. Within this paper, an appropriate configuration of the utility-interactive photovoltaic (PV) power generation system with energy storage (ES) for locals, and its operation principle are discussed. Subsequently, an adapted operation algorithm which gives an economical advantage, and contributes for grid impact is applied. Then, the experimental setup to verify the feasibility of recommended structure and operation algorithm is implemented. Development of the PV power generation system with ES will lead to a reduction in peak power usage, and lessened amount of CO2 emissions is expected to be resulted. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Distributed generation system; Home energy system; Polluted-air; PV system; Utility-Interactive system
Index Keywords: Distributed power generation; Electric power system interconnection; Electric utilities; Photovoltaic cells; Solar energy; Distributed generation system; Energy systems; Interactive system; Photovoltaic power generation systems; Power generation systems; PV power generation systems; PV system; Technical evaluation; Electric energy storage

Authors: Niu G., Wu M., Kou L., Hou X., Qu X., Sun L., Li Y.
Title: Economic Analysis of User-end Grid Connected Energy Storage System Based on the Sensitivity Analysis of Battery Price
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; School of Mechanical Electronic and Information Engineering, China University of Mining and Technology Beijing (CUMTB), Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Niu, G., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Wu, M., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Kou, L., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Hou, X., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Qu, X., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Sun, L., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Li, Y., School of Mechanical Electronic and Information Engineering, China University of Mining and Technology Beijing (CUMTB), Beijing, China
Abstract: With the rapid development of the renewable energy system, distributed energy supply system, micro-grid and smart grid, the need for energy storage in the energy market has become more and more imminent. In recent years, the battery energy storage has had a rapid growth. Most of the battery energy storages are installed at the user-end. It is important for the user to evaluate the economy of the ESS systematically for the economic analysis and evaluation of the energy storage system (ESS) can provide guarantee for the profitability of investment project. In this paper, an economic analysis of user- end grid connected ESS is made, which is based on the sensitivity analysis of battery price. The cost composition and revenue model of the user-end ESS are studied systematically, and the IPP, ROI and NII are introduced into the economic analysis and evaluation of the ESS. Based on a case study, the influence of the battery price change on the cost and the economy of the user-end ESS is analyzed through a sensitivity analysis of battery price. Our researches show that the battery cost reduction has a significantly impact on the economy of the user-end ESS. It will be a principal factor to promote the development of the energy storage industry. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery price; cost composition; economic analysis; energy storage system; revenue analysis
Index Keywords: Cost benefit analysis; Cost reduction; Economic analysis; Electric batteries; Electric power transmission networks; Investments; Renewable energy resources; Sensitivity analysis; Smart power grids; Analysis and evaluation; Battery energy storage; battery price; Distributed energies; Energy storage systems; Investment projects; Principal factors; Renewable energy systems; Battery storage

Authors: Yu L., Zhang Z., Wang W., Liu Y.
Title: Study of the Hierarchical Control System for DC Micro-grid
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: School of Electronic Engineering, Dong Guan University of Technology, Dongguan, China; College of Mechatronics and Control Engineering, Shenzhen University, Shenzhen, China
Authors with affiliations: Yu, L., School of Electronic Engineering, Dong Guan University of Technology, Dongguan, China; Zhang, Z., School of Electronic Engineering, Dong Guan University of Technology, Dongguan, China; Wang, W., School of Electronic Engineering, Dong Guan University of Technology, Dongguan, China; Liu, Y., College of Mechatronics and Control Engineering, Shenzhen University, Shenzhen, China
Abstract: In order to better realize the plug and play function of various distributed energy sources (photovoltaic, storage batteries, etc.) in the DC micro-grid, improve energy conversion efficiency and improve DC side bus voltage performance. The layered control strategy introduced contains two layers: the new energy in the inner layer of the micro-grid is maximized by the maximum power tracking control, and the energy storage unit uses the voltage leveling control to ensure the stability of the DC side bus voltage; The bidirectional vector decoupling control includes voltage and current double closed loop control, and uses d-q coordinate axis transformation to control DC voltage and power factor to solve the problem of bidirectional flow of power during grid connection. This paper gives a detailed theoretical analysis and design method for each layer control. Simulation results demonstrate the feasibility and effectiveness of the proposed method. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Peng J., Meng J., Wang Y., Song M.
Title: Research on Virtual Synchronous Generator Control Strategy Based on the Battery State of Charge
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System With Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, 071003, China
Authors with affiliations: Peng, J., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System With Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, 071003, China; Meng, J., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System With Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, 071003, China; Wang, Y., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System With Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, 071003, China; Song, M., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System With Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, 071003, China
Abstract: The rotational inertia of the power grid is reduced due to the high penetration level of distributed generator (DG) in the system. Virtual synchronous generator (VSG) technology has a prominent advantage as an effective way to solve this problem, but it is still constrained by the energy storage system. Firstly, a virtual synchronous generator control strategy based on battery state of charge (SOC-VSG) according to the actual working conditions is proposed in this paper. The virtual inertia is adjusted according to the state of charge of the battery, and it can avoid over-charging or over-discharging and prolong the service life of the battery. Secondly, the system stable operating boundary conditions and the setting principle of control parameters are proposed in this paper. Finally, a four-terminal network model with battery VSG unit is built, and the validity of the proposed control strategy is verified by the controller-level hardware-in-the-loop experimental test platform. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: stability of the system; state of charge; virtual inertia; VSG control
Index Keywords: Battery management systems; Charging (batteries); Electric machine control; Electric power transmission networks; Smart power grids; Synchronous generators; System stability; Battery state of charge; Control parameters; Distributed generators; Energy storage systems; Hard-ware-in-the-loop; Rotational inertia; State of charge; virtual inertia; Secondary batteries

Authors: Lu Q.-Y., Tan Y., Duan L.-J., Yang Y.-G.
Title: Virtual Power Plant Model for the Cluster of Household Prosumers Based on Minkowski Sum
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: Power dispatch and control center, Guangdong Power Grid Company Lmt, Guangzhou, China; Electrical Engineering Department, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Lu, Q.-Y., Power dispatch and control center, Guangdong Power Grid Company Lmt, Guangzhou, China; Tan, Y., Power dispatch and control center, Guangdong Power Grid Company Lmt, Guangzhou, China; Duan, L.-J., Electrical Engineering Department, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Yang, Y.-G., Power dispatch and control center, Guangdong Power Grid Company Lmt, Guangzhou, China
Abstract: With the great integration of distributed generation and practical control strategies as demand response, household prosumers are willing to take part in the day-ahead dispatch of distribution network. However, managing enormous amount of household prosumers with individually low controllable power becomes a huge challenge to the distribution system operator. In this paper, we propose a virtual power plant model for aggregating household prosumers into a simplified dispatch-able model. The feasible region for aggregated power of the household prosumers is contracted to a pyramid by means of Minkowski Sum, which represents an operational region for a power plant, and this model is then uploaded to distribution system operator. By using the aggregated model, distribution system operator no longer need to communicate with each household prosumer and to process a lot of individual constraints, but only use the virtual power plant model in day-ahead dispatch optimization. We take heat pump, electric vehicle, energy storage and photovoltaic into consideration and simulations show the effectiveness of the proposed model. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: distribution network; household prosumer; Minkowski Sum; virtual power plant
Index Keywords: Electric power distribution; Electric power transmission networks; Heating; Power plants; Smart power grids; Aggregated modeling; Day-ahead dispatches; Distribution systems; Minkowski sum; Operational regions; Practical controls; Prosumer; Virtual power plants; Electric load dispatching

Authors: Fu Y., Li Z., Ge X., Zhang Z.
Title: Optimal Operation of Hybrid AC/DC Distribution Network Based on Two-Stage Robust Optimization Model and Corrective Control
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; School of Logistics Engineering, Shanghai Martime University, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Fu, Y., School of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; Li, Z., School of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; Ge, X., School of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; Zhang, Z., School of Logistics Engineering, Shanghai Martime University, Shanghai, China
Abstract: Hybrid AC/DC distribution network (HADDN) will be the development trend of smart grid. This paper presents an optimal operation method for hybrid AC/DC distribution network to achieve safe and economic operation, in the case of uncertain renewable energy (RES) output and load demand. The proposed model is formulated based on a novel two-stage robust model. The first stage of the model optimizes the work states of the on-load tap changers (OLTC), capacitor banks (CBs) and energy storages (ESs) at one cycle. The second stage of the model optimizes the AC/DC converter stations (CSs) output to suppress the overvoltage problem and further reduce the operating cost by using corrective control policy. Furthermore, this paper adopts an ambiguity set to represent uncertainties of RESs and load demand, which makes the model less conservative and also shortens the model solving time. Then, the proposed model can be converted into the mixed integer second-order cone programming (MISCOP) problem, which can be solved by the delayed column-and-constraint generation algorithm. Finally, case study shows that this method can effectively realize safe and economic operation of the HADDN, which is obviously superior to other mainstream methods in reducing operation cost and restraining overvoltage problem. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: AC/DC distribution network; converter station; corrective control and robust model
Index Keywords: Cost reduction; Electric power transmission networks; Electrolysis; Integer programming; Operating costs; Smart power grids; Voltage control; Constraint generation; Converter station; Corrective control; Economic operations; On-load tap changers; Robust modeling; Robust optimization models; Second-order cone programming; Rectifying circuits

Authors: Gu S., Qian K., Li J., Song J., Shen H.
Title: Energy Management Strategy of Smart Residential Community Considering Aggregated Air-conditioning Loads
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: Suzhou Power Supply Company, State Grid Corporation of China, Suzhou, China; NARI Technology Development Co. Ltd, NARI Group Corporation, State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China

Ltd, NARI Group Corporation, State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Shen, H., NARI Technology Development Co. Ltd, NARI Group Corporation, State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China
Abstract: A smart residential community energy management strategy considering aggregated air-conditioning loads is proposed in this paper, aiming at the problem of comprehensive scheduling of multiple demand-side resources of smart residential community. Firstly, an approximate aggregation model of air conditioning load grouping is developed. On this basis, the aggregation response potential of air conditioning loads under temperature control mode is evaluated. Then, a smart energy management model for residential community considering the uncertainty of air conditioning response is established. The optimal operation of the air conditioning load and energy storage device is optimized to achieve the lowest cost of residential electricity consumption. Finally, the simulation analysis shows that the energy management strategy proposed in this paper can significantly reduce the cost of electricity and improve the load characteristics. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Yan Y., Lin Z., Wen F., Palu I., Chen X., Zheng W., Zhang L.
Title: Optimal Operation Strategy for an Integrated Low-Carbon Energy System in Coupled Electricity and Natural Gas Markets
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; Department of Electrical Power, Engineering and Mechatronics, Tallinn University of Technology, Estonia; State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Co. Ltd., Hangzhou, 310007, China; State Grid Zhejiang Economic Research Institute, Hangzhou, 310008, China
Authors with affiliations: Yan, Y., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; Lin, Z., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; Wen, F., Department of Electrical Power, Engineering and Mechatronics, Tallinn University of Technology, Estonia; Palu, I., Department of Electrical Power, Engineering and Mechatronics, Tallinn University of Technology, Estonia; Chen, X., State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Co. Ltd., Hangzhou, 310007, China; Zheng, W., State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Co. Ltd., Hangzhou, 310007, China; Zhang, L., State Grid Zhejiang Economic Research Institute, Hangzhou, 310008, China
Abstract: The coordination of electricity and natural gas systems has ever been intensifying due to a growing share of natural gas-fired generating units in electricity production. Accordingly, concerns of the interrelationship between the coupled electricity and natural gas markets are emerging. Given this background, an Integrated Energy System (IES) with gas turbines, combined heat and power systems (CHP), distributed generation units, power-to-gas (P2G) facilities and multi-energy storage systems (ESSs) is first described. The operation strategy for the IES is investigated in a low-carbon context. Then, the Copula method is employed to model the joint probability distribution of electricity and natural gas prices. An optimal operation strategy of the IES is proposed to minimize the total operating cost, with the interdependence structure of electricity and natural gas prices well taken into account. Finally, a solution approach and case studies are presented, and the effectiveness of the proposed method demonstrated. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Yuan L.
Title: Optimization Operation of Multi-energy Complementary System based on Interval Model
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: NARI Group Corporation, State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, NARI Research Institute, Nan Jing, China
Authors with affiliations: Yuan, L., NARI Group Corporation, State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, NARI Research Institute, Nan Jing, China
Abstract: It has become an inevitable choice for the development of the energy industry to build a distributed multienergy flow co-generation system. It forms a multi-energy complementary co-generation system by coupling cold, heat, gas and electricity through energy production, transmission, conversion, supply, storage, energy using equipment and protection, measurement and control equipment. This paper is based on interval theory to describe the uncertainties of cold, hot and electric load, distributed energy output and operating conditions, using the transfer matrix to construct the relationship between the input and output of multiple energy sources, and the coupling modeling of the multi-energy complementary system. Considering the impact environment, economy and other factors, multi-objective optimization is carried out for the system. The interval linear programming based on affine operation is used to solve the model, which can effectively solve the problem that the interval operation is too conservative, and simulated verify the validity and rationality of the model and method. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: affine arithmetic; coupling modeling; interval theory; multi-energy complementarity; transfer matrix

Title: Mid Long Term Optimized Dispatching of Virtual Power Plant Based on Weighted Kilowatt Hour Battery Loss Model
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Liaoning Electric Power CO LTD, Power Economic Research Institute, Shenyang, 110015, China; State Grid Jiangsu Electric Power Engineering Consulting Co., Ltd, Nanjing, 210008, China
Authors with affiliations: Tianqi, L., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power CO LTD, Power Economic Research Institute, Shenyang, 110015, China; Heyan, Z., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power CO LTD, Power Economic Research Institute, Shenyang, 110015, China; Peng, Y., State Grid Jiangsu Electric Power Engineering Consulting Co., Ltd, Nanjing, 210008, China; Chuang, Y., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power CO LTD, Power Economic Research Institute, Shenyang, 110015, China; Zhe, N., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power CO LTD, Power Economic Research Institute, Shenyang, 110015, China; Xue, X., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power CO LTD, Power Economic Research Institute, Shenyang, 110015, China; Zheng, G., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power CO LTD, Power Economic Research Institute, Shenyang, 110015, China; Xiao, P., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power CO LTD, Power Economic Research Institute, Shenyang, 110015, China
Abstract: Given the relatively small installed capacity of virtual power plants, the power market trading model can be a bilateral joint venture model. That is to say, the virtual power plant also participates in the trading of the current power market while signing the bilateral trade contract. In this model, operators need to determine in advance the power that needs to be traded in the bilateral contract with the user or power retailer. At the same time, virtual power plant operators can also buy and sell electricity as price receivers in the day's electricity market. Due to the contribution of the wind power plant, the output of the solar photovoltaic power plant and the recent market price are all random variables[1]-[4]. Therefore, the virtual power plant operator obtains the optimal scheduling strategy through a random planning method. In addition, the operator considers the battery loss model based on the weighted kilowatt hour method in this example to analyze the impact of the battery energy system loss on the scheduling decision, and on this basis, to increase the service life of the battery energy storage system. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery energy storage system; Battery loss model; optimal scheduling strategy; Virtual power plant; Weighted kilowatt-hour method

Authors: Hui H., Zhao M., Su J., Liu W.
Title: Capacity Allocation Optimization of Components in Regional Integrated Micro-energy System
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Hui, H., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Zhao, M., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Su, J., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Liu, W., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China
Abstract: Through realizing the mutual supply of power, gas, heating, cooling and other energy systems, regional integrated micro-energy system (RIMS) could make full use of the absorption capacity of renewable energy, and improve the comprehensive utilization rate of energy. The capacity allocation of components is the key content of RIMS design. This paper establishes an optimization model with the objective of minimizing the cost of unit productivity and constraints of energy balance, equipment outputs and charging & discharging power of energy storage devices. A case of RIMS was studied to verify the model. Simulation results show that the proposed capacity allocation optimization model could effectively reduce the cost of unit productivity, reduce peak-valley difference of various types of loads and improve utilization efficiency of clean energy. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: capacity allocation; regional integrated micro-energy system; the cost of unit productivity

Authors: Saatwong P., Suwankawin S.
Title: An Interoperable Building Energy Management System with IEEE1888 Open Protocol for Peak-Load Shaving
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: Power Electronic Research Laboratory, Smart Grid Research Unit, Chulalongkorn University, Bangkok, Thailand
Authors with affiliations: Saatwong, P., Power Electronic Research Laboratory, Smart Grid Research Unit, Chulalongkorn University, Bangkok, Thailand; Suwankawin, S., Power Electronic Research Laboratory, Smart Grid Research Unit, Chulalongkorn University, Bangkok, Thailand
Abstract: A peak-load shaving is implemented for a Building Energy Management System (BEMS). The IEEE1888 open protocol is adopted to facilitate the interoperability capability through the TCP/IP network. The data structure is determined by the Facility Information Access Protocol (FIAP). The operation of equipped Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) is optimized from the analytical load-forecast model. The peak-load-shaving application is developed with a 15-minute on-line processing. The real-world BEMS is demonstrated by a test-bed building at Chulalongkorn University, Thailand; where the significant loads are the distributed air-conditioning systems. Experimental results are gathered; the work-day load forecast is conducted for two weeks and the optimized operation of a 5.76 kW/ 14.4 kWh BESS is examined accordingly, and up to 4 kW of peak load is successfully shaved out of 50-kW peak demand. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: BEMS; BESS; IEEE1888 open protocol; implementation; Peak-load shaving
Index Keywords: Air conditioning; Digital storage; Electric power plant loads; Electric power transmission networks; Energy management; Interoperability; Smart power grids; BEMS; BESS; implementation; Open protocols; Peak load; Energy management systems

Authors: Tan Z., Zhai Y., Wang F.
Title: Research on Improving the Operation Stability of Wind Farms Connected to Power Grid by Using VSC-HVDC Containing SMES
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, China
Authors with affiliations: Tan, Z., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, China; Zhai, Y., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, China; Wang, F., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, China
Abstract: Due to the volatility and intermittent nature of wind energy, the impact of wind power access on the stable operation of the power grid is particularly prominent. In this paper, this problem can be solved by using VSC-HVDC technology containing superconducting magnetic energy storage (SMES). SMES is connected in parallel on the DC bus of VSC-HVDC system. According to the mathematical model of VSC-HVDC system in d-q synchronous rotating coordinate system and PWM technology, the direct current control strategy of converter station and SMES is designed. In PSCAD/EMTDC, a simulation model of wind farm with asynchronous wind turbines connected to the grid via SMES and VSC-HVDC system is built. The simulation results show that the topology and control strategy proposed in this paper can not only effectively smooth the wind power fluctuation, but also improve the transient stability of the wind farm. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Huang Y., Li P., Wang W., Dong L.
Title: Capacity Optimization of Battery Energy Storage System in Multi-energy Complementary System Based on Time Series Simulation Method
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control, Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Company, Xining, China
Authors with affiliations: Huang, Y., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control, Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Li, P., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control, Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Wang, W., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control, Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Dong, L., State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Company, Xining, China
Abstract: Constructing multi-energy complementary system is a promising way to promote the utilization of renewable energy. This paper proposes a novel method based on time series simulation technology to optimize capacity of battery energy storage system in the multi-energy complementary system with wind power, photovoltaic and concentrating solar power. An optimization model is established to maximize the equivalent uniform annual profit of the system with considering operation constraints of power plants and renewable energy curtailment rate. To make full use of complementary characteristics of the renewable energy, the power rating and battery storage capacity are then optimized coordinately based on hourly wind and solar power outputs in a year. Case studies are conducted on a multi-energy complementary system of China with wind power, photovoltaic, concentrating solar power and battery. Optimization results indicate that the proposed method can fully utilize the complementary characteristics and provide the optimal battery capacities. Sensitivity analyses also show that the proposed method can obtain the threshold of generation price for the project. Overall, the testing results verify the effectiveness and applicability of the proposed method. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery energy storage; capacity optimization; concentrating power plant; Multi-energy complementary system; time series simulation

Authors: Li T., Liu Z., Chai Y., Xiang Y., Liu J., Li Z.
Title: Automatic Simulation of Active Distribution Network Based on Multi-Agent Technology
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Fujian Electric Power Company, Fuzhou, China; State Grid Fujian Electric Power Research Institute, Fuzhou, China; College of Electrical Engineering and Information Technology, Sichuan University, Chengdu, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, T., State Grid Fujian Electric Power Company, Fuzhou, China; Liu, Z., State Grid Fujian Electric Power Research Institute, Fuzhou, China; Chai, Y., College of Electrical Engineering and Information Technology, Sichuan University, Chengdu, China; Xiang, Y., College of Electrical Engineering and Information Technology, Sichuan University, Chengdu, China; Liu, J., College of Electrical Engineering and Information Technology, Sichuan University, Chengdu, China; Li, Z., College of Electrical Engineering and Information Technology, Sichuan University, Chengdu, China
Abstract: With the high increasing penetration of renewable energy, it is difficult to meet the investment development requirements of active distribution network with multi-agent access by traditional way. Therefore, a model of operation sample automation simulation based on multi-agent and technical path is proposed in this paper. The agent models are built with the characteristics of DG, energy storage (ES) and flexible loads, it proposed an automation coordinated strategy by grid agent guidance in this paper. At the same time, in order to improve the utilization efficiency of multi-agent in active distribution network, the model considers load growth and the change of technology path to analyze the economic operation ability under different schemes. The results of the model are verified which by following the development of technology path to realize the simulation of long-time scale of active distribution network. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Automation simulation; Dynamic coordination; Load growth model; Multi-Agent technology; Technical path
Index Keywords: Automation; Electric power transmission networks; Investments; Smart power grids; Automation simulation; Dynamic coordination; Load growth; Multi-agent technologies; Technical path; Multi agent systems

Authors: Wang H., Gao R., Yang P., Ren Z.
Title: Integrated operation mode of grid-connected microgrid considering double-layer demand response
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: Guangdong Key Laboratory of Clean Energy Technology, School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, 510000, China; National-Local Joint Engineering Laboratory for Wind Power Control and Integration Technology, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, 510000, China

Abstract: The market-oriented operation mode of grid-connected microgrid is crucial to improve the operator's revenue and promote the large-scale development of grid-connected microgrid. An integrated operation mode considering double-layer demand response is proposed in this paper. In this mode, the microgrid operator is sole and can carry out multi-type purchase and sale of electricity, self-declaration of maximum demand and double-layer demand response, and achieve the goal of economic optimization by internal "source-load-storage" unified coordination and optimal operation. Day-ahead optimal scheduling models of grid-connected microgrid under the proposed operation mode and decentralized operation mode are established and solved by CPLEX. The annual revenue of the operator is calculated considering the multiple scenes of distributed generator output and electricity price. An actual microgrid system containing wind turbine, photovoltaic generator and energy storage system is taken as an example to verify the superiority of the proposed operation mode. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: double-layer demand response; grid-connected microgrid; integrated operation mode; multiple scenes
Index Keywords: Electric power transmission networks; Smart power grids; Demand response; Distributed generators; Economic optimization; Energy storage systems; Integrated operation modes; Large-scale development; Micro grid; multiple scenes; Electric energy storage

Authors: Yunfei Z., Yingxiang W., Jiong Y., Chenying Y., Weiwei L., Yue N., Zhi C., Zhijian H.
Title: An Integrated Operation Strategy of Energy Storage System in ADN Planning
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: Economic Research Institute, State Grid Hubei Electric Power Company Limited, Wuhan, China; School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China

Abstract: This paper proposes an operation strategy of energy storage system, considering the effect of gaining profit and peak load shifting. In the strategy, the charging-discharging periods are divided based on the TOU price and the charging or discharging power in each period is determined by the actual operation of distribution network. This paper applies the strategy to Active Distribution Network (ADN) planning and establishes a bi-level programming model that includes investment layer and operation layer. Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) is selected as the research object and improved particle swarm optimization algorithm is used to solve the problem. The simulation results of an improved IEEE 33-bus distribution system and the comparison with an existing BESS operation strategy verify that the proposed strategy obtains better economic benefits and the effect of peak load shifting, and it is conducive to improving DG permeability. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Active distribution network planning; Battery energy storage system; Charging-discharging strategy

Authors: Xu X., Hu W., Cao D., Huang Q., Chen Z.
Title: Operational Optimization of Wind Farm Integrated Battery/Electrolyzer in Electricity Market Considering Fluctuation Penalty
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: School of Mechanical and Electrical Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, 611731, China; Department of Energy Technology, Aalborg University, Aalborg, 9220, Denmark

Abstract: With the liberalization of the electricity market and the rapid development of renewable energy technology, more and more renewable energy power stations such as wind farms participate in the electricity market. These renewable energy power stations are using the entire power systems as their storage which will eventually influence the safe and stable operation of the power grid. In order to address this problem, the electricity market considers the fluctuation penalty which can incentivize investors to take measures on fluctuation reduction. Therefore, this paper proposes two strategies on fluctuation penalty reduction which are: 1) Integrating battery into the wind farm, 2) Integrating electrolyzer into the wind farm. Based on the objective of the income, the optimal operations of the two strategies are presented and investigated on the two typical days. The results reveal that the battery performs better than the electrolyzer on mitigating fluctuation penalty but the electrolyzer can obtain more income than the battery. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery; Electricity market; Electrolyzer; Fluctuation penalty; Wind farm

Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019

LTD, Nanjing, China; Anxin, Y., China Energy Engineering Group Jiangsu Power Design Institute CO. LTD, Nanjing, China; Ruoxuan, S., Southeast University, Nanjing, China
Abstract: In this paper, the basic modules of distribution network are divided based on reliability calculation demand. From the conventional high reliability power supply mode, a new three-way connection mode with flexible DC loop is proposed creatively, which is suitable for high reliability area with distributed generators(PV, wind turbine) and DC load, and the corresponding operation policy is put forward. Briefly, referring to an improved minimal path set reliability calculation method, the operation transfer situation and influence of distributed generators are counted into the calculation. The connection mode and the calculation method are brought into a practical distribution network, and the double fire and double loop network connection mode are compared and analyzed. It is proved in the paper that the proposed connection mode can improve the system reliability, and well adapt to the developing requirement of the distribution network with distributed generators, energy storage and DC load in the future. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Zhu J., Zheng Y., Wang Y., Yuan Y.
Title: Isolated Microgrid Capacity Configuration Considering Economic Risk of Customer Interruption
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: Hohai University, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhu, J., Hohai University, Nanjing, China; Zheng, Y., Hohai University, Nanjing, China; Wang, Y., Hohai University, Nanjing, China; Yuan, Y., Hohai University, Nanjing, China
Abstract: In this paper, an optimal capacity configuration method for isolated microgrid considering the economic risk of customer interruption is proposed. Firstly, the output model of wind turbine, photovoltaic generation system and energy storage system in microgrid is established. Secondly, the loads in the microgrid are classified into three categories according to their importance, and Conditional Value at Risk (CVAR) is used to evaluate the economic risk of interruption caused by intermittent and volatility of renewable energy sources in isolated microgrid. Thirdly, the economic risk of customer interruption is considered based on the initial investment cost and maintenance cost of the microgrid. Finally, particle swarm optimization is used to solve the capacity configuration problem of microgrid. The results show that the model is correct and can provide quantitative basis for the planning and construction of microgrid in power companies. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Jiao S., Li Y., Hu S., Zhang Y., Song X., He L., Shi J.
Title: Cooperative Energy Management for Enterprise Microgrid Using Electrical Energy Router
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, China; China Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, China

Abstract: With the multiple functions such as power conversion and information exchange, the electrical energy router (EER) has the potential to effectively manage the energy flow of the microgrid. In this paper, an extendable AC/DC hybrid microgrid topology regulated by EER is constructed for large industrial enterprise. Considering the policy background of the two-part electricity price, this paper carries out a dual gradient division of the whole-day control period, and presents a flexible strategy with multi-mode switches to help the enterprise alleviate energy consumption pressure. Finally, the simulation platform of AC/DC hybrid microgrid is designed and built in DIgSILENT/PowerFactory. The simulation results demonstrate feasibility and economic efficiency in utilizing the proposed cooperative energy management strategy. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: This paper proposes a method for feasibility analysis of pumped storage integration for smoothing fluctuation in a Hydro-PV hybrid energy system based on the operational optimization. To simplify the calculation, a design of multi-time scale temporal scenario reduction is presented first. Case studies shows the various generated scenarios which reflects different time scales and different power characteristics. Furthermore, hourly and minutely time-scale feasibility analysis indicates that a reasonable capacity pumped storage such as 5MW can effectively smooth fluctuation and reduce the safety risks of grid operation. In addition, the research can provide a reference for planning of pumped storage in Hydro-PV hybrid energy system. © 2019 IEEE.

Ltd., Beijing, 100190, China; Xie, X., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China; Li, Z., State Grid Xinyuan Co. Ltd., Beijing, 100053, China
Abstract: Driven by the fast integration of renewable energy, power systems have an increasing need for flexible resources. Energy storage (ES) technologies provide an attractive solution to facilitate the integration of renewable resources due to energy shifting and fast-ramping capabilities. Among all the ES technologies, pumped hydro storage (PHS) is the most commercially mature utility-scale ES technology. This paper aims at quantifying the performance of PHS in supporting renewable integrated power systems. The role of PHS is analyzed and a multi-timescale evaluation method is proposed based on the functions and applied scenarios studied in this paper. A case study of Pushihe station in northeast China is demonstrated to verify the practicality of the proposed quantitative evaluation method. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: DERs Sizing of Hybrid Microgrid by Hierarchic Optimization Strategy
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019

LTD, Wuhan, China; Cao, Z., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; Chen, H., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China
Abstract: Optimal sizing of distributed energy resources is of great importance to enhance the reliability and economic performance of microgrid. In this paper, multiple objective functions are employed to determine the optimal capacity, including the utilization rate of renewable energy, economic performance, and reliability of the system. The capacity optimization is transformed into two parts by using hierarchic optimization strategy. The first part is to calculate the rough capacity range of wind, PV, storage and diesel generator. The mixed integer programming is employed to solve the problem, taking the minimum capacity of energy storage and diesel generator as the objective function. The second part is to seek the best capacity through the rough capacity range. The capacity configuration scheme is obtained by optimizing the cost and operation of hybrid microgrid. The method is used in an example microgrid, the results show that the model can get the optimal capacity guaranteeing the reliability and economy of the system, and the utilization rate of renewable energy is improved. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Ma T., Peng L., Du Y., Yu Z.
Title: Two-stage Economic Dispatch Optimization for Integrated Energy System Using Improved Brain Storm Optimization Algorithm
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Sichuan Economic Research Institute, Technical Economic Center, Chengdu, China; Dept. of Market research, Sichuan Power Exchange Center Co.Ltd, Chengdu, China; State Key Laboratory for Alternate Electrical Power System, Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Ma, T., State Grid Sichuan Economic Research Institute, Technical Economic Center, Chengdu, China; Peng, L., Dept. of Market research, Sichuan Power Exchange Center Co.Ltd, Chengdu, China; Du, Y., State Grid Sichuan Economic Research Institute, Technical Economic Center, Chengdu, China; Yu, Z., State Key Laboratory for Alternate Electrical Power System, Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Abstract: In this paper, a two-stage economic dispatch operation model of integrated energy system is constructed. Firstly, the day-ahead economic dispatching model is established, which comprehensively considers the operation and maintenance cost, electricity purchase cost, heat purchase cost, fuel cost and energy storage cost. Secondly, on the basis of day-ahead dispatching model, a real-time dispatching optimization model is built by modifying the running state of each micro-source unit. Furthermore, in order to solve the above optimization model, a brain storm optimization(BSO) algorithm based on chaotic crisscross mutation is proposed, that is, the Gaussian mutation in BSO is replaced by chaotic crisscross mutation to enhance the optimization performance and computational efficiency by maintaining the population diversity. Finally, the constructed dispatching model and the proposed CCSO-BSO are validated by a real-world case, and the relative results show that two-stage dispatching optimization model can effectively improve the renewable energy utilization and reduce the system operation cost, it may be a promising alternative for economic operation of integrated energy system. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: brain storm optimization algorithm; chaos crisscross optimization; day-ahead dispatch; Integrated energy system; real-time dispatch

Authors: Liang Z., Song Z., Wang J., Zhang G., Wang X.
Title: Residual Capacity Estimation of Valve-regulated Lead-acid (VRLA) Batteries for Second-use
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China
Authors with affiliations: Liang, Z., State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China; Song, Z., State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China; Wang, J., State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China; Zhang, G., State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China; Wang, X., State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China
Abstract: Valve-regulated lead-acid (VRLA) batteries widely used in substations still have large residual capacities when they are retired, so they can be used secondly in energy storage systems. To enhance the economic and technical performance of second-used VRLA batteries, the estimations of battery's residual capacity before and during second-use are essential, which are the two main topics of this paper. First, based on the electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) of retired VRLA batteries, an equivalent circuit model is established as the basis for subsequent research. Then, the relationship between the EIS and the residual capacity of the retired VRLA battery that has not been put into second-use is studied by theoretical analysis and experiment research. It is found that the impedance at 0.01Hz (capacitance) and 50Hz (resistance) can be used to select batteries that need restoration and the irreparable batteries respectively. Moreover, the test results of charge-discharge cycles show that the residual capacity of the retired VRLA battery that has been put into second-use can be estimated using battery's open-circuit voltage and DC impedance, both of which are easy to measure for batteries in operation. The residual capacity estimation methods lay a theoretical foundation for the second-use of retired VRLA batteries, thus promoting resource recycling and producing social and economic values simultaneously. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS); residual capacity; second-use; valve-regulated lead-acid (VRLA) battery

Authors: Wang L., Han X., Chen G., Ding L., Miao S., Zhang H., Chang X., Luo B.
Title: Research Prospect of Cascade Hydro-photovoltaic-pumped Storage Hybrid Power Generation Technology
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019

Abstract: Development of renewable energy has become a key strategic measure for energy development in countries around the world. The technology of cascade hydro-photovoltaic-pumped storage hybrid power generation closely combines small cascade hydropower, photovoltaic(PV) power and pumped storage power generation, and realizes complementary optimization of these renewable resources. Taking the cascade hydro-photovoltaic-pumped storage combines power generation technology as the research object, this paper summarizes its research status in recent years, and discusses the prospects of three key technologies of multi-time-scale planning of hydro-photovoltaic-pumped storage power generation which adapts to complex dynamic and static operating conditions, dynamic safe operation interval analysis and cluster control of cascade hydro-photovoltaic hybrid system and intelligent dispatching and optimal control of cascade hydro-photovoltaic-pumped storage hybrid power station with consideration taken on stochastic behaviors. This paper aims to, suggesting research approaches for the research and relevant works on the technology development of cascade hydro-photovoltaic-pumped storage hybrid power generation. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Ji X.-P., Liu Z., Liu W., Zhang X.
Title: Collaborative Control of Integrated Generation and Storage for Offshore Wind Turbines
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: School of Automation, Nanjing University of Science and Technology, Nanjing, China; Department of Microgrid Technology, Shenzhen Quant-Cloud Energy Network Technology Co. Ltd., Shenzhen, China

Ltd., Shenzhen, China
Abstract: The development of offshore wind power has become an attractive option in the zone with developed economy and large electric loads along the coast. Nevertheless, the fluctuation and intermittence of wind power have exerted adverse impacts on the power grid and restricted the capacity of wind power integrated into the grid. Moreover, the typhoon also has a detrimental effect on the safety of wind energy conversion system, especially when the offshore wind farm is disconnected from the main grid before the typhoon is comming. This paper proposes a collaborative control scheme of integrated generation and battery energy storage for an offshore semi-direct drive wind turbine based wind energy conversion system. The battery energy storage system serves to maxmize the utilization of wind power under nomal conditions, and as a backup power source for the auxiliary system of wind turbines in typhoon period. The effectiveness of the proposed approach is validated through digital simulations. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Ge L., Fu C., Wu M., Wang Y., Man L.
Title: Coordinated Optimal Planning of Generation and Storage in Hybrid AC/DC Micro-grid
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Pudong Supply Company, Shanghai, 200120, China; State Grid Liaoning Economic Research Institute, Shenyang, China
Authors with affiliations: Ge, L., State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Pudong Supply Company, Shanghai, 200120, China; Fu, C., State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Pudong Supply Company, Shanghai, 200120, China; Wu, M., State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Pudong Supply Company, Shanghai, 200120, China; Wang, Y., State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Pudong Supply Company, Shanghai, 200120, China; Man, L., State Grid Liaoning Economic Research Institute, Shenyang, China
Abstract: The hybrid AC/DC micro-grid that integrates AC and DC micro-grid, including a variety of distributed generation, energy storage devices, load, lead the trend of micro-grid. To improve the operation economic efficiency and acceptance of renewable energy source of the hybrid AC/DC micro-grid, it is necessary to configure battery energy storage system for distributed generation. In this paper, a mix integer optimization model of generation and storage is proposed for the hybrid AC/DC micro-grid to determine the optimal configuration of generation and storage. Taking the minimum cost of generation and storage investment as well as the minimum operation cost of power generation and purchase and sale of electricity, the dynamic characteristics of generators and storage devices are taken into consideration, and the power loss through AC/DC converter is taken into account. The model is solved as a mixed integer optimization based on Benders Decomposition algorithm. The numerical study shows that the optimal configuration of coordinated generation and storage can effectively save the investment cost of AC/DC hybrid micro-grid, which verifies the validity of the proposed model. © 2019 IEEE.

Ltd, Nanjing, China; Yang, T., College of Power Electric Engineering, Nanjing Institute of Technology, Nanjing, China; Zhang, L., College of Power Electric Engineering, Nanjing Institute of Technology, Nanjing, China; Shui, H., College of Communications Engineering, Nanjing Institute of Technology, Nanjing, China; Fang, C., Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China
Abstract: Plug and play (PNP) technology of Battery Energy Storage Power Station (BESPS) based on the emergency support and scale application background of battery energy storage is presented in this paper, and the key to the PNP technology is fully studied. Firstly, PNP technology of BESPS is divided into two dimensions: energy flow level to achieve 'plug' goal and information flow level to achieve 'play' goal. Then, advanced applications in energy flow level are given, which include conversion control between grid-connected and off-grid, active voltage and frequency support, load peak shifting. The basic principles of establishing BESPS grid-connected communication model and communication mechanism based on information flow are first proposed. The communication interaction method with the example of between Control Center of Power Station (PSCC) and Power Dispatching Center (PDC) is analyzed. the compatibility of BESPS can be improved by researching the basic ways of device interface interoperability, which includes two parts: battery to Energy Storage Unit (ESU), ESU to BESPS. Finally, the BESPS operating between various operation modes are verified by simulation. The research work in this paper has a very positive guiding significance and reference value for the development of enhanced BESPS and solving the problems of large-scale and flexible grid connection of BESPS. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: BESPS; communication mechanism; energy flow; information flow; interface interoperability; PNP
Index Keywords: Electric batteries; Electric load dispatching; Electric power transmission networks; Interoperability; Power plants; Smart power grids; Battery energy storage; BESPS; Communication interaction; Communication mechanisms; Communication modeling; Energy flow; Information flows; Power dispatching center; Battery storage

Authors: Yang H., Guo C., Ren J., Sheng J.
Title: A Coordinated Charging Strategy on Battery Swapping Station in Microgrid Considering Battery to Grid
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, H., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Guo, C., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Ren, J., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Sheng, J., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Abstract: After the electric vehicle battery swapping station (BSS) is connected to microgrid, the battery in the BSS can provide auxiliary services through the battery to grid(B2G) technology. It is not only able to reduce the configuration capacity of the energy storage system and the construction cost of the microgrid, but also can improve the operating profit of BSS. In this context, this paper proposes a method for full battery to participate in B2G service. Secondly, we propose a coordinated charging strategy for BSS in the microgrid with the goal of minimum daily charging cost. Finally, an example is given to analyze the effectiveness of the proposed B2G method and the coordinated charging strategy. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery swapping station; battery to grid (B2G); charging plan; microgrid
Index Keywords: Electric power transmission networks; Secondary batteries; Vehicle-to-grid; Auxiliary services; Battery swapping; battery to grid (B2G); Charging plan; Coordinated charging; Electric vehicle batteries; Energy storage systems; Micro grid; Charging (batteries)

Authors: Wang X., Liu Z., Zhang H., Zhao Y., Shi J., Ding H.
Title: A Review on Virtual Power Plant Concept, Application and Challenges
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Jibei Electric Power Co. Ltd., Beijing, 100032, China; North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China; North China Electric Power Resaerch Institute Co. Ltd., Beijing, 100045, China

Ltd., Beijing, 100032, China; Ding, H., State Grid Jibei Electric Power Co. Ltd., Beijing, 100032, China
Abstract: Due to the high penetration of distributed energy resources (DER) in the power grid and electricity market, numerous papers have focused on the new idea of virtual power plant (VPP). VPP can integrate DERs such as distributed generation (DG), energy storage, controllable loads, electric vehicle (EV) to provide capacity and ancillary services to the grid operations, sell power to electricity wholesale markets, enhance the overall system economics and reliability, promote efficient optimization in resources, and facilitate renewable integration to the grid. This paper reviews the VPP in terms of concept, applications and challenges and proposes a new concept of VPP. In the paper, 9 typical VPP projects are introduced, which are mainly distributed in Europe, USA and Australia. In addition, VPP also brings challenges in resource allocation, operation and control system, communication technology and power transactions. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Fan J., Bi S., Yuan H., Han Y., Wu Q., Liu X., Li X.
Title: An Optimal Dispatch Strategy of Distribution Networks with Electric Vehicle Charging Stations Integrated Energy Storage
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019

Abstract: With increased penetration of distributed energy resources and electric vehicles (EVs), EV charging stations integrated with energy storage (ES) is regarded as an important measure to mitigate the power fluctuation and support the distribution networks. Therefore, this paper works on the dispatch strategy of distribution networks with EV charging stations coupled with ES. Firstly, a within-day dispatch model of distribution network is established which consider the characteristics of EV charging load. Secondly, an optimal dispatch strategy is proposed to minimize the daily operation cost, which consider the difference of electricity price under peak and valley load curve. Finally, Case studies are conducted and the simulation results demonstrate that the proposed dispatch strategy can greatly reduce the economic operation costs and smooth the power fluctuations within the charging station. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: With the development of renewable energy, the amount of renewable energy data is growing rapidly. Renewable energy data is either large in volume or low in value density. Traditional data processing methods cannot meet the rapid query for state monitoring, evaluation and prediction. The need for power system analysis using renewable energy big data is thus urgent. This paper studies the storage and processing methods of big data in power systems with high proportion of renewable energy. Based on the analysis of renewable energy data characteristics and distributed data storage methods, this paper presents a general processing and storage framework for renewable energy big data. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Kittiwararat T., Pongjirapat K., Khanaroek R., Suwankawin S.
Title: A Control Methodology of Inverter-Based Battery Energy Storage System for AC Microgrid
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: Power Electronic Research Laboratory, Smart Grid Research Unit, Chulalongkorn University, Bangkok, Thailand
Authors with affiliations: Kittiwararat, T., Power Electronic Research Laboratory, Smart Grid Research Unit, Chulalongkorn University, Bangkok, Thailand; Pongjirapat, K., Power Electronic Research Laboratory, Smart Grid Research Unit, Chulalongkorn University, Bangkok, Thailand; Khanaroek, R., Power Electronic Research Laboratory, Smart Grid Research Unit, Chulalongkorn University, Bangkok, Thailand; Suwankawin, S., Power Electronic Research Laboratory, Smart Grid Research Unit, Chulalongkorn University, Bangkok, Thailand
Abstract: Control Methodology of inverter-based Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) is a key issue for the operation of AC microgird. In this paper, the voltage-mode control of inverter is considered and the control scheme of inverter for BESS is presented. Virtual synchronous generator is a core function and the frequency droop control and Automatic Voltage Regulator (AVR) form the outer cascade loops. The resynchronization of microgrid is rigorously studied, the concept of vector Phase-Locked-Loop (PLL) is adopted and formed as the outside cascade loop. Simulation is conducted by a pilot-site microgird at Mae Hong Son, Thailand, where a 4 MW/1 MWh BESS is designed. During the grid-connected mode, the default function of BESS is spinning reserve operation, while BESS can help forming the grid throughout the islanding mode. In addition, the proposed control technique of BESS can make the transition between grid-connected and islanding modes seamlessly. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: AC microgrid; Battery Energy Storage System (BESS); inverter control methodology; resynchronization; seamless transfer; virtual synchronous generator
