LTD., Nanjing, 210024, China; Liu, Y., State Grid Jiangsu Electric Power Co. LTD., Research Institute, Nanjing, 211103, China
Abstract: With the energy crisis and environmental protection problems, residential photovoltaic generation technology has developed rapidly. This paper studies the optimized capacity configuration of photovoltaic generation and energy storage for residential microgrids containing photovoltaic generation and energy storage systems. An energy management strategy based on energy storage is proposed. Considering the electricity cost, electricity income and the cost of photovoltaic generation and energy storage system, the optimized capacity configuration model of photovoltaic generation and energy storage with the largest investment benefit/cost ratio is established. The genetic algorithm is used to solve the problem. Finally, the validity of the model and the solution method is verified in the specific residential microgrid. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Huang X., Wang J., Cheng S., Wang T.
Title: An optimal operation method for cascade hydro-photovoltaic-pumped storage hybrid generation system
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering and Electronic Information, Xihua University, Chengdu, Sichuan Province, 610039, China
Authors with affiliations: Huang, X., School of Electrical Engineering and Electronic Information, Xihua University, Chengdu, Sichuan Province, 610039, China; Wang, J., School of Electrical Engineering and Electronic Information, Xihua University, Chengdu, Sichuan Province, 610039, China; Cheng, S., School of Electrical Engineering and Electronic Information, Xihua University, Chengdu, Sichuan Province, 610039, China; Wang, T., School of Electrical Engineering and Electronic Information, Xihua University, Chengdu, Sichuan Province, 610039, China
Abstract: Since photovoltaic power stations and cascade hydropower stations have complementary characteristics, while pumped storage power stations have energy storage and rapid regulation characteristics, it is of great significant to combine cascade hydropower, photovoltaic, pumped storage to increase the absorption of photovoltaic. To improve the stability of the system operation and the economic benefits, this paper proposes a cascade hydro-photovoltaic-pumped storage hybrid generation system. Considering the actual conditions such as uncertainty of photovoltaic output, the reservoir capacity of pumped storage power station and real time electricity price, an objective function and related constraint conditions are established. In addition, a particle swarm optimization algorithm with linear decreasing of inertia weight is used to find the optimum results of the model. Finally, actual power station parameters are selected for simulation test and the results show that the hybrid generation system has good economic benefits and water-light complementary ability, which guarantee the system to operate more safely and economically. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: cascade hydropower-PV-pumped storage hybrid generation; optimal scheduling; particle swarm optimization

Title: Distributed Economic Dispatch for Active Distribution Networks with Virtual Power Plants
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019

Abstract: With the growing penetration of distributed energy resources (DERs) such as renewable energy generators, battery storages and controllable loads, virtual power plant (VPP) has become the promising solution for flexible energy management in active distribution networks (ADNs). This paper presents an alternating direction method of multipliers (ADMM)-based distributed economic dispatch (ED) strategy for ADNs with multiple VPPs. The proposed scheme is suitable for three-phase unbalanced system considering network constraints. Each VPP exchanges limited boundary information with distribution system operator (DSO) protecting data privacy. Numerical tests validate the effectiveness of the proposed method. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Zhao Y., Shi X., Zhou B., Wang X.
Title: Wind Power Fluctuation Smoothing with BESS Considering Ultra-short-term Prediction
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent, Dispatch and Control of Ministry of Education, Jinan, China; State Grid of China Technology College, Jinan, China; Huaneng Shandong Power Generation Co. Ltd, Jinan, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, Y., Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent, Dispatch and Control of Ministry of Education, Jinan, China; Shi, X., Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent, Dispatch and Control of Ministry of Education, Jinan, China; Zhou, B., State Grid of China Technology College, Jinan, China; Wang, X., Huaneng Shandong Power Generation Co. Ltd, Jinan, China
Abstract: Nowadays, power system often faces the intractable problem of power fluctuation due to the intermittency and stochasticity of renewable energy, such as wind and photovoltaics, generation system. The energy storage system, such as the battery energy storage system (BESS) is an effective way to smooth the power fluctuation so as to increase the allowed penetration level of renewable energy generation in power grid. However, the cost of the energy storage system is still very high and the efficient control strategies are needed to improve the benefit of per unit energy storage as high as possible. In view of that, this paper proposed a novel control strategy for BESS based on the common moving average filter (MAF) and ultra-short-term wind power forecast. By adding future wind power data predicted into inputs of the filter, the MAF could possess the characteristic of nearly zero phase delay, which almost eliminates the low-frequency components in the load of BESS. The control strategy proposed enables BESS to focus on the compensation of the high-frequency components of the wind power, therefore obtaining better smoothing results for given BESS and improving its economic efficiency. Simulation results in various scenarios verify the effectiveness of the proposed method. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery energy storage system; first-order moving average filter; power fluctuation smoothing; wind power forecast
Index Keywords: Battery storage; Digital storage; Smart power grids; Weather forecasting; Wind power; Battery energy storage systems; High frequency components; Low-frequency components; Moving average filter; Power fluctuations; Renewable energy generation; Short-term wind power forecast; Wind power forecast; Electric power transmission networks

Authors: Hu J., Ji W., Shen P.
Title: Smart Terminal Unit for Distribution Network with Model Verification Ability
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: Nanjing Power Supply Company, State Grid Corporation of China, China
Authors with affiliations: Hu, J., Nanjing Power Supply Company, State Grid Corporation of China, China; Ji, W., Nanjing Power Supply Company, State Grid Corporation of China, China; Shen, P., Nanjing Power Supply Company, State Grid Corporation of China, China
Abstract: Large scale integration of intermittent renewable energy sources, responsive loads and energy storage devices in distribution network has brought great challenges to operation in power systems, especially under fault condition. To cope with the requirement of reliability of the distribution network, distributed feeder automation (FA) is utilized, and the performance of it is high relied on the accuracy of the system model. In this paper, a verification algorithm is introduced to check the model from smart terminal unit (STU) and master station to enhance the reliability of distributed FA. The algorithm utilized MD5 message-digest algorithm and consensus algorithm to generate the "finger print" of the model to be compared with each other. Thus, the comparison can be achieved by communication between the master station and only one STU, which greatly simplifies the verification procedure and increase its speed. And the application of this algorithm is also given in the paper. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Distribution Network; Model Interaction Mechanism; Model Verification; Topology
Index Keywords: Electric power distribution; Electric power transmission networks; Grid computing; Renewable energy resources; Smart power grids; Consensus algorithms; Distributed feeders; Fault conditions; Model interaction; Model verification; Renewable energy source; Responsive load; Verification algorithms; Topology

Authors: Cui X., Li X., Zhang K., Wen Y., Meng Y.
Title: An Optimized Control Model of Battery Energy Storage Systems for Primary Frequency Response
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019

Abstract: This paper proposes an optimal model of output power of battery energy storage systems (BESS) in the primary frequency response. A good level of state of charge (SOC) of BESS can extend the lifetime of BESS. This model can not only maintain a good level of SOC, but also optimize the output power of BESS. In addition, this paper presents a new method to confirm coefficients of the model in terms of types of BESS, which can optimal the output power and extend the lifetime. The model is applied in the primary frequency response under the condition of a single area power system. The simulation can prove validity of the model in the primary frequency response. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Lv Y., Yang P., Liu Z., Chen Y., Chen J.
Title: Real-time Model Predictive Control for The Regional Autonomy Multi-microgrids With Three-Phase/Single-Phase Architecture
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: Guangdong Key Laboratory of Clean Energy Technology, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, 510640, China; National-Local Joint Engineering Laboratory, Wind Power Control and Integration Technology, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, 511458, China
Authors with affiliations: Lv, Y., Guangdong Key Laboratory of Clean Energy Technology, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, 510640, China; Yang, P., Guangdong Key Laboratory of Clean Energy Technology, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, 510640, China, National-Local Joint Engineering Laboratory, Wind Power Control and Integration Technology, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, 511458, China; Liu, Z., Guangdong Key Laboratory of Clean Energy Technology, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, 510640, China; Chen, Y., Guangdong Key Laboratory of Clean Energy Technology, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, 510640, China; Chen, J., Guangdong Key Laboratory of Clean Energy Technology, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, 510640, China
Abstract: With the large-scale application of microgrids, the microgrids with three-phase/single-phase architecture, which are geographically relatively close can be interconnected to multi-microgrids systems with multi-phase architecture. For the regional autonomy multi-microgrids which are out of the power distribution network, the paper proposes a real-time control strategy based on Model Predictive Control (MPC). Based on multi-microgrids distributed and hierarchical control architecture, the proposed strategy considers the three-phase unbalance and the minimum deviation between the actual tie line power and the given reference value, which builds a dynamic prediction model with multi-input, multi-disturbance and multi-variable. Then transform it into a mixed integer nonlinear programming and solve it. With the introduction of feedback correction for prediction error correction, it finally realizes rolling finite time closed loop optimization. By the simulation results, the proposed strategy can adjust power of sources, loads and energy storage systems (ESSs) for the regional autonomy multi-microgrids as well as stabilize power fluctuation of sources and loads. Besides, it can keep track of tie line power so as to meet the unbalanced constraints, which is beneficial to the operation of the multi-microgrids that are out of the distribution network. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: model predictive control; multi-microgrids; regional autonomy; three-phase unbalance

Authors: Chunlin G., Qinbo Y., Xiangzheng S., Jingjing Y.
Title: Research on the Economic Benefit of Energy Storage System Works with Photovoltaic System Considering the Cost of Electricity
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System, Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Chunlin, G., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System, Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Qinbo, Y., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System, Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Xiangzheng, S., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System, Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Jingjing, Y., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System, Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Abstract: The energy storage system (ESS) works with the photovoltaic (PV) system is an important application scenario. This paper studies the economic benefits of ESS operation. Firstly, the calculation method of the electricity cost of the ESS is proposed, and then the optional discharge period of the ESS is determined according to the electricity price structure, further determined the operation strategy of the ESS. Secondly, the three-parameter empirical aging model of lithium battery is proposed, and the battery aging estimation method is obtained by combining the rainflow counting method. Finally, based on the net present value calculation, the economic calculation method of ESS is proposed. The analysis of the example shows the effectiveness of the economic calculation method, and the calculation results have certain reference value. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Qing K., Huang Q., Chen S., Hu W., Henan J.W.
Title: Optimized operating strategy for a distribution network containing BESS and renewable energy
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu CN, 611731, China; University of Technology, Zhengzhou CN, 450001, China
Authors with affiliations: Qing, K., University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu CN, 611731, China; Huang, Q., University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu CN, 611731, China; Chen, S., University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu CN, 611731, China; Hu, W., University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu CN, 611731, China; Henan, J.W., University of Technology, Zhengzhou CN, 450001, China
Abstract: In this paper, battery energy storage system (BESS) is installed in the distribution network (DN) to realize peak shaving and valley filling. Furthermore, the reactive power capabilities of the wind turbine (WT) and BESS are utilized to reduce the power losses and improve voltage quality. The overall operating strategy is formulated as a nonlinear programming mathematical model, which consists of BESS charging/discharging power scheduling, BESS and WT reactive power dispatching as well. The formulated mathematical model is further solved by a nonlinearly decreased inertia weight particle swarm optimization (PSO) method. Finally, a modified 69-bus distribution network is selected to verify the performance of the proposed optimal operation strategy. Experimental results show that the optimal operating strategy of BESS and WT can greatly decrease the power losses of the DN and increase the profit of the DN utilities. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Sha J., Liu H., Dong H., Wang T., Jiang X.
Title: Peaking Compensation Mechanism for Supply and Demand Sides Union Promoting Wind Power Integration
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Henan Comprehensive Energy Service Co. LTD, Zhengzhou, China; School of Electrical Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Sha, J., State Grid Henan Comprehensive Energy Service Co. LTD, Zhengzhou, China; Liu, H., State Grid Henan Comprehensive Energy Service Co. LTD, Zhengzhou, China; Dong, H., State Grid Henan Comprehensive Energy Service Co. LTD, Zhengzhou, China; Wang, T., School of Electrical Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China; Jiang, X., School of Electrical Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China
Abstract: A peaking compensation mechanism for supply side and demand side is proposed aiming to deal with large-scale wind power curtailment. Firstly, based on the clustering thought, the demand-side battery energy storage system (BESS) is integrated into virtual peaking plant (VPP), and thermal units are divided into several deep peaking clusters. Secondly, a two-stage coordinated optimization scheduling model is constructed based on the cooperative game theory. In the first stage, load curve is optimized according to the control strategy of VPP. On the basis of, a wind-thermal-VPP coordinated optimization operation model with considering wind power curtailment is established. Furthermore, a two-layer peaking compensation mechanism based on improved Shapley value is proposed, in which the outer layer accounts for the coefficient of peaking capability and the inner layer is allocated by peaking mileage. Results show that the proposed method is effective for promoting the supply side and demand side union peaking. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Solangi A.R., Huang Q., Raza G., Abbas M., Solangi S.H.
Title: DC Bus Voltage Regulation for Distributed Energy Sources through Buck-Boost Converter in a Direct Current Micro Grid
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: Sichuan Provincial Key Lab of Power System Wide -Area Measurement and Control, School of Mechanical and Electrical Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, China; Benazir Bhutto Shaheed University of Technology and Skill Development, Khairpur, Pakistan; Indus University, Karachi, Pakistan; University of Sindh, Jamshoro, Pakistan

Abstract: Direct current micro-grid (DCMG) based on renewable energy sources (RES) is facing an issue of maintaining standard voltage at DC bus under variable power generation and utilization. This paper proposes the DCMG based on distributed energy sources (DES) and buck-boost converter to maintain standard voltage at DC bus. Photovoltaic panel (PV), wind turbine (WT) and battery are utilized as DES. PV, battery and WT are linked to DC bus through buck-boost converter. The simulation model of PV and WT has been developed using MULTISIM simulation tool. To measure the performance of the designed system, the DC load of 500 watt has been organized for DCMG system. The protection from reverse current flow and over voltage is also provided. The simulation outcomes verified that, at DC bus standard voltage has been maintained for both utilization and generation. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: buck-boost converter and energy storage system; DC micro grid; photovoltaic panel; wind turbine

Authors: Zhang X., Yang D., Du W., Chen Y., He G.
Title: Research on Operation Optimization Method of Regional Integrated Energy System
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019

Abstract: To solve the energy optimization scheduling problem of regional integrated energy system, the distributed generation output characteristics and the system optimization operation strategy are analyzed. Constraints of the distributed energy operation, electric-heat-cold load demand and the energy daily storage balance are fully considered. Then the optimal scheduling model of integrated energy microgrid is established and solved by linear programming method. Finally, a typical scenario is constructed referring a university campus, the CCHP optimal operation mode is carried out and compared with the operation mode of "CCHP full power". The results show that the optimal scheduling model can meet the scenario requirements, and can provide a unified optimization scheme for regional integrated energy system. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Liu K., Hu W., Xu X., Huang Q., Zhang Z., Chen Z.
Title: Optimized Operation of Photovoltaic and Pumped Hydro Storage Hybrid Energy System in the Electricity Market
Source title: 2019 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Asia, ISGT 2019
Affiliations: School of Mechanical and Electrical Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, 611731, China; Department of Energy Technology, Aalborg University, Aalborg, 9220, Denmark

Abstract: At present, the electricity market is relatively free and open for investors. With the development of the renewable energy technology, investing in a hybrid renewable energy system, such as photovoltaic-pumped hydro storage (PV-PHS) and wind-battery hybrid energy system, in the electricity market may be a promising choice for investors to obtain the profits. Therefore, in this paper, the optimal operation strategy of the PV-PHS hybrid energy system in the electricity market is proposed. The sequential quadratic programming (SQP) method is used to find the optimal operation strategy with maximum income. Moreover, the influence of various rated power of the reversible pump and capacity of the upper reservoir on the daily income is investigated. The results show the PHS have a significant improvement on the daily income, especially when the fluctuation of the electricity price is high. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Gasca M.V., Garces A., Molinas M.
Title: Stability Analysis of the Proportional-Resonant Controller in Single Phase Converters
Source title: 2019 IEEE Workshop on Power Electronics and Power Quality Applications, PEPQA 2019 - Proceedings
Authors with affiliations: Gasca, M.V.; Garces, A.; Molinas, M.
Abstract: The proportional-resonant control (PR-control) is a simple and efficient control, which has the ability to eliminate error in linear time varying signals. This type of control is typically used in applications such as the integration of solar panels, energy storage and electric vehicles among others. Despite having non-linear dynamics, the analysis of the PR-control is usually performed using linear systems theory. This paper proposes a non-linear stability analysis based on Lyapunov theory which formalizes the main stability results on these controls that are standard in industrial applications. The proposed approach is general and independent of the structure of the phase-locked loop which is considered as a vanishing perturbation. This approach allows a better understanding of the control from a non-linear perspective. In addition, it gives an exact criteria for tuning the parameters of the controller. Numerical simulation results in a wide range of scenarios complement the analysis and validate them. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Lyapunov Stability Analysis; Phase Locked Loop (PLL); Proportional resonant control (PR-Control); Single Phase voltage Source Converter (SP-VSC)

Source title: 2019 IEEE Workshop on Power Electronics and Power Quality Applications, PEPQA 2019 - Proceedings

Authors with affiliations: Alvarez, S.R., Facultad de Minas, Universidad Nacional de Colombia, Medellín, Colombia; Oviedo, J.E., Facultad de Minas, Universidad Nacional de Colombia, Medellín, Colombia
Abstract: The recent improvements in batteries efficiency and advances in information and control systems have to lead to a change in the paradigm of fossil fuel-based vehicles. Hence, new technologies for mobility more eco-friendly and more energy-efficient are emerging, such as electric mobility systems. Furthermore, the inclusion of electric vehicles offers an opportunity to use the batteries of the electric vehicles to provide electric energy storage-based ancillary services. But this practice can shorten the life-span of the batteries. Therefore, this paper evaluates the aging in the batteries of electric vehicles caused by their participation in the smoothing the intermittencies introduced by renewable sources in a microgrid. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Castro L., Lopez M.B., Mora-Florez J.
Title: Adjustment strategy of a fuzzy control to integrate renewable sources and storage devices in microgrids
Source title: 2019 IEEE Workshop on Power Electronics and Power Quality Applications, PEPQA 2019 - Proceedings

Abstract: This paper proposes the design of Fuzzy logic control applied to the outer loop of a voltage source converter, which is indispensable the integration of renewable sources and storage devices in a micro grid. The fuzzy logic method is implemented in non-linear, uncertain or non-stationary processes, since it is characterized by its ease incorporation of human experience and the understanding of its natural language. The general aim of this paper is focused on the detailed design of fuzzy logic control, considering the characteristics of the power converters. Finally, several tests is carried out to verify the proper functioning of the proposed fuzzy logic control, which is compared to a traditional PI control. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Kang Z., Wang L., Guo S., Gong R., Deng Y., Dou Q.
Title: ASIE: An asynchronous SNN inference engine for AER events processing
Source title: Proceedings - International Symposium on Asynchronous Circuits and Systems
Affiliations: College of Computer Science and Technology, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China
Authors with affiliations: Kang, Z., College of Computer Science and Technology, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China; Wang, L., College of Computer Science and Technology, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China; Guo, S., College of Computer Science and Technology, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China; Gong, R., College of Computer Science and Technology, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China; Deng, Y., College of Computer Science and Technology, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China; Dou, Q., College of Computer Science and Technology, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China
Abstract: Neuromorphic computing based on spiking neural network (SNN) shows good energy-efficiency. However, the conventional convolution operation required in processing the output of the frame-based vision sensor makes SNN inefficient because the convolution requires full-image processing. Frameless vision sensors (also called event-based vision sensors) can address this problem because they produce spikes only when events occur in the image. The image encoding of frameless vision sensors is Address Event Representation (AER), an emerging asynchronous protocol. AER events are particularly well-suited for SNN processing. Indeed, computation and communication in SNN are asynchronous because of the asynchronous nature of AER events. This paper presents an SNN hardware inference engine based on an asynchronous Processing Element (PE) array with AER events as input. The engine uses a convolution algorithm based on AER events. This design also uses distributed storage in the PE array to reduce the cost of memory access. The experimental results show that the design can achieve a recognition accuracy of 97.5% for the MNIST AER dataset. This design reduces by 9 the computing activity compared to a baseline systolic array based accelerator. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: AER; Asynchronous circuit; Event-driven; Frame-based; Neuromorphic computing; Spiking Neural Networks; Systolic Array
Index Keywords: Asynchronous sequential logic; Convolution; Energy efficiency; Engines; Green computing; Image processing; Neural networks; Asynchronous circuits; Event-driven; Frame-based; Neuromorphic computing; Spiking neural networks; Systolic arrays

Authors: Cao Y., Xu Q., Zhang H., Yu Q., Gao S., Li J.
Title: Comprehensive assessment of second-life battery energy storage system operation performance based on analytic hierarchy process
Source title: 2019 2nd International Conference on Electronics Technology, ICET 2019
Affiliations: Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent Dispatch and Control of the Ministry of Education, Shandong University, Jinan, 250061, China; State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, State Grid Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, 250002, China
Authors with affiliations: Cao, Y., Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent Dispatch and Control of the Ministry of Education, Shandong University, Jinan, 250061, China; Xu, Q., Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent Dispatch and Control of the Ministry of Education, Shandong University, Jinan, 250061, China; Zhang, H., Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent Dispatch and Control of the Ministry of Education, Shandong University, Jinan, 250061, China; Yu, Q., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, State Grid Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, 250002, China; Gao, S., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, State Grid Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, 250002, China; Li, J., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, State Grid Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, 250002, China
Abstract: Considering the adequate energy capacity and lower price of retired electric vehicle traction batteries, the second-life battery energy storage system (SLBESS) is of great significance for active distribution network (ADN) to enhance sustainable energy accommodation and decrease investment capital costs. This paper proposes a comprehensive assessment approach to quantify the operation performance of SLBES in the ADN. A multi-level comprehensive assessment framework is established, which incorporates both the operation benefits and electrical features. As for the SLBES operation benefits, the amount and volatility of exchanging power between the ADN and utility grid are adopted. Moreover, the voltage volatility, three-phase unbalance and harmonic content at the point of common coupling are taken as the main quantitative indices of electrical features. Furthermore, the analytic hierarchy process method is utilized to determine the relative weights of intra-level indices, and then the comprehensive assessment index is obtained via the linear weighted summing of sub-level quantitative indices orderly. A case study is conducted to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed assessment approach. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Active distribution network; Analytic hierarchy process; Comprehensive assessment; Energy storage system; Second-life battery

Authors: Vasilakis E., Papaefstathiou V., Trancoso P., Sourdis I.
Title: LLC-guided data migration in hybrid memory systems
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 IEEE 33rd International Parallel and Distributed Processing Symposium, IPDPS 2019
Affiliations: Chalmers University of Technology, CSE Dept, Gothenburg, Sweden; Foundation for Research and Technology - Hellas (FORTH), Heraklion, Crete, Greece
Authors with affiliations: Vasilakis, E., Chalmers University of Technology, CSE Dept, Gothenburg, Sweden; Papaefstathiou, V., Foundation for Research and Technology - Hellas (FORTH), Heraklion, Crete, Greece; Trancoso, P., Chalmers University of Technology, CSE Dept, Gothenburg, Sweden; Sourdis, I., Chalmers University of Technology, CSE Dept, Gothenburg, Sweden
Abstract: Although 3D-stacked DRAM offers substantially higher bandwidth than commodity DDR DIMMs, it cannot yet provide the necessary capacity to replace the bulk of the memory. A promising alternative is to use flat address space, hybrid memory systems of two or more levels, each exhibiting different performance characteristics. One such existing approach employs a near, high bandwidth 3D-stacked memory, placed on top of the processor die, combined with a far, commodity DDR memory, placed off-chip. Migrating data from the far to the near memory has significant performance potential, but also entails overheads, which may diminish migration benefits or even lead to performance degradation. This paper describes a new data migration scheme for hybrid memory systems that takes into account the above overheads and improves migration efficiency and effectiveness. It is based on the observation that migrating memory segments, which are (partly) present in the Last-Level Cache (LLC) introduces lower migration traffic. Our approach relies on the state of the LLC cachelines to predict future reuse and select memory segments for migration. Thereby, the segments are migrated when present (at least partly) in the LLC incurring lower cost. Our experiments confirm that our approach outperforms current state-of-the art migration designs improving system performance by 12.1% and reducing memory system dynamic energy by 13.2%. © 2019 IEEE
Index Keywords: Bandwidth; Dynamic random access storage; Three dimensional integrated circuits; 3D-stacked memory; Improving systems; Lastlevel caches (LLC); Migration efficiency; Performance characteristics; Performance degradation; Performance potentials; State of the art; Cache memory

Authors: Tsenempis I., Filios G., Katsidimas I., Nikoletseas S.
Title: Energy harvesting and smart management platform for low power IoT systems
Source title: Proceedings - 15th Annual International Conference on Distributed Computing in Sensor Systems, DCOSS 2019
Affiliations: Department of Computer Engineering and Informatics, University of Patras, Greece; Computer Technology Institute and Press Diophantus, Greece
Authors with affiliations: Tsenempis, I., Department of Computer Engineering and Informatics, University of Patras, Greece, Computer Technology Institute and Press Diophantus, Greece; Filios, G., Department of Computer Engineering and Informatics, University of Patras, Greece, Computer Technology Institute and Press Diophantus, Greece; Katsidimas, I., Department of Computer Engineering and Informatics, University of Patras, Greece, Computer Technology Institute and Press Diophantus, Greece; Nikoletseas, S., Department of Computer Engineering and Informatics, University of Patras, Greece, Computer Technology Institute and Press Diophantus, Greece
Abstract: Advances in Micro-Electro-Mechanical Systems (MEMS) and energy scavenging technologies are now able to provide viable solutions based on different application environments. In particular, rechargeable battery-operated Wireless Sensor Networks (WSN) can now be set upon a new basis that targets both ambient energy harvesting and wireless charging technologies in different forms and scales. Hence, the assumption of finite energy budget (that may also affect the system's performance) can be over-passed by potentially unlimited energy supply. The presented platform is able to effectively power a low power IoT system with processing, sensing and wireless communication capabilities. It embeds an advanced energy management IC that allows extremely high efficiency energy harvesting, suitable for low-power and miniaturized energy generators. Unlike other systems it not only supports a variety of power supply options, but also a hybrid energy storage scheme. This paper aims to provide a description of the system's design, the embedded intelligence and the performance in terms of energy autonomy. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Shao Y., Yang R., Li X., Chen G.
Title: Battery Energy Storage System with Energy Spring Based on VSG Control Strategy
Source title: ICPE 2019 - ECCE Asia - 10th International Conference on Power Electronics - ECCE Asia
Affiliations: Zhejiang University, China
Authors with affiliations: Shao, Y., Zhejiang University, China; Yang, R., Zhejiang University, China; Li, X., Zhejiang University, China; Chen, G., Zhejiang University, China
Abstract: To solve the problem of small capacity and low voltage level of the traditional battery energy storage system (BESS), a single-stage cascaded H-bridge with energy spring (ES) which can eliminate the secondary pulsating current injecting into the battery is proposed in this paper. In addition, the virtual synchronous generator (VSG) control strategy is adopted for the grid-friendly integration of the BESS. The VSG control strategy is analyzed and optimized to achieve seamless grid connection and improve the dynamic performance of reactive power. The experimental results demonstrate the correctness and effectiveness of the proposed topology and control strategy. © 2019 The Korean Institute of Power Electronics (KIPE).

Authors: Lashab A., Sera D., Guerrero J.M.
Title: A Low-Computational High-Performance Model Predictive Control of Single Phase Battery Assisted Quasi Z-Source PV Inverters
Source title: ICPE 2019 - ECCE Asia - 10th International Conference on Power Electronics - ECCE Asia
Affiliations: Aalborg University, Department of Energy Technology, Aalborg, DK 9220, Denmark
Authors with affiliations: Lashab, A., Aalborg University, Department of Energy Technology, Aalborg, DK 9220, Denmark; Sera, D., Aalborg University, Department of Energy Technology, Aalborg, DK 9220, Denmark; Guerrero, J.M., Aalborg University, Department of Energy Technology, Aalborg, DK 9220, Denmark
Abstract: Impedance network inverters are a good alternative for voltage-source and current-source inverters. The shoot-through solution and the boosting capability of such converters make them an excellent solution for photovoltaic (PV)application. Furthermore, energy storage integration in these inverters does not require any additional components in the converter; indeed, a battery can be directly connected in parallel with one of the capacitors of the Z- or quasi Z-network. However, for an optimal control of these converters, complex control and modulation strategies are required. Model Predictive Control (MPC)provides high control performance at the expense of the computational effort. In this paper, a low computational control method where both MPC and proportional resonant (PR)controller are combined, is proposed. This makes the proposed controller perform two iterations only instead of iterating for all the available switching states. As shown in the obtained results, the proposed controller conserves the high performance of the conventional MPC with 50% less computational burden. © 2019 The Korean Institute of Power Electronics (KIPE).

Authors: Zhou Jiawu A., Bao Guangqing B., Ma Ming C., Wang Ningbo D.
Title: Multi-Energy Coordinated Regulation Strategy Based on the Decomposition of Large-Scale New Energy Fluctuations
Source title: ICPE 2019 - ECCE Asia - 10th International Conference on Power Electronics - ECCE Asia
Affiliations: Electrical and Information Engineering College of LanZhou, University of Technology, China; Power Science Research Institute of State Grid Gansu Electric Power Company, China; Key Laboratory of New Energy Grid-connected Operation and Control in Gansu Province, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhou Jiawu, A., Electrical and Information Engineering College of LanZhou, University of Technology, China; Bao Guangqing, B., Electrical and Information Engineering College of LanZhou, University of Technology, China; Ma Ming, C., Power Science Research Institute of State Grid Gansu Electric Power Company, China, Key Laboratory of New Energy Grid-connected Operation and Control in Gansu Province, China; Wang Ningbo, D., Power Science Research Institute of State Grid Gansu Electric Power Company, China, Key Laboratory of New Energy Grid-connected Operation and Control in Gansu Province, China
Abstract: The high volatility and weak support of wind, photovoltaic power generation and other new energy sources have a negative impact on the stability of the power system. Therefore, the power spectrum density of the power curve compensating the combined output of wind power and photovoltaic power was analyzed by discrete Fourier transform (DFT)based on the study of the random fluctuation characteristics of wind power and photovoltaic output, and the multi-energy frequency division compensation control mode of thermal power, hydropower and energy storage was proposed to deal with the fluctuation of high proportion of new energy grid-connection. Firstly, the wave compensation is decomposed into low frequency, medium frequency and high frequency components by two wavelet packet decomposition. Then the annual operating cost is minimized to optimize the capacity of different compensation units according to the output characteristics of differ-ent energy units on the basis of introducing the penalty coefficient of fluctuation. By analyzing the data of wind farm group and photovoltaic power station in a western region, the correctness and feasibility of the proposed scheduling optimization method are verified. © 2019 The Korean Institute of Power Electronics (KIPE).
Author Keywords: Fluctuation of new energy grid connection; Frequency division compensation; Optimal control; Wavelet packet decomposition

Authors: Zhao M., Li S., Xiao D., Zhao G., Li B., Liu L., Chen X., Yang M.
Title: Consumption ability estimation of distribution system interconnected with microgrids
Source title: Proceedings - IEEE International Conference on Energy Internet, ICEI 2019
Affiliations: Economic Research Institute, State Grid Jibei Electric Power Company Limited, Beijing, China; Key Laboratory of Underwater Acoustic Environment, Institute of Acoustics, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, M., Economic Research Institute, State Grid Jibei Electric Power Company Limited, Beijing, China; Li, S., Economic Research Institute, State Grid Jibei Electric Power Company Limited, Beijing, China; Xiao, D., Key Laboratory of Underwater Acoustic Environment, Institute of Acoustics, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; Zhao, G., Economic Research Institute, State Grid Jibei Electric Power Company Limited, Beijing, China; Li, B., Economic Research Institute, State Grid Jibei Electric Power Company Limited, Beijing, China; Liu, L., Economic Research Institute, State Grid Jibei Electric Power Company Limited, Beijing, China; Chen, X., Economic Research Institute, State Grid Jibei Electric Power Company Limited, Beijing, China; Yang, M., Economic Research Institute, State Grid Jibei Electric Power Company Limited, Beijing, China
Abstract: With fast development of distributed generation, storages and control techniques, a growing number of microgrids are interconnected with distribution networks. Microgrid capacity that a local distribution system can afford, is important to distribution network planning and microgrids well-organized integration. Therefore, this paper focuses on estimating consumption ability of distribution system interconnected with microgrids. The method to judge rationality of microgrids access plan is put forward, and an index system covering operation security, power quality and energy management is proposed. Consumption ability estimation procedure based on rationality evaluation and interactions is built up then, and requirements on multi-scenario simulation are presented. Case study on a practical distribution system design with multi-microgrids guarantees the validity and reasonableness of the proposed method and process. The results also indicate construction and reinforcement directions for the distribution network. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Li D., Chen H., Yuan H.
Title: Optimal dispatch for power system considering pumped storage and demand response
Source title: Proceedings - IEEE International Conference on Energy Internet, ICEI 2019
Affiliations: Xi'an Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Xi'an, China; Training Center of State Grid, Zhe'Jiang Electric Power Co.Ltd., Hang'zhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, D., Xi'an Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Xi'an, China; Chen, H., Training Center of State Grid, Zhe'Jiang Electric Power Co.Ltd., Hang'zhou, China; Yuan, H., Xi'an Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Xi'an, China
Abstract: Renewable energy has been vigorously developed in recent years. However, considering the characteristics of intermittence and stochastic volatility, it will be hard to schedule the smart grid with renewable energy accessing. Reasonable optimized dispatching can consume more renewable energy, because the development of pumped storage and demand response brings more flexibility to optimal dispatch of power system. Therefore, an optimal dispatching model for power system containing various renewable energy is proposed in this paper. The impact of pumped storage and demand response on the renewable energy consumption is also included. With the economic efficiency as objective function, the established shortterm optimal dispatching model is combined with the interaction of demand response and the hydropower model with pumped storage. Finally, the case study is performed based on a 63-unit test system, and results verify the effectiveness and superiority of the proposed model. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Demand response; Optimal Dispatch; Pumped Storage; Renewable energy

Source title: Proceedings - IEEE International Conference on Energy Internet, ICEI 2019

Authors with affiliations: Zhao, S., Dalian University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Dalian, China; Hu, X., Dalian University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Dalian, China; Li, X., Dalian University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Dalian, China; Ba, Y., Dalian University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Dalian, China; Li, W., Dalian University of Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Dalian, China
Abstract: As Battery Energy Storage (BES) has valuable regulation characteristics, it may become an important Automatic Generation Control (AGC) auxiliary service provider in the future power grid operation. However, the existing evaluation standard has low qualification on the regulation speed, insufficient consideration on the battery life and the state of charge issue, which causes BES benefit little from its technology and economic advantages. Comparing BES with conventional units on their regulation performance, state of charge constraints and key factors affecting battery life, we propose three regulation requirements including (1) improving the regulation speed, (2) relaxing the regulation accuracy, and (3) allowing appropriate reverse regulation. By analyzing the optimal response pattern when BES cooperating with AGC service, we design a novel evaluation standard regarding battery life for BES AGC control performance referring to existing standards. The simulation shows that our evaluation criteria improve the frequency quality, activate BES regulation, contribute docking with existing standards precisely. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Automatic generation control (AGC); Battery energy storage (BES); Battery life; Evaluation standard; State of charge (SOC)
Index Keywords: Battery management systems; Battery storage; Charging (batteries); Electric power system control; Electric power transmission networks; Secondary batteries; Automatic generation control; Battery energy storages (BES); Battery life; Evaluation standard; State of charge; Quality control

Authors: Wang X., Shi J., Liu L., Gu J., Zhu K.
Title: Optimum configuration of grid-connected microgrid based on probability model
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 8th Joint International Information Technology and Artificial Intelligence Conference, ITAIC 2019
Affiliations: State Grid Zhejiang Economy Research Institute, Hangzhou, 310000, China; State Grid Lishui Power Supply Company, Lishui, 323000, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, X., State Grid Zhejiang Economy Research Institute, Hangzhou, 310000, China; Shi, J., State Grid Lishui Power Supply Company, Lishui, 323000, China; Liu, L., State Grid Lishui Power Supply Company, Lishui, 323000, China; Gu, J., State Grid Zhejiang Economy Research Institute, Hangzhou, 310000, China; Zhu, K., State Grid Zhejiang Economy Research Institute, Hangzhou, 310000, China
Abstract: Due to the different location and resource endowments of microgrids, it is difficult to unify or standardize different microgrid configurations. At present, under the policy guidance that wind power and photovoltaic power generation need to be completely eliminated, microgrids have further increased the peak-to-valley difference than the simple load due to the irregularity of their internal source, network, load and storage configuration. The trend presents a random two-way, which causes difficulties in the configuration of relay protection and uneconomical operation of the line. This paper considers the probability characteristics of wind power and photovoltaic output, and the economic operation conditions of integrated power lines. The particle swarm optimization algorithm is used to give the internal configuration optimization model of the networked microgrid. This paper establishes the optimization goal from the perspective of the external characteristics of the networked microgrid, and views the microgrid configuration optimization problem from the perspective of global economy. It avoids the external system burden caused by the internal efficiency and performance of the microgrid. The method is robust and has certain guiding significance for the development and configuration of the microgrid in the later stage. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: External characteristics; Microgrid; Optimization algorithm; Probability; Renewable energy

Authors: Jiaqian Z., Jingjing Y., Kejian S.
Title: Design of on-line monitoring system for catenary compensation device
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 8th Joint International Information Technology and Artificial Intelligence Conference, ITAIC 2019
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, China
Authors with affiliations: Jiaqian, Z., School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, China; Jingjing, Y., School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, China; Kejian, S., School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, China
Abstract: The safe operation of high-speed railway is directly affected by the reliability of catenary. Manual inspection is time/labor consumptive, bad real-time and etc. To solve these problems, a non-contact intelligent remote control monitoring system based on laser sensor is devised in this paper which can effectively monitor the catenary status and send alarm messages in time. On the respect of performance improvement, GPRS Network Communication Technology is applied to reduce the difficulty and cost of the access to the Internet of the intelligent terminal. A SD card is used to expand the store space to enhance the capacity of batch data processing. In order to decrease the consumption of outdoor electrical energy, a relay is utilized in circuit to control the turn-on and off of the solar power. At the same time, the control software is capable to analyze and store massive data with database technology. It turns out that the system has high reliability and real-time performance in functions such as acquiring accurate data and alarming timely by means of the spot test. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Xu Z., Shen L., Song W., Zhang Y., Zheng X.
Title: Unpowered walking assistive device based on gait kinetic energy analysis
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 8th Joint International Information Technology and Artificial Intelligence Conference, ITAIC 2019
Affiliations: School of Mechatronic Engineering and Automation, Shanghai University, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Xu, Z., School of Mechatronic Engineering and Automation, Shanghai University, Shanghai, China; Shen, L., School of Mechatronic Engineering and Automation, Shanghai University, Shanghai, China; Song, W., School of Mechatronic Engineering and Automation, Shanghai University, Shanghai, China; Zhang, Y., School of Mechatronic Engineering and Automation, Shanghai University, Shanghai, China; Zheng, X., School of Mechatronic Engineering and Automation, Shanghai University, Shanghai, China
Abstract: In recent years, there has been increased attention paid to the research of lower extremity walking assistive devices. However, many of them are powered by external energy and require separate actuators with corresponding control modules, which increase the overall quality while reducing the portability and wear-ability. In this paper, through the gait kinetic energy analysis, we summarized the movement rules of each joint in lower extremity to improve the walking efficiency. Considering that ankle joint whose movement rules are apparent has a significant influence on human gait performance, we proposed that there is a negative work stage in dorsiflexion, whereas plantarflexion does positive work by consuming muscle energy to drive the body forward. Therefore, we designed an unpowered walking assistant device, which imitated the normal gait by using the characteristics of energy storage under pressure of torsion spring in dorsiflexion and energy release in plantarflexion. The biodynamic simulation of the proposed design was conducted to verify the function of walking-assistant. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Gait; Kinetic energy analysis; Unpowered assistive device; Walking efficiency
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Energy efficiency; Energy management; Kinetic energy; Kinetics; Quality control; Assistive devices; Energy analysis; External energy; Gait; Lower extremity; Overall quality; Torsion Springs; Walking efficiency; Walking aids

Authors: Li Z.-L., Wang L.-Y., Yu J.-Y., Cheng B.-W., Hao L.
Title: The design of lightweight and multi parallel CNN accelerator based on FPGA
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE 8th Joint International Information Technology and Artificial Intelligence Conference, ITAIC 2019
Affiliations: Beijing Institute of Spacecraft System Engineering, China Academy of Space Technology, Beijing, 100094, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, Z.-L., Beijing Institute of Spacecraft System Engineering, China Academy of Space Technology, Beijing, 100094, China; Wang, L.-Y., Beijing Institute of Spacecraft System Engineering, China Academy of Space Technology, Beijing, 100094, China; Yu, J.-Y., Beijing Institute of Spacecraft System Engineering, China Academy of Space Technology, Beijing, 100094, China; Cheng, B.-W., Beijing Institute of Spacecraft System Engineering, China Academy of Space Technology, Beijing, 100094, China; Hao, L., Beijing Institute of Spacecraft System Engineering, China Academy of Space Technology, Beijing, 100094, China
Abstract: In this paper, a lightweight, parallel computing and storage, high energy efficiency CNN accelerator based on FPGA was designed. According to the characteristics of forward inference structure of deep convolution neural network, the parallel characteristics of convolution operation are analyzed from two aspects of computational efficiency and data reuse rate, and the full parallel pipeline implementation of full connection layer is studied. The accelerator has adopted full parallel pipeline structure to improve the computational efficiency, and making full use of various convolution parallel computing architectures to balance the requirements of computing efficiency, parameters and data load bandwidth, a lightweight and tightly coupled accelerator architecture is designed based on the characteristics of hardware resources such as internal computing, logic and storage in FPGA. In the validation test of open data set based on ImageNet, the accelerator is deployed on Xilinx Virtex7-690T FPGA with 28nm technology, under the working frequency of 200MHz, the maximum number of multiplication and addition operation is 1728 times per cycle, the peak operation rate is 691.2Gops, the energy ratio is 138.24Gops/w. In the end, the classification results are consistent with the processing results using double-precision floating-point data format. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Infrared thermography and computer simulation in research of PEM fuel cells
Source title: Proceedings of the 2019 20th International Scientific Conference on  Electric Power Engineering, EPE 2019
Affiliations: Department of Electric Power Engineering, VSB-Technical University of Ostrava, Ostrava, Czech Republic; ENET Centre-Research Centre of Energy Units for Utilization of Non Traditional Energy Sources, VSB-Technical University of Ostrava, Ostrava, Czech Republic

Abstract: The method of infrared thermography was used in this paper to identify over-heated areas inside module of hydrogen fuel cells. This module fitted with polymer proton exchange membranes, is a part of a laboratory off-grid system that serves to storage of electricity gained from photovoitaic panels. Hydrogen is not an energy source but a storage medium and an energy carrier. Hydrogen module operation with insufficient cooling can lead to its overheating and destruction. The cause of this undesirable state is detected here by the help of computer simulation using suitable numerical model. An appropriate solution to this problem is proposed to allowed a more efficient and safe operation of this module of hydrogen fuel cells. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Zheng H., Xiong K., Fan P., Zhong Z.
Title: Wireless powered communication networks assisted by multiple fog servers
Source title: 2019 IEEE International Conference on Communications Workshops, ICC Workshops 2019 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Computer and Information Technology, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, 100044, China; Department of Electronic Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China; State Key Lab of Rail Traffic Control and Safety, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, 100044, China; Beijing Engineering Research Center of High-speed Railway Broadband Mobile Communications, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, 100044, China

Abstract: This paper investigates the optimal design of the wireless powered communication network, where a power transmitter (PT) and multiple fog servers (FSs) are used to charge an energy-constrained wireless device (WD) by radio-frequency (RF)-based energy harvesting, and the WD's computing task is partioned into multiple parts, processed by WD itself (local computing) and FSs (fog computing) jointly, in which an orthogonal spreading coding (OSC)-based transmission protocol is employed for task offloading. For such a system, we formulate an optimization problem to maximize system computation rate by jointly optimizing the energy beamforming, the time assignment, the computing frequency and the power allocation at the WD in the presence of multiple system constraints, including the energy causality, the computation capability and the power and the storage capacities. Since the problem is non-convex, we first transform it into some equivalent forms and then design a Dinkelbach's programming-based method to solve it. Some semi-closed form results are obtained. Simulation results show that our proposed system with OSC outperforms the benchmark systems. It also confirms that with the increment of the number of FSs, the computation rate will increase, but the increasing rate is rapidly decreased if the FS number is larger than 3. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Fog computing; Joint computing and offloading; Multi-server offloading; Wireless power transfer

Authors: Elia Y., Lucache D.D., Serea E.
Title: Battery Energy Storage Applications: Two Case Studies
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 8th International Conference on Modern Power Systems, MPS 2019
Affiliations: Energy Storage Systems Solutions Dep., Ormat Technologies, Inc., Yavne, Israel; Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Gheorghe Asachi Technical University of Iasi, Iasi, Romania
Authors with affiliations: Elia, Y., Energy Storage Systems Solutions Dep., Ormat Technologies, Inc., Yavne, Israel; Lucache, D.D., Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Gheorghe Asachi Technical University of Iasi, Iasi, Romania; Serea, E., Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Gheorghe Asachi Technical University of Iasi, Iasi, Romania
Abstract: The worldwide increasing energy consumption resulted in a demand for more load on existing electricity grid. The electricity grid is a complex system in which power supply and demand must be equal at any given moment. Constant adjustments to the supply are needed for predictable changes in demand, such as the daily patterns of human activity, as well as unexpected changes from equipment overloads and storms. Energy storage plays an important role in this balancing act and helps to create a more flexible and reliable grid system. In additional, most developed countries have adopted policies to reduce nuclear and fossil fuel consumption and to increase the renewabies energy plant as wind power, hydroelectric, solar thermal, solar thermo-electric and photovoltaic. To reduce the dependence of the renewable energy on the hour duration of the wind and sun it is important to develop and use the various technologies of energy storage. Among these, battery energy storage systems (BESS) are currently escalating and trending major growth in the world market. The paper mainly discuss different applications of BESS and exemplifies with two study cases. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: Reducing the cost of manufacturing batteries for electricity storage has led EU Electricity Distributors OD to investment programs in battery storage systems and the supply of electricity stored at daily peak load or in case of damage to the regional power supply consumers over limited time periods. Combined with the possibility of powering storage batteries in local photovoltaic or wind farms, the storage of electricity and the delivery to the energy system leads to the reduction of the Technological Consumption, the elimination of the interruptions in the power supply of the consumers and implicitly the development of a regional business for the Operators OD sale of electricity from renewable sources. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Electromobility and Climate Change

Abstract: At the moment, the generalization of electric transportation creates the fear that this will increase both global warming and CO2 pollution generated from power plants using fossil fuels as a result of increased electricity demand. The paper analyzes the real situation in Romania and abroad in terms of pollution sources and the modern methods that our society will provide in the near future: energy storage in batteries and the massive recycling the waste battery materials. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Grigoras G., Neagu B.-C., Ivanov O.
Title: An Efficient Approach for Flattening the Electricity Consumption Profile at Small and Medium Enterprises
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 8th International Conference on Modern Power Systems, MPS 2019

Abstract: Production scheduling represents a significant tool for reducing the cost of electricity bills, flattening the consumption profile, energy conservation, improving the energy efficiency and economic performance, and strengthening competitiveness at small and medium enterprises (SMEs). Considering these aspects, an efficient approach for flattening the electricity consumption profile based on the production scheduling at SMEs was proposed. The optimal solutions were obtained using combinational optimization. The approach was tested at an industrial consumer (a small enterprise in the automobile repair activity domain). The obtained results led at a decrease of peak values of the electricity consumption with 15.87%. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Chen Z., Chen Z., Jia Y., Liang L.
Title: Residual Energy-Aware Caching in Mobile D2D Cellular Network
Source title: IEEE International Conference on Communications
Affiliations: School of Microelectronics and Communication Engineering, Chongqing University, Chongqing, 400044, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, Z., School of Microelectronics and Communication Engineering, Chongqing University, Chongqing, 400044, China; Chen, Z., School of Microelectronics and Communication Engineering, Chongqing University, Chongqing, 400044, China; Jia, Y., School of Microelectronics and Communication Engineering, Chongqing University, Chongqing, 400044, China; Liang, L., School of Microelectronics and Communication Engineering, Chongqing University, Chongqing, 400044, China
Abstract: Caching popular contents at the mobile devices is a promising technique to alleviate the backhaul data rate demand. Since both file placement and data exchange among mobile devices consume energy, the energy status of devices has a significant effect on the caching utility of the whole system. This work considers the caching optimization in a cellular network where mobile devices are served by one base station (BS). As the devices can collect the file segments from the local storage, via device-to-device (D2D) links, and via a cellular link, we aim at minimizing the percentage of file segment that should be collected from the BS by optimizing the file placement scheme at devices to improve caching performance. Due to the difficulty of solving the optimal caching problem, we propose a residual energy-aware file placement algorithm based on the popularity distribution of contents and causality of energy arrival. Simulation results show that in comparison to other two conventional caching methods, the proposed algorithm can effectively reduce the percentage of file segments that collected from the BS. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Electronic data interchange; Power management (telecommunication); Wireless networks; Caching methods; Caching performance; Cellular links; Cellular network; Energy status; File placement; Popularity distribution; Residual energy; Mobile telecommunication systems

Authors: Bhat R.V., Motani M., Murthy C.R., Vaze R.
Title: Energy Harvesting Communications with Batteries Having Full-Cycle Constraints
Source title: IEEE International Conference on Communications
Authors with affiliations: Bhat, R.V.; Motani, M.; Murthy, C.R.; Vaze, R.
Abstract: In energy harvesting (EH) communications, it is customary to use a battery to temporarily store harvested energy prior to using it for communication. In practice, these batteries suffer from degradation in the usable capacity when they are repeatedly charged after being partially discharged and vice versa. The capacity can be recovered by imposing the full-cycle constraint, which says that a battery must be charged only after it is fully discharged and vice versa. Further, practical batteries cannot be charged and discharged simultaneously. With the above constraints, we consider and compare EH communication systems under two cases: (a) the single-battery case and (b) the dual-battery case, in which the transmitters are equipped with a single battery of capacity 2B joules and two batteries, each having capacity of B joules, respectively. Under (a) and (b), our goal is to obtain the long-term average throughputs and throughput regions in a point-to-point (P2P) channel and a multiple access channel (MAC), respectively. For the P2P channel, we derive the optimal solution in the single-battery case, and propose optimal and suboptimal power allocation policies for the dual-battery case, assuming Bernoulli energy arrivals. Based on these policies, we obtain long-term average achievable throughput regions in MACs by jointly allocating rates and powers. From numerical simulations, we find that the optimal throughput in the dual-battery case is significantly higher than that in the single-battery case, although the total storage capacity in both cases is 2B joules. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Energy harvesting; Achievable throughputs; Average throughput; Multiple access channels; Optimal solutions; Optimal throughputs; Power allocations; Storage capacity; Throughput regions; Electric batteries

Authors: Yang C., Chen X., Liu Y., Zhong W., Xie S.
Title: Efficient Task Offloading and Resource Allocation for Edge Computing-Based Smart Grid Networks
Source title: IEEE International Conference on Communications
Affiliations: School of Automation, Guangdong University of Technology, Guangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, C., School of Automation, Guangdong University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Chen, X., School of Automation, Guangdong University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Liu, Y., School of Automation, Guangdong University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Zhong, W., School of Automation, Guangdong University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Xie, S., School of Automation, Guangdong University of Technology, Guangzhou, China
Abstract: By providing computation and storage resources at the edge of the wireless access networks, edge computing(EC) has been regarded as a provisioning solution to enable the efficient, reliable and cost-effective two-way energy and information flows in smart grids. In this paper, we propose the framework of EC-based smart grid networks, in which EC servers are deployed at the gateways between the remote cloud center and the terminal smart meters. The EC servers perform energy scheduling and renewable energy generation(RG) output forecasting, based on the collected power demand data of terminal devices and monitoring data of RG equipments. According to the inherent collaboration features of the monitoring data offloading, that the outputs of the same size/type RG equipments in a limited area are the same in a short time, we consider an efficient cooperative task offloading and resource allocation scheme. Not all of the monitoring data should be offloaded. Then, an optimal problem is formulated, the transmission powers and channels, computation resource allocation and task offloading fraction of devices are jointly optimized. Numerical results show that our proposed schemes reduce the system cost efficiently, while the latency constraints are ensured. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Computer networks; Cost effectiveness; Digital storage; Edge computing; Electric power transmission networks; Monitoring; Renewable energy resources; Resource allocation; Computation resource allocations; Cooperative tasks; Energy and information; Latency constraints; Renewable energy generation; Resource allocation schemes; Smart grid networks; Wireless access networks; Smart power grids

Authors: Qian L.P., Feng A., Feng X., Wu Y.
Title: Deep RL-Based Time Scheduling and Power Allocation in EH Relay Communication Networks
Source title: IEEE International Conference on Communications
Affiliations: College of Information Engineering, Zhejiang University of Technology, Hangzhou, Zhejiang, China; National Mobile Communications Research Laboratory, Southeast University, Nanjing, Jiangsu, China
Authors with affiliations: Qian, L.P., College of Information Engineering, Zhejiang University of Technology, Hangzhou, Zhejiang, China, National Mobile Communications Research Laboratory, Southeast University, Nanjing, Jiangsu, China; Feng, A., College of Information Engineering, Zhejiang University of Technology, Hangzhou, Zhejiang, China; Feng, X., College of Information Engineering, Zhejiang University of Technology, Hangzhou, Zhejiang, China; Wu, Y., College of Information Engineering, Zhejiang University of Technology, Hangzhou, Zhejiang, China
Abstract: Powering relays with harvested renewable ambient energy has been emerging as a promising solution to reduce the on-grid energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions in green relaying communication networks. In this paper, we study the joint time scheduling and power allocation problem for the Decode-and-Forward energy-harvesting relay communication network. Particularly, our goal is to maximize the end-to-end throughput by a deadline subject to the finite data and energy storage. Due to the multi-slot optimization, the traditional deep reinforcement learning (RL) framework cannot be directly applied to obtain the optimal solution of maximizing the end-to-end throughput by a deadline in the online manner. To this end, we explore a novel deep reinforcement learning framework consisting of multiple computation units to obtain the online time scheduling and power allocation based on the current causal knowledge of energy arrivals and channel fading at each time slot. Simulation results show that the proposed deep reinforcement learning based algorithm can achieve more than 90% of maximum end-to-end throughput. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Adu J.A., Rios Penaloza J.D., Napolitano F., Tossani F.
Title: Virtual Inertia in a Microgrid with Renewable Generation and a Battery Energy Storage System in Islanding Transition
Source title: SyNERGY MED 2019 - 1st International Conference on Energy Transition in the Mediterranean Area
Authors with affiliations: Adu, J.A.; Rios Penaloza, J.D.; Napolitano, F.; Tossani, F.
Abstract: This paper focuses on the islanding transition of an AC microgrid equipped with a doubly-fed induction generator wind turbine, a photovoltaic unit, a battery energy storage system (BESS) and local loads. It is well known that the islanding transition put at risk system stability, especially for the systems with low inertia. This paper has explored the combined contribution of virtual inertia support schemes applied to the BESS and to the DC-link capacitor of the back-to-back inverter of the wind power generator in order to ensure a smooth islanding transition by preserving the microgrid stability. For this purpose, we analyse the frequency/inertia support provided by two virtual inertia control schemes: i) a virtual synchronous generator technique on the BESS and ii) a DC-link capacitor control. The analysis is carried out by using time domain simulations in the DIgSILENT PowerFactory environment. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery energy storage system; Distributed energy resource; Frequency control; Islanding; Microgrid; Virtual inertia; Virtual synchronous generator; Wind turbine

Authors: Armenakis A., Chatzigeorgiou N., Afxenti S., Panagiotou K., Efthymiou V., Georghiou G.E.
Title: System Implementation and Preliminary Results of a Community Battery Energy Storage System
Source title: SyNERGY MED 2019 - 1st International Conference on Energy Transition in the Mediterranean Area
Affiliations: Electricity Authority of Cyprus, Nicosia, 2025, Cyprus; Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, FOSS Research Centre for Sustainable Energy, PV Technology Lab, University of Cyprus, Nicosia, 2109, Cyprus
Authors with affiliations: Armenakis, A., Electricity Authority of Cyprus, Nicosia, 2025, Cyprus; Chatzigeorgiou, N., Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, FOSS Research Centre for Sustainable Energy, PV Technology Lab, University of Cyprus, Nicosia, 2109, Cyprus; Afxenti, S., Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, FOSS Research Centre for Sustainable Energy, PV Technology Lab, University of Cyprus, Nicosia, 2109, Cyprus; Panagiotou, K., Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, FOSS Research Centre for Sustainable Energy, PV Technology Lab, University of Cyprus, Nicosia, 2109, Cyprus; Efthymiou, V., Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, FOSS Research Centre for Sustainable Energy, PV Technology Lab, University of Cyprus, Nicosia, 2109, Cyprus; Georghiou, G.E., Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, FOSS Research Centre for Sustainable Energy, PV Technology Lab, University of Cyprus, Nicosia, 2109, Cyprus
Abstract: All power systems have some inherent level of flexibility as loads change over time and sometimes in unpredictable ways. In addition, as renewable energy sources (RES) are intermittent in nature (this is more common to wind systems and less for PV systems) increasing their share in the energy mix means the demand/supply balance will be even harder to achieve through the existing inflexible conventional power plans. Battery energy storage systems (BESS) are a promising technology that can provide flexibility., reliability, and resilience to the power grid. This paper focuses on the analysis of the first-ever community BESS installed in Cyprus, in terms of system integration, control strategies, and overall system operation. At the end of the paper, recommendations for further exploitation of the community BESS are given, such as the possibility of providing ancillary services to the distribution grid. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Yianni C., Efthymiou V., Venizelou V., Georghiou G.E.
Title: Provision of Frequency Regulation Service and Peak Demand Reduction by Distributed Battery Storage
Source title: SyNERGY MED 2019 - 1st International Conference on Energy Transition in the Mediterranean Area
Affiliations: FOSS Research Center, University of Cyprus, Nicosia, Cyprus
Authors with affiliations: Yianni, C., FOSS Research Center, University of Cyprus, Nicosia, Cyprus; Efthymiou, V., FOSS Research Center, University of Cyprus, Nicosia, Cyprus; Venizelou, V., FOSS Research Center, University of Cyprus, Nicosia, Cyprus; Georghiou, G.E., FOSS Research Center, University of Cyprus, Nicosia, Cyprus
Abstract: This paper investigates the potential for provision of frequency regulation services in combination with other financially rewarding services, such as peak demand reduction and Photovoltaic (PV) export support by distributed Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS). Initially, the financial potential from the individual services were estimated and the possible combination of services were evaluated. Historical data for consumption and PV generation were used from residential sites from various locations in Cyprus, as well as frequency measurements from the local electricity grid. Modelling and simulation of those services was performed, based on the historical data and subsequently the operational and financial performance of the services was examined. Different combinations of services were tested, and the operational and technical conflicts were indicated. The most valuable and viable combinations are presented and analyzed further. A high-level control strategy has been developed aiming at the maximization of the economic value streams while avoiding the operational and technical conflicts. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery Energy Storage Systems; Distributed Storage; Frequency Regulation; Grid Services; Photovoltaics
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Electric batteries; Photovoltaic cells; Battery energy storage systems; Distributed storage; Frequency regulations; Grid services; Photovoltaics; Battery storage
