Authors: Zhang Y., Feng D., Tong W., Liu J., Wang C., Xu J.
Title: Tiered-ReRAM: A Low Latency and Energy Efficient TLC Crossbar ReRAM Architecture
Source title: IEEE Symposium on Mass Storage Systems and Technologies
Affiliations: Wuhan National Laboratory for Optoelectronics, Key Laboratory of Information Storage System, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Ministry of Education, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, Y., Wuhan National Laboratory for Optoelectronics, Key Laboratory of Information Storage System, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Ministry of Education, China; Feng, D., Wuhan National Laboratory for Optoelectronics, Key Laboratory of Information Storage System, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Ministry of Education, China; Tong, W., Wuhan National Laboratory for Optoelectronics, Key Laboratory of Information Storage System, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Ministry of Education, China; Liu, J., Wuhan National Laboratory for Optoelectronics, Key Laboratory of Information Storage System, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Ministry of Education, China; Wang, C., Wuhan National Laboratory for Optoelectronics, Key Laboratory of Information Storage System, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Ministry of Education, China; Xu, J., Wuhan National Laboratory for Optoelectronics, Key Laboratory of Information Storage System, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Ministry of Education, China
Abstract: Resistive Memory (ReRAM) is promising to be used as high density storage-class memory by employing Triple-Level Cell (TLC) and crossbar structures. However, TLC crossbar ReRAM suffers from high write latency and energy due to the IR drop issue and the iterative program-and-verify procedure. In this paper, we propose Tiered-ReRAM architecture to overcome the challenges of TLC crossbar ReRAM. The proposed Tiered-ReRAM consists of three components, namely Tiered-crossbar design, Compression-based Incomplete Data Mapping (CIDM), and Compression-based Flip Scheme (CFS). Specifically, based on the observation that the magnitude of IR drops is primarily determined by the long length of bitlines in Double-Sided Ground Biasing (DSGB) crossbar arrays, Tiered-crossbar design splits each long bitline into the near and far segments by an isolation transistor, allowing the near segment to be accessed with decreased latency and energy. Moreover, in the near segments, CIDM dynamically selects the most appropriate IDM for each cache line according to the saved space by compression, which further reduces the write latency and energy with insignificant space overhead. In addition, in the far segments, CFS dynamically selects the most appropriate flip scheme for each cache line, which ensures more high resistance cells written into crossbar arrays and effectively reduces the leakage energy. For each compressed cache line, the selected IDM or flip scheme is applied on the condition that the total encoded data size will never exceed the original cache line size. The experimental results show that, on average, Tiered-ReRAM can improve the system performance by 30.5%, reduce the write latency by 35.2%, decrease the read latency by 26.1%, and reduce the energy consumption by 35.6%, compared to an aggressive baseline. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: compression; flip scheme; Incomplete Data Mapping; IR drop; TLC crossbar ReRAM; write latency and energy

Title: Simulator for automation and control systems in a power system
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 22nd International Conference on Control Systems and Computer Science, CSCS 2019
Affiliations: University Politehnica of Bucharest, Faculty of Automatic Control and Computers, Bucharest, Romania

Abstract: Through the future Smart Grid influenced by the challenges brought by distributed and unpredictable generation, limited energy storage infrastructure or shifting consumption patterns, the real-Time large-scale system control becomes a necessity. When several energy concepts are translated into simulated processes, it is important to implement and test a large range of applications from process control, electrical grid protection systems, automatic line/reserve switching, monitoring and control of energy systems, for training reasons. Energy applications can vary from generation, transport/distribution and consumption, these covering a wide area of applications of discrete and continuous control. In this context, the paper presents the simulator system architecture, implemented applications and field necessity. As shown in the paper, the simulator applications vary from generation control to load control, including various specific automation functions and energy management in the grid. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Jiang T., Yang X., Shi Y., Wang H.
Title: Layer-wise Deep Neural Network Pruning via Iteratively Reweighted Optimization
Source title: ICASSP, IEEE International Conference on Acoustics, Speech and Signal Processing - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, Shanghai, 201210, China
Authors with affiliations: Jiang, T., School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, Shanghai, 201210, China; Yang, X., School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, Shanghai, 201210, China; Shi, Y., School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, Shanghai, 201210, China; Wang, H., School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, Shanghai, 201210, China
Abstract: The huge number of parameters of deep neural network makes it difficult to deploy on embedded devices with limited hardware, computation, storage and energy resources. In this paper, we shall propose a log-sum minimization approach to prune a trained network layer by layer thereby improving the network compression ratio. Specifically, this is achieved by enhancing sparsity for network parameters such that the output of the network after pruning is consistent with the original one. We further present an iteratively reweighted algorithm to solve the nonconvex and nonsmooth log-sum minimization problem with general convex constraints. Furthermore, we show the existence of the cluster points for the iterates and the global convergence of the proposed iteratively reweighted algorithm. Numerical experiments demonstrate that the proposed approach is able to significantly prune the trained neural network while preserving the prediction accuracy. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: In this study, a broadband RF energy harvester implementation is presented. The system uses a broadband discone antenna, which can operate efficiently in a broad frequency spectrum, including LTE, DCS 1800 and UMTS 2100 cellular frequency bands. The system is able to acquire energy from many electromagnetic field sources increasing the total amount of energy harvested, in order to charge a storage energy element efficiently in a short time. The prototype broadband RF energy harvester was tested on the laboratory and also in a typical urban environment. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Li Z., Wang C., Ding Y., Yang M., Zhu W.
Title: Probability-interval based optimal planning of integrated energy system with uncertain wind power
Source title: Conference Record - Industrial and Commercial Power Systems Technical Conference
Affiliations: University of Shandong, 17923 Jingshi Road, Jinan, 250061, China; State Grid of China Technology College, 500 Erhuan South Road, Jinan, 250002, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, Z., University of Shandong, 17923 Jingshi Road, Jinan, 250061, China; Wang, C., University of Shandong, 17923 Jingshi Road, Jinan, 250061, China; Ding, Y., State Grid of China Technology College, 500 Erhuan South Road, Jinan, 250002, China; Yang, M., University of Shandong, 17923 Jingshi Road, Jinan, 250061, China; Zhu, W., University of Shandong, 17923 Jingshi Road, Jinan, 250061, China
Abstract: Owing to higher energy supply efficiency and operational flexibility, integrated energy system (IES), including power, heating and gas systems, will be the primary form of energy supply in the future. However, with the increase of large-scale stochastic wind power integrated, the IES operation will face significant challenge as same as traditional power system. In view of the above problems, considering the probability distribution characteristics of wind power, a conditional value-at-risk (CVaR) based probability-interval method is proposed to describe the uncertain wind power in this paper. Then, besides traditional facilities, electricity storage system (ESS) is introduced to improve the flexibility of IES. Furthermore, a planning model is established based on minimizing the total cost including investment, operation, CVaR cost and unserved energy cost. Finally, an IEEE14-NGS14 system is constructed and its planning model is solved by GAMS/CPLEX. The numerical results illustrate the correctness and effectiveness of the proposed method. © 2019 IEEE.

Modal Analysis describes how the optimal placement and sizing of the SMES is determined for a test system to improve voltage stability. Results from simulations are given. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Standalone hybrid energy system model and control for economic load dispatch
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 Southern African Universities Power Engineering Conference/Robotics and Mechatronics/Pattern Recognition Association of South Africa, SAUPEC/RobMech/PRASA 2019
Affiliations: Dept. of Electrical and Electronic Science, University of Johannesburg, Johannesburg, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Mhlanga, J., Dept. of Electrical and Electronic Science, University of Johannesburg, Johannesburg, South Africa; Dzobo, O., Dept. of Electrical and Electronic Science, University of Johannesburg, Johannesburg, South Africa
Abstract: It is very expensive to connect remote areas to the grid. For reliable and sustainable electricity supply in remote areas, renewable energy sources are commonly used as supply options. Wind and solar energy are the most sustainable renewable energy resources because of their good compensation characters when combined into a hybrid energy system. This paper presents a case study of a hybrid energy system for a remote rural location. The hybrid energy system consists of a solar photovoltaic system, wind energy system, battery bank storage system and a diesel generator. The diesel generator is used for backup power supply. Results show that the proposed hybrid energy system performs better than the diesel generator acting alone. The economic saving is more than 50% when the proposed hybrid energy system is used. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Daniel F., Rix A.
Title: Optimising the Design of a Hybrid Power Supply Using a Genetic Algorithm
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 Southern African Universities Power Engineering Conference/Robotics and Mechatronics/Pattern Recognition Association of South Africa, SAUPEC/RobMech/PRASA 2019
Affiliations: Dept. of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, University of Stellenbosch, Stellenbosch, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Daniel, F., Dept. of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, University of Stellenbosch, Stellenbosch, South Africa; Rix, A., Dept. of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, University of Stellenbosch, Stellenbosch, South Africa
Abstract: This paper proposes the optimisation of a hybrid power supply (HPS) design by implementing a Genetic Algorithm (GA). Single-source renewable energy systems (RES) are associated with low capacity factor, high capital costs and intermittency. Combining two or more power sources, whether renewable or non-renewable, increases the system's reliability in terms of power consistency, reduces fuel emissions and is a more sustainable and financial viable solution overall. A grid-connection and a battery storage system can further increase the dispatchability of the system. The design of each HPS can become more complex due to the location and stochastic availability of renewable energy sources. A GA is developed to solve this sizing problem. The objectives of the algorithm are: minimizing the loss of power supply probability, maximizing usage of renewable energy and minimizing capital and life cycle costs. A GA is developed to incorporate operational and dispatch strategies and a techno-economic and trade-off analysis is done to study the advantages and disadvantages of different combinations. This can help develop a methodology to choose the most suited HPS for the location and resource availability. The in-house GA will be compared with HOMER design software to highlight the similarities and differences between the two design strategies. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: genetic algorithm; HOMER; hybrid power supply; multi-attribute trade-off analysis; optimisation

Authors: Aswat M., Dangor M.R.E., Cronje W.
Title: A Standalone Personal Consumer Grid for Rural Household Electrification
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 Southern African Universities Power Engineering Conference/Robotics and Mechatronics/Pattern Recognition Association of South Africa, SAUPEC/RobMech/PRASA 2019
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, University of the Witwatersrand, Johannesburg, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Aswat, M., School of Electrical Engineering, University of the Witwatersrand, Johannesburg, South Africa; Dangor, M.R.E., School of Electrical Engineering, University of the Witwatersrand, Johannesburg, South Africa; Cronje, W., School of Electrical Engineering, University of the Witwatersrand, Johannesburg, South Africa
Abstract: An off-grid, DC, distributed generation smart grid termed the Personal Consumer (PeCo) Grid is proposed as a possible solution to address the energy poverty crisis within rural regions. The PeCo grid utilises a nature inspired de-centralised control strategy and operates at a voltage of 12 V. The PeCo grid is composed of blocks of which there are 3 variants: Renewable energy source blocks, energy storage blocks and load blocks. The flexible architecture of the PeCo grid allows for blocks to be added or removed in a plug-and-play manner. Blocks commission and operate autonomously and bus voltage signalling based control is applied to achieve the required action form each block. The PeCO grid operates autonomously and the end-user requires no technical knowledge to commission or operate the system. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Lestari R.A.S., Nurlaili E.P., Kusumo P.
Title: The effect of carbon dioxide concentration and the dimension of photobioreactor on the growth of microalgae Nannochloropsis sp.
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: Chemical Engineering Department, 17 Agustus 1945 University, Semarang, Indonesia; Food Technology Department, 17 Agustus 1945 University, Semarang, Indonesia; Center for Environmental and Energy Alternative, 17 Agustus 1945 University, Semarang, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Lestari, R.A.S., Chemical Engineering Department, 17 Agustus 1945 University, Semarang, Indonesia, Center for Environmental and Energy Alternative, 17 Agustus 1945 University, Semarang, Indonesia; Nurlaili, E.P., Food Technology Department, 17 Agustus 1945 University, Semarang, Indonesia, Center for Environmental and Energy Alternative, 17 Agustus 1945 University, Semarang, Indonesia; Kusumo, P., Chemical Engineering Department, 17 Agustus 1945 University, Semarang, Indonesia, Center for Environmental and Energy Alternative, 17 Agustus 1945 University, Semarang, Indonesia
Abstract: Microalgae is one of the organisms that can be considered ideal and potential for raw materials for bioenergy production because the lipid content in microalgae is relatively high. Microalgae are aquatic organisms that produce complex organic compounds from inorganic molecules using carbon dioxide as a source of carbon, and sunlight for energy supply. Fixation of microalgae-CO 2 has a potential advantage compared to other carbon capture and storage approaches, such as wide distribution, high photosynthesis rates, good environmental adaptability, and ease of operation. The rate of growth and capture of CO 2 from microalgae is influenced by gas flow velocity and CO 2 concentration. This study quantitatively investigated the effect of inside diameter (ID) of photobioreactor and CO 2 concentration on the growing rates of Nannochloropsis sp. microalgae cultivated in photo-bioreactors. Photobioreactor ID effects to the value of the Reynolds number. The high value of Reynold's number makes the microalgae damaged and dead. The optimal CO 2 concentration for Nannochloropsis sp. growth is 10%. © 2019 Author(s).

Authors: Wijayanti W.
Title: An effect of CO 2 on the characteristic of gas hydrate in a vessel tank
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Mechanical Engineering, Brawijaya University, Jl. Mayjend Haryono 167, Malang, 65145, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wijayanti, W., Department of Mechanical Engineering, Brawijaya University, Jl. Mayjend Haryono 167, Malang, 65145, Indonesia
Abstract: Gas hydrate represents a mixture of natural gas and water molecules formed at high pressures and low temperatures near the freezing point of water. Physically, the hydrates are ice-shaped and among the water molecules, there is a cavity filled by a hydrate gas called clathrate. The hydrates can be formed because there is gas injected in water molecules at high pressure condition having temperature above the freezing point of water. Then it is exposed to a force that can dissolve gas inside the water. A lot of research has been conducted to investigate the performance of the gas hydrate itself. The performances include the rate of hydrate formation, the hydrate stability, and the hydrate storage capacity. Several studies have been studied, among others, to observe the effect of initial gas injection pressure on gas hydrate process, the effect of rotation in a vessel tank as a container for gas hydrate formation, and the hydrate formation process on stirrer tank. One of the most important things in the gas hydrate process is how the hydrate can be formed, which can be seen from the rate of hydrate formation by investigating how much the gas pressure will penetrate into water molecules. It is due the hydrate formation requires low temperature and high pressure. However, a conditioning of the gas hydrate formation at high pressure and low temperature is a matter that requires considerable energy. Therefore, it is needed a system in which the pressure of hydrate formation is not too high. One method to lower the hydrate pressure in order to the hydrate-forming pressure is not too high, CO 2 will be mixed to the gas hydrate. It is because CO 2 is soluble in water molecules. It make an effect that the pressure of gas formation will be lower. In the previous research, it is showed that CO 2 was able to make the pressure in methane gas mixture lower. By decreasing its pressure, CO 2 is expected to improve the hydrate performances. The study was conducted by varying the percentage of CO 2 volume from 0% to 100%. Each percentage of CO 2 will be seen as its effect on the gas hydrate performance. The gas used in this experiment were propane-butane gas mixture of 50% each. The mixture of propane-butane gas and CO 2 were then fed into the water molecules. The water used was a demine water of 50 cm 3 . The initial pressure of the formation rate was 0.3 MPa and the temperature formation was 273 K. Meanwhile, the temperature used to stabilize the hydrate was 268 K. The vessel tank, used to process the occurrence of hydrate has the capability of high pressure has a cavity diameter material of 4 cm, height 12 cm, 0.5 cm thick and total volume of 150 cm 3 . The vessel tanks were inserted into the cooling bath that was set at a temperature of 273 K. The results showed that as greater the CO 2 content, as smaller the initial hydrate initiation phase, However, it has an impact to decrease the hydrate stability. For hydrate storage capacity performance, pure CO 2 hydrate has the highest storage capacity, while the lowest storage capacity was CO 2 with gas-CO 2 mixed percentage of 50%. It shows that CO 2 is capable to decrease the pressure effect on 50% composition variation. © 2019 Author(s).

Authors: Melinda I.D., Jauhari W.A., Rosyidi C.N.
Title: The optimal-sizing of energy storage for a fossil fuel power plant
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: Production System Laboratory, Department of Industrial Engineering, Universitas Sebelas Maret, Surakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Melinda, I.D., Production System Laboratory, Department of Industrial Engineering, Universitas Sebelas Maret, Surakarta, Indonesia; Jauhari, W.A., Production System Laboratory, Department of Industrial Engineering, Universitas Sebelas Maret, Surakarta, Indonesia; Rosyidi, C.N., Production System Laboratory, Department of Industrial Engineering, Universitas Sebelas Maret, Surakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: We develop a mathematical model for optimizing energy storage size for a fossil fuel power plant. The electricity generated by the power plant is transmitted to the transmission and distribution station and then consumed by the end-customers. Besides providing electricity for end customers, a power plant also supplies electricity to their utility system to fulfill the in-house demand. In the production activity, power plant used coal as a raw material to produce electricity. Power plant needs to order coal from the supplier by considering the conversion factor from coal to electricity. The proposed model considers in-house demand, end-customer's demand and a conversion factor of fuel to electricity. The objective of the model is to determine the supply size of in-house demand, shipment size of end-customers demand and production lot size factor to minimize a total cost incurred by a power plant. We utilize an inventory theory to develop our model and propose an algorithm to obtain the optimal solutions for this problem. A numerical example and sensitivity analysis are provided to illustrate the application of the model and to study the influence of some key parameters on model's behavior. The results show that the total cost is significantly affected by some parameters which are setup cost, demand, and production rate. © 2019 Author(s).

Abstract: We present an O-band micro-ring-based silicon-photonic 4-channel WDM transmitter with 6.75 nm-channel spacing for high-speed optical interconnects and demonstrate 4×40 Gb/s data generation operation featuring an energy efficiency of 24.84 fJ/bit/RM under 1.82 Vpp drive. © 2019 OSA.

Authors: Kan T., Gao F., Li J.
Title: Optimal configuration of the hybrid energy storage system for reducing the amount of discarded photovoltaic
Source title: ECTI DAMT-NCON 2019 - 4th International Conference on Digital Arts, Media and Technology and 2nd ECTI Northern Section Conference on Electrical, Electronics, Computer and Telecommunications Engineering
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Northeast Electric Power University, Jilin, China
Authors with affiliations: Kan, T., School of Electrical Engineering, Northeast Electric Power University, Jilin, China; Gao, F., School of Electrical Engineering, Northeast Electric Power University, Jilin, China; Li, J., School of Electrical Engineering, Northeast Electric Power University, Jilin, China
Abstract: With the development of industry, more fossil energy is consumed to generate electricity, which increases carbon emissions. To reduce carbon emissions, renewable energy generation systems such as photovoltaic system are being used. However, the randomness and volatility of photovoltaic will affect the stable operation of power system, which results in a large number of photovoltaic is discarded. The energy storage system has the characteristics of flexible control and fast response, which can help the power grid to increase stability. In this paper, five-point estimation Method is used to disperse photovoltaic output. A hybrid multi-objective particle swarm optimization algorithm is proposed, which introduces the Non-dominated Sorting Genetic Algorithm of elite strategy combined with the probabilistic power flow. The optimal location and capacity of the energy storage unit can be found by minimizing the operating cost of the system and improving the voltage distribution. Finally, through the case analysis of the IEEE-30 node system, it is proved that the optimized configuration can reduce the voltage offset, reduce the operating cost of the system and reduce the amount of the system discarded photovoltaic. The economic advantage of the hybrid energy storage is also verified. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Hybrid energy storage system; Hybrid multi-objective particle swarm optimization algorithm; Optimal configuration; Photovoltaic
Index Keywords: Carbon; Cost benefit analysis; Electric energy storage; Electric load flow; Electric power systems; Electric power transmission networks; Genetic algorithms; Multiobjective optimization; Operating costs; Particle swarm optimization (PSO); Photovoltaic cells; Renewable energy resources; Screening; Hybrid energy storage systems; Multi-objective particle swarm optimization algorithms; Non- dominated sorting genetic algorithms; Optimal configuration; Photovoltaic; Point estimation method; Probabilistic power flow; Renewable energy generation; Electric power system control

Authors: Li R., Chen H.
Title: DOBBS: A Highly Available Distributed Block Storage Service for Virtual Machines
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE International Conference of Safety Produce Informatization, IICSPI 2018
Affiliations: Shanghai Jiaotong University, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, R., Shanghai Jiaotong University, China; Chen, H., Shanghai Jiaotong University, China
Abstract: The information technology industry has seen the rapid development of storage devices, Solid State Drives (SSD), due to its high performance and low energy consumption, it has been widely used in the cloud storage systems. However, because of its high price and limited capacity, whether SSD is able to replace the Hard Disk Drives (HDD) completely is not clear. Therefore, a primary research task to be addressed is how to use SSD to provide high-performance storage systems that cost less. This paper presents a distributed software defined hybrid storage system called DOBBS which leverages the data characteristic to magnify the advantages of SSD/HDD and provide high performance block storage for virtual machines. By monitoring I/O access at runtime, DOBBS dynamically migrates data to proper storage devices for optimal performance. An efficient heat diffusion method is utilized to reach state of Global Heat Balancing. For rapid fault recovering, DOBBS also employs consensus protocol to share metadata among control nodes of cluster. DOBBS is evaluated based on several benchmarks to demonstrate its efficiency and effectiveness. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Distributed Storage; Heat Balancing; Object Storage
Index Keywords: Balancing; Energy utilization; Green computing; HPSS; Network security; Virtual machine; Virtual storage; Cloud storage systems; Data characteristics; Distributed storage; Hybrid storage systems; Information technology industry; Low energy consumption; Object storages; Solid state drives (SSD); Hard disk storage

Abstract: In this paper, a multi-agent system (MAS) -based hundreds megawatt-scale battery energy storage station monitoring system is proposed, which adopts the monitoring method of multi-agent zoning and hierarchical control to establish a multi-agent system at terminal level, local level and equipment level. Each energy storage converter of energy storage plant is controlled by a virtual synchronous machine, and the specific functions of each Agent and its coordination strategy are discussed to realize the real-time monitoring and operation control of the ultra-large-scale battery energy storage station in order to keep hundreds of megawatt-scale battery storage power station efficient and stable operations. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: A Networked Control Scheme of Residential Microgrid for China Remote Areas

Abstract: A set of complete residential microgrid (MG) control scheme for China remote areas is proposed in the paper. Firstly, a residential MG, which mainly includes distributed generation (DG), energy storage (ES), controllable load (CL), key load (KL), and control system, is proposed. Considering some communication security issues, main control systems including prediction system (PS), energy management system (EMS), and DGs control system are then introduced. By the above design, the residential MG can provide reliable electricity for local residents. Finally, simulations in MATLAB indicate the feasibility of proposed scheme. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Gao H., Yu X., Cao J.
Title: Analysis of Multi-intelligent Coordinated Optimal Control Strategy of Source Network with Distributed Power Supply
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 5th IEEE International Conference on Cloud Computing and Intelligence Systems, CCIS 2018
Affiliations: Nanjing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Nanjing, Jiangsu, 210023, China
Authors with affiliations: Gao, H., Nanjing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Nanjing, Jiangsu, 210023, China; Yu, X., Nanjing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Nanjing, Jiangsu, 210023, China; Cao, J., Nanjing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Nanjing, Jiangsu, 210023, China
Abstract: In order to reduce the impact of scaled distributed power access on the original grid and improve the multiple utilization efficiency of the source grid. In this paper, by analyzing the multi-stage energy interaction scene with distributed power supply, the multi space scale of main network, distribution network, feeder and platform area, and short-term, ultra short term, quasi real time multi time scale interaction mechanism are formulated, a multi-source interactive coordinated optimal control model for distributed power supply including large wind power plants, gas turbines and centralized large capacity energy storage is established. The objective function of the model is the minimum active power fluctuation, the closest network loss and the largest economic benefit. The model sets constraints such as node power flow, wind power, and so on. Taking Chongming Island in Shanghai as an example, the multi intelligence coordinated optimization control application scene of source network is set up to simulate and verify the short-term, super-short-term and quasi-real-time optimization effects of multiple spatial scales, and to provide optimized control basis for the access of large-scale distributed power supply. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Coordinated optimization control; Distributed power supply; Multi-level energy; Multiple spatial scales; Multiple time scales

Authors: Yin X., Ma T., Yin L., Tian F., Lyu B.
Title: Optimization for Demand Side Management with PAR in Smart Building
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 5th IEEE International Conference on Cloud Computing and Intelligence Systems, CCIS 2018
Affiliations: Information and Communication Company, State Grid Tianjin Electric Power Company, Tianjin, 300010, China; Nari Group Corporation, Nanjing, 211000, China; Key Lab of Broadband Wireless Communication and Sensor Network Technology, Nanjing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Ministry of Education, Nanjing, 210003, China

Abstract: Buildings can be viewed as small cities due to their size, users, and mixed complex activities. Similar to that in smart grid, Demand Side Management (DSM) in micro grid plays an important role in achieving effective and reliable energy management in buildings. In this paper, in order to reduce the Peak-to-Average Ratio of energy consumption and guarantee fairness between users, we investigate fair load scheduling for DSM based on Narrowband IoT (NB-IoT) technology in smart building. Firstly, the load scheduling model based on NB-IoT is constructed. Then, considering the constraints of energy consumption, energy storage and energy generation in buildings, a minimum-maximum fair energy load scheduling problem with PAR limit is formulated into Linear Programming (LP) and solved by commercial software CPLEX. Finally, simulation results validate our proposed optimization method to achieve fair load scheduling with DSM mechanism by comparing with the case without DSM mechanism in smart building. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Demand side management; Fairness; Load scheduling; NB-IoT; Smart building

Title: Analysis of the Characteristics of PV Generation Equipped with Storage for Power Grid Frequency Response

Affiliations: Nanjing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Automation School, Nanjing, 210023, China; Southeast University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, 210096, China; China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing Key Laboratory of Demand Side Multi-Energy Carriers Optimization and Interaction Technique, Beijing, 100192, China

Abstract: In this paper, the most influential factors of weather conditions on PV power generation are investigated. The active output control model of PV generation equipped with storage is established for frequency response research. With the given ancillary service prices decided by both the power grid and the service providers, the decision-making of PV generation equipped with storage participating into frequency response is studied. In the decision-making, the influence factors of the frequency response auxiliary service, the PV power output capacity and the charge and discharge limits of energy storage are considered. Finally, the characteristics of the frequency response of PV generation equipped with storage affected by the weather conditions are analyzed. The simulation results validate that PV generation equipped with storage can enhance the security of the power system. © 2018 IEEE.

Building comfort and energy costs are considered as the optimization objective functions. Finally, a simulation of a commercial building show that the model can effectively meet the needs of building comfort, also can reduce the energy costs in commercial buildings. The grey optimization algorithm obviously has more advantages than the GA and PSO in solving this optimization problem. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Yang J., Li Z., Gan J., Zhang J.
Title: Development of Efficient Management Platform and Data Interface Module for Photovoltaic Power Station
Source title: 8th Annual IEEE International Conference on Cyber Technology in Automation, Control and Intelligent Systems, CYBER 2018
Affiliations: Qinghai Province Key Laboratory of Photovoltaic Grid Connected Power Generation Technology, State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Research Institue, Xining, 810008, China; Nanjing Upbest Information Technology Company, Nanjing, 210000, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, J., Qinghai Province Key Laboratory of Photovoltaic Grid Connected Power Generation Technology, State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Research Institue, Xining, 810008, China; Li, Z., Qinghai Province Key Laboratory of Photovoltaic Grid Connected Power Generation Technology, State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Research Institue, Xining, 810008, China; Gan, J., Qinghai Province Key Laboratory of Photovoltaic Grid Connected Power Generation Technology, State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Research Institue, Xining, 810008, China; Zhang, J., Nanjing Upbest Information Technology Company, Nanjing, 210000, China
Abstract: Currently, the large amount of data collected from grid-connected photovoltaic(PV) is mainly unstructured, the processing, storage, and representation of which are different in various application systems. The characteristics of the data are dispersive and heterogeneous. Serious 'data island' problem is caused since the data directly connected to large data centers does not obey unified standard, whose value, therefore, cannot be fully excavated. In the light of the facts above, this paper developed efficient management platform and data interface module software system for PV power station based on B/S architecture of Java 2 Platform Enterprise Edition(J2EE), designed hierarchical architecture of system with the method of component-based service-oriented architecture(SOA), and built components and services through object-oriented approach based on Java. Effectiveness of developed software system has been verified in the construction of large data center for clean energy in State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Company. The system has a uniform and concise user interface, offers a strong extensibility, reusability, and performance, which can enhance efficiency of applying and sharing level of data resources. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Li C., Xu Y., He J., Wang Y., Ni P., Wang J., Liu S.
Title: Distributed Generation for Service Restoration Considering Uncertainties of Intermittent Energy Resources
Source title: 8th Annual IEEE International Conference on Cyber Technology in Automation, Control and Intelligent Systems, CYBER 2018
Affiliations: Beijing Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, 100044, China; China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China; State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, 200000, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, C., Beijing Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, 100044, China; Xu, Y., Beijing Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, 100044, China; He, J., Beijing Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, 100044, China; Wang, Y., Beijing Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, 100044, China; Ni, P., Beijing Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, 100044, China; Wang, J., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China; Liu, S., State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, 200000, China
Abstract: Local distribution resources, such as distributed generations (DGs), energy storage systems, and some renewable energy resources, can be interconnected for service restoration in distribution systems and operate as an island after extreme events. High penetration of renewable energy resources makes it difficult to make decisions on restoration strategies because the power injections become uncertain. This paper proposes a chance-constrained program with relaxed second-order cone constraints (SOCC) to formulate the critical load restoration problem. The joint probability density function of power outputs of PVs and WTs is represented by a Gaussian mixture model (GMM). Using the sample average approximation method, an approximate analytical form of the chance constraints is proposed, which transforms the probabilistic program to a deterministic mixed-integer second-order cone program (MISOCP). The MISOCP can be solved by off-the-shelf optimization solvers. The effectiveness of the proposed method is validated by the simulation of the IEEE 33-node test system. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: distributed generation; Distribution system; resilience; restoration; uncertainties
Index Keywords: Distributed power generation; Gaussian distribution; Image reconstruction; Integer programming; Intelligent systems; Probability density function; Restoration; Approximate analytical; Distributed generations (DGs); Distribution systems; Joint probability density function; resilience; Sample average approximation; Second order cone programs; uncertainties; Renewable energy resources

Authors: Yang L., Gan J., Xia C., Hu Z., Gao B., Qu L.
Title: Research on the Frequency Regulation Strategy of Virtual Synchronous Generator Based Photovoltaic Power Plant
Source title: 8th Annual IEEE International Conference on Cyber Technology in Automation, Control and Intelligent Systems, CYBER 2018
Affiliations: State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Company, Qinghai Province Key Laboratory of Photovoltaic Grid Connected Power Generation Technology, Electric Power Research Institute, Xining, 810008, China; Southeast University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, 210096, China; China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, 210003, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, L., State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Company, Qinghai Province Key Laboratory of Photovoltaic Grid Connected Power Generation Technology, Electric Power Research Institute, Xining, 810008, China; Gan, J., State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Company, Qinghai Province Key Laboratory of Photovoltaic Grid Connected Power Generation Technology, Electric Power Research Institute, Xining, 810008, China; Xia, C., Southeast University, School of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing, 210096, China; Hu, Z., State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Company, Qinghai Province Key Laboratory of Photovoltaic Grid Connected Power Generation Technology, Electric Power Research Institute, Xining, 810008, China; Gao, B., State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Company, Qinghai Province Key Laboratory of Photovoltaic Grid Connected Power Generation Technology, Electric Power Research Institute, Xining, 810008, China; Qu, L., China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, 210003, China
Abstract: With the integration of large-scale photovoltaic (PV) plants, the impacts of photovoltaic generation on the power system are growing serious. Due to the randomness and intermittency of the output power of PV generation, the frequency stability of power system deteriorates and the difficultly of frequency regulation increases. In this paper, by simulating the traditional frequency regulation process, a hierarchical frequency regulation strategy of PV power plants is proposed. Firstly, Energy storage system (ESS) based on virtual synchronous generator (VSG) provides inertial support to the system at the beginning of the frequency fluctuations. Then, the primary frequency regulation is achieved by PV units based on the droop control. The droop character are reasonable designed to ensure the orderly participation and fully utilization of each PV units. Finally, the emergency frequency control is provided by ESS when the frequency beyond the allowable range. Simulations are performed in Matlab/Simulink to verify the effectiveness of the proposed control strategy. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Intelligent systems; MATLAB; Photovoltaic cells; Control strategies; Energy storage systems; Frequency fluctuation; Frequency regulations; Photovoltaic generation; Photovoltaic power plant; Primary frequency regulation; Stability of power system; Synchronous generators

Authors: Lv Z., Yang P., Xia Y., Yu M., Wei W.
Title: State of Charge Based Decentralized Coordination Control for Multiple Bidirectional Power Converters in a Hybrid AC/DC Microgrid
Source title: 8th Annual IEEE International Conference on Cyber Technology in Automation, Control and Intelligent Systems, CYBER 2018
Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China
Authors with affiliations: Lv, Z., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; Yang, P., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; Xia, Y., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; Yu, M., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; Wei, W., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China
Abstract: Multiple bidirectional power converters (BPCs) are the key equipment in a hybrid AC/DC microgrid. In the literatures, the hybrid AC/DC microgrid adopts the BPCs to balance the power in both AC subgrid and DC subgrid, but the SOC management of battery storage system has not been considered in BPCs' operating strategy. Besides, the information exchange between devices relies on the communication links. This paper considers a hybrid microgrid topology which has two energy storages in both AC side and DC side. And a coordination control method without communication links for multiple BPCs based on SOC has been proposed to enhance the reliability of hybrid microgrid. Finally, the simulation results in different situations verify the correctness of the theory. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: hybrid AC/DC microgrid; parallel converters; power sharing; SOC management
Index Keywords: Charging (batteries); Intelligent systems; Rectifying circuits; Battery storage system; Bi-directional power converter; Coordination control; Decentralized coordination; Hybrid ac/dc microgrid; Information exchanges; Parallel converter; Power sharing; Battery management systems

Authors: Ramzan N., Shakeel U., Gungor A., Zaman M.
Title: Techno-Economic Analysis of Selexol and Sulfinol Processes for Pre-Combustion CO2 Capture
Source title: 4th International Conference on Power Generation Systems and Renewable Energy Technologies, PGSRET 2018
Affiliations: Department of Chemical Engineering, Pakistan Institute of Engineering and Applied Sciences (PIEAS), Nilore Islamabad, Pakistan; Department of Mechanical Engineering, Akdeniz University, Turkey
Authors with affiliations: Ramzan, N., Department of Chemical Engineering, Pakistan Institute of Engineering and Applied Sciences (PIEAS), Nilore Islamabad, Pakistan; Shakeel, U., Department of Chemical Engineering, Pakistan Institute of Engineering and Applied Sciences (PIEAS), Nilore Islamabad, Pakistan; Gungor, A., Department of Mechanical Engineering, Akdeniz University, Turkey; Zaman, M., Department of Chemical Engineering, Pakistan Institute of Engineering and Applied Sciences (PIEAS), Nilore Islamabad, Pakistan
Abstract: One of the reasons for global warming and climate change is the anthropogenic CO2 release into the air, especially when low quality coal is used. So there is the basic need to mitigate the emissions of CO2 to avoid the global warming. To decrease the amount of CO2 being released into the air in near future, the carbon capture and storage is now considered an effective and practical way. Integrated gasification Combined cycle (IGCC) power plants are considered relatively advanced fossil fuel based power generation system due to higher net power efficiency, ease in CO2 capture and cogeneration opportunities. Liquid absorption is the widely used and matured technology for gas separation. Physical solvents are mainly used for pre-combustion CO2 capture. The main objective of this paper is to search the most suitable solvent or combination of their mixture. Performance comparison and economic evaluation for two different physical solvents including Selexol process and Sulfinol Process has been made for the optimal selection of the capture process. The performance of Sulfinol hybrid solvent (a mixture of Sulfolane, MDEA and H2O) is compared with the Single Stage Selexol process. When both the Dual Stage processes were compared, Dual Stage Selexol was found to be economical over Dual Stage Sulfinol process. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: CO2 Capture; IGCC; Physical solvents; Selexol; Sulfinol
Index Keywords: Carbon capture; Carbon dioxide; Coal combustion; Cogeneration plants; Fossil fuel power plants; Fossil fuels; Global warming; Mixtures; Precombustion; Renewable energy resources; Solvents; CO2 capture; IGCC; Physical solvent; Selexol; Sulfinol; Economic analysis

Authors: Ullah W., Ahmad G., Kamran M.
Title: A Cost Efficient DC-DC Converter for Wireless Sensor Node
Source title: 4th International Conference on Power Generation Systems and Renewable Energy Technologies, PGSRET 2018
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Engineering Technology, Peshawar, Pakistan; Department of Electronics, University of Peshawar, Peshawar, Pakistan
Authors with affiliations: Ullah, W., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Engineering Technology, Peshawar, Pakistan; Ahmad, G., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Engineering Technology, Peshawar, Pakistan; Kamran, M., Department of Electronics, University of Peshawar, Peshawar, Pakistan
Abstract: Limited energy sources and high cost are considered as the primary disadvantage of the WSN (Wireless Sensor Node). New studies show that in the future the major drawback of WSN will be energy storage, harvesting and processing. WSN are placed remotely which are powered by PV (Photovoltaic) Panels and batteries. The power source is variable in both cases; the output voltage of a PV panel fluctuates due to the environmental parameters such as intensity of light, dust, ambient temperature, cloud factor and humidity etc. While the output voltage of a battery drop due to the continuous use. On the other hand a regulated voltage is required for a load driven by a PV panel. DC-DC converter is a device which regulates the output voltage of a PV across the load. The converter design technique is based on PWM (Pulse Width Modulation). With PWM technique battery can be fully charged with less charging stress so prolonging the life time of a battery and reducing the cost. To maximize the accuracy and further reduce the cost analog control system will be used instead of an expensive microcontroller chip. The designed DC to DC converter has been simulated in well-known software called PSIM and tested under different circumstances. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Analog Control Technique; Cost Efficient; Photovoltaic; PWM; SEPIC Converter; Wireless Sensor Node

Authors: Abbasi A., Qureshi I.M., Abdullah H.
Title: An Overview of control strategies with emphasis on demand response for stability and reliability enhancement of Microgrids
Source title: 4th International Conference on Power Generation Systems and Renewable Energy Technologies, PGSRET 2018
Affiliations: Electrical Engineering Dept., International Islamic University, Islamabad, Pakistan; Electrical Engineering Dept., Air University, Islamabad, Pakistan; USPCAS-E, NUST, Islamabad, Pakistan
Authors with affiliations: Abbasi, A., Electrical Engineering Dept., International Islamic University, Islamabad, Pakistan; Qureshi, I.M., Electrical Engineering Dept., Air University, Islamabad, Pakistan; Abdullah, H., USPCAS-E, NUST, Islamabad, Pakistan
Abstract: Real time effective power management is offered by Microgrids (MG) where the aim is to provide finest management of energy and its supply among resources, storage elements and loads. Grid voltage fluctuation is a huge problem that is caused by Power imbalance in the grid, which can adversely affect the reliability of the MG and may damage the loads. This paper discusses different strategies for power management in the MGs, their classification and review. Emphasis will be given to hierarchical control strategies, which offers reliable and cost-effective solutions and thus are more suitable for prevailing situation in Pakistan and remote places. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Azeem F., Munawwar S.
Title: Design and Analysis of Load Switching Mechanism Using Sub-Microgrid Approach
Source title: 4th International Conference on Power Generation Systems and Renewable Energy Technologies, PGSRET 2018
Affiliations: Department of Electronic Engineering, NED University of Engineering and Technology, Pakistan; Department of Electrical Engineering, Faculty of Engineering Practices and Sciences, Nazeer Hussain University, Karachi, Pakistan
Authors with affiliations: Azeem, F., Department of Electronic Engineering, NED University of Engineering and Technology, Pakistan; Munawwar, S., Department of Electrical Engineering, Faculty of Engineering Practices and Sciences, Nazeer Hussain University, Karachi, Pakistan
Abstract: Microgrids are evolving as a solution to exhausted, overburdened conventional power systems. However, several issues related to inverter interfaced microgrids exist. These issues include intermittency of renewable energy based generations sources which leads to the voltage, frequency mismatch that eventually disturbs the grid quality and affect the loads. This paper develops a sub-microgrid approach i.e. Sub-grid within a microgrid using load switching mechanism (LCM). The LCM switches the load from one distributed generation to the other using central controller. The loads are divided into three groups i.e. Heavy loads, light loads and critical loads. Two distributed generators, solar power and wind power along with the central storage are the generation sources. The central controller checks the power generation from the two sources and connects the heavy and light loads to the distributed generator appropriate for the loads. In case of no power available from any distributed generators, demand response program is initiated to supply the critical loads only. Three scenarios have been tested based on the frequency deviations during transition state from one source to the other source. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy management; Microgridt; Frequency; Stability
Index Keywords: Convergence of numerical methods; Energy management; Solar energy; Wind power; Conventional power; Demand response programs; Design and analysis; Distributed generators; Frequency deviation; Frequency mismatch; Microgridt; Frequency; Renewable energies; Distributed power generation

Authors: Ahmad H., Ahmad A., Ahmad S.
Title: Efficient Energy Management in a Microgrid
Source title: 4th International Conference on Power Generation Systems and Renewable Energy Technologies, PGSRET 2018
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, COMSATS University Islamabad, Wah Cantt, 47040, Pakistan
Authors with affiliations: Ahmad, H., Department of Electrical Engineering, COMSATS University Islamabad, Wah Cantt, 47040, Pakistan; Ahmad, A., Department of Electrical Engineering, COMSATS University Islamabad, Wah Cantt, 47040, Pakistan; Ahmad, S., Department of Electrical Engineering, COMSATS University Islamabad, Wah Cantt, 47040, Pakistan
Abstract: Small scale renewable energy sources like photo-voltaic panels, wind turbines, etc can be easily installed on home roof top and such architecture can minimize cost of energy and load on the main grid. Our approach is to generate energy at home through renewable energy (RE) resources and store surplus energy in the battery bank. If RE generation sources and battery reserve fails to satisfy the load, then power is supplied by the main grid. The major work is to develop an autonomous system that can manage all these sources effectively and efficiently. Despite many advantages of renewable energy sources its drawback is that these sources are weather and climate dependent. Night hours, clouds, wind speed, fog, etc are the factors that effect the performance of renewable energy sources with big impact. This research is based on a group of three prosumers who can generate energy via RE sources at home, stores it in a battery bank and takes the extra energy from nearby grid to fulfill the local demand if it is required. A heuristic algorithm is proposed and implemented for this study. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Tahir S., Khaliq A.
Title: Operation of Microgrid with cascaded Current-Voltage Control of Voltage-sourced Converter based on H-infinity Repetitive Control Strategy
Source title: 4th International Conference on Power Generation Systems and Renewable Energy Technologies, PGSRET 2018
Affiliations: Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, Sir Syed CASE Institute of Technology, Islamabad, Pakistan
Authors with affiliations: Tahir, S., Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, Sir Syed CASE Institute of Technology, Islamabad, Pakistan; Khaliq, A., Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, Sir Syed CASE Institute of Technology, Islamabad, Pakistan
Abstract: The aim of this research is to identify some issues related to practical implementation of cascaded Current-Voltage Control of Voltage-sourced Converter (VSC), based on H-infinity Repetitive Control Strategy, through Simulations. Earlier research implemented the subject Control Strategy of VSC on a Laboratory scale System with a constant DC Voltage Source. This research replaces DC Voltage Source in Laboratory Setup with a 700 Volts DC Bus, with DC Voltage being controlled by Lead-Acid Battery based Battery Energy Storage System (BESS). DC Bus also includes a 40 kW Fuel Cell and 41 kW Photovoltaic (PV) System. The Control Strategy is tested for balanced Loads, unbalanced Loads and nonlinear Loads in Grid-connected and Islanded Modes. In Islanded Mode, the Voltage of DC Link can be controlled by BESS with smaller Discharge Power. In Grid-connected Mode, large Power Exchanges occur between Grid and DC Link at start up, due to slow response time of Repetitive Controllers, resulting in unacceptably large deviations of DC Link Voltage. To settle DC Link Voltage within reasonable time, BESS with Discharge Power equal to sum of Microgrid's local Load and main Grid's Demand is needed. Moreover, the DC Link Voltage has ripples at low frequency with unbalanced local Load in Grid-connected and Islanded Modes, despite presence of independently controlled Neutral Leg. All Simulations are carried out in MATLAB/Simulink Environment. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: BESS; H-infinity Control; Nonlinear Loads; Repetitive Control; Unbalanced Loads

Title: Analysis of research status and development trend of hydrogen storage technology
Source title: PervasiveHealth: Pervasive Computing Technologies for Healthcare
Affiliations: Beijing University of Technology, 100 Ping Le Yuan, Chaoyang District, Beijing, 100124, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, Y., Beijing University of Technology, 100 Ping Le Yuan, Chaoyang District, Beijing, 100124, China; Wu, F., Beijing University of Technology, 100 Ping Le Yuan, Chaoyang District, Beijing, 100124, China; Miao, H., Beijing University of Technology, 100 Ping Le Yuan, Chaoyang District, Beijing, 100124, China
Abstract: Hydrogen storage technology, playing the role of connecting hydrogen energy production with application, determines the large-scale application of hydrogen energy. We use bibliometric analysis of hydrogen storage research in order to get a view of research status and development trend of hydrogen storage technology. The results show that the research on hydrogen storage technology has turned from the rapid growth stage to the in-depth research stage. The basis discipline of hydrogen storage alloy, including the composition of its additives and catalyst, as well as its internal structure and ways of improving its performance. Baseonanalyzing the citation/frequency burst of researchkeywords, the key research topic in the future is mainly to study the stability and hydrogen release performance of magnesium-based hydrogen storage alloys at a specific temperature, and the exploring structure and composition of material through nanoparticles. The key research teams worthy of attention are YU XB team of the Chinese academy of sciences; PAN HG team of Zhejiang university; ZHANG YH team of Inner Mongolia university of technology; SAKAI T team of Osaka Electro-Communication University; FUJII H team of Hiroshima university; LIU HK team of University of Wollongong. © 2019 Association for Computing Machinery.

Authors: Iqbal W., Akhtar R., Kazmi S.A.R.
Title: Design and Implementation of Smart Load Management (SLM) between Grid and Solar Generation
Source title: 2019 2nd International Conference on Communication, Computing and Digital Systems, C-CODE 2019
Affiliations: Department O F Electrical and Computer Engineering, Air University, Islamabad, Pakistan
Authors with affiliations: Iqbal, W., Department O F Electrical and Computer Engineering, Air University, Islamabad, Pakistan; Akhtar, R., Department O F Electrical and Computer Engineering, Air University, Islamabad, Pakistan; Kazmi, S.A.R., Department O F Electrical and Computer Engineering, Air University, Islamabad, Pakistan
Abstract: With the ever-growing demand of electrical energy and alarming danger of continuously decreasing reserves of conventional fossil fuels, people all over the world are shifting toward the renewable energy resources. Solar being the primary source of energy for the planet is in focus for electrical energy production. This paper enables automatic load transfers between grid and solar generation. It senses the availability of sufficient supply from both sources and automatically switches load between them enabling uninterrupted supply to the load. This paper mainly consists of two major parts one is operational network consisting of solar panel, battery storage, inverter and load, while, the other is control mechanism consisting of Arduino, relays, sensors and switches. The control mechanism senses the output of supply sources and manages the load to operate without any interruption even if the supply from grid is cut off. Thus, it mainly automates the load transfer mechanism between solar and grid minimizing the dependence on conventional energy. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Tseng Y.-M., Huang C.-C., Huang H.-S., Freg C.-P., Tu C.-S.
Title: Power Shift with Coordination Both Ice Storage and Central Air Conditioner Mainframe
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE International Conference of Intelligent Applied Systems on Engineering, ICIASE 2019
Affiliations: Fuzhou University Town, College of Robotic, Fuzhou City, Fujian Province, 350108, China

Abstract: The electricity consumption of commercial buildings is discussed in terms of rank of load ratio which is most of the air-conditioning power consumption is used. And the air-conditioning of commercial building uses ice storage and central air conditioner to adjust the indoor temperature and humidity to complete a comfortable working environment. Both Ice storage equipment and central air conditioner use the electric power to match the peak and off-peak loading period by coordination strategy to make ice and melt ice which can save the consumption power. Firstly, to investigate the load characteristic curves of the air conditioner mainframe (ACM) and ice storage. Secondly is to collect electricity consumption data of commercial key-customers and analyze the proportion and relationship of power consumption of related conditioning equipment. Coordination both of ice storage and ACM that can suppress the peak loading and base on the peak and off-peak period in load curve of the commercial key-customer to derive the index parameter of power suppress of peak power or power shifting. © 2019 IEEE.

Abstract: We report on vertically stacked lateral nanowires (NW)/nanosheets (NS) gate-all-around (GAA) FET devices as promising candidates to obtain a better power-performance metric for logic applications for advanced sub-5nm technology nodes, in comparison to finFETs. In addition, vertical NW/NS GAA FETs appear particularly attractive for enabling highly dense memory cells such as SRAMs (with improved read and write stability), and as the selector devices for ultra-scaled MRAMs with lower energy consumption values. These cells can be manufactured by a cost-effective, co-integration scheme with a finFET or NW/NS FET high-performance logic platform for increased on-chip memory content. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Feng J.-J., Wang X.-Y., Yang J., Quan L.
Title: Simulation research on operation characteristics of three-chamber cylinder driving loader arm based on hydraulic-gas balancing
Source title: Proceedings of the 8th International Conference on Fluid Power and Mechatronics, FPM 2019
Affiliations: Taiyuan University of Technology, Key Lab of Adv. Transducers and Intelligent Contr. Syst. of Min. of Education and Shanxi Province, Taiyuan, China
Authors with affiliations: Feng, J.-J., Taiyuan University of Technology, Key Lab of Adv. Transducers and Intelligent Contr. Syst. of Min. of Education and Shanxi Province, Taiyuan, China; Wang, X.-Y., Taiyuan University of Technology, Key Lab of Adv. Transducers and Intelligent Contr. Syst. of Min. of Education and Shanxi Province, Taiyuan, China; Yang, J., Taiyuan University of Technology, Key Lab of Adv. Transducers and Intelligent Contr. Syst. of Min. of Education and Shanxi Province, Taiyuan, China; Quan, L., Taiyuan University of Technology, Key Lab of Adv. Transducers and Intelligent Contr. Syst. of Min. of Education and Shanxi Province, Taiyuan, China
Abstract: The load of wheel loader boom is frequently and widely changed during the lifting and falling process. When the loader arm is lifting, the peak power of the hydraulic pump is high, and when the boom is falling the gravitational potential energy of the boom is dissipated by the hydraulic valve port. Then, the dissipated energy is converted into thermal energy, which increases temperature of the hydraulic oil and reduces the energy efficiency of hydraulic system. In order to improve energy efficiency, a potential energy recovery and wheel loader boom dead-weight hydraulic-gas balance system is proposed in this paper. In the system, the three-chamber hydraulic cylinder and accumulator are used to recycle the potential energy by balancing the weight of boom. In this paper, The co-simulation model of original boom hydraulic system of wheel loader was built in SimulationX firstly. After the model had been verified by experiments, the potential energy recovery and loader arm dead-weight hydraulic-gas balance system is stablished, in which the original two-chamber cylinder of boom hydraulic system is replaced by the three-chamber hydraulic cylinder. Operating characteristics and energy consumption are compared during the lifting and falling simulation process of boom system in no-load conditions. The results show that the proposed system has same operating characteristics with the original machine when the initial pressure of accumulator is 6Mpa, the peak power of pump can be reduced by 57.1 %, and the energy consumption can be decreased by about 39.5%. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Hydraulic-gas energy storage; Potential energy recovery; Three-chamber hydraulic cylinder

Authors: Li J.-S., Zhao J.-Y., Xing H.-Y., Zhang X.-C., Jin Y.-F.
Title: Research on flywheel based energy recovery system for hydraulic excavator boom
Source title: Proceedings of the 8th International Conference on Fluid Power and Mechatronics, FPM 2019
Affiliations: Xuzhou College of Industrial Technology, Research and Development Center for Intelligent Manufacturing Technology of Engineering Equipment, Xuzhou, China; China University of Mining and Technology, School of Mechatronic Engineering, Xuzhou, China; Excavating Machinery Co., Ltd of XCMG, Xuzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, J.-S., Xuzhou College of Industrial Technology, Research and Development Center for Intelligent Manufacturing Technology of Engineering Equipment, Xuzhou, China; Zhao, J.-Y., China University of Mining and Technology, School of Mechatronic Engineering, Xuzhou, China; Xing, H.-Y., China University of Mining and Technology, School of Mechatronic Engineering, Xuzhou, China; Zhang, X.-C., China University of Mining and Technology, School of Mechatronic Engineering, Xuzhou, China; Jin, Y.-F., Excavating Machinery Co., Ltd of XCMG, Xuzhou, China
Abstract: Increasingly stringent national emission standards for construction machinery and rising fuel prices have promoted excavator manufacturers to improve energy efficiency. When the hydraulic excavator boom lowers, the gravitational potential energy is converted into heat, which results in poor energy efficiency. To solve this problem, a novel flywheel based energy recovery system (FESS) is proposed in this paper. A hydraulic pump/motor (PM) is employed as the energy conversion element and a flywheel is used as the energy storage element. To reduce the power loss when the flywheel is idling, a clutch is installed between the PM and the flywheel. The working principle of the system is analyzed in detail. A 4 t hydraulic excavator is taken as the research object, and the key parameters of the system are matched. The model of the FESS is developed in AMESim. The influence of the key parameters such as the PM displacement and the moment of inertia of the flywheel on the energy recovery and reutilization efficiency in the typical working cycle are simulated and analyzed, and the specific value of the energy recovery and reutilization is obtained, up to 65% for 4 t excavator and 60% for a 21 t excavator. The simulation results show that the FESS can significantly improve the energy efficiency of the hydraulic system. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: NaitMalek Y., Najib M., Bakhouya M., Essaaidi M.
Title: Forecasting the State-of-Charge of Batteries in Micro-Grid Systems
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 IEEE World Conference on Complex Systems, WCCS 2019
Affiliations: International University of Rabat Faculty of Computing and Logistics, ECINE, LERMA Lab, TIC Lab, Morocco; Mohamed v University, ENSIAS, Rabat, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: NaitMalek, Y., International University of Rabat Faculty of Computing and Logistics, ECINE, LERMA Lab, TIC Lab, Morocco, Mohamed v University, ENSIAS, Rabat, Morocco; Najib, M., International University of Rabat Faculty of Computing and Logistics, ECINE, LERMA Lab, TIC Lab, Morocco; Bakhouya, M., International University of Rabat Faculty of Computing and Logistics, ECINE, LERMA Lab, TIC Lab, Morocco; Essaaidi, M., Mohamed v University, ENSIAS, Rabat, Morocco
Abstract: Micro-grid (MG) systems are increasingly deployed on buildings in order to enhance energy efficiency while maintaining occupants' comfort. A MG system includes renewable energy sources (RES) for energy production, storage devices for storing energy excess, and control strategies for orchestrating all components and for improving the efficiency of the system. However, forecasting methods are required to develop predictive control strategies in order to tackle the uncertainty and intermittency of energy production and consumption. The State-of-Charge (SoC) of batteries is one of the main parameters used in predictive control algorithms, because it indicates how much energy is stored and how long a MG system can be relying on the deployed storage devises. Several methods have been developed for SoC estimation, but little work has been dedicated for SoC forecasting in MG systems. In this paper, we introduce a predictive approach for SoC forecasting using the Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) algorithm. Extensive experiments have been conducted and results are provided and show the accuracy of this algorithm for different forecasting horizons. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Forecasting; Long-Short Term Memory; Microgrid; State of Charge; Time-series forecasting
Index Keywords: Brain; Charging (batteries); Energy efficiency; Forecasting; Long short-term memory; Renewable energy resources; Secondary batteries; Virtual storage; Forecasting methods; Micro grid; Micro-grid systems; Predictive control algorithm; Predictive control strategy; Renewable energy source; State of charge; Time series forecasting; Battery management systems

Authors: Khormuji M.N., Popovic B.M., Perotti A.G.
Title: Enabling SWIPT via OFDM-DC
Source title: IEEE Wireless Communications and Networking Conference, WCNC
Affiliations: Huawei Technologies, Stockholm, AB, Sweden
Authors with affiliations: Khormuji, M.N., Huawei Technologies, Stockholm, AB, Sweden; Popovic, B.M., Huawei Technologies, Stockholm, AB, Sweden; Perotti, A.G., Huawei Technologies, Stockholm, AB, Sweden
Abstract: We propose a novel Simultaneous Wireless Information and Power Transmission (SWIPT) scheme to enable a compatible multiplexing of energy and information based on the frequency that can be used with the state-of-art transceivers. In the proposed scheme, the transmitter superimposes a Direct-Current (DC) signal on Orthogonal Frequency-Division Multiplexing (OFDM) Radio Frequency (RF) signal to generate OFDM-DC signal for SWIPT where the OFDM part is used for information transmission and the DC signal is used for energy transfer. The power level of the DC signal is configured by a controller at the transmitter side. The corresponding receiver is constructed with direct-conversion-receiver front-end such that the DC signal is extracted using a low-pass filter whose bandwidth is configured based on the subcarrier spacing of the OFDM waveform and then fed to a voltage-to-current converter to generate current to charge a battery for energy storage. The OFDM signal without DC power signal is then fed to Analog-to-Digital (A/D) converter for information decoding. The numerical and simulation evaluations provide encouraging evidence in the favor of the proposed OFDM-DC scheme. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Analog to digital conversion; Energy transfer; Low pass filters; Radio transceivers; Radio transmission; Analog to digital converters; Direct conversion receivers; Energy and information; Information transmission; Radiofrequency signals; Simulation evaluation; Sub-carrier spacings; Voltage-to-current converters; Orthogonal frequency division multiplexing

Authors: Zand P., Romme J., Govers J., Pasveer F., Dolmans G.
Title: A high-accuracy phase-based ranging solution with Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE)
Source title: IEEE Wireless Communications and Networking Conference, WCNC
Affiliations: IMEC, Eindhoven, Netherlands
Authors with affiliations: Zand, P., IMEC, Eindhoven, Netherlands; Romme, J., IMEC, Eindhoven, Netherlands; Govers, J., IMEC, Eindhoven, Netherlands; Pasveer, F., IMEC, Eindhoven, Netherlands; Dolmans, G., IMEC, Eindhoven, Netherlands
Abstract: Nowadays, indoor positioning and asset tracking have become popular and essential for many applications and use-cases. As Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) is widely deployed in smart tags, smart-phones, and smart-devices, adding functionality to support localization and asset tracking is crucial. In order to locate a device, either the angle or range to the device needs to be calculated. In this paper, we focus on a phase-based solution to calculate the range between devices. We introduce a multi-carrier phase-based ranging solution compatible with the BLE standard that utilizes BLE channel hopping to exchange tones in the entire 2.4 GHz frequency band to mitigate the multi-path fading problem. We recognize that in the BLE standard, slow channel-hopping, long packet size and frame spacing between two consecutive communications (named TIFS) affect ranging error/accuracy, in the case of crystal offset and phase-noise. Therefore, we introduce a new mathematical model to analyze the impact of the BLE link layer protocol on the ranging error. Finally, we evaluate the accuracy of our proposed solution through modelling, by considering the results of real experiments and by validating the correctness of our mathematical model for the ranging error. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE); channel hopping; CTE; localization; phase-measurement; ranging
Index Keywords: Bluetooth; Errors; Multipath fading; Phase measurement; Range finding; Smartphones; Adding functionality; Bluetooth low energies (BLE); Channel hopping; Indoor positioning; Link layer protocol; localization; New mathematical model; Ranging errors; Buffer storage

Authors: Bayhan S., Abu-Rub H.
Title: Smart energy management system for distributed generations in AC microgrid
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 IEEE 13th International Conference on Compatibility, Power Electronics and Power Engineering, CPE-POWERENG 2019
Affiliations: Qatar Environment and Energy Research Institute, Hamad Bin Khalifa University, Doha, Qatar; Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Texas AM University at Qatar, Doha, Qatar
Authors with affiliations: Bayhan, S., Qatar Environment and Energy Research Institute, Hamad Bin Khalifa University, Doha, Qatar; Abu-Rub, H., Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Texas AM University at Qatar, Doha, Qatar
Abstract: This paper proposes a novel smart energy management system (EMS) for distributed generations (DGs) in AC microgrid. The considered microgrid consists of two DGs, energy storage system, and loads. The solar PV system and the wind energy conversion system (WECS) are selected as an input power source of DGs. Model predictive control technique is used to regulate each DG's output current whereas adaptive neuro-fuzzy inference system (ANFIS) based EMS is developed to manage the available energy in AC microgrid. The proposed method is validated analytically and through Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) experiments. The carried out HIL experiments prove the merit of the proposed method. © 2019 IEEE.
