Authors: Chongyang G., Rui Z., Xiaodi Q., Wei D., Xiaolin Z.
Title: Design and study on the wind-solar complementary power system for household use
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China; Automatic Control Design Center of State Power Economic Research Institute (SPERI), Beijing, 102209, China
Authors with affiliations: Chongyang, G., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China; Rui, Z., Automatic Control Design Center of State Power Economic Research Institute (SPERI), Beijing, 102209, China; Xiaodi, Q., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China; Wei, D., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China; Xiaolin, Z., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100192, China
Abstract: A scheme of wind-solar complementary power system based on energy storage is proposed in this paper, taking the operating characteristics of wind and photovoltaic power system into consideration. The BUCK circuit, tracking the voltage variation of DC BUS, is adopted in the pre-stage system to drive the conversion of the wind and solar power. Push-pull topology, with a high frequency flux, and H4 full bridge topology structure are employed in the backward-stage system, which accomplished high-gain conversion of electrical energy, realized DC boosting and inverter discharging. This paper fully considers the practical application in the remote region, where the power grid is usually less developed. On the basis of the electrical parameters of the system and the lead-acid battery taking as storage unit, the energy management strategy is designed and analyzed, and a prototype is made successfully. Finally, according to the actual operating conditions, a variety of conditions are simulated, and the electrical performance of the prototype is verified according to the relevant standards of the distributed system. © 2018 IEEE.

Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings

Abstract: With the continuous improvement of the energy consumption revolution and the electric power system reformation, energy storage (ES) market showed large-scale development trend. However, the information management level of distributed energy storage (DES) resource is generally low, resulting in utilization rate of DES resources is quite low and diversified business value is not fully exploited. Based on the concept of shared ES, this paper provide an architecture for network operation platform for DES, which supports the deepening interaction between the DES and power grid system in the context of market-oriented. Aimed at the temporal and spatial dispersion characteristics of DES are strong, a hierarchical power optimization dispatching strategy is presented, which can realize the optimization of the benefit of the platform operator and the owners of the DES system. Finally, the validity of the control strategy is worked out by sim-ulation analysis. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Li H., Lu Z., Qiao Y.
Title: Bi-level Coordinated Flexible Planning Considering the Uncertainty of Wind Power Construction
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, H., Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China; Lu, Z., Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China; Qiao, Y., Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China
Abstract: The explosive growth of wind power is accompanied with the problem of disorderly construction, which is difficult to take into consideration in planning stage and would lead to high cost of power grid expansion. To cope with the uncertainty of wind power construction, this paper proposed a coordinated flexible planning method based on the bi-level optimization model. A probabilistic method is used to analyze uncertainty of wind power. Considering variable flexible resources from generation, grid, demand side and energy storage, a bi-level optimization model is built for planning, with the upper layer making investment decisions considering both wind accommodation benefit and economic cost and lower layer simulating operation status in detail and maximizing flexibility supply. A maximum net benefit/increment ratio method is used to solve the model, basing on the unified evaluation indicator of different flexible resources. Case study shows that the bi-level model and the planning method can take wind power construction uncertainty into consideration and obtain an economic and credible planning result, thus achieving efficient accommodation of renewable energy. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: bi-level model; coordinated planning; flexible resource; uncertainty; wind power construction

Title: Day-ahead Dynamic Economic Dispatch of Incremental Distribution Network Considering P2G

Ltd, China; Qingbin, Z., Guangzhou Power Electrical Technology Co. Ltd, China; Jie, X., Guangzhou Power Electrical Technology Co. Ltd, China
Abstract: The incremental distribution network operating income will be the focus of attention of the company that has the power of incremental distribution network operation under the electricity reform. Based on this, this passage establishes the dynamic economic dispatch model of incremental distribution network considering P2G. It also proposes a catastrophe genetic algorithm based on double iterative optimization genetic algorithm to solve the time coupling problem under the constraints of control means, such as energy storage and demand-side response. Taking the improvement IEEE33 node model as an example, the influence of various regulatory methods on the operating income of incremental distribution network is analyzed and discussed. It is verified that the consideration of 2PG and demand-side response is essential to improve the operating income of incremental distribution network. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: A Computationally Efficient Sizing Method of Flexible Resources for Grid-connected Microgrids
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings

LTD., Guangzhou, 510530, China; Huang, Q., Guangzhou Suihua Energy Technology Co. LTD., Guangzhou, 510530, China
Abstract: In this paper a computationally efficient sizing method is proposed for flexible resources of grid-connected microgrids to efficiently obtain the optimal ratings of flexible resources with a large number of uncertainty scenarios considered. Initially, based on the historical data method, the scenarios are generated to represent GCMG uncertainty, which are then partitioned into the over-power scenario and under-power scenario set. The worst case of the over-power scenario set is used to determine the feasible range of grid-tied transformers and the minimum capacities of battery storage. The capacities of battery storage are optimized based on the battery storage dynamics with the under-power scenario set. Finally, simulation comparisons with a general MILP-based planning method shows the effectiveness and extraordinary computational performance of the proposed method. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Wei D., Cheng Y., Sun S., Su J., Wang Y.
Title: Optimal Design of Parameters and Coupling study on Multi-objective of a Combined Cooling Heating and Power System
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, China
Authors with affiliations: Wei, D., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, China; Cheng, Y., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, China; Sun, S., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, China; Su, J., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, China; Wang, Y., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, China
Abstract: Optimal design is critical to the efficient operation of the combined cooling heating and power (CCHP) system, different design combinations will definitely lead to different characteristics. However, the problem of balancing different system performance by regulating the capacity of facilities and key parameters still remain unclear. This paper designs a CCHP system with the storage unit and the electric chiller. A multi-objective model considering the energetic, economic and environmental benefits has been built, aiming to optimize the rated power of the power generation unit (PGU), the capacity of storage unit, the electric chilling ratio and the on-off coefficient of the PGU. Moreover, the Non-dominated Sorting Genetic Algorithm-II (NSGA-II) is adopted to solve the optimal model, thus obtaining multiple optimal designing combinations focusing on different performance. The energy saving rate is chosen as an example, which is used for revealing the inherent effects of all designing parameters on the system performance. Furthermore, the coupling relationships between these objectives are quantified, thereby providing the reliable method of balancing the benefits of all participants for the decision-makers in the designing process. © 2018 IEEE.

Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings

Authors with affiliations: Ochani, M.K., Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent Dispatch and Control, Ministry of Education, School of Electrical Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, 250061, China; Zhang, H., Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent Dispatch and Control, Ministry of Education, School of Electrical Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, 250061, China; Rafiq, H., Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent Dispatch and Control, Ministry of Education, School of Electrical Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, 250061, China; Nawaz, A., Key Laboratory of Power System Intelligent Dispatch and Control, Ministry of Education, School of Electrical Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, 250061, China
Abstract: Many inverters nowadays have the ability to control the output power from the renewables sources. They all are mainly PI-based controllers and have been proved to provide stable and controllable power to the output. These inverters are known as Synthetic inverters because they provide synthetic inertia to the power system. The main problem arising from implementing the Synthetic inverters is that the renewables cannot always work on MPPT, some power must be reserved that can provide inertia to the system. In many ways, this residual power is wasted during the low demand, which means that cost of electricity would be increased. A new research has been carried out on BESS to provide the synthetic inertia. BESS can emulate the internal response just like conventional power plants (CPP) as well as synthetic inverters. In this paper BESS providing PFR (Primary frequency Response), IR (Inertial Response), and DR (Damping Response) is implemented and its effect on wind and steam turbines are analyzed with simulations. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery Energy Storage System (BESS); Damping Response; Inertial response; Non-inertial nature (NIN); Primary Frequency response
Index Keywords: Damping; Electric energy storage; Electric inverters; Frequency response; Steam power plants; Steam turbines; Wind power; Battery energy storage systems; Conventional power plants; Cost of electricity; Damping response; Inertial response; Non-inertial nature (NIN); Output power; Residual power; Power control

Authors: Chao H., Quan D., Yang T.
Title: Multi-time Scale Simulation of Optimal Scheduling Strategy for Virtual Power Plant Considering Load Response
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Guo Dian Nanjing Automation CO., LTD., Nanjing, 210032, China
Authors with affiliations: Chao, H., Guo Dian Nanjing Automation CO., LTD., Nanjing, 210032, China; Quan, D., Guo Dian Nanjing Automation CO., LTD., Nanjing, 210032, China; Yang, T., Guo Dian Nanjing Automation CO., LTD., Nanjing, 210032, China
Abstract: The conventional scheduling models of the virtual power plant(VPP) only consider the electricity trading in the day-ahead market. In this paper, a multi-time scale model covering the day-ahead plan decomposition and the intraday forecast is proposed. At the same time, the load response is considered a resource that can participate in scheduling with traditional generators. Firstly, the power models of VPP has been established, VPP realizes the output tracking plan in each period by simulating the power flow between DG, grid, energy storage and the controllable load. Then, the highest profit and the lowest power generation costs, controllable load compensation and penalty costs is used as a target. By setting parameters and calculating, the economical and environmental protection of the VPP can be reflected. In order to ensure economic and environmental protection, the emission target is converted into economic penalty cost, and genetic algorithm optimization is adopted. The case study verifies the effectiveness of proposed method in the end. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: multi-objective optimization; optimal scheduling strategy; simulation; virtual power plant
Index Keywords: Commerce; Electric energy storage; Electric equipment protection; Electric load flow; Electric power system control; Environmental protection; Genetic algorithms; Multiobjective optimization; Scheduling; Conventional scheduling models; Electricity trading; Genetic-algorithm optimizations; Multi time scale model; Optimal scheduling strategies; simulation; Virtual power plants; Virtual power plants (VPP); Power markets

Authors: Xiaodong Z., Yingqing R., Zhenan Z., Yufei R., Jun Y., Xin W.
Title: A New Generalized Integrated Load Model and Its Equivalent Description Based on a Variety of New Energy Loads
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Electric Power of HeNan, China
Authors with affiliations: Xiaodong, Z., Electric Power of HeNan, China; Yingqing, R., Electric Power of HeNan, China; Zhenan, Z., Electric Power of HeNan, China; Yufei, R., Electric Power of HeNan, China; Jun, Y., Electric Power of HeNan, China; Xin, W., Electric Power of HeNan, China
Abstract: With the addition of new distributed energy sources, a new and more accurate load model need to be established. Based on MATLAB/Simulink, this paper researches on the modeling and simulating of photovoltaic power generation system and battery energy storage and their equivalent model. First, a detailed model of the photovoltaic system is built. Boost circuit and MPPT control are selected on the DC side of photovoltaic power generation system. The double closed loop control method of current internal loop and external voltage loop is used for grid inverter control. The model is improved considering the capability of LVRT (low voltage ride through). Based on the above precise models, the model is equaled. The equivalent transfer function is calculated by the grid connected control loop, so the model is simplified. The battery energy storage module establishes a general mathematical model based on the charging and discharging principle. Charge and discharge are controlled through the DC/DC converter. And it is connected to the power grid after inverting and filtering. The common PQ control are selected in the inverter control mode. According to the same principle, the energy storage model is equaled. Finally, based on the traditional load model, the above load model is added to set up a new generalized integrated load model. And the actual model is replaced to build up an equivalent model. The equivalent model is compared with the actual model to verify the equivalent description ability. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery energy storage; equivalent description; integrated load model; LVRT; photovoltaic
Index Keywords: DC-DC converters; Electric inverters; Electric power transmission networks; Photovoltaic cells; Secondary batteries; Solar energy; Battery energy storage; equivalent description; Load modeling; LVRT; Photovoltaic; Battery storage

Authors: Kunpeng Z., Junzheng C., Yong X., Dongqing W., Fei T.
Title: Application of VSC Based DC Distribution Network and Key Technology
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: C-EPRI Electric Power Engineering Co., Ltd, China
Authors with affiliations: Kunpeng, Z., C-EPRI Electric Power Engineering Co., Ltd, China; Junzheng, C., C-EPRI Electric Power Engineering Co., Ltd, China; Yong, X., C-EPRI Electric Power Engineering Co., Ltd, China; Dongqing, W., C-EPRI Electric Power Engineering Co., Ltd, China; Fei, T., C-EPRI Electric Power Engineering Co., Ltd, China
Abstract: Due to the continuous development of distributed energy and energy storage systems, the VSC based DC and AC-DC hybrid distribution networks have been developed rapidly in recent years. Compared with the traditional AC distribution network, DC distribution network can remove the power conversion links in power supply, storage, and end loads, reducing the complexity and cost of the access system, improving the network efficiency and power quality. This paper introduces several VSC based DC distribution network projects to be implemented in China. The key technologies proposed, including AC/DC conversion, control and protection, fault isolation and restore, and DC transformer, are analyzed together with their technical challenges. This paper also explains the development trends of several DC distribution network related subjects such as DC voltage level, key equipment development, rapid protection isolating fault, and regional coordinated control etc. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: conversion; converter; DC distribution network; DC transformer; MMC; VSC
Index Keywords: Data storage equipment; Rectifying circuits; Ship conversion; Transformer protection; Continuous development; Control and protection; converter; DC distribution network; Energy storage systems; Power conversion link; Regional coordinated controls; Technical challenges; DC transformers

Authors: Lu X., Ding C., Wang Y., Zhang M.
Title: Assessment of Renewable Energy Absorption Based on System Flexibility
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Nanjng Power Supply Company, Nanjing, China; State Grid JiangSu Power Company Maintenance Branch, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Lu, X., State Grid Nanjng Power Supply Company, Nanjing, China; Ding, C., State Grid JiangSu Power Company Maintenance Branch, Nanjing, China; Wang, Y., State Grid Nanjng Power Supply Company, Nanjing, China; Zhang, M., State Grid Nanjng Power Supply Company, Nanjing, China
Abstract: Traditional methods of generation schedule, based on the condition of power balance, can satisfactorily deal with system uncertainty mainly from load variation. However, with a high proportion of renewable energy generation, traditional methods are difficult to meet the need of renewable energy accommodation because of much more severe power variation and large uncertainty in system. Assessing system capability to accommodate renewable energy generation becomes more and more important. From the perspective of system flexibility, this paper quantitatively analyzes the flexibility provided and consumed by various resources in system. And it proposes a method for assessing the system flexibility and renewable energy consumption. In addition, some measures to enhance system's renewable energy accommodation are discussed, such as self-generation taking part in power regulation and storage facilities running. From the result of the case in paper, we can see that the system reliability is boosted by energy storage and regulation of own-plant. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: high proportion of renewable energy sources; renewable energy absorption; system flexibility
Index Keywords: Energy absorption; Energy policy; Energy utilization; Generation schedules; Renewable energy consumption; Renewable energy generation; Renewable energy source; System capabilities; System flexibility; System reliability; System uncertainties; Renewable energy resources

Authors: Qu J., Shi W., Luo K., Feng C., Mou J.
Title: Day-ahead Generation Scheduling Method for New Energy and Hydro Power System
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, CO, 100192, China; State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, CO, 100031, China
Authors with affiliations: Qu, J., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, CO, 100192, China; Shi, W., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, CO, 100192, China; Luo, K., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, CO, 100192, China; Feng, C., State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, CO, 100031, China; Mou, J., State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, CO, 100031, China
Abstract: When the stochastic and fluctuant new energy integrates to the power system, it increases conventional units' burden. On the other hand, some conventional units are replaced by new energy units, which lead to the decline in peak load regulation ability. In order to make full use of the water storage capacity of hydropower to improve system's peak load regulation ability, this paper proposes a method of optimizing the day-ahead generation scheduling based on the coordinated operation of new energy and hydropower. This method comprehensively considers the constraints of hydro-plants generation constraints, power balance, unit output, new energy output prediction, and can prepare unit combinations and output plans. In the objective function, new energy accommodation is given greater weight. This will implicitly achieve the goal of the first priority of accommodating new energy and the second priority of accommodating hydropower, which can reduce the start-stopping of thermal power units and is particularly suitable for power systems with high start-up costs and high operating costs of thermal power units. The example results show that the method can make full use of hydropower and new energy to regulate peak load, which can not only promote accommodation of new energy and guarantee the safety of power safety, but also ensure the stability of thermal power plants operation and increase the economic efficiency of power system. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: cooperate in harmony; hydro power; new energy; regulating peak load
Index Keywords: Fossil fuel power plants; Hydroelectric power; Operating costs; Scheduling; Stochastic systems; Thermoelectric power plants; cooperate in harmony; Coordinated operation; Generation scheduling; Hydro power; New energies; Peak load; Peak load regulations; Water storage capacity; Hydroelectric power plants

Authors: Kang K., Deng S., Wu S., Zhong T., Wu X., Wang Z.
Title: A Multi-time Scale Coordinated Real Time Dispatch Model of CCHP-based Microgrid
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Hubei Electric Engineering Corporation Limited, Wuhan, Hubei, 430040, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, Shaanxi, 710049, China
Authors with affiliations: Kang, K., Hubei Electric Engineering Corporation Limited, Wuhan, Hubei, 430040, China; Deng, S., Hubei Electric Engineering Corporation Limited, Wuhan, Hubei, 430040, China; Wu, S., Hubei Electric Engineering Corporation Limited, Wuhan, Hubei, 430040, China; Zhong, T., Hubei Electric Engineering Corporation Limited, Wuhan, Hubei, 430040, China; Wu, X., Department of Electrical Engineering, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, Shaanxi, 710049, China; Wang, Z., Department of Electrical Engineering, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, Shaanxi, 710049, China
Abstract: Conventional real time dispatch models are usually based on the day ahead scheduling. If the day ahead prediction is far from accuracy, the real time dispatch may fail. To improve it, this paper proposes a multi-time scale coordinated real time dispatch model of CCHP-based microgrids. The proposed model is conducted based on the boundary information offered by a rolling schedule with a larger time resolution. To mitigate the influence of the cumulative prediction error, a feedback model is also integrated into the model. The main advantage of this model is that the state of charge (SOC) of the energy storage systems (ESSs) can be tightly controlled while the total cost can also be reduced. The real time dispatch model is converted into a mixed integer second order core programming (MISOCP) problem, which could be solved by mature algorithm. The methodology is tested on a modified IEEE 33-bus distribution system. Simulation results indicate that the proposed models are capable to mitigate the influence of prediction error. In addition, the SOC of ESS is controlled as expected, which is useful especially for energy reserve for the next scheduling period. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: CCHP microgrids; feedback; multi-time scale; real time dispatch
Index Keywords: Feedback; Forecasting; Integer programming; Scheduling; Boundary information; Day-ahead scheduling; Distribution systems; Energy Storage Systems (ESSs); Micro grid; Multi-time scale; Real time dispatches; Scheduling periods; Time measurement

Authors: Dong H., Wu H., Wu D.
Title: Coordinated control of MT and ESS in an islanded AC/DC hybrid microgrid
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, 230009, China
Authors with affiliations: Dong, H., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, 230009, China; Wu, H., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, 230009, China; Wu, D., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, 230009, China
Abstract: In the AC/DC hybrid microgrid system under the island mode, the coordinated control of the main power supply and other distributed power sources is the key issue to ensure the stable operation of the microgrid. To solve this problem, a coordinated control method based on the main power supply and other distributed generators (DGs) is designed in this paper. Firstly, an AC/DC hybrid microgrid model with PV, PMSG, an energy storage system (ESS) and micro gas turbine (MT) is established; according to the characteristics of the different DGs, the control strategies, such as MPPT control and PQ control, are adopted. Secondly, the application of virtual synchronous generator (VSG) control in the MT and ESS is studied. A seamless switching strategy for the MT and ESS is proposed in view of the potential power outage when the MT is out of operation. In addition, the phase angle seamless switching method and a switching time sequence are designed. Finally, verification of the simulation is carried out using Matlab/Simulink. The simulation results show that the proposed coordinated control strategy ensures a small impact and short time during the switching process, which verifies the correctness and validity of the proposed coordinated control strategy. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: AC/DC hybrid microgrid; coordinated control; seamless switch; virtual synchronous generator

Authors: Tan Y., Zhang Y., Su H., Chen C., Gao C., Tang Q., Wan S.
Title: Operational Optimization to Double Battery Energy Storage System (dBESS) against Ramp Events of Wind Power
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Hefei Electrical Power Company, China; School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, 230009, China
Authors with affiliations: Tan, Y., Hefei Electrical Power Company, China; Zhang, Y., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, 230009, China; Su, H., Hefei Electrical Power Company, China; Chen, C., Hefei Electrical Power Company, China; Gao, C., Hefei Electrical Power Company, China; Tang, Q., Hefei Electrical Power Company, China; Wan, S., Hefei Electrical Power Company, China
Abstract: To avoid the ramp events of wind power and smooth its fast fluctuation, the synchronous and asynchronous control strategies to double battery energy storage system (dBESS) are proposed to allocate the charge and discharge times and optimize the parameters of the dBESS. Considering the discarded wind, the ramp events of the wind power are analyzed. The improved particle swarm optimization (IPSO) is applied to optimize the life time and cost of the battery, as well as the penalty cost of the wind curtailment and deficiency. The simulation results validate the accuracy of the dynamic definition to the wind ramp events, the control effect of the asynchronous strategy, and economics of wind curtailment. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Niu M., Libei, Li J., Huang J., Susu
Title: Coordinated operation control strategy and droop improvement method for DC microgrid
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; National Active Distribution Network Technology Research Center, Beijing Jiaotong University, No.3, Shangyuan Village, Haidian District, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Niu, M., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy Storage Systems, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Libei, National Active Distribution Network Technology Research Center, Beijing Jiaotong University, No.3, Shangyuan Village, Haidian District, Beijing, China; Li, J., National Active Distribution Network Technology Research Center, Beijing Jiaotong University, No.3, Shangyuan Village, Haidian District, Beijing, China; Huang, J., National Active Distribution Network Technology Research Center, Beijing Jiaotong University, No.3, Shangyuan Village, Haidian District, Beijing, China; Susu, National Active Distribution Network Technology Research Center, Beijing Jiaotong University, No.3, Shangyuan Village, Haidian District, Beijing, China
Abstract: The permeability of renewable energy in the microgrid is relatively high, and its intermittence will lead to the fluctuation of power supply in the system. At the same time, the sudden change of load and switch will cause voltage flicker and drop of DC bus, which will threaten the stable operation of the system. The DC microgrid composed of photovoltaic power generation, battery energy storage device, grid converter and DC and it is used as the research object load in this paper, what's more, based on the bus voltage information, the operation control strategy of microgrid is designed to realize the independent operation of the microgrid, such as parallel in and off the grid. Aiming at the problem of uneven voltage drop and power distribution in traditional droop control, an improved droop control based on hybrid compensation is adopted to realize bus voltage stability and power sharing in the system. Finally, simulation analysis is carried out, and the experimental results verify the feasibility of the control strategy mentioned above. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Chen X., Chen Q., Yuan X., He Y., Chen Q.
Title: Economic Schedule of a Microgrid with Load Flexibility Based on Rolling Robust optimization
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Huizhou Power Supply Bureau Co.Ltd, Huizhou, 516001, China; State Key Lab of Control and Simulation of Power Systems and Generation Equipments, Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, X., Huizhou Power Supply Bureau Co.Ltd, Huizhou, 516001, China; Chen, Q., Huizhou Power Supply Bureau Co.Ltd, Huizhou, 516001, China; Yuan, X., Huizhou Power Supply Bureau Co.Ltd, Huizhou, 516001, China; He, Y., State Key Lab of Control and Simulation of Power Systems and Generation Equipments, Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China; Chen, Q., State Key Lab of Control and Simulation of Power Systems and Generation Equipments, Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China
Abstract: This paper investigates a robust economic schedule scheme for a grid-connected microgrid with high penetration of distributed energy resources (DER) and flexible loads. The schedule scheme seeks to minimize the overall costs of load consumption by controlling the resources of flexibility including an EV fleet, an aggregation of cooling appliances, a battery storage system, and the power exchange with public grid. The demand in the microgrid is first fulfilled by the local DER, and the net demand is balanced through an intraday market with real time pricing. A two-stage robust optimization (RO) formulation is proposed to take account of the uncertainty due to forecast errors of load consumption and renewable energy generation. Instead of the RO approach considering the worst scenario, a weak robust optimization (WRO) is proposed and solved using a modified constraint-and-column generation (C CG) algorithm. A case study is conducted on a test microgrid to validate the efficiency and robustness of the proposed method. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Demand response; flexible load; microgrid; renewable energy; two-stage robust optimization
Index Keywords: Linear programming; Renewable energy resources; Demand response; Flexible loads; Micro grid; Renewable energies; Robust optimization; Electric power system control

Authors: Mao H., Zhang Y., Wang H.
Title: Design of a centralized management system based on mobile modular on-board batteries
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: South China University of Technology, China
Authors with affiliations: Mao, H., South China University of Technology, China; Zhang, Y., South China University of Technology, China; Wang, H., South China University of Technology, China
Abstract: With the continuous development of the industrialization of electric vehicles, how to efficiently use the energy storage value of the vehicle battery has become a hot research direction. Based on the analysis of the trip characteristics of electric vehicles and the capacity of traditional batteries, this paper proposes that the power-changing mode with small capacity can well match the characteristics of the majority of users' short and medium trips. Therefore, a mobile modular sharing design is adopted for on-board batteries. Further, the working mode and total capacity of the proposed Centralized Battery management System (CBMS) are designed, taking into account the difference of travel time and the influence of battery charging mode. Finally, the design of battery management system is analyzed and illustrated by taking a small district as an example. The results show that the proposed battery management model can promote the absorption of photovoltaic and reduce the average cost of on-board batteries, providing reference for the development of electric vehicle industry. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Zhang H., Zhou J.
Title: The Application of Electricity-sale in Operation Mode of Pumped Storage Power Station
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: CSG Power Generation Co. LTD, Guangzhou, 510630, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, H., CSG Power Generation Co. LTD, Guangzhou, 510630, China; Zhou, J., CSG Power Generation Co. LTD, Guangzhou, 510630, China
Abstract: The electricity-sale operation mode is proposed, which means the pumped storage power station has electricity-sale licenses. In this operation mode, the pumped storage power station gets the valley electricity from gird at a low price for energy storage in the nighttime. While in the daytime the pumped storage power station is used as a power plant. It supply power to large industrial users and takes a part in the electricity balance between supply and demand side, with the advantages of fast adjustment and high power storage with less loss. With the help of pumped storage power units, the load of large industrial users has the ability to track the load of power grid. And the peak and valley of electricity demand is got smooth. The pumped storage power units in electricity-sale mode are maximum called, and the profit of the pumped storage power plant is well increased. According to the principle that who benefits and who apportionment, the cost of pumped storage power plant is shared by large industrial users in demand side and grid companies, which is changed from grid companies bearing alone. The grid companies' expenditure for the pumped storage power units calling is reduced. Only the flat electricity price can meet the operation requirements of grid companies and pumped storage power station. Large industrial users in demand side do not have to pay peak prices. Electricity price for demand side declines, and the profit of demand side is well increased. At the same time, the win-win situation is contributed. The profit of pumped storage power station is increased, the cost of power grid for energy balance is reduced and the profit of demand side is increased. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Demand Side; electricity-sale; Power gird; pumped storage power station
Index Keywords: Costs; Electric energy storage; Profitability; Pumped storage power plants; Demand-side; Electricity demands; Electricity prices; Electricity sales; Industrial users; Power gird; Pumped storage power station; Supply and demand; Electric power transmission networks

Authors: Zhuo C., Zhaobin D., Haoqin Z., Kai W.
Title: An Evaluation Method of Reactive Power and Voltage Control Ability for Multiple Distributed Generators in an Islanded Micro-grid
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangdong, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhuo, C., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangdong, China; Zhaobin, D., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangdong, China; Haoqin, Z., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangdong, China; Kai, W., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangdong, China
Abstract: Micro-gird, as an effective way of connecting the large-scale distributed generators (DGs) to distribution network, has attracted the attention of scholars these years. However, the reactive power and voltage control is a big challenge to the islanded micro-grid, due to the small capacity of the master source or lack of a diesel generator with a large load fluctuation. In the interest of more economical and flexible adapting to various operation modes in an islanded micro-grid with renewable sources, it is necessary to utilize the reactive power potential of existing DGs as much as possible. In this paper, a comprehensive index for evaluating the reactive power and voltage control capability of DGs is proposed using the Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP). The comprehensive index is determined by five subindices, including Voltage Deviation, Voltage Fluctuation, Voltage Harmonics, Static Reactive Power Support Capability, and Transient Reactive Power Support Capability. The proposed indices are utilized to evaluate the reactive power and voltage control capability of islanded micro-grids with various combinations of DGs such as wind turbine, photovoltaic and energy storage, while the difference between master-slave control and peer-to-peer control is mainly analyzed in this way. Simulations are carried out in the DIgSILENT environment. The effectiveness of the proposed comprehensive index is verified by the comparison of different cases, which can be a reference for the generation planning and voltage control strategies of islanded micro-grids. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Analytic hierarchy process; Control strategies; Distributed generation; Islanded micro-grid; Reactive power/voltage control
Index Keywords: Analytic hierarchy process; Distributed power generation; Electric power system control; Electric power system economics; Electric power transmission networks; Power control; Process control; Reactive power; Voltage control; Wind turbines; Analytic hierarchy process (ahp); Comprehensive indices; Control strategies; Distributed generator (DGs); Islanded micro grids; Multiple distributed generators; Reactive power support; Voltage control strategies; Electric machine control

Authors: Jiang X., Zheng X., Chen G., Miao Y.
Title: Optimization of BESS Locating and Sizing for the Gird under the Market Mechanism
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Electrical Engineering Department, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, Henan, China; State Grid Jiangsu Economic Research Institute, Nanjing, Jiangsu, China
Authors with affiliations: Jiang, X., Electrical Engineering Department, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, Henan, China; Zheng, X., Electrical Engineering Department, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, Henan, China; Chen, G., Electrical Engineering Department, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, Henan, China; Miao, Y., State Grid Jiangsu Economic Research Institute, Nanjing, Jiangsu, China
Abstract: An optimization model of battery energy storage system (BESS) sizing and locating under the market mechanism is proposed in this paper. Planning and operational problem are both involved in optimal allocation of BESS. In response to this question, the inner and outer two-level optimization model is established with considering the impact of irregular charging and discharging strategy on the equivalent life cycle of BESS. The inner layer is the optimal scheduling model, and the outer layer is the optimal BESS locating and sizing based the cost-benefit analysis. As an independent market operator (IMO), the most direct benefit for BESS is the arbitrage benefit based on the peak-valley electricity price and the auxiliary service compensation benefit. What's more, the indirect benefit for other IMO with configuration BESS includes the reducing of curtailed renewable energy, the saving of operating cost of conventional units, and the decreasing of network loss of systems. Thus, a multi-objective, two-tier decision-making model is built. Results based on the improved IEEE 39-node system verify the feasibility and effectiveness of the proposed model. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery energy storage system; equivalent life loss; multi-objective bi-level decision; particle swarm optimization
Index Keywords: Battery storage; Commerce; Decision making; Life cycle; Location; Particle swarm optimization (PSO); Battery energy storage systems; Decision making models; Equivalent lives; Multi objective; Operational problems; Optimization modeling; Renewable energies; Two-level optimization; Cost benefit analysis

Authors: Xiang X., Wei Z., Jie Z., Ning X., Qi X.
Title: Key technologies and applications of AC/DC hybrid distributed renewable energy system
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Electric Power Research Institute, Guangdong Power Grid Co., Ltd, Guangzhou, 510080, China
Authors with affiliations: Xiang, X., Electric Power Research Institute, Guangdong Power Grid Co., Ltd, Guangzhou, 510080, China; Wei, Z., Electric Power Research Institute, Guangdong Power Grid Co., Ltd, Guangzhou, 510080, China; Jie, Z., Electric Power Research Institute, Guangdong Power Grid Co., Ltd, Guangzhou, 510080, China; Ning, X., Electric Power Research Institute, Guangdong Power Grid Co., Ltd, Guangzhou, 510080, China; Qi, X., Electric Power Research Institute, Guangdong Power Grid Co., Ltd, Guangzhou, 510080, China
Abstract: In general, distributed renewable energy, energy storage and DC load are connected to the traditional AC distribution network through multistage converters, which leads to low energy efficiency of the system. AC/DC power distribution technology can effectively reduce the intermediate link of AC/DC transformation, and improve the economy, reliability and operation flexibility of power distribution. This paper is aimed at the economic energy problems of efficient access for high-capacity distributed renewable energy and DC load, on the basis of research before, several aspects such as system structure design, key equipment support technology and operation control technology are explored, in order to provide some ideas and references for further research and application of AC/DC hybrid system. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: AC DC hybrid system; DC loads; distributed renewable energy; power electronic transformer

Authors: Chen Y.
Title: Optimal Configuration and Sensitivity Analysis of Distributed Generations in a Grid-connected Micro-grid
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Suzhou Nuclear Power Research Institute Co. Ltd., Suzhou, 215000, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, Y., Suzhou Nuclear Power Research Institute Co. Ltd., Suzhou, 215000, China
Abstract: In this paper a grid-connected micro-grid system is established and simulated in an attempt to find out the optimal configuration of distributed generations (DGs) in the system. A typical micro-grid structure comprising of wind generator, photovoltaic array, micro gas turbine and storage battery is presented; and the output model of DGs is built. The proposed grid-connected micro-grid with thermal load is developed in hybrid optimization models for energy resources (HOMER) software. Emission penalties of the micro-grid, cost parameters of all DGs and fuel consumption are addressed in the HOMER software. The simulation result shows that the total net present cost (NPC) of the case under study reaches its minimum when the photovoltaic capacitor is 500kW, the wind capacity is 1000kW, the micro gas turbine capacity is 500kW, the inverter is 500kW and the purchased power is 200kW. It will be shown that the optimal configuration of DGs is meeting the demand of the loads in this system. A sensitivity analysis of the natural gas price and the electricity price is studied to find out the impacts of various parameters to the micro-grid system, and the results show that in this case the natural gas price fluctuation has the most pronounced effects on NPC. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: HOMER; Micro-grid; optimal configuration; sensitivity analysis
Index Keywords: Distributed power generation; Electric power supplies to apparatus; Energy resources; Gas turbines; Natural gas; Photovoltaic cells; Distributed generations (DGs); HOMER; Hybrid optimization; Micro gas turbines; Micro grid; optimal configuration; Photovoltaic arrays; Wind generator systems; Sensitivity analysis

Authors: Zhu Y., Zhang W., Cheng J., Li Y.
Title: A novel design of reconfigurable multicell for large-scale battery packs
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Authors with affiliations: Zhu, Y.; Zhang, W.; Cheng, J.; Li, Y.
Abstract: Battery packs consisting of a great number of battery cells are becoming more and more widely used, such as 220kV transformer substation, and large-scale energy storage system in the power grid. However, low energy efficiency, short service life, potential safety hazards as well as low flexibility and reliability have become bottlenecks in conventional utilized battery packs for practical applications. This paper presents a novel design of recon figure able battery packs, in which each battery cell can be connected in series, in parallel or bypassed via switch matrix. By appropriate control signals on switches, battery cells can be configured to different configurations to meet several requirements, including capacity maximization, stable output voltage, cell balancing, weak/faulty cell replacement, etc. Compared with other reconfigurable structure with the same function, the proposed design reduces the number of required switches by 20%. It is verified by simulation results that the proposed design can significantly improve the performance of battery packs. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery management system; cell balance; reconfigurable battery packs; stable output voltage
Index Keywords: Battery management systems; Electric power transmission networks; Energy efficiency; Transformer substations; Cell balancing; Control signal; Energy storage systems; Output voltages; Potential safety hazards; Reconfigurable; Reconfigurable structure; Switch matrix; Battery Pack

Authors: Huang Q., Zhang D., Yang H., Yang R., Cheng L., Li X.
Title: Mechanical Fault Diagnostics of Power Transformer On-load Tap Changers Based on Marginal Point Distribution Coefficient
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Wuhan NARI State Grid Power Research Institute, Wuhan, 430070, China; State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, 430074, China; Shanghai Huaming Power Equipment, Shanghai, 200333, China

Abstract: With the continuous construction of power system in China, the safe and stable operation of power system has become a very important problem. The On-Load Tap Changer (OLTC), as the only movable part in power transformer, plays an important role in the stable operation of the transformer and even the whole power system. At present, the fault diagnosis of the OLTC based on the vibration signal has become the focus of scholars. In this paper, the vibration signals of the OLTC including good condition, tap loosening, tap abrasion and insufficient energy-storage are obtained by simulating experiment. Meanwhile, in order to characterize OLTCs in different conditions, a characteristic parameter Marginal Phase Space Distribution Coefficient (MPPDC) is proposed based on phase space reconstruction technology. Furthermore, based on MPPDC and fuzzy set, a fault diagnosis strategy of OLTC is proposed in this paper. The experimental results show that based on the method proposed in this paper, the fault types of the OLTC can be effectively identified, which provides the theoretical basis for the on-line monitoring technology of OLTC. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Fault diagnostics; Marginal Phase Point Distribution Coefficient (MPPDC); On-load tap changer (OLTC); Phase space reconstruction; Vibration signal
Index Keywords: Electric fault currents; Electric power systems; Failure analysis; Fault detection; Phase space methods; Power transformers; Distribution coefficient; Fault diagnostics; On-load tap changers; Phase space reconstruction; Vibration signal; Voltage control

Authors: Shen L., Zhao Q., Ma G., Qiu Z., Lu T.
Title: Coordinated Optimization Strategy of 'Network-Load-Storage' System Based on Price Response Mechanism
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Power System Technology, POWERCON 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Supply Co.LTD, Shenyang, 110003, China; School of Information Science Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; NARI Group Corporation, State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, 210000, China
Authors with affiliations: Shen, L., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Supply Co.LTD, Shenyang, 110003, China; Zhao, Q., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Supply Co.LTD, Shenyang, 110003, China; Ma, G., School of Information Science Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; Qiu, Z., NARI Group Corporation, State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, 210000, China; Lu, T., NARI Group Corporation, State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, 210000, China
Abstract: With the increasing permeability of wind power, the peak-load regulation pressure of the unit is increasing, and it is a difficult problem to control the distribution network by reducing the wind power curtailment while ensuring the space of peak-load regulation. In this paper, based on the system of distribution network, variable load and energy storage device, a collaborative optimization strategy of network-load-storage system considering the response mechanism of price is proposed. The strategy takes fully into account the time shift capacity of energy storage devices for power and energy as well as the physical characteristics of the complementary electrical and thermal systems. The agent system and the electricity price mechanism are introduced to construct the coordination and optimization framework. The framework includes the distribution network agent (DNA), the source-load agent (SOLA), the storage-load agent (STLA) and the target function of the minimum operating cost of the agent. Under the energy balance constraint, the unit operation constraint and the energy storage constraint of the agent, the function is solved by golden section method and the improved particle swarm optimization algorithm. Finally, the simulation results demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: 'network-load-storage' system; agent; coordination and optimization; electricity price mechanism; wind power accommodation
Index Keywords: Agents; Electric energy storage; Particle swarm optimization (PSO); Wind power; Collaborative optimization; Coordinated optimization; Electricity prices; Improved particle swarm optimization algorithms; Network load; Physical characteristics; Wind power accommodations; Wind power curtailments; Data storage equipment

Authors: Ignat A., Lazar E., Petreus D.
Title: Energy Management for an Islanded Microgrid Based on Particle Swarm Optimization
Source title: 2018 IEEE 24th International Symposium for Design and Technology in Electronic Packaging, SIITME 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Applied Electronics, Technical University of Cluj-Napoca, Cluj-Napoca, Romania
Authors with affiliations: Ignat, A., Department of Applied Electronics, Technical University of Cluj-Napoca, Cluj-Napoca, Romania; Lazar, E., Department of Applied Electronics, Technical University of Cluj-Napoca, Cluj-Napoca, Romania; Petreus, D., Department of Applied Electronics, Technical University of Cluj-Napoca, Cluj-Napoca, Romania
Abstract: Microgrids that include renewable energy sources are the latest solution for clean energy generation and use. This paper presents the secondary control of a microgrid operating in islanded mode that consists of several renewable energy sources, one energy storage system, and loads. The day-ahead scheduling problem can be solved in different ways. This paper uses the Particle Swarm Optimization Algorithm for determining the optimal operation of the solar, geothermal and biomass units of the microgrid, the purpose being cost optimization. The scheduling scheme are made available to the user through a graphical interface. The paper compares the different results obtained using the Particle Swarm optimization algorithm and the Harmony Search Optimization Algorithm. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Vasile D.C., Svasta P.M.
Title: Antitamper Conductive Mesh Used for Securing Cryptographic Modules
Source title: 2018 IEEE 24th International Symposium for Design and Technology in Electronic Packaging, SIITME 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: UPB-CETTI, University POLITEHNICA of Bucharest, Bucharest, Romania
Authors with affiliations: Vasile, D.C., UPB-CETTI, University POLITEHNICA of Bucharest, Bucharest, Romania; Svasta, P.M., UPB-CETTI, University POLITEHNICA of Bucharest, Bucharest, Romania
Abstract: Physical unique identity patterns, provided by the electronic components and electric circuits, are used in cryptographic applications in many forms. These patterns can act as secret data or cryptographic keys, rather than embodying them in non-volatile memories. This paper proposes a special antitamper conductive mesh that provides a unique identity pattern that can be used as cryptographic key. This key needs no energy for storage and is automatically compromised in case of tampering. In this way, the antitamper conductive mesh has dual role: physical antitamper structure and secret key. The proposed mesh can protect cryptographic modules, communication terminals, security and IoT devices. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: By considering transmission losses, power system operators can obtain more realistic economic dispatching. This paper proposes a multi-period DC optimal power flow (DC-OPF) with losses formulation for minimizing power system operation costs. The classic DC power flow formulation and the power transfer distribution factors (PTDF) formulation are used to formulate the transmission network, and losses are included by using a piecewise linear approximation approach. The formulations are validated and compared on IEEE 14-bus and 57-bus systems. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Zhu D., Xu H., Guo Y., Wei L., Cui H., Miao W., Chen X., Jiang C.
Title: Research and development of customized wireless device based on the multimode chip for energy internet applications
Source title: International Conference on Communication Technology Proceedings, ICCT
Affiliations: Wireless Communication Technology Laboratory, State Grid Jiangsu Electric Power Co.LTD., Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Department of Communications, State Grid Jiangsu Electric Power Co., LTD., Nanjing, China

Abstract: The customized wireless devices play a key role in information exchanging for various electrical facilities. However, the development of the devices is hindered by diversity of interfaces (RS-232/485, Ethernet, USB, etc.), high cost, outdoor environment, etc. In this work, we proposed a 'system on module' solution to address above issues. We optimize and spare the storage space of baseband chip for embedded control system to replace the independent chips, which dramatically reduces the size, cost and power consumption of devices. Meanwhile, our SOM wireless devices can support multi-interfaces and thus realize 'plug and play'. Moreover, our developed wireless devices allow multimode wireless communications including operator's wireless networks LTE FDD/TDD, UMTS, GSM and self-built LTE-G 1800MHz network. Last but not least, we can embedded positioning chip and the client of management system in the wireless devices for the sake of operation and maintenance. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Shi F., Sun K., Huang W., Wei Y.
Title: User association for on-grid energy minimizing in hetnets with hybrid energy supplies
Source title: International Conference on Communication Technology Proceedings, ICCT
Affiliations: College of Electronic Information Engineering, Inner Mongolia University, Hohhot, China
Authors with affiliations: Shi, F., College of Electronic Information Engineering, Inner Mongolia University, Hohhot, China; Sun, K., College of Electronic Information Engineering, Inner Mongolia University, Hohhot, China; Huang, W., College of Electronic Information Engineering, Inner Mongolia University, Hohhot, China; Wei, Y., College of Electronic Information Engineering, Inner Mongolia University, Hohhot, China
Abstract: With the development of renewable energy technology, it is possible that base stations (BSs) are powered by renewable energy. In this paper, we study the problem of minimizing the on-grid energy consumption in heterogeneous cellular networks with hybrid energy supplies, and propose an energy-aware user association algorithm. The key idea of our proposed algorithm is to adaptively set the biasing factor for each small BS (SBS) according to the renewable energy storage and make more utilization of the renewable energy for minimizing the on-grid energy consumption. The proposed algorithm is compared with the max-RSRP algorithm and the traditional cell range expansion (TCRE) algorithm. The simulation results show that the proposed algorithm can effectively reduce the consumption of on-grid energy and improve the utilization of renewable energy in the network. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Pan Z., Lin J., Zhang H.
Title: Energy efficiency analysis of cache-enable small-cell interference networks under different caching placement strategies
Source title: International Conference on Communication Technology Proceedings, ICCT
Affiliations: Department of Physics and Telecommunication Engineering, Guangdong Provincial Research Center for Cardiovascular Individual Medical, Big Data South China Normal University, Guangzhou, 510026, China
Authors with affiliations: Pan, Z., Department of Physics and Telecommunication Engineering, Guangdong Provincial Research Center for Cardiovascular Individual Medical, Big Data South China Normal University, Guangzhou, 510026, China; Lin, J., Department of Physics and Telecommunication Engineering, Guangdong Provincial Research Center for Cardiovascular Individual Medical, Big Data South China Normal University, Guangzhou, 510026, China; Zhang, H., Department of Physics and Telecommunication Engineering, Guangdong Provincial Research Center for Cardiovascular Individual Medical, Big Data South China Normal University, Guangzhou, 510026, China
Abstract: Small-cell caching is recognized as an essential technique for improving the ultimate limit of networks with the help of the embedded storage at both small-cell base station (SBS) and mobile user (MU). In this paper, we consider a typical 3 × 3 cache-enable small-cell interference networks, and propose three different caching placement strategies, namely, the conventional caching placement strategy (CCPS), the cooperative caching placement strategy (CPCPS), and the coded caching placement strategy (CDCPS). In order to evaluate the system performance, we also mathematically characterize the energy efficiency (EE) of the downlink transmission w.r.t. the above three caching placement strategies. Numerical results demonstrate that CDCPS achieves a superior performance to both CPCPS and CCPS. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Hu Y., Zheng Y., Liu H.
Title: A route maintenance method for marine mobile sensor network based on ring broadcast mechanism
Source title: International Conference on Communication Technology Proceedings, ICCT
Affiliations: Institute of Oceanographic Instrumentation, Qilu University of Technology, Shandong Academy of Sciences, Qinudao, China; Shandong Provincial Key Laboratory of Ocean, Environmental Monitoring Technology, Qingdao, China; National Engineering and Technological Research, Center of Marine Monitoring Equipment, Qingdao, China; Qilu University of Technology, Shandong Academy of Sciences, Shandong Computer Science Center, National Supercomputer Center in Jinan, Shandong Provincial Key Laboratory of Computer Networks, Jinan, China
Authors with affiliations: Hu, Y., Institute of Oceanographic Instrumentation, Qilu University of Technology, Shandong Academy of Sciences, Qinudao, China, Shandong Provincial Key Laboratory of Ocean, Environmental Monitoring Technology, Qingdao, China, National Engineering and Technological Research, Center of Marine Monitoring Equipment, Qingdao, China, Qilu University of Technology, Shandong Academy of Sciences, Shandong Computer Science Center, National Supercomputer Center in Jinan, Shandong Provincial Key Laboratory of Computer Networks, Jinan, China; Zheng, Y., Institute of Oceanographic Instrumentation, Qilu University of Technology, Shandong Academy of Sciences, Qinudao, China, Shandong Provincial Key Laboratory of Ocean, Environmental Monitoring Technology, Qingdao, China, National Engineering and Technological Research, Center of Marine Monitoring Equipment, Qingdao, China; Liu, H., Institute of Oceanographic Instrumentation, Qilu University of Technology, Shandong Academy of Sciences, Qinudao, China, Shandong Provincial Key Laboratory of Ocean, Environmental Monitoring Technology, Qingdao, China, National Engineering and Technological Research, Center of Marine Monitoring Equipment, Qingdao, China
Abstract: This paper provides a route maintenance method for marine mobile sensor networks (MMSN) to monitor the marine surface environment. The two-layer collection network on the marine surface is firstly constructed, in which sensor nodes send small-scale data to the collection head (CH) node for storage by multi-hop route. The CHs upload data to nearby UAV, which help to save network energy while expanding network coverage. Secondly, the broadcast mode of the Ring Broadcast message can effectively guide search direction of the sensor node routing. Meanwhile the inner-collection nodes select the optimal next-hop node by the fitness function, which helps to balance the energy consumption of each node and search optimal path. Lastly, dynamic routing mechanism in complex environment can quickly search the alternative path to repair route, and thus adapt to the frequent change of MMSN topology. In this paper, the dynamic transmission of UAV mobility and collection network structure are used to realize the high-efficiency transmission of maritime monitoring data, which can effectively improve the network hole problem in harsh maritime environment. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Dynamic route maintenance; Marine mobile sensor networks; Ring broadcast mechanism; UAV

Authors: Abis Naqvi S.M., Ikram S.M., Shen Z., Zhang G.
Title: Energy scheduling in mobile device using heterogeneous batteries
Source title: International Conference on Communication Technology Proceedings, ICCT
Affiliations: College of Information Science and Technology, Donghua University, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Abis Naqvi, S.M., College of Information Science and Technology, Donghua University, Shanghai, China; Ikram, S.M., College of Information Science and Technology, Donghua University, Shanghai, China; Shen, Z., College of Information Science and Technology, Donghua University, Shanghai, China; Zhang, G., College of Information Science and Technology, Donghua University, Shanghai, China
Abstract: The battery is a crucial component for durable functionality in a mobile device. Different storage technologies have unique features, i.e., charging, response times and capacity. In this paper, a mobile device supplied with slow- and fast-responding energy storage units is adopted. We consider two different stage for energy management decisions. A solar energy source with a commercial electricity source is acknowledged for dual timescale batteries in the mobile device. Slow-responding energy storage units i.e., batteries are operated at an hourly resolution where decisions remain the same for multiple fast control time slots. We use the Lyapunov optimization approach because dual timescale energy storage units are charged depending on real-time with significant sub-optimality bounds. Simulations and results using real data show the benefit of dispatching heterogeneous energy storage units. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Reif S., Gerhorst L., Bender K., Hönig T.
Title: Towards low-jitter and energy-efficient data processing in cyber-physical information systems
Source title: Proceedings of the Annual Hawaii International Conference on System Sciences
Affiliations: Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg (FAU)
Authors with affiliations: Reif, S., Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg (FAU); Gerhorst, L., Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg (FAU); Bender, K., Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg (FAU); Hönig, T., Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg (FAU)
Abstract: Cyber-physical systems build the backbone of today's information systems and implement, for example, complex control applications that strictly rely on sensor data. Thus, it is inherently important for cyber-physical systems to provide a reliable data path throughout the entire system: from the sensor nodes to the data post-processing infrastructure in networked environments (e.g., edge and cloud infrastructure). This paper analyzes system-level aspects of the data path of cyber-physical systems (i.e., storage components and file systems) and reveals limitations of current technologies. To improve the current state of the art, we present the implementation of an embedded file system with low jitter which improves predictability characteristics of cyber-physical systems. © 2019 IEEE Computer Society. All rights reserved.

Authors: Md Jalil A.A.M., Faudzi Mat Isa M., Rostani K., Othman N.A., Shariff A.M., Lau K.K., Partoon B., Tay W.H.
Title: Design and engineering implementation of blowdown system for cryogenic CO2- NG pilot facility
Source title: Proceedings - SPE Annual Technical Conference and Exhibition
Affiliations: PETRONAS Research Sdn Bhd; Universiti Teknologi Petronas
Authors with affiliations: Md Jalil, A.A.M., PETRONAS Research Sdn Bhd; Faudzi Mat Isa, M., PETRONAS Research Sdn Bhd; Rostani, K., PETRONAS Research Sdn Bhd; Othman, N.A., PETRONAS Research Sdn Bhd; Shariff, A.M., Universiti Teknologi Petronas; Lau, K.K., Universiti Teknologi Petronas; Partoon, B., Universiti Teknologi Petronas; Tay, W.H., Universiti Teknologi Petronas
Abstract: As easy gas resources around the world are depleting; high Carbon Dioxide (CO2) gas fields are thrust into the spotlight to become new candidates for field development. However, the presence of oftentimes sizable Carbon Dioxide contents in the gas reservoir (can be up to 80% volumetric) introduced a huge technical and economic challenges towards the field exploitation. Over the last few years, several studies have been conducted on cryogenic technologies such as cryogenic distillation and supersonic nozzle in CO2 separation for fields containing more than 40% of CO2. Based on the studies, these new cryogenic technologies have shown to have high potential in separating CO2 from natural gas offshore to be utilized under carbon, capture, storage and utilization (CCUS) project. The new cryogenic technologies are currently being tested for the proof of concept. Hence, a pilot plant, which is a scaled down version of the technology was developed. One of the major challenges faced during the pilot plant testing is the emergency depressurization philosophy as the process involves CO2 solids handling which is uncommon to the industry standard. Depressurization of high CO2 fluid at cryogenic temperature would lead to possibility of CO2 solids formation, hence potential blockage of process equipment and venting line. Therefore, this paper will focus on the design of the pressure relieving system of such a facilities. It would also touched on the implementation of the pressure relieving system during the operation of the pilot tests and as well as the tests designed specially to test the pressure relieving system. Finally the paper would give a few proposals on improvements to be made to such system. It is also the ultimate aim of the authors and the team to introduce a new philosophy for Cryogenic CO2 Blowdown system to the process industry. Copyright 2019, Society of Petroleum Engineers.
Index Keywords: Carbon dioxide process; Chromium compounds; Cryogenics; Distillation; Energy resources; Natural gasoline plants; Offshore gas fields; Offshore oil well production; Offshore technology; Petroleum reservoirs; Pilot plants; Cryogenic distillations; Cryogenic technologies; Cryogenic temperatures; Economic challenges; Engineering implementation; Pilot-plant testing; Process equipments; Scaled-down versions; Carbon dioxide

Authors: Bampoulas A., Saffari M., Pallonetto F., de Rosa M., Mangina E., Finn D.P.
Title: Quantification and characterization of energy flexibility in the residential building sector
Source title: Building Simulation Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: UCD Energy Institute, University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland; UCD School of Mechanical and Materials Engineering, University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland; UCD School of Computer Science, University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland
Authors with affiliations: Bampoulas, A., UCD Energy Institute, University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland, UCD School of Mechanical and Materials Engineering, University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland; Saffari, M., UCD Energy Institute, University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland, UCD School of Mechanical and Materials Engineering, University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland; Pallonetto, F., UCD Energy Institute, University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland; de Rosa, M., UCD Energy Institute, University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland, UCD School of Mechanical and Materials Engineering, University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland; Mangina, E., UCD Energy Institute, University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland, UCD School of Computer Science, University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland; Finn, D.P., UCD Energy Institute, University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland, UCD School of Mechanical and Materials Engineering, University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland
Abstract: Demand response can enable residential consumers to take advantage of control signals and/or financial incentives to adjust the use of their resources at strategic times. These resources usually refer to energy consumption, locally distributed electricity generation, and energy storage. The building structural mass has an inherent potential either to modify consumption or to be used as a storage medium. In this paper, the energy flexibility potential of a residential building thermal mass for the winter design day is investigated. Various active demand response strategies are assessed using two flexibility indicators: the storage efficiency and storage capacity. Using simulation, it is shown that the available capacity and efficiency associated with active demand response actions depend on thermostat setpoint modulation, demand response event duration, heating system rated power and current consumption. © 2019 by International Building Performance Simulation Association (IBPSA) All rights reserved.

Authors: Murray P., Orehounig K., Carmeliet J.
Title: Optimal vehicle selection in the design of urban energy systems: An integration of the private transport and building energy sectors

Abstract: An optimization model has been built to select the optimal combination of vehicle technologies, charging and building system technologies for a group of 52 buildings and 82 cars in Switzerland. The multi-objective optimization reduces both total costs and total emissions and performs both a selection of vehicle, building, charging and storage technologies as well as operation over one year. The car selection chooses from internal combustion engine, hybrid, battery electric, and fuel cell vehicles. The building optimization can select a combination of gas-boilers, fuel cells, heat pumps, and electrolysers to enable meeting both heating demands, electricity demands, and vehicle demand requirements. The results indicate that both heat pumps and battery vehicles are the lowest cost technologies that significantly reduce carbon emissions; however, there are cases where fuel cell vehicles and hybrid vehicles may be a better alternative depending on charging and driving requirements. © 2019 Building Simulation Conference Proceedings. All rights reserved.

Authors: Mohammadi Z., Hoes P.J., Hensen J.L.M.
Title: Simulation-based design optimization of houses with low grid dependency
Source title: Building Simulation Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: Unit Building Physics and Services, Department of the Built Environment, Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e), Eindhoven, Netherlands
Authors with affiliations: Mohammadi, Z., Unit Building Physics and Services, Department of the Built Environment, Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e), Eindhoven, Netherlands; Hoes, P.J., Unit Building Physics and Services, Department of the Built Environment, Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e), Eindhoven, Netherlands; Hensen, J.L.M., Unit Building Physics and Services, Department of the Built Environment, Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e), Eindhoven, Netherlands
Abstract: There is significant growth in the utilization of renewable energy in the built environment. Due to the intermittent nature of most renewable energy sources, energy mismatch problems between on-site generation and demand both in hourly and seasonal levels are unavoidable. This problem is more significant in Northern latitudes, as in summer there is high solar availability despite low or no electricity demand for cooling and in winter the solar availability is low when there is a high demand for heating. In addition, energy-pricing policies are leading to less or no Photovoltaic (PV) feed-in-tariffs in the near future and/or even providing incentives to uphold self-consumption. Therefore, it is important to enhance the energy flexibility potential of a building to improve utilization of on-site generated energy. In this study, a performance optimization of various residential building designs with differences in energy demand, on-site energy generation and storage sizes is carried out considering future policy scenarios. The objective is to minimize the dependency to the nearby energy grid and maximize the self-consumption. To achieve this, a performance-based design support framework is proposed and demonstrated using a case study. © 2019 Building Simulation Conference Proceedings. All rights reserved.
Index Keywords: Heating; Renewable energy resources; Electricity demands; Energy flexibility; Performance based design; Performance optimizations; Renewable energies; Renewable energy source; Residential building; Simulation-based designs; Buildings

Authors: Nourozi B., Wang Q., Ploskic A.
Title: Preheating cold supply air to mechanical balanced ventilation using wastewater or passive geothermal energy
Source title: Building Simulation Conference Proceedings
